description: PITTSBURGH, May 9 (AP) The Westinghouse Electric Corporation said it has de veloped a nuclear power plant design that it says eliminates any discharge of radioactivity to the environ ment under normal copor ating conditions.

title: Angels Vanquish Yankees With 18Hit Attack, 113
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., May 9The New York Yankees con firmed tonight what has been creeping up on them for a week. They have a pitching problem and it was quite evident as the California Angels made 18 hits in an 113 victory. Manager Ralph Houk was hoping for a wellpitched game from Mike Kekich for two reasons. One, because Kekich would have been the fourth starting pitcher if he hadn't torn a hamstring muscle in his last start almost four weeks ago. Two, because the long relief pitching is suffer ing a serious shortage since John Cumberland sprained an ankle in a mysterious club house accident two nights ago.

title: Edinburgh's Way With Kids
description: EDINBURGHThe thou sands of fully grown visitors who come to this ancient capital usually marvel at Edinburgh Castle, as well as at the city's wealth of history, its gardens and its worldfamous Interna tional Festival of Music and Drama. And with justifica tion.

title: Maria L. Low, Writer, Is Wed
description: Miss Maria Luisa Low and Daniel Bartlett Hinckley were married here yester day afternoon in the chapel of St. Bartholomew's Epis copal Church. The Rev. Dr. Terrence J. Finlay performed the ceremony.

title: You Can't Tell the Economy by Watching The Market
description: WASHINGTON  Although there are no statistics on the point, it is probable that last week gamblers lost some hun dreds of thousands of dollars in Las Vegas. No one thought of making a big news story out of the event.

title: Mrs. Monique Pflieger Blake Married to Benjamin Leaman
description: WEST VINCENT, Pa., May 9  Mrs. Monique Pflieger Blake was married here this noon to Benjamin Franklin Leaman of Birchrunville in St. Andrew's Episcopal Church by the Rev. Kenneth C. Werner.

title: ROUSE MEMBERS CURB ACTIVITIES
description: WASHINGTON, May 9  At east five of the 41 members of the New York Congressional delegation have reduced their outside business activities with in the last 16 months.

title: BLUES IN BOSTON FOR 4TH CONTEST
description: BOSTON, May 9 (AP)The Bosun Bruins are so close to the Stanley Cup they can taste the champagne.

title: Earthshaking Developments In Nicaragua
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua  North Americans have traditionally considered Nicaragua only as a country where a canal might be built, where Marines land or where businessmen shop for coffee, cotton and bananas. Not exactly a tourist haven.

title: Indictment For a Spiller Of Oil
description: LOS ANGELES  In the knee deep surf just south of Santa Barbara, some California pio neers in 1887 built a rickety wooden platform and drilled what might have been the na tion's first offshore oil well. An oil industry maxim was born: There's no significance to the shore line, geologically, when you're hunting for oil.

title: JUDGE PLANS SALE OF PAPER'S STOCK
description: DENVER, May 8A legal struggle for control of a key block of Denver Post stock moved a step closer to solution this week when a Federal Dis trict Court judge announced that he planned to order a pub lic auction of most of the se curities involved.

title: DR. ALFRED GROSS, ORNITHOLOGIST, 87
description: GREENWICH, Conn., May 9 Dr. Alfred O. Gross. a retired member of the Bowdoin College faculty and an expert on birds and wildlife, died in Green wich Hospital today. He was 87 years old.

title: SMITH BIDS COURT VOID CONFESSION
description: TRENTON, May 9In his 18th attempt to escape the electric chair and perhaps go fre after nearly 13 years on Death Row, Edgar H. Smith Jr. has asked a Federal judge to strike down the confession that was a key part of the evidence that led to his con viction for murder.

title: Another Increase In Ranks Of the Unemployed
description: The highest monthly increase in 12 years sent the number of Americans out of work to more than 4 million at the end of April, the Labor Department re ported last week. The April re port also showed that the na tional jobless rate rose during the month from 4.4 per cent to 4.8 per cent of the working force.

title: Building a Champion: How the Knicks Did It
description: Willis ReedSecondround draft choice in 1964, out of Grambling College.

title: Now Even in May, There's Just No Rest for the Partygoer
description: AND so fall and winter got so socially oversched uled that benefit chairmen began to think about the spring, and now look what's happened. Spring is the soc ial season that matters and May Is just plain chaotic.

title: Art
description: THE large exhibition of American folk art called Plain and Fancy, which Stuart P. Feld has organized at the Hirschl & Adler Galleries, 21 East 67th Street, arrives at an oppor tune moment. At the very least, it pro vides an essential corrective to the view or our native visual arts that has lately been put forward in the mammoth 19thCentury America exhibition at the Metropolitan Museum. For reasons that remain obscure, the Met exhibition ?? been organized on a false assump tion, namely, that the esthetic vitality of the visual arts in 19thcentury America was limited to the domain of genteel taste, academic values, and the atelier tradition. Virtually every trace of folk expression has been omitted from this exhibition.

title: Article 1  No Title
More Black Colleges Urged In Both North and South
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., May 9 More blackcontrolled colleges should be developed, both in the North and South, says a former Harvard University dean who took a job at a black col lege in Birmingham, Ala., three years ago.

title: Critical Case for Issue of Death Penalty
description: WASHINGTON  The Su preme Court was reminded in vivid fashion last week that to the 510 condemned men in death rows across the country, the capital pun ishment issues now pending before the justices are lit erally a matter of life and death.

title: PROGRESS SEEN IN PAPER TALKS
description: Representatives of the print ers' union and the city's four major newspapers ended a 19 hour bargaining session yester day morning at which they were reported to have come closer to an agreement than at any time since the contracts ran out on March 30.

title: SWAHILI DECLARED KENYA'S LANGUAGE
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, May 9 The Government has issued orders establishing Swahili as the national language in Kenya, as it is in neighboring Tan zania.

title: In Memoriam
description: ABRAMSONLieut. Arthur S. In cherished memory of my beloved son, May 5, 1956. Mother.

title: Miss Nancy Mackey Plans Nuptials
description: SANDS POINT, L. I., May 9 The engagement of Miss Nancy Clarissa Mackey to James Edward Patterson, son of Mrs. Curtiss Henry Patter son of Brunswick, Me., and the late Major Patterson, U.S.A.F., retired, has been announced by the prospective bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Chandler Shaw Mackey.

title: Hotweather stew
description: There is no such thing as a bad fish stew, providedand it's an important provisothat only the freshest ingredients are used and that liquids and herbs are added judiciously. And there's no better season for the dish than right now through the toobrief months of summer. The seafood stew here, with a hot loaf of crusty, buttery garlic bread, is a meal sufficient unto itself. It is given body with cubed potatoes and dash with cloves, saffron and dry white vermouth. And, that final fillipthe least touch of aniseflavored liqueur.

title: PRISON TORTURES DENIED BY BRAZIL
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, May 9  The Brazilian military govern ment has formally denied for the first time that suspected terrorists are being tortured during interrogations in Bra zilian jails.

title: SHIFTING BREEZES PERPLEX SKIPPERS
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., May 9 Shifting breezes perplexed both the committee and 68 skippers on Long Island Sound today when the Larchmont Yacht Club conducted the third of six races in its annual spring series for Yacht Racing Association onedesign classes.

title: Stamps
description: OLIVER TWIST, David Copperfield, Samuel Pickwick and Wilkins Micawber will be de picted on a series of four S cent stamps to be issued by Britain on June 3 to com memorate the centenary of the death of Charles Dickens, who created these fictional characters.

title: LINDSAY DRAFTING A 2STEP REVISION OF RENT CONTROLS
description: Mayor Lindsay is expected to propose a twostep revision of the city's 27yearold rent con trol law this week, with the first phase mandating immedi ate rent increases for thousands of tenants.

title: The Immoralist
description: During the thirties, Andre Gide was the most famous of all living French writers, not so much because of the literary quality of his works, but because he was the one great representative in France of the posi tive revolt against 19th century con ventions. For several generations, the majority of French writers had been fiercely critical of French so ciety, but they had either taken the view that ordinary living was in any case dreary and that salvation lay in art, or they had opted for a re turn to the cosmic drama of intense Catholicism.

title: City Area Stuck by Glue
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., May 9 (UPI)  A twoblock area was sealed off and all businesses closed when an Army bomb squad identified a pint of liquid in a young woman's refrigera tor as pure nitroglycerine strong enough to blow up four city blocks. Miss Jackie Samay, 22 years old, said a friend had given her the substance when she had to drive home alone late at night and had told her that if anyone bothered her, to throw it at him. Chemists ana lyzed the substance Wednesday. It was glue.

title: Egg Business Becoming Unscrambled Once Again
description: The egg market is becom ing unscrambled again after prices reached almost record levels late last year.

title: Murder, Family Style
description: SAMUEL GOLDWYN JR. is deter mined to make crime pay. Cotton Comes to Harlem, the young pro ducer's cops and robbers comedy, will open soon, and now he has an nounced his plan to film The Bloody Benders, Robert H. Adleman's notso comic book about an actual murder case, which Stein and Day will publish May 29.

title: Safety Bags for Cars Not Required Until '73
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 (AP) Secretary of Transportation John A. Volpe has postponed for a year the beginning of mandatory installation of air bag, crashprotection devices in autos.

title: Nabokov The Collector
description: A dance of bright yellow wings, the swift crunch of heavy feet over rough ground, the soundless swish of a white, gauzy net and Vladimir Nabo kov stood in the Sicilian sun shine, panting with glee and holding a tiny orange and yel low butterfly in triumph.

title: Paterson's Candidacy for State Office Troubling Some Democrats
description: The Democratic State Com mittee's designation of a black man as its candidate for the nomination for Lieutenant Gov ernor has raised problems for some Democratic leaders who fear that, if he wins the prim ary, the selection will cost them the votes of many whites.

title: Susan Emery Darien Bride
description: DARIEN, Conn., May 9 Miss Susan Emery, public in formation officer for the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts in Washing ton, was married here this afternoon to Thomas Francis Darcey, an account rep resentative with the Com puter Sciences Corporation in Washington.

title: 50 Killed in Western India By HinduMoslem Rioting
description: NEW DELHI, May 9At least 50 persons have been killed and hundreds injured in the last three days in Hindus Moslem riots in two major towns of Maharashtra state, in Western India.

title: Caution in Cambodia
description: Under the pressure of student and other protests, Congressional criticism and a worldwide clamor, Presi dent Nixon now has given the nation new assurances that his Cambodian incursion will remain limited in duration and character and, most important, will not be repeated later. His news conference commitments cannot undo all the disastrous consequences at home and abroad of this illconsidered adventure, but they do open the possibility of limiting the damage.

title: Twentyfive War Years
description: A quarter of a century ago President Truman pro claimed victory over Hitler's Third Reich to mark the end of the Second World War in Europe. Few peaceful years have existed since then in this warring world of hot and cold conflicts.

title: Surfing Has Become for Some a Way to Religious Experience
description: LA JOLLA, Calif.Michael Hynson, his short, lean fig ure clad in a black rubber wet suit, sat crosslegged in the sand in a Yoga stance and looked intently out into the Pacific. He meditated quietly for several minutes, then took his surfboard in hand and strove out into the waves.

title: Local Shows Move Outdoors Saturday With Fixture on L.I.
description: ALLBREED dog show com petition outdoors will begin for the New York metropolitan area next week end with two shows on Long Island. The Ladies Kennel Association of America event will be held Saturday on the Hofstra University Saturday in Hempstead. The Long Island Kennel Club fixture will follow the next day on the C. W. Post College grounds at Brook ville.

title: Lovell Gets a Mouthful Of Admirer's Confetti
description: DOWNEY, Calif., May 10 APThe Apollo 13 com mander, Capt. James A. Lovell Jr., of the Navy caught a mouthful of confetti from a young admirer waiting with 9,000 other persons Wednes day to see the three astro nauts visit their spacecraft for the first time since their illfated moon voyage last month.

title: ComboCruiser a Mobile Houseboat for Land, Water
description: The ComboCruiser, a mo bile houseboat designed for land and water, was intro duced recently in the New York area by ShipAShore Corporation of Mishawaka, Ind., with a demonstration of the craft's durability at the Lighthouse Yacht Center, Ny ack, N. Y.

title: CUBS DOWN REDS ON 2 HOMERS, 81
description: CHICAGO, May 9Jim Hick man's threerun homer and Ernie Banks' 499th of his career today spurred the Chi cago Cubs to an 81 victory over Cincinnati in a battle be tween the National League's division leaders.

title: By Night Ferry From Copenhagen To Languid Bornholm
description: RONNE, DenmarkNo one admits that it rains on Bornholm, a Danish island nestled in the Baltic Sea beneath Sweden's southern coast. Even the fatigued traveler will overlook his temporarily rainsoaked vestments for the freshness and charm that await him in each little hamlet.

title: Friday Night Fights
description: SAN DIEGOKen Norton, 205 pounds, San Diego, knocked out Ray Ellis, 217, San Francisco, 2 rounds.

title: California Vinters Study Extensive Frost Damage
description: NAPA, Calif., May 9 Three weeks of killing frost in the vineyards of Napa and Sonoma Countiesthe worst in 16 to 50 years, depending on the district have resulted in grape crop losses that some experts say may reach a retail value ap proaching 110million.

title: 70 Cars in World Cup Rally Finish Stage to Sao Paul
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, May 9 (Reuters)The 70 cars remain ing in the LondontoMexico World Cup rally reached an Paulo today on the first stage of the 12,000mile LatinAmer ican section of the grueling, event.

title: HARVARD'S EIGHT WINS SPRINT TITLE
description: WORCESTER, Mass., May 9 The Harvard crew took its revenge on Pennsylvania today in winning the Eastern sprint championship and left unsettled for a second year in a row the determination of the nation's best intercollegiate eight.

title: DODGERS DEFEAT PHILS IN 14TH, 94
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 9 (AP)  Jeff Torborg's tiebreaking single and Manny Mota's sec ond triple of the game today keyed a fiverun surge in the 14th inning to give the Los Angeles Dodgers a 94 victory over the Philadelphia Phillies.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: EDGARTOWN, Mass.  Freeman Willoughby of the Edgartown Post Office helped me catch my first striped bass of the season a few days ago.

title: Institutional Investors Marking Time
Police Find Arms Cache In Rented Car Downtown
description: A routine spot check yester day of a motorist whose license plate registration sticker was missing uncovered an arms hoard that included two pistols, a hand grenade and bomb components, the police at the East Fifth Street station said.

title: Article 17  No Title
description: THE airport was Toronto's, and was soon after a rash of airplane hijackings to Cuba. Michael Rabin, the violin virtuoso, sat sleepily aboard a Miamibound plane as the craft taxied for takeoff. Suddenly, it turned completely around, moved to the edge of the runway and stopped. Then the copilot emerged from the cockpit and walked straight to where Rabin was sitting.

title: Curry College Expands
description: MILTON, Mass., May 9 (AP) Curry College has announced that it will purchase the ad joining 65acre property here of Jeanne d'Arc Academy, a Cath olic girls' school. Jeanne d'Arc announced last January it would close in June. 1971.

title: At Last And Alas Mahagonny
description: NO experience in the theater is more dis tressing than the shock of seeing a re vered masterpiece being butchered by a bad produc tion. After the first few mo ments of startled, then in dignant, disbelief, you want to pick up your coat, turn defiantly up the aisle and head out into the calming air of the street, where noise, filth, garish lights and jos tling crowds are balm com pared with the spectacle you have just witnessed.

title: Twenty One Stories
description: Giving half of The Nobel Prize to S. Y. Agnon in 1966 was a semispiritual gesture to ward faith, graceand to the prophets of the Old Testament. To Agnonwho populated his literary and real world with Hebrew philosophers, commen tators, Biblical scholars, myth makers, ritualists and young students at the Yeshivait was a reward for just these scholar ly elements encompassing the brethren of his books. His characters are of another time, yet facing yesterday's and to day's realities and mysteries. A fable becomes a real as well as a mystical experiencewith 10tongued interior meanings. To Agnon, born in Poland, schooled in Vienna and Berlin, his earlier studies prepared him for his literary aliyah. He settled within the Biblical sources of Judaism, coming to Palestine at the age of 18, in 1908, to become one of the most profound Hebrew writers of this century.

title: Students: Turmoil For Peace In Tragic Week
description: WASHINGTON They started arriving Friday by car, by bus, by train, by planethousands of students streaming into the na tion's capital to protest their Government's policies. The anti war rally this weekend, the larg est mass demonstration in Wash ington since the Vietnam Mora torium last November, climaxed a week of campus strikes, riots and canceled classes at more than 400 colleges across the country.

title: Coast Guard Tests Navigational Radar Beacon
description: Tests of racon, a new navi gational radar beacon, are be ing conducted by the Coast Guard in an effort to improve navigation in restricted waters.

title: High School Textbooks Called Still Unfair to Minority Groups
description: The AntiDefamation League of B'nai B'rith reported yester day that a study of junior and senior high school social studies textbooks had failed to find a single text that presented a reasonably complete and un distorted picture of America's many minority groups.

title: Educators Say President Didn't Vow to Quiet Agnew
description: WASHINGTON, May 9Sev eral of the university presidents who met with President Nixon last Thursday said today that Mr. Nixon was correct in deny ing he had promised to muz zle or censor Vice President Agnew.

title: City's Economy Is Called Robust Despite Some Talk of Downturn
description: If a guy can't get mortgage money, the builder doesn't buy a new car and the car sales man's wife doesn't buy a new dress.

title: ROME'S LAWYERS BOYCOTT COURTS
description: ROME, May 9The 5,800 lawyers of Rome are on a week long strike to protest against the scattering throughout the capital of tribunals and judici ary offices that have been evicted from the crumbling 60 yearold Palace of Justice.

title: A Frustrated and Angrier Mood
description: WASHINGTON, May 9  This was protest in search of a method by a crowd that knew what it wanted but not how to get it.

title: McGee Runs 100 Yards In 9.1 2d Night in Row
description: HOUSTON, May 9 (UPI) Willie McGee of Alcorn A. and M., a freshman from Hattiesburg, Miss., tied the 100yard dash world record of 9.1 seconds for the second straight night in the South western Athletic Conference track meet.

title: Voici Le Phrase BookAu Secours!
description: IT'S standard behavior for anyone planning a trip abroad: scratching his vaccination, caressing his pass port and studying his phrase book. Having received the first two from my doctor and Government, respectively, couldn't wait for friends to give me French phrase book. I rushed out and bought my own.

title: Nixon's Welfare Plan To Get Vermont Test
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 (AP) Robert H. Finch, Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, has announced that Vermont will be the test state for the Nixon Administra tion's welfare reform proposal.

title: Hardly a Major Historian Escapes Unscathed
description: If one laughs when David Hackett Fischer sits down to play, one will stay to cheer. His book must be read three times: the first in anger, the second in laughter, the third in respect. That the author of Histori ans' Fallacies (Harper & Row, $10) would immediately see the first sen tence above as an example of a fal lacy in questionframing serves as warning to anyone who attempts to discuss the book, as well as to any historian who hereafter fails to read it. For Fischer has caught the guild of historians out: they have failed to give proper attention to the logic of historical thought, which is properly adductive, since they often regard methodological and logical problems with suspicion and even hostility.

title: HIGH COURT GETS SCANDAL IN SPAIN
description: MADRID, May 9The Span ish Supreme Court, meeting in plenary session for the first time since its special powers) were defined in 1870, has voted to investigate a major political and financial scandal at Cabi net level.

title: Hannah Hope Randolph Married
description: RADNOR, Pa., May 9  Miss Hannah Hope Randolph and Samuel Richards Ship ley 3d were married here this afternoon at St. Martin's Episcopal Church. The Rev. William H. Jefferys per formed the ceremony.

title: Mexican Masks and Faces
description: MEXICO CITY will be the site for the Jules Rimet Cup 1970 international soccer football championship se ries. Jean Mahon reports that Mex ico, this year's host, will commemorate the event postally on May 31 with two stamps based on designs by Lance Wyman, creator of a number of unusual designs for Mexican stamps of recent years.

title: The World Of Bats
description: I suppose bats are nobody's fav orite animals. They are nocturnal, therefore dimly seen, and they fly in a ragged and uneven fashion so that the amateur observer is nerv ously concerned least he be struck by them. Moreover, bats suffer ter ribly by comparison with birds. Bats have dull hair and naked ugly wings, in place of the birds' downy and brilliant feathers; they emit shrill squeaks in place of the birds' melo dious songs.

title: Army and Navy Quit Meet Over Ivy Protest Note
description: NEW HAVEN, May 9In an unexpected move 15 min utes before the first event, Army and Navy withdrew today from the 36th annual Heptagonal outdoor track and field championships. With their athletes in warmup outfits ready and eager to compete, coaches of the two service academies, after hasty telephone conversations with superiors at West Point and Annapolis, said protest statement prepared for delivery during the meet would have made their par ticipation inappropriate.

title: Advertising:
description: The big numbers war be tween Life and Look is over. The winner? At the moment no one knows.

title: Rauschenberg and Johns: AntiArt?
description: IT is by accident that Jas per Johns and Robert Rauschenberg are given comprehensive shows of their prints simultaneously and in close proximity: Johns at the Philadelphia Museum of Art (through June 14) and Rauschenberg at the Institute of Contemporary Art of the University of Pennsylvania (through May 10). The acci dent is a happy one indeed for the two shows comple ment each other.

title: Rap Brown Is the Man Who Wasn't There
description: WASHINGTON  When the Kerner Commission report on civil disorders came out two years ago, its authors made avail able separately a detailed com mission working paper on one of the notable disturbances of 1967  the burning and shoot ing nightmare of the socalled Night of Rap Brown in Cam bridge, Md. Mr. Brown, in a street speech there on the humid night of July 24, 1967, had declared that it's time for Cambridge to explode, baby and ventured rhetorically that if this town don't come around [to black militant demands] this town should be burnt down.

title: News of the Rialto
description: OPTIMISTS, who listen closely these days, are being rewarded with the hopeful sounds of productions being hammered into shape for the new sea son. Thus, for example, last week sensitive antennae picked up evidence that two promised shows now actually appear to be on their way.

title: Tripe Lovers Exhibit Prowess At Annual Feast in Normandy
description: LONGNY  AU  PERCHE, France, May 3Despite their top hats, the knights of the Fellowship of the Dish of Tripe are not at all snobbish about their favorite fond.

title: FRESH AIR FUND PRESSES APPEAL
description: With summer just six weeks away, appeals have been in creased by the Fresh Air Fund to achieve a 1970 goal of $800,000 in contributions.

title: MEXICAN SURVIVES RIVAL'S LATE RUSH
description: ROME, May 9 (UPI)Vicente Saldiver of Mexico regained the world featherweight champion ship tonight by pounding out a unanimous 15round decision over Johnny Famechon, the de fending titleholder from Aus tralia.

title: DAYAN IN WARNING ON CANAL MISSILES
description: JERUSALEM, May 9  De fense Minister Moshe Davan said today that Israel would not permit the installation of Soviet SAM3 missiles along the Suez Canal.

title: 30 U.S. Ships Join Push Into Cambodia On Mekong River
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 9Thirty American gunboats joined with a South Vietnamese flotilla today in a thrust into Cambodia on the Mekong River.

title: Spotlight:
description: We have one rule in shareholder relationsmain tain the dividend. This corp orate philosophy, set forth some years ago by an execu tive, is being sorely tested during the Great Bear Mar ket of 1970.

title: Mexicans Term Cuba's Sugar Goal Unattainable
description: MEXICO CITY, May 9The 11million ton sugar crop, on which Premier Fidel Castro staked the honor of the Cuban Revolution, is now un attainable, according to expert analysis of the latest Cuban figures on the harvest.

title: HOMER J. LIVINGSTON, CHICAGO BANKER, 66
description: CHICAGO, May 9Homer J. Livingston, who retired last year as chairman of the board and chief executive officer of the First National Bank of Chicago, died today in Presby terianSt. Luke's Hospital of complications resulting from hepatitis. His age was 66.

title: Delaware Democrats Name A Farmer for Senate Race
description: DOVER, Del., May 9 (AP) Jacoh W. Zimmerman, 39year old Dover potato farmer and state legislator, won an easy first ballot Democratic nomina tion for United States Senator today.

title: Never Let Her Go
description: Many years ago when the world was youngoh, it must hav, been in the early 1950's  John Crosby was making trenchant comments on tele vision for The New York Her ald Tribune. Then television disappeared, except for sport ing events, the late movies, and commercials. Mr. Crosby disap peared too, to surface in Lon don writing trenchant commen tary for The London Observer.

title: WAR CENSOR NEXT, 3 LENGTHS BACK
description: BALTIMORE, May 9  Fort Marcy, a 6  year  old gelding from the Rokeby Stable of Paul Mellan, carried topweight of 124 pounds to a track record for a 1mile turf race as he won the $57,500 Dixie Handi cap at Pimlico Race Course.

title: Peking and Moscow See Joint Cause in Indochina
description: The United States action in Cambodia has touched off a swift Chinese diplomatic offen sive which is radically altering SinoSovietAmerican relation ships and may open the way to temporary easing of SinoSo viet tensions.

title: Article 14  No Title
description: Treason

title: The Quest for Florida's Lost Plantations
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla.Although the resort area hereabouts is as modern as any to be found in Florida, it is the quest for the past that occupies many visitors in the quiet hours away from the beach and speedway. The target: The ruins of the socalled Lost Plantations that once dotted the Halifax River.

title: ContentsPage 22
description: THERE are a lot of black Ameri cans who have never been in jail, never been on dope, never participated in a riot or even a civil rights demonstration, are not on welfareand they are not members of the socalled black bourgeoisie or black middle class. This may sound strange to some people who have become accustomed it the last few years to a racial discussion that has tended to divide the black community into categories representing either the tormented soul of an Eldridge Cleav er, the manchild of a Claude Brown, or the attach case of an upwardly mobile black man newly appointed to the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Kosygin's Blast
description: Western diplomats in Mos cow were surprised last week when Soviet Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin called a press confer ence to criticize the increased American involvement in Indo China. It was Mr. Kosygin's first such conference in the more than five years he has been in office.

title: U.S. Business:
description: DALLAS, May 9Dallas County banks were hit by a $177million drop in bank de posits, sliding down from $4.7 billion to $4.5billion, bank call figures showed this week.

title: The Blue Movie Blues
description: THE hostnarrator of The Art of Marriage, a sort of filmed sane sex manual that employs two pairs of live actors to demonstrate the various positions for coitus, refers at one point in his lecture, which he presents as if he were sightreading from the Congressional Record, to the pioneering work done by Masters and Johnson, to whom we owe all indebted ness.

title: Quebec Isle Has Few People, Lots of Fish and 50,000 Deer
description: PORT MENIER, Anticosti Island, Quebec  The motorship Anti costi does not wait for passengers. The crew practically pulled me aboard as the ship got under way for the overnight trip down the St. Lawrence River from Rimouski to Anticosti Island, in the Gulf of St. Lawrence.

title: Catholic Leaders Back U.S. China Policy
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., May 9The leaders of the Roman Catholic Church in the United States have commended the Nixon Administration for its continuing efforts to develop workable relations with the Chinese Communist Govern ment.

title: Cornelia Harriman Gerry Bride
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L.I., May 9  Miss Cornelia Har riman Gerry, a greatgrand daughter of Edward H. Har riman, the railroad magnate, was married here this after noon to Richard Alan Cor bett, assistant to the presi dent of the Park Agency, Inc., in New York, the com pany that manages the Jo seph P. Kennedy fortune.

title: Use of TV Satellites In Propaganda War Concerns Experts
description: RACINE, Wis., May 9Both hopeful and worried about tele vision broadcasts that will eventually be beamed directly from satellites to home receiv ers, a group of communications experts met here this week to discuss a proposed set of inter national guidelines.

title: Article 16  No Title
description: REAL ESTATE

title: JONES'S MUSTANG WINS AT LIME ROCK
description: LIME ROCK, Conn., May 9 Parnelli Jones of Torrance, Calif., won his second consecu tive TransAmerican race of the season today in a Boss 302 Mustang. In an uneventful en durance run of 2 hours, one of the easiest races of his 20 year career, Jones led from wire to wire.

title: STARS TURN BACK ROCKETS, 109107
description: DENVER, May 9 (AP) Mery Jackson's jump shot with 16 seconds left to play today gave the Los Angeles Stars a 109107 victory over Denver and the Western Division title in the American Basketball Associa tion.

title: New Police Commissioner Appointed in New Rochelle
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., May 8 (UPI)James E. Gordon, a former agent of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, was appointed Police Commissioner of New Rochelle today in place of Edward F. Carey, who was summarily dismissed two weeks ago.

title: Sandra Lee Morgan Married To Thomas E. Bertelsen Jr.
description: Miss Sandra Lee Morgan and Thomas E. Bertelsen Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Bertelsen of Fort Lauderdale, Fla., for merly of Winnetka, Ill., were married here yesterday ?? the Roman Catholic Church of St. Thomas More. The Rev. John Calhoun performed the ceremony.

title: New Port for Indiana Expected To Produce an Industrial Boom
description: PORTAGE, Ind. May 9 (AP) Indiana's $25million port on Lake Michigan, a dream that spanned four generations, could start an industrial boom and launch an almost landlocked state into worldwide commerce by way of the St. Lawrence Seaway.

title: IRANIANS PRESSING FOR TOP GULF RULE
description: TEHERAN, Iran, May 9 e are the lions, the banker declared. Give us our share!

title: NAVY BEATEN, 97, BY JOHNS HOPKINS
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., May 9 Johns Hopkins shattered Navy's hopes for an undefeated la crosse season today by trounc ing the midshipmen 97, in NavyMarine Memorial Stadium before more than 12,000 fans.

title: Uranium Deal Set By Westinghouse
description: OAK RIDGE, Tenn., May 2 The Westinghouse Electric Corporation of Pittsburgh is to get additional uranium en richment services from the Atomic Energy Commission's Oak Ridge operations. The contract now provides for total of $24,190,9722 of such services through October, ac cording to S. R. Sapirie manager of the Oak Ridge operations.

title: Article 8  No Title
10Year RentRise Plan Asked
description: THE author of an exhaustive study of rentcontrolled housing in New York, Dr. George W, Sternlieb, says that the city needs a 10year plan leading to a substantial alleviation of the rent control law.

title: THEY HOPE CALM WILL HELP CAUSE
description: WASHINGTON, May 9Most of the war critics in Congress stood detached today from the peace demonstration near the White House. They were look ing to the protest to build up public support for their cause but fearful that it might have the opposite effect.

title: Sargent Signs Bill to Allow Prayer In Public Schools
description: BOSTON, May 10 (AP) Gov. Francis W. Sargent has signed a bill to allow prayers by pupils in public schools, if they follow a recent Superior Court ruling.

title: Article 15  No Title
Nationwide College Protest Continues
description: The collegiate protest against United States military opera tions in Southeast Asia gener ated rallies and demonstrations in many cities yesterday, but only scattered incidents of vio lence were reporteed.

title: O'BRIEN CONTENDS NIXON IS DIVISIVE
description: WASHINGTON, May 9  Lawrence F. O'Brien today ac cused the leaders of the Nixon Administration, including the President, of attempting to divide us as a nation, to polar ize us, and to create anarchy.

title: For Young Readers
description: Each of these women, placed her stamp on her time and place and had a backbone of steel. All were willing to flout convention and tilt lances at prejudice.

title: Peking and Pyongyang Say Cambodia Is Holding Envoys
description: HONG KONG, May 9 (Reu ters)  Communist China and North Korea charged today that their embassy staffs in Pnompenh were being pre vented from leaving by the Cambodian Government.

title: REUTHER BELIEVED DEAD IN AIR CRASH
description: PELLSTON, Mich., May 9 A small jet plane chartered by the United Auto Workers union crashed tonight in a heavy fob near Pellston. The dispatcher for the charter plane service said in Detroit that Walter P. Reuther, United Auto Workers president, was aboard.

title: Personality:
description: PITTSBURGH  About 15 years ago, Edgar B. Speer was transferred by the Unit ed States Steel Corporation to its Fairless Works, near Philadelphia. At that time, the Fairless plant  of which Mr. Speer was soon to become general superin tendent  was the newly built showplace of the world's biggest steel com pany.

title: Theater in London
description: London.

title: A Spanking For Fellini Satyricon
description: PETRONIUS'S Satyricon was about something. There were real people in it; relationships which, though farcical, mattered because they involved genuine feelings; and there was a plot. Encolpius the drifter's love for Giton, the young bisexual whore, and his rivalry over him with the stronger Ascyltus, is a sort of homosexual Roman Lolita, pathetic as well as ludicrous, and, above all, recognizably human.

title: The Violent Black Minority
description: DURING the nineteenthirties in New York City, the black white boundary ran along Morningside Avenue. My family lived on 123d Street, just on the westthe whiteside of that frontier. East of Morningside, one was in Harlem. Yet, only whites crossed this line. Apart from some domestic servants and an occasional delivery boy, entire days might go by without a black face appearing in adjacent white neighbor hoods. On the other hand, those of us who were white never regarded Momingside Avenue as a barrier. We felt entirely free to wander into Har lem at any hour of the day or night, feeling secure that we would be neither accosted nor attacked. These were Depression years, and Harlem was by all odds the poorest section of the city. It could well have been dangerous territory for any white trespasser. Nevertheless, it was en tirely safe.

title: U.S.South Korean Talks
description: SEOUL, South Korea, May 9 United States and South Ko rean officials have scheduled a second round of talks in Geneva on May 14 to discuss the proposed United States im port restrictions on manmade and woolen textiles.

title: Lloyd's Elects U.S. Aide
description: Lloyd's Register of Shipping has announced the election of Andrew G. Spyrou to its Amer ican Committee. Mr. Spyrou is head of the technical depart ment or Olympic Maritime, S.A., Monte Carlo, Monaco,

title: Youth Guilty of Flag Charge
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., May 9 (AP)  A 17yearold boy has been ordered to pay $15 for wearing on his jacket an Amer ican flag with the written words Give peace a chance and a peace symbol. Bruce C. Parker of Maiden was assessed court costs Tuesday by Judge P. B. Beachurrt,..who found the youth, guilty in District Court of vio lating a North Carolina law that forbids writing or placing any thing on the flag.

title: Davis Cup vs. Rhodesia
description: Informal, unofficial over tures have been made to Rhodesia urging a with drawal from further Davis Cup competition this year, top United States tennis offi cial has disclosed.

title: Decision For the Panthers
description: In the early hours of the morn ing last Dec. 4, a shootout took place in a raid by Chicago police men on an apartment occupied by Black Panthers. Exactly who began the shooting is still a matter of dispute. But when it was over, Illinois Black Panther leader Fred Hampton, 21, and Mark Clark, 22, another Panther leader, were dead. Four other Panthers, including two young women, were wounded.

title: Article 3  No Title
In The Nation: Getting Through to the President
description: WASHINGTONEvery line of Secretary Hickel's remarkable appeal to President Nixon to communicate with our youth and listen to their ideas and problems badly needed stating. But the most important part of this remarkable letter may well have been its conclusion:

title: RED SOX HALT A'S, 53 ON 2RUN BELT IN 9TH
description: OAKLAND, May 9 (AP) Tony Conigliaro's tworun homer in the ninth inning gave the Boston Red Sox a 53 vic tory today over the Oakland Athletics.

title: Christian Conference to Support the Palestinians Opens in Beirut
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 9 ?? American professors today ??ew the attention of a confer ence of Christians here to what ??ey termed the contradiction between Biblical justifications ?? Israeli nationalism and the Iiblical message of reconcilia tion and peace.

title: The Market and Recessions
description: When the stock market drops, is that a sign that a recession is on the way? There have been 11 major market declineswhen stock prices fell by 10 per cent or more and four recessions in the postWorld War II period. (That does not include the September 1955 market break on news of President Eisenhower's heart attack, or the Novem ber 1963 break following President Kennedy's assassination; both drops were quickly reversed. Neither does it include the present market drop, which may or may not be followed by a recession.)

title: Daughter to Mrs. Koenig
description: A daughter was born April 15 to Dr. and Mrs. Ronald H. Koenig of the Bronx at the hospital of the Albert Einstein College of Medi cine in the Bronx, where Dr. Koenig is chief resident in neurology at the Albert ?? Medical Center. Mrs. Koenig is the former Miss Flaine Melnick of Par ?? N.J. The child has been named ?? Anne.

title: Authors' Queries
description: For a history of the Piccolo Teatro of Milan, I would appre ciate receiving any information relating to its 1960 North American tour, or any other pertinent information.

title: Alarming Pollution Seen in MidOcean On Atlantic Voyage
description: PARIS, May 9Thor Heyer dahl, the author and ethnolo gist, reports that he found alarming pollution far out to sea during his most recent expedition.

title: $180,000 to Soccer Star
description: SOUTHAMPTON, England, May 9 (UPI)  Southampton signed Brian O'Neil of the First Division Burnley soccer team for $180,000.

title: Kapp of Vikings Is One of Six To Gain Status of Free Agent
description: TOE KAPP, the quarterback of the Minnesota Vikings and voted by the New York chapter of the Pro Football Writers Association as player of the year in the National Football League, is a free agent. Kapp exercised the option clause in his 1968 con tract and as of May 1 the vikings no longer owned his serv ices.

title: I Didn't Burn My Bra
description: OPEN letter to: Eve, Cle opatra, Helen of Troy, Salome, Juliet, Mme. DuBarry, Mata Hari, Scarlett O'Hara, Lorelei Lee, Amber, Candy, Camille, Mar guerite from Faust, Meg, Jo, Beth and Amy.

title: Miss Faver Thomason Married To Edgar Marvin Hawkins 3d
description: PORTOLA CALLEY, Calif., May 9Miss faver Chance Thomason was married here this afternoon to Edgar Mar vin Hawkins 3d, whose fa ther, Mr. Hawkins Jr., is sen ior vice president of Stone & Webster, New York manage ment consultants. He is the son also of Mrs. Hawkins of Darien, Conn.

title: The Lazy Life on Cayman Brae
description: CAYMAN BRAC, Cayman Islands, B.W.I.Someone asked a guest one time what there was to do here, said Anton Foster, owner of Buccaneers' Inn and a member of one of the original families on the island. Nothing, he replied, and we love it!

title: Pope Exchanges Kiss of Peace With Armenian Church Leader
description: ROME, May 9Pope Paul VI and the Supreme Catholicos of the Armenian Church, Vasken I, ceremonially met in the Vat ican's Sistine Chapel today, ex changed the kiss of peace and pledged to strive for Christian unity.

title: Westchester Mental Health Sets Dinner and Art Sale
description: The Mental Health Associa tion of Westchester County will sponsor a champagne buffet dinner and art auction at Mercy College in Dobbs Ferry on Sunday, May 24, to benefit the association's wide range of projects.

title: Instant Nostalgia on Wheels
description: LAYHILL, Md. With no trolley company hereabouts to even consider hiring them, 80 Wash ington area juice fans decid ed to become their own employers. The ministreetcar railway that they have established and operate here as the National Capital Trolley Museum captures and preserves many of the delights of this fast disappearing mode of transportation.

title: USEDCAR SELLERS FACE STIFF RULES
description: Simon Lazarus, general coun sel for the Department of Con sumer Affairs, said yesterday that the city had drafted a new set of regulations aimed at rooting out sharp practice and highpressure sales tech niques in the usedcar busi ness.

title: Are psychiatrists human? All too
description: One of the most useful techniques employed by those in power in society is to classify their actual or potential opponents as inferior be ings. By so doing they ensure that the views and actions of the in ferior group are invalidated and that its members can, with apparent justification, be physically restrained from putting their ideas into action.

title: BRUNDAGE URGES BAN ON 4 SPORTS
description: AMSTERDAM, The Nether lands, May 9Avery Brundage, the president of the Interna tional Olympic Committee, urged the international sports federations today to withdraw Alpine skiing, ice hockey, soc cer and basketball from the Olympic Games.

title: Listing of Benefit Entertainment Parties
description: Tickets for the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless other wise indicated:

title: Gardens
description: THE pluses on owning a swimming pool are obvious, but more subtle are the minuses. After a few visits with pool owners, the disadvan tages loomed up as continual main tenance, cost, and the element of danger inherent in having a body of water in the back yard.

title: Maze of Gimmicks And Overdirection Distort Patience
description: Modernizing Gilbert and Sullivan is a risky business. These classic operettas have been produced in almost every conceivable way over the last century, but Gilbert's mordant wit and Sullivan's elegant music remain very much a part of the Victorian times in which they were written.

title: CATBIRD VICTOR AT FARMINGTON
description: FARMINGTON, Conn., May 9 Barney Ward, riding the Tri color Farms' Catbird, won the Professional Horsemen's Asso dation class for open jumpers today at the Children's Serv ices horse show at the Farm ington Valley Polo Club.

title: Houston Boy, 9, Adds $1.83 To Fight Against Pollution
description: AUSTIN, Tex., May 9 (AP) A 9yearold Houston boy, wor ried over whether there would he enough oxygen to breathe for the rest of his life, has sent. Gov. Preston E. Smith $1.83 in coins he collected to fight pollution.

title: Anguilla Tranquil, But the Memory Lingers On
description: THE VALLEY, Anguilla, W. I. Anguilla roared into the news last year when British paratroopers landed here and a battleship stood ready nearby. Today all is calm and the scarcity of tourists makes them the more highly prized. The only British military forces left are construction workers.

title: New State Panel Created To Study Drug Problems
description: ALBANY, May 9Governor Rockefeller has signed a bill creating a commission to gath er statistics on drugs and to evaluate the state's drug laws.

title: The Sands of Time Are Running Out for Miami Beach
description: MIAMI BEACHMayor Jay Der mer leaned against the con crete seawall and pointed be low. That, he said, referring to the beach for which this city is named, is the disgrace of Miami Beach. All that remains of the beach at the spot where Dermer was pointing is strip about 10 feet widenot much for a city that built its reputation and flourishing resort industry on the lure of its golden sands.

title: A Missile Site Becomes a Home
description: CHUGWATER, Wyo., May 6  We'll build a sweet little nest.

title: Foster Bout Set for June 27
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 (AP) Bob Foster's defense of his light heavyweight boxing title against Mark Tessman of Houston has been rescheduled for June 27 in Baltimore's Civic Center.

title: Formidable Obstacles To a Mideast Ceasefire
description: JERUSALEM  When De fense Minister Moshe Dayan told a Haifa student audience last week that Israel was ready to accept an unconditional cease fire, he was restating the obvi ous. This has been Israel's po sition ever since the end of the 1967 war stretched her borders far beyond what anyone except a small fringe here deems neces sary to her security.

title: Anatomy of a Selloff
description: The dramatic and chaotic events of May 28 and 29, 1962, provide a classic example of a con vulsive selling climax in the stock market. May 28 was a Mondaysince dubbed Blue Monday by historiansand it came following a week heavy losses and expressions of great concern by Wall Street leaders.

title: Tanzania Charges 8 in Plot
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, May 9 (Reuters)Eight per sons, including former Foreign Minister Oscar Kambona and former Labor Minister Michael Eamaliza, were charged today with treason in a reported plot lo overthrow the Government of President Julius K. Nyerere. The Government charged in a preliminary hearing that a coup timed for between last Oct. 10 and 15 had been plotted from July. ?? to September 1969. ?? ??

title: Old Norway in the Midwest
description: MOUNT HOREB, Wis.  When the Crown Prince (now King Olav) of Norway visited here in 1939, he commented that Nissedahl, a valley called Little Norway by those who live hereabout, looked exactly like Nor way. Nissedahl, which translates to Valley of Elves, was originally a work ing farm owned by a Norwegian immi grant named Osten Olson Haugen. It was later bought by Isak J. Dahle, who turned the whole valley into a museum for Nor wegian memorabilia.

title: Author's Query
description: For a book describing and evaluating the role of the late Brig. Gen. Philip R. Faymon ville in AmericanSoviet rela tions, I would appreciate re ceiving any information relating to his career between 191848.

title: Bowdoin Honors Negro
description: BRUNSWICK, Me., May 9 (AP)  Bowdoin College has awarded its Franklin Delano Roosevelt Cup to a former pres isend of the college AfroAmer ican Society. The recipient is Robert C. Johnson Jr., a Bow doin junior who is a guest stu dent at Tufts University this semester. The cup is given an nually to the underclassman whose vision, humanity and courage most contribute to making Bowdoin a better col lege.

title: Tigers Beat Royals
description: DETROIT, May 9 (AP)Wil lie Horton hit two home runs and drove in three runs today to help the Detroit Tigers rally for a 74 victory over the Kansas City Royals.

title: Spain Dismisses General Who Criticized the Regime
description: MADRID, May 9 (UPI)The government announced for mally today the dismissal of the chief of the military general staff school, who had spoken publicly of social injustice in Spain.

title: Alice Fenvessy and J. B. Healy Wed
description: Miss Alice Fenvessy was married here at noon yester day to James Bruce Healy in the Madison Avenue Pres byterian Church by the Rev. David H. C. Read.

title: Nixon: He Faces A Divided, Anguished Nation
description: WASHINGTONAmerica was a nation in anguish last week, her population divided, her cam puses closed, her capital shaken, her Government confused, her President perplexed.

title: Foreign Affairs: The Logic of Destruction
description: MADRIDIl popolo  una bestia, wrote Tommaso Cam panella, the people is a beast, and, like each species of beast from dinosaur to whooping crane, mankind now seems intent on selfdestruction as his predetermined function ap proaches an end.

title: Article 2  No Title
David Matheus Wilson to Wed Miss Elizabeth Hulsart on Aug. 1
description: Miss Elizabeth Sharon Hulsart, a personnel execu tive with the American Man agement Association, and David Matheus Wilson, as sociate director of special projects for the New York University Law School, plan to be married on Aug. 1.

title: PARLEY STRESSES AFRICAN HERITAGE
description: Many black scholars are at tempting to organize a world union of people of African de scent in the tradition of Marcus Garvey, founder of modern African nationalism.

title: Lag in Private Giving Forecast; Panel Calls for Tax Incentives
description: A citizens commission study ing philanthropy and founda tions has concluded that a multibilliondollar deficit in private giving many occur within five years and has urged the Nixon Administration to push for new and more demo cratic tax incentives to pre vent it.

title: Calendar of Horse Show Events
description: Today  Children's Services, Farmington Valley Polo Club, Farm ington, Conn. Championships in all divisions. 8:15 A.M.

title: CAMBODIAN CRISIS HURTS A FACTORY
description: CHOSUNG EK, Cambodia, May 4Shining mounds of stacked bottles and bowls are gradually surrounding the Ver rerie d'Etat, the $2million Cambodian state glass works built just outside Pnompenh by the Chinese.

title: Twins Down Indians
description: CLEVELAND, May 9 (UPI) Paul Ratliff, who had hit his last majorleague homer In 1963, hit one with a man on base in the ninth inning today and it gave the Minnesota Twins 53 victory over the Cleveland Indians.

title: A Dire View of the United States From Abroad
description: LONDON  To most Europeans, I guess, America now looks like the most dangerous country in the world. Since America is unquestionably the most powerful country, the transfor mation of America's image within the last 30 years is very frightening for Europeans. It is probably still more frightening for the great majority of the human race who are neither Euro peans nor North Americans, but are Latin Americans, Asians and Africans. They, I imagine, feel even more inse cure than we feel. They feel that, at any moment, America may intervene in their internal affairs with the same appalling consequences as have fol lowed from American intervention in Southeast Asia.

title: Income Rises In Virginia
description: RICHMOND, Va., May 9 The upward income trend continued in 1969 in the Fifth District, the latest editon of the Federal Reserve Bank of Richmond's Monthly Re view reports.

title: Prisoners Of Culture
description: There is good reason to be lieve that understanding man's present dilemmas depends to a large extent on understanding what happened in prehistory, during the hundreds and thou sands of millennia that preced ed Egypt and Greece and Rome. Any other conclusion would be surprising indeed, considering that members of the family of man roamed wildernesses for at least 15,000,000 years and have been civilized, or rather partly and intermittently civilized, for only 5,000 years. Conceding the pertinence of the remote past, however, the challenge is to spell it out. Specifically what information should be brought to the attention of people deep ly committed to the business of survival, people professionally concerned with such things as crime and drugtaking, poverty, defense and international di plomacy?

title: Is It True Women Hate Women?
description: I AM glad to learn from Joseph Papp's program notes for Mod Donna, the new musical at the Public Theater, that the evening is not to be construed as a profeminist entertainment. I am glad because if it were a feminist entertainment, anything I might have to say against it would be taken as maleoriented, biased, vengeful, nearsighted, thickheaded and disloyal to that half of the population which has been making so much noise lately and to which I have hitherto been so intensely devoted. I'm off the hook. Right?

title: Bridge
description: GLUTTONY ranks high on the list of deadly sins, for bridgeplay ers as well as for weightwatchers. But whereas the glutton at the din ingtable gains pounds and ounces and his wife ceases to love him, the glutton at the bridgetable loses pounds or dollars and his partner ceases to love him.

title: Discount Stores Face Challenges and Obligations of Success
description: In Indianapolis some weeks ago, seven new discount Lores sprang up like dan delions virtually overnight. In St. Louis, it took a bit lunger, but four national trains, including the first unit of a conventional depart mentstore chain that had started a discountstore sub sidiary, blanketed the area with multiple units. Compe tition in both cities rose sharply.

title: Pinning All on a Rope in Austria
description: INNSBRUCK, AustriaSix years ago, Hannes Gasser, Bergfiihrer (Moun tain leader), founded the Alpin schule Innsbruck. Today, it is the largest Alpine school in Austria. Its 29 Bergfiihrers have undergone two to four years of training, passed rigorous state examinations and are knowledgeable in all mountainclimbing techniques, as well as in geography, geology, botany, first aid and general geiniitlichkeit.

title: A Flock Of Ships
description: Out of the hulks of a pair of freighters destroyed by U boats in 1941, Mr. Callison has fabricated a story of war at sea that has just about every thing: An unorthodox but in genious naval engagement; a

title: Slain CoPilot Honored
description: MIAMI, May 9 (AP)East ern Airlines will name a new Miami training center for a copilot who was shot fatally on a shuttle flight from New York to Boston last March. The James E. Hartley Training Cen ter will be dedicated Wednes day, the airline said. Mr. Hart ley disarmed a gunman aboard his airliner, enabling the cap tain to land the plane's 73 oc cupants safely.

title: Dance: Royal Ballet's Superb Giselle
description: ONCE upon a time the Royal Ballet was a great organization that had two shining stars in its firma ment, They were Margot Fonteyn and Rudolf Nureyev, both laughingly called guest artists, but they were guests so frequently and were so absolutely invaluable that the company without them would be all but un thinkable.

title: A CONSERVATIVE ELECTED AT L.I.U.
description: In a complete turnabout from the current trend of col lege politics, the students at Long Island University's liberal Broklyn campus have elected an outspoken conservative Re publican as president of the student body. Moreover, he had the endorsement of a number of black student leaders on the campus.

title: The Miracle
description: Even in a late spring the eternal miracle of May is unmistakable. The idea that miracles must be mys terious, of course, misleads a good many people, for the wonders of May are not only out in plain sight but doing their best to be visible. There isn't much mystery about a flowering dogwood in full bloom, or a maple tree in first leaf, or a roadside goldspattered with dandelions. No mystery at all, except that big, enduring mystery of life.

title: Barbara Smith Married Here
description: The marriage of Miss Bar bara Lynn Smith, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph P. Smith of Bayside, Queens, to Charles Edwin Carr, son of Dr. and Mrs. Francis H. Carr of Worcester, Mass., took place here yesterday morn ing. Msgr. Thomas J. Feeney, uncle of the bride, performed the ceremony at a nuptial mass in St. Catherine of Si ena Roman Catholic Church.

title: Letters: Anyone for Bandarawela?
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Scientist Calls Two Children Too Few
description: Dr. Rene DuBos, the prize winning virologist, has told a group of scientists and human ists that he does not think Americans could survive with only two children to a family.

title: Results Uncertain In First Cambodian Forays
description: SAIGON  It is, of course, precisely what the generals here have always longed for: the chance to sweep through the enemy's sanctuaries in eastern Cambodia and smash them once and for all. But last Friday, the eighth day of the massive allied operation across the border, there was a distinct uneasiness among the military men at the headquarters of the United States command here.

title: amex Rally Fails to Go Past Losses
description: The American Stuck Ex chanoe and the overthe counter market staged a strong rally on Wednesday but the upswing was nut sufficient to puluret issues into the plus, column for the week.

title: Home Improvevnent
description: ACCORDING to a recent survey the second most popular extra that suburban home buyers would select, if they were given $2,400 to spend as they wished, is an under ground lawn sprinkling sys tem (central air conditioning was first). It's not hard to understand why sprinkling systems are so much in de mand. A look at any lawn that has one will graphically demonstrate how much greener and healthier looking the grass is when water is automatically and uniformly applied at regular intervals.

title: Chile Expecting a Close Election As 3 Compete for the Presidency
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, May 3  Chileans are ?? of saying that their ?? sport and entertainment is politics. If their degree of public participa tion is tallied, it would be difficult to doubt their claim.

title: ApresSeason Skiing All Summer Long In the French Alps
description: TIGNES, FranceA light snow began falling shortly after dark, dusting powder over the 15foot drifts that still blanketed the val ley. It had been a violent winter. Even the oldest among the natives could not recall, when the snows had swept so heavily and regularly across the French Alps.

title: E. H. Martin Fiance Of Eloise F. White
description: Miss Eloise Frances White and Edwin Hubbard Martin will be married June 14 in the Appleton Chapel at Har vard University.

title: SANDERSON GAINS LEAD IN YALE GOLF
description: NEW HAVEN, May 9Chase Sanderson, a sophomore at Yale, took full advantage of his knowledge of the home course today to gain the firstday lead in the 43d annual Eastern Inter collegiate Golf Association championship.

title: A Correction
description: In a reference to campus un rest in this section on May 3, the impression was incorrectly created that 15,000 demonstra tors at Yale had to be restrained by police using tear gas. The police action was directed against a small group of vio lent demonstrators; the major ity was orderly.

title: Iless Humphreys To Be June Bride
description: Miss Iness Humphreys, a senior at Colby College, and Robert Warner Nielsen, a senior at Amherst, plan to be married on June 13. Both will teach at the Pomfret School in Connecticut in the fall.

title: Charitable Work Aids Class
description: CATONSVILLE, Md., May 9 (AP)The first graduating class at the Baltimore County branch of the University of Maryland is soliciting loan funds for needy students in return for charitable work in the donor's behalf. The class had set a goal of $10,000 for the fund. At last count it had received $13.000 in dona tions.

title: Dance
description: WHEN Britain's Royal Ballet first visited New York 21 years ago, there were many marvels. The first sight New York had had (albeit under British aegis) of uncut and sumptuously staged ver sions of the great Tchaikov sky classics for one, and a first glimpse of Margot Fon teynJohn Martin called her a ballerina among balleri nas'for another. And then there was Frederick Ashton, Britain's leading choreograph er, and the style setter of the British school of dancing.

title: For Seed and Trowel Shoppers in the City
description: IN SPITE OF Manhattan's concrete canyons, there are oasis of greenery created by city gardeners who plant and tend on penthouse terraces, in brownstone backyards and on city root tops. Listed here are some of the garden centers where city folk can shop for all their growing needs. Most of the stores also have design and planting services available. Farm & Garden Nursery, 116 Reade Street.

title: Reds' Pamphlets Discuss Feminists
description: In the view of the Commu nist Party, U.S.A., what today's feminists call male chauvinism is really a capitalist plot.

title: JERSEY PLANNING 2 NEW COLLEGES
description: PLEASANTVILLE. N. J.,  Southern New Jersey's new fouryear state college has a staff of seven persons, a name honoring a native son who signed the Declaration of Inde pendence, a temporary office in a shopping center near Atlantic City and no buildings of its own.

title: The Patapharis Affair
description: One must take his hat off to the French, who have moved ahead in fiction on all fronts. In the novel of introspective experiment, no AngloSaxon has yet caught up with Claude Simon or Jean Cayrol. In the realistic novel, Bernard Clavel writes with an absolute con viction that makes him fresh and exciting. Even in the realm of fashionable surrealism,

title: Lone Woman
description: The devotional, even sac rificial character of the I9thcentury women's move ment is exemplified in Eliza beth Blackwell, the first woman of modern times to graduate in medicine. Impa tient with her limited role as teacher and abolitionist sym pathizer, this impoverished English immigrant girl still seemed an unlikely pioneer for she had not even considered the possibility until it was urged upon her by a dying friend who described the extra suffering she had undergone through the immodesty of having to be examined and treated by a man.

title: KNICKS TO LOSE 2 OR 3 MEN IN DRAFT
description: Two or three members of the New York Knicks will be among the 33 players lost to morrow when the National Basketball Association stock; Buffalo. Cleveland and Portland with players from its existing 14 teams.

title: Voter League in Nixon Plea
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (AP)  Delegates to the national convention of the League of Women Voters urged President Nixon today to listen to the voices of all the people. In a letter to the President, the dele gates said: We urge you to lis ten with close attention to the voices of all the peoplethe young and the mature, the poor and the affluent, the farms, the auburbs, the cities, and the campus.

title: Lavin Appointed Steward At Delaware Park Track
description: Allan W?. Lavin, longtime thoroughbred racing official and executive, has been named as a steward for the 1970 sea son at Delaware Park.

title: Knicks Sing Their Title Tune: Sitting on Top of the World
description: Top of the world, said a contented, champagnedoused young man named Walt Frazier.

title: F.A.A. Begins Reforms That Air Controllers Want
description: Leaders of the Federal Avi ation Administration have be gun to institute many of the reforms demanded by air traffic controllers whose mass sick calls caused nearchaos on the nation's airways for 21 days this spring.

title: MANSFIELD FACING TOKEN OPPOSITION
description: BILLINGS, Mont., May 9  United States Senator, Mike Mansfield faces only token opposition in the Montana Democratic primary election June 2, and the state's two members of the House of Rep resentatives, also Democrats, have no opponents.

title: POLITICAL ACTION BY YOUTH IS GOAL
description: Representatives of student and faculty organizations at 29 universities met here yesterday to plan strategy for electing antiwar candidates to Congress that they hope will provide a new trend for college students to get back into the electoral process.

title: The American Psychodrama Called Everyone Hates Us
description: THE phrase America has gone mad has, of course, been in constant use in Europe for gen erations. One can hardly open a book with any transAtlantic tinge without coming across it. For, of course, Euro peans have detected lunacy in the most varied American phenomena, from W. H. Auden's complaint about your insane salads to more general diagnoses of the whole American cul ture. If a Londoner accepts your in vitation to go into it all once again, it is because many Americans seem to have the wrong idea of just what it is that produces doubts in Euro minds.

title: Steel Shipments At Record Pace
description: The American Iron and S??el Institute has reported that steel shipments in January set a surprising, record pace.

title: Article 5  No Title
GOVERNORS FORM A POLLUTION UNIT
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., May 9 The Governors of 17 South ern and border states and two territories have joined in an effort to fight pollution through multistate compacts and agree ments.

title: The New Show
description: MOD DONNA, the New York Shakespeare Festival's pro duction of a musical by Myrna Lamb and Susan Hulsman Bingham, pleased one of the six critics who reviewed it. Clive Barnes: It is one of the most perti nent and stimulating offer ings that the New York Shakespeare Festival has so far given us. It is basically a political play, and al though I found it far from totally successful  artisti cally it is a very mixed eveningit raises the is sues of women's liberation in a persuasive manner that will be of interest to men and women alike. Miss Lamb has provided a cho rus of women who comment on the action, pointing out woman's sexual subjuga tion and the resultant arro gance of man. This, to me, was the nub of the piece, and I regret that the char acterless music by Susan Hulsman Bingham was not as memorable or as imagi native as Miss Lamb's lyrics. Joseph Papp has staged the work with a fluid form and sparsely ele gant look that is just right For Walter Kerr, see page 1.

title: Nicole Marie Bellamy Betrothed
description: Miss Nicole Marie Bellamy, a freshman at Bard College, and Edward Allen Loughman, a junior there, plan to be married on June 20.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: A $30million office build ing with a million square feet of floor space will be built in Cullen Center, a six block office and hotel com plex in downtown Houston. At 590 feet, the new tower will be the third tallest of fice building in the Texas city.

title: Critics of Strip Mining Are Stepping Up Resistance
description: MARSHALL'S BRANCH, Ky. The nation's second largest steel manufacturing corpora tion has started keeping a wire mesh container filled with dime store goldfish in the creek that gurgles down from steep, timbered hills and hollows to the narrow bottom land here.

title: Allison Escapes Injury
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 9 (AP) The racer driven by Donnie Allison of Hueytown, Ala., was involved in an accident today shortly after the Indianapolis Motor Speedway opened for practice. Allison said he lost control on a turn, apparently because of a gust of wind. The car spun and hit the track wall. Allison was not hurt.

title: Ireland: Crisis in South Over Aid To North
description: DUBLIN  In the heady days of the Irish rebellion, Eamon De Valera and his Warriors of Destiny (Fianna Fail) attacked the infant Irish Free State for accepting the British partition of Ireland. But in 38 years of almost continuous political dom ination, Fianna Fail has adjus ted to the existence of Northern Ireland as part of Great Britain. It has officially committed it self to work for reunification by polite diplomacy of indefinite duration.

title: Coins
description: THE Metropolitan New York Convention will open a fourday run on Thursday at the Park Sheraton Hotel, Seventh Avenue and 56th Street. More than 100 cases of world coin age, medals and paper monies will be displayed at the 15th annual event.

title: Pines Are At Home Everywhere
description: THERE is at least one pine adapted to every state and in some of the northern states as many as twen ty different species would make themselves at home. The best known shrub form is the mugo pine (Pinus mugo) which varies in the length of its needles, density, form and height. The looser more open forms with longer needles may reach a height of 10 to 12 feet while the short needled, dense types may be only two to three feet high after 15 years. Selections should be made in the nursery for a specific size.

title: A God Who Made Dam Builders Think Twice
description: DEL RIO, Tex.A massive stone statue of Tlaloc, the Aztec rain god, towers over the Mexican end of huge Amistad Dam on the Rio Grande and silently observes the rising popularity of Amistad Reservoir, the Southwest's newest floodcontrol and watersports recreation complex.

title: BILL LEE BASSISTS SKIM FOLK OPERA
description: Whenever Bill Lee's unique New York Bass Violin Choir has given a concert in recent years, its program has usually included a few excerpts from Mr. Lee's folk opera, The De pot. Friday night at Judson Hall, Mr. Lee and the Bass Vio lin Choir devoted most of the evening to The Depot, per forming enough to suggest that it is ready for some sort of regular presentation.

title: Unsolicited Mail Called Gift
description: AUSTIN, Tex. (UPI)Un solicited goods sent through the mail are regarded as gifts in Texas.

title: OPENINGS
description: THE SHEPHERD OF AVENUE B and STEAL THE OLD MAN'S BUNDLETomorrow, Fortune Theater, 7. Plays by Lawrence Holofcener and Kenneth Pressman.

title: Mrs. Thompson wed To S. F. Beach Jr.
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 Mrs. Kate Todd Thompson was married here this after noon to Samuel Ferguson Beach Jr. in St. John's Epis copal Church by the Rev. John C. Harper.

title: The Guard Is Poorly Trained For Riot Duty
description: WASHINGTONIn the after math, it seemed an alltoopre dictable tragedy compounded by the bitterness it engendered on a national scale.

title: Sarah Genung Bride in Jersey Of Carter Booth
description: PLAINFIELD, N. J., May Miss Sarah Madsen Genung and Carter Booth of New York were married here this afternoon in the Crescent Avenue Presbyterian Church by the Rev. Charles L. Meade. He was assisted by the Rev. Charles T. New berry 3d, minister of the First Presbyterian Church of Watsontown, Pa.

title: EXCITEMENT GONE FROM PARIS TALKS
description: PARIS, May 9The refusal of the two Communist dele gations to held the 66th plenary session last Wednesday has created an air of near crisis in the Vietnam peace talks. But it is generally agreed that the only concrete thing ;that any delegate lost by the refusal was the lunch the French hosts serve during the session break.

title: Ludwig Plus Four Other B's
description: THERE is a nice sense of directorial continuity in the New York Philhar monic's 197071 sea son. Leonard Bernstein, the orchestra's previous music director and now laureate conductor, will lead the open ing event on Sept. 22, a Pen sion Fund benefit, and con duct the first five weeks of subscription concerts. Early in the season George Szell, now in his last season as music advisor, will be in charge for another five weeks. Then Pierre Boulez, who becomes music director in the fall of 1971, will have the season's final five weeks, ending on 15.

title: Camera Doings
description: PROCLAIMED by the manufacturer to be the world's small est, lightest, instant load singlelens reflex cam era, the Rolleiflex SL 26 Is now being distributed in this country by Honeywell Photographic Products. Equipped with a 40mm f/2.8 Zeiss Tessar lens, the cam era is priced at $329.50 and offers interchangeble lenses, throughthelens exposure control, and miniaturized be tweenthelens shutter with nine Xsynchronized shutter speeds. Two bayonetmounted accessory lenses are avail able: a 28mm f/3.2 Zeiss ProTessar wideangle, and an 80mm f/4 Zeiss ProTessar telephoto.

title: Curb on Loitering In a Campus Town On Coast Defeated
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif., May 9Several members of the fiveman Santa Barbara County Board of Supervisors say they intend to reintroduce a stern antiloitering ordinance if distur bances break out again in Isla Vista.

title: Marcel Cerdan Jr.'s Mystique Likely to Draw 13,000 to Bout Here Tomorrow
description: Tomorrow night, when Marcel Cerdan Jr, makes his American boxing debut at Madi son Square Garden he will be wearing memory of his father.

title: D. S. Dodge Weds Mrs. Garfield Here
description: The marriage of Mrs. Christine Henriques Garfield of Lake Forest, Ill., and Cut tyhunk Island, Mass., to Douglas Sutherland Dodge of New York and Sheffield, Mass., took place here yes terday afternoon in the chap el of the Unitarian Church of All Souls. The Rev. Dr. Walter Donald Kring per formed the ceremony.

title: TODAY'S PROBABLE PITCHERS
description: San Francisco at New York (2 P.M.)Marichal (0.0) vs. Ryan (22).

title: Telephone Operator Union Tells Members to Call in Sick Today
description: The telephone operators' union has told its members to call in sick today to put pres sure on the New York Tele phone Company in a wage dispute.

title: Foreigners Study U.S. Management
description: The Americans are bet ter! Everyone knows that. You can see it in the way they take over our business.

title: Sports Today
Sponsor of Massachusetts Bill To Test War Dies of Gun Injury
description: NEWTON, Mass., May 9  State Representative H. James Shea Jr., sponsor of the Massa chusetts legislation designed to test the constitutionality of the war in Vietnam, died of a gun shot wound at his home early today.

title: Looking Beyond The Pill
description: WASHINGTONThe era of chemical birth control is about to enter its second decade with the prospect that it will be as far differ ent from the first as that span was from all the ages that went before.

title: CORNFELD RESIGNS AS I.O.S. CHAIRMAN
description: GENEVA, May 9  Bernard Cornfeld resigned today as chairman and chief executive officer of Investors Overseas Services, the mutualfund com plex he founded 14 years ago and built into a financial em pire.

title: The Fortune Machine
description: A programer in a computer dating service devises a system to break the bank at Las Vegas. With the two hundred grand he plans to win at blackjack, Eddie Clark hopes to subsidize marriage to the girl of his dreams, daughter of rich truck ing magnate. Veteran students of vingtetun may wonder if Eddie's system (which is sup posed to work even when the dealer's sleightofhand stacks the killing honorcards) is real ly foolproof. But Mr. Rose han dles his affairs in nice, hard boiled pulpmagazine style, bringing special authority to the junctures at the gambling table.

title: 2 Mount Vernon Runners Star; Nine School Meet Records Fall
description: WHITE PLAINS, May 9Two unusual things happened today at the third annual Loucks Me morial schoolboy track and field games. For one, the meet ended an hour ahead of schedule, a rarity for schoolboy meets.

title: Campaign to End Legal Restrictions on Abortions in Canada Begun by Women's Liberation Movement
description: TORONTO, May 9A nation wide campaign to make abor tion completely legal in Cana da has been begun by the wom en's Liberation Movement.

title: Authors' Queries
description: I am writing a biography of the English writer and author of Black Beauty, Anna Sewell (182078), and I would be grateful for information about any papers connected with her that may be in this country.

title: Article 11  No Title
MANGAN REGISTERS 2 UPSETS IN TENNIS
description: ARMONK, N. Y., May 9Up sets marked the resumption of play in the annual Westchester County tennis championships at the Armonk Club today.

title: PICTURE CREDITS
description: 1Dennis Chalkin; The New York Times (George Tames)

title: Flag Misuse Made Crime
description: MADISON HEIGHTS, Mich., May 9 (AP)An emergency or dinance has been approved by the City Commission in this De troit suburb making it a crime to act contemptuously againstii either the American or Michi gan flag.

title: Soviet Pollution Reaches Capitalistic Quantities
description: LOS ANGELES Two cur rents of thought run through the current flurry of environ mental protest demonstra tions at stockholder meetings of big corporations.

title: GEORGETOWN IS 2D ON THE SCHUYLKILL
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 9 After dominating the Dad Vail varsity competition for two straight years, Georgetown was beaten by a smoothstroking St. Joseph's eight on the sunny Schuylkill today.

title: Lebanon Holds Frenchman In Hijacking of U.S. Jet
