title: U.S. to Sell Jets to Latins
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP) The United States has agreed to sell 16 military jets to Argentina and has agreed in principal to the sale of 50 other jets to Brazil, Chile and Colom bia. The State Department made the announcement yes terday, adding that it was seek ing to counteract what it called the increasing dependence of LatinAmerican countries on European military suppliers.

title: INCREASE IS URGED IN BLACK DOCTORS
description: WASHINGTON, May 16A study group sponsored by major medical organizations has recommended a sweeping na tional program to increase the number of blacks and other minoritygroup students in the nation's medical schools.

title: Martha Beard Plans Nuptials
description: RYE, N. Y., May 16Mr. and Mrs. Josephus Simmons Beard 2d have anounced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Martha Lyndley Blaine Beard, to Peter Will liam Retchin, son of Mr. and Mrs. Norman Retchin of Greenwich. Conn.

title: Increasingly, Business Must Face Issue of Consumerism
description: Caspar W. Weinberger, the new chairman of the Federal Trade Commission, is apparently nudging Mrs. Virginia H. Knauer, the Pres ident's Special Assistant for Consumer Affairs, from her top role as the most popular speaker at business functions on the consumer issue.

title: Ed Begley 19011970
description: ED BEGLEY was a powerful actor of great simplicity and truth. He was some thing of a true primitive. By that I mean that he was selftaught. Indeed, he did not come to New York to become an actor until he was past 40. So far as I know, he received no artistic in struction of any kind.

title: PERSONALITY TAKES $203,800 PREAKNESS BY A NECK; KOOSMAN BEATS PHILS, 60
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 16  Like Old Man River, the New York Mets' young pitching staff kept rolling along tonight as Jerry Koosrnan sent the Philadelphia Phillies to their ninth straight defeat with a fourhit shutout.

title: Martha Beard Plans Nuptials
description: RYE, N. Y., May 16Mr. and Mrs. Josephus Simmons Beard 2d have anounced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Martha Lyndley Blaine Beard, to Peter Will liam Retchin, son of Mr. and Mrs. Norman Retchin of Greenwich. Conn.

title: U.S. Business:
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP)  Mergerminded com panies swallowed up a rec ord of 4,550 other concerns last year as the impact of the trend toward concen tration spread to all sectors of the economy, the Federal Trade Commission reports.

title: Swedish Soccer Side Wins
description: BUDAPEST, May 16 (AP) Sweden's World Cup soccer team defeated Hungary 21, to day in an exhibition match.

title: Marjorie Fleck, Scott Withers Wed in Jersey
description: PLAINFIELD, N. J., May 16The marriage of Miss Marjorie Elizabeth Fleck, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. G. Peter Fleck of Bernardsville, and South Orleans, Mass., to Scott Kelso Withers, son of Mr. Walter Withers of West Hartford, Conn., and the late Mrs. Withers, took place this morning in the First Unitarian Church here. The Rev. Ray mond J. Baughan performed the ceremony. He was assist ed by Michael Lee Carter Henderson, the bride's broth erinlaw, who is a divinity student.

title: U.S. STAR BEATEN ON A SLOW COURT
description: LONDON, May 16 (AP) Bob Maud defeated Keith Die pream, 75, 75. 86. in an all South African final to win the London hardcourt (clay) tennis ??nament at the Hurlingham Club today.

title: FEDERAL UNIONS SEER TO BE CALM
description: WASHINGTON, May 16Two months after the postal strike and the air traffic controllers' stickout that seemed to shat ter the no strike tradition of Civil Service, further evidence of turbulence among Federal employes and their unions is hard to find.

title: Miss Wesson And John Hope Are Wed Here
description: Miss Victoria Wesson, daughter of Mrs. Frank Lee Wesson of Victoria. Ark., and Cotuit, Mass., and the late Mr. Wesson, was married here yesterday afternoon to John Tickner Hope, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur H. Hope of Shrewsbury. N. J. and Marco Island, Fla. The cere mony was performed in the chapel of St. Bartholomew's Episcopal Church by the Rev. Dr. Terence J. Finlay.

title: Miss Susan Hathaway Bunting Wed to James Robert Blunt Jr.
description: STRAFFORD, Pa., May 16  The marriage of Miss Su san Hathaway Bunting, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Reeves Bunting, to James Robert Blunt Jr. of Philadel phia, son of Mrs. M. McCol lum Blunt of Narberth, and J. Robert Blunt of Birming ham, Mich., took place here this afternoon at the Bunting home.

title: Barbara Joan Munson Wed to Frederick Goff
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., May 16Miss Barbara Joan Munson and Frederick James Goff were married here this afternoon in Kirkpatrick Chapel at Rutgers University. The Rev. John C. Owens, assistant rector at St. Luke's Episcopal Church in Mont clair, performed t he cere mony.

title: Groton School Shows Art
description: A memorial exhibition of watercolor and tempera paint ings of John Heber Murray (19191969) is being held at Groton School in Massachusetts until May 30. An instructor at the school for 16 years, Mr. Murray taught drawing and painting, as well as sculpture crafts.

title: Predictable
description: By midMay the year always catches up. When we stop to think of it we often tell ourselves how wonderful it is that things worked out that way again, that things have evened out in time for June.

title: DOMINICANS VOTE IN RELATIVE CALM
description: SANTO DOMINGO, Domini can Republic, May 16Presi dent Joaquin Balaguer's bid for re  election against four oppo nents brought out an apparent ly light and peaceable turnout of Dominican voters today.

title: MRS. HERBERT B. FEIT
description: Mrs. Sylvia Kaufman Feit, wife of Herbert B. Feit, presi dent of Richelieu Fabrics, Inc., died Thursday of cancer at her home, 8116 189th Street, Ja maica Estates, Queens. Her age was 54.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: One misty morning not long ago, when the dew was on the thorn, I drove my Jeep to a lonely beach and there amidst other jetsam prepared to quiddle away an hour at fishing for striped bass.

title: 13 Exofficials Urge More Foreign Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Alay 16 Three former high Government officials told a Congressional panel this week that survival of the United States and of the world required larger amounts of foreign aid for economic de velopment and a concerted ef fort to solve the economic and social problems of poor coun tries.

title: DR. FOSTER ORTON
description: RAHWAY, N. J., May 16 Dr. Foster Orton of 911 Bryant Street, attending surgeon at the Rahway Memorial Hospital and past president of its medical staff, died today in the hospital. His age was 58.

title: Eva Abt and George Kemp 3d Married
description: GREENWICH, Conn., May 16  Miss Eva Helen Abt and Spec. 5 George Steven son Kemp 3d, U.S.A., were married here this morning in St. Bede's Chapel at Rose mary Hall by the Rev. Frank lin K. Robinson, an Episcopal minister.

title: Festivolution Now!
description: CANNES, France. IF and when the world ends, I wouldn't be at all surprised if there weren't at least two or three American movie companies willing to bid for the distri bution rights, on the outside chance that the cataclysm might turn out to be a good show, as well as something less than total. One of the most impressive things about the justended 23d Inter national Cannes Film Festival was the apparent enthusiasm of American film people to merchandise national disas ter. Sometimes this was simply a coincidence, as when Stuart Hagmann's The Strawberry Statement, a drama of campus unrest that has a brutal police riot as its climax, was shown here the day after the news came in from Kent, Ohio. Sometimes it seemed more selfconscious, more selfserving. The direc tor of Woodstock, Michael Wadleigh, a handsome young man who wears his hair in a long, Christlike bob, and his associates passed out black arm bands at the screening of their film, which they an nounced was being dedicated to the four students who were killed by U.S. troops while manifesting their oppo sition to the Vietnam and Cambodian wars. Unfortu nately, this gesture, no mat ter how sincere, followed a lot of conventional, high pressure publicity organized on behalf of the film by War ner Brothers, the distributor, and thus suggested oppor tunism, at least to members of the press corps. Warners had celebrated the film's ap pearance here by, among other things, passing out Wood stock headbands and lapel pins (the sort of things that are printed to order on 42d Street), bringing in a couple of bus loads of American students from AixenPro vence to carry antiwar ban ners in a small manifesta tion, by staging a rock con cert on the beach and by throwing a hippiestyle party that had, I'm told; a couple of the most elegant of the local couturiers working overtime. I think, said one French producer, that War ners did everything but plant a bomb in the festival palace.

title: ROME DAILY FIGHTS PARISBASED PAPER
description: ROME, May 16The Daily American, the Englishlanguage newspaper published here, in formed its readers today that it was in a circulation war with the International Herald Tribune, based in Paris.

title: LIFE IN 6TH FLEET: ROUTINE HAZARDS
description: ABOARD U.S.S. JOSEPH P. KENNEDY JR., in the Mediter ranean, May 10Aboard the gray ships of the Sixth Fleet moving through the placid Med iterranean are missiles that can pluck an enemy bomber out of the sky. Cockpits of fighters and bombers display a bewildering array of complex apparatus. The mushroom farms, as the sailors call the combat control rooms, are the epitome of computerized, elec tronic warfare.

title: WAR RADICALIZES MANY AT OBERLIN
description: OBERLIN, Ohio, May 14  The corridors of Wilder Hall ere plastered with notices, pos ters, petitions and newspaper clippings, and the tired looking students pause to check them as they go to and from inter minable meetings and discus sions.

title: To the Hartford Convention
description: Traditionally regarded as one of the darker episodes in American his tory, the Hartford Convention of 1814 has usually been interpreted as a blatant expression of New England disloyalty and sectional selfinterest, conceived by radical Federalist lead ers to promote secession and rend the young American republic. In this thorough and frankly revisionist study, James M. Banner Jr. of Prince ton University convincingly chal lenges this view. In the process, he displays an impressive ability to handle both intellectual and quanti tative data intelligently and effec tively and adds important new di mensions to our understanding of party development and the diffi culty of achieving national political integration in the American nation.

title: LondonBased Company to Buy 16 More Tugs for Its Oil Fleet
description: A Londonbased consortium that operates a fleet of 34 sea going tugs announced yester day that it would order 16 more vessels in an $18.5mil lion acquisition program.

title: President Is Named At Hampton Institute
description: HAMPTON, Va., May 16 Dr. Roy D. Hudson, former associate dean of the Brown University graduate school, who is a widely known neuro pharmacologist, has been named as president of Hamp ton Institute.

title: Derailment Disrupts L.I.R.
description: MANHASSET, L. I., May 16 A Long Island Railroad work train locomotive was derailed here this morning, disrupting service between 11 A.M. and 1 P.M., when the track was cleared. Eastbound trains on the Port Washington line were terminated at Great Neck and passengers were transported by bus to stations farther east.

title: PICTURE CREDITS
description: 1Micha BarAm from Magnum

title: I.C.4A Track Tickets Go On Sale Tomorrow
description: Tickets for the 94th an nual I,C.4A track and field championships go on sale tomorrow at the University of Pennsylvania's Franklin Field in Philadelphia, where the event will he held on May 29 and 30, The starting time each day will be 1 P.M.

title: The Hudson Compact
description: By extending the Hudson River Compact Law for another three years, the Federal Government has helped insure that its own river and construction proj ects along the Hudson will he carefully scrutinized for possible environmental intrusions. The compact, which links the Federal Government with New York and New Jersey on matters affecting the Hudson, gives the Secretary of the Interior review power over Federal projects that could harm the Hudson's ecology, beauty and natural resources.

title: U.S. Quits Cambodia Area
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 16The United States military command announced today the end of one of its operations in Cambodia and the return to South Vietnam of final elements of the 5,500 troops involved.

title: Advertising:
description: The successful industrial ad agency of today has di versified into many areas. And it's a good thing, too, since industrial budgets in the present economy are tak ing a beating.

title: New and Recommended
description: CITY LIFE, by Donald Barthelme. Q. Is the novel dead? A. Depends on how you look at it. One fresh perspective can be found in these taped segments from the American Language Library.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Nixon Names I.C.C. Aide
description: KEY BISCAGNE, Fla., May 16 (UPI)  President Nixon nominated W. Donald Brewer, deputy administrator of the Small Business Administration to fill a vacancy on the Inter state Commerce Commission.

title: Lawrence Bennett Dead at 81; Lawyer Was Mortgage Expert
description: Lawrence Bennett, a partner in the New York law firm of Milbank, Tweed, Hadley & Mc Cloy, died Friday in the Colum biaPresbyterian Medical Cen ter. He was 81 years old and lived at 15 Peaceable Street, Ridgefield, Conn., and at 301 East 75th Street here.

title: Heavy Chinese Buying Keeps World Steel Demand High
description: By linking a fairly long chain of causes and effects, it is possible to suggest that a few steelworkers in Gary, Ind., or Youngstown, Ohio, owe their jobs to the fact that Communist China is import ing more and more metals of all kinds.

title: Cecily Fowler Fiancee Of Gordon Grand 3d
description: KATONAH, N.Y., May 16  Harry Winthrop Fowler, chairman and president of the Fiduciary Trust Com pany of New York, and Mrs. Fowler of Katonah and George Town, Exuma, the Bahamas, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Cecily Win throp Fowler, to Gordon Grand 3d. He is the son of Mr. Grand, president of the Olin Corporation, and Mrs. Grand of Greenwich, Conn., and Fishers Island.

title: Move Over, You Mets, Jets and Knicks, Make Way for the Jolts
description: In the corner between rounds. Bobby Lewis crouched as he spoke to James Brackett, a tall featherweight.

description: BASEBALL

title: Winds Bar Gale Warning
description: ATLANTIC CITY (UPI)No gale warnings were hoisted here for a storm, after high winds blew down the flagpole at the Coast Guard station here or which the redandblack gale warning flags are displayed.

title: Olympic Unit Puts Off Talks On Amateurism Until Fall
description: AMSTERDAM. The Nether lands, May 16 (AP)The Inter national Olympic Committee put off the question of ama truism until its September meeting as it completed 10 days of talks today.

title: Rail Buffs Hear Call of Open Road
description: FOR the motorist, this is the time of year to hit the open road. For the railroad buff, this is the beginning of the sea son for special excursions, the time, perhaps, to get a seat behind a steampowered locomotive for a dayeven at the risk of catching a cin der in the eye. A wide va riety of such excursions and/ or tours is on the agenda, among them the following:

title: Boston 16891776
description: On the eighteenth of April, 1689 86 years to the day before Gen eral Gage's troops marched from Boston through the Middlesex coun tryside to Lexington and Concord, thus launohing the war of the Amer ican Revolution there was a blood less rebellion in the town of Boston.

title: Alan Anderson Weds Miss Nelson
description: The marriage of Miss Karyn Jeannine Nelson to Alan Betts Anderson, son of Mrs. F. David Anderson of Greenwich, Conn., and the late Mr. Anderson, took place yesterday afternoon in Sas katoon, Saskatchewan. The Rev. D. E. Christensen per formed the ceremony in the Augustana Lutheran Church.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Art
description: JAPANESE painting today is in a position so ambivalent as to be downright schizoid, although you would never suspect it from the examples exhibited in this country. The Japanese at home are aggressively proud of being Japanese and at the same time determined to match the West at its own game. Our exhibitions of Japanese art take no notice of the Japanese obsession with tradition, but are selected from the provincial point of view by which the merit of any work is gauged by its degree of adherence to one or another of the international vogues. The biggest of these exhibitions, the Museum of Modern Art's New Japanese Painting and Sculpture, of 1966, could as well have been called New York in Tokyo.

title: Spotlight:
description: The partner in charge of the Chicago office of a ma jor brokerage house recently riffled through the day's stock trades made by the of fice. There were a total of eight tickets involving about 2.000 shares.

title: Opera Center's Il Giuramento Honors Its Neglected Composer
description: It was to be hoped that the newly established American Opera Center of the Juilliard School would turn its attention to more than just the standard repertory and essay the new or the neglected. In their second production at the Juilliard Theater Friday night, they visited the past with a ven geance, digging up an 1837 opera, Il Giuramento, by practically forgotten Italian, Saverio Mercadante.

title: CHANGES PRESSED IN RENT PROPOSAL
description: Changes in Mayor Lindsay's rent control package were pro posed yesterday by a leader of the City Council to limit in creases for 200,000 lowincome families and guarantee some re lief to their landlords.

title: Patricia Gresio And J. R. Peters To Be Married
description: GLEN COVE, L. I., May 16 Miss Patricia Gresio, who will he graduated Friday from Skidmore College, and John Runals Peters, a cum laude graduate of Union Col lege, plan to be married June 26 in St. Patrick's Cathedral in New York.

title: Article 5  No Title
Citizens' Group Asks That the City School Board Put Agendas for Its Hearings in Laymen's Language
description: A recommendation has been made that the Board of Educa tion draft hearing agendas in laymens' language, with im portant items easily identifi able. The action was urged last week by a civic group that suggested that the board and the newly elected community school boards could facilitate their public hearings by adop ting the reform.

title: Stram Stars in Film of the Super Bowl
description: NFL Films, producer of the annual Super Bowl film plus a host of other pro foot ball shows for television and promotional purposes, achieved another first this spring. The coach of the win ning Super Bowl team was wired for sound throughout the game and thus became a focal point of the movie. Hank Stram, the coach of the champion Kansas City Chiefs, emerged as the star of the new Super Bowl film, which will inaugu rate the American Express television series over the Co lumbia Broadcasting System network on May 24.

title: U.S. SECRETLY SENT ARMS TO CAMBODIA
description: WASHINGTON, May 16The United States secretly began supplying Cambodia with small arms on April 25 while the Nixon Administration said publicly that no decision had yet been made on Premier Lon Nol's request for military as sistance.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: TWO Wall Street invest ment companiesGold man, Sachs & Co. and Halle Stieglitz, Inc.have taken large blocks of space in the 53story office build ing under construction at 55 Water Street on the edge of the downtown financial dis trict.

title: U. S. Is Told That Unsafe Toys Are Still on Sale Despite Ban
description: WASHINGTON, May 15Six months after the enactment of a law intended to protect children from dangerous toys, the Government has not used its authority to remove such toys from the market.

title: F. C. Havemeyer Weds Cecile Hoge
description: St. Ignatius Loyola Roman Catholic Church was the set ting here yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Miss Sarah Cecile Hoge, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Hamilton Hoge, to Frederick Christian Havemeyer Jr., a member of a family long indentified with the sugar industry in this country.

title: Stamps
description: ROBERT P. ODENWEL LER of Glen Cove, N. Y., topped other American exhibitors at ANPEX, the recent Sydney, Australia, international exhi bition. His display of Samoa, the Express and G. R. I. is sues was awarded a gold silver medal.

title: CUBS STOP SLUMP, SUBDUE CARDS, 32
description: ST. LOUIS, May 16  Two out doubles by Cleo James and the pitcher, Ken Holtzman, in the fifth inning ended the Chi cago Cubs' scoreless streak at 22 innings today and the Cubs went on to defeat the tS. Louis Cardinals, 32.

title: Winged Foot Golf Club Gets '72 Women's Open
description: The 1972 United States women's open golf champion ship will be played over the East Course of the Winged Foot Golf Club at Mamaro neck, N. Y., June 29 to July 2. This will be the second time the club has been host to the women's open. It was played there in 1957.

title: PRINTERS STEP UP PRESSURE TACTICS
description: Union printers increased their economic pressure on The New York Times yesterday in an ef fort to get the paper to make a higher contract offer to them.

title: Trial of Draft Board Ransackers to Hear a Challenge to War
description: CHICAGO, May 16The trial of 11 persons accused of ran sacking a Chicago Selective Service office enters its third week Monday with the defend ants preparing to attack Amer ica's involvement in the Indo china war and continuing to challenge a Federal court's au thority to try them.

title: Colombian President Lifts PostElection State of Siege
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, May 16. (UPI)President Carlos Lieras Restrepo today lifted a state of siege that he imposed April 21 after postelection street dis turbances and also ended the house arrest of the defeated presidential candidate, Gen. Gustavo. Rojas Pinilla.

title: M*A*S*H Wins Top Cannes Prize; Italian Film Is 2d
description: CANNES, France, May 16 (UPI)The American movie M*A*S*H, an antiwar comedy set in Korea, was awarded the Golden Palm as the best pic ture of the 23d International Cannes Film Festival tonight.

title: Martha Beard Plans Nuptials
description: RYE, N. Y., May 16Mr. and Mrs. Josephus Simmons Beard 2d have anounced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Martha Lyndley Blaine Beard, to Peter Will liam Retchin, son of Mr. and Mrs. Norman Retchin of Greenwich. Conn.

title: Old Blue Beats London Irish In Rgby Match Here, 123
description: American rugby further es tablished itself as a growing power in international compe tition when the Old Blue of New York trounced the London Irish considered one of the world's best clubs, 123, at Gaelic Park in the Bronx yes terday. The Irish team included guest players from the powerful Malone club of Ulster.

title: Uneasiness Grips Israeli Town Near Lebanese Line
description: QIRYAT SHMONA, Israel, May 14 The irregular black smudges on the pavement of this northern frontier town are from a spectacular display of Roman candles, Catherine wheels and green and gold sky rockets.

title: Personalities:
description: Peter J. H. Pattinson hopes to sell American utilities three to five large, British made turbine generators a year. That's a major part of his job as president of the English Electric Corporation.

title: Nuptials for Miss Brooke Babcock
description: DENVER, May 16Miss Brooke Somerville Babcock, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Hugh Babcock of Katonah, N. Y., and Tucker's Town, Bermuda, was married here this afternoon to William King Prather, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Edward Prather of Denver.

title: Chess
description: THE recent 10board, fourround chess match between the Soviet Union and the rest of the world was a Soviet win by the narrow est of margins: 2019. Twentyone games were drawn, while 19 were played to a decision.

title: A Haven for the Amateur Naturalist
description: BAR HARBOR, Me.Schoodic Point is only five miles across French man Bay from Bar Harbor, but it is a full 50 miles around the head of the bay by road. One result of this isolation is that there are relatively few visitors to this outlying piece of Acadia National Park.

title: Reader's Report
description: Snakes

title: Foreign Affairs: Who Will Rogers Talk To?
description: MADRIDWhen Secretary of State Rogers comes here this month his visit will be inade quate and will leave a distorted impression unless he makes sure to confer with opposition leaders as well as Spain's mono lithic Government.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE FINANCIAL EDITOR:

title: Unbeaten Cornell Trounces Princeton in Lacrosse, 155
description: PRINCETON, N. J., May 16 Alan Rimmer scored four goals and had two assists vesterday to lead Cornell to a 155 la Crosse victory over Princeton. It was the Big Red's ninth straight victory, without a de feat.

title: DUTCH RUETHER, PITCHER ON REDS
description: PHOENIX, May 16 (AP)  Walter H. (Dutch) Ruether, who pitched for the Cincinnati Reds against the Chicago White Sox, in the World Series of 1919 that produced the Black Sox scandal almost a year later, died here today at a hospital. He was 76 years old.

title: Miss Bowman To Be a Bride
description: Miss Pamela Ann Bowman and John Helm Lockwood Jr. plan to be married on June 6 in Brussels, where the future bridegroom is marketing su pervisor with Loews Loril lard International.

title: GONZALES DEFEATS LAVER, WINS $17,500
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 16 (AP)  Pancho Gonzales, the 42yearold tennis pro, posted a stunning victory over the top seeded Rod Laver of Aus tralia today in the $47,000 Howard Hughes champion ships.

title: Residents Rallying to Preserve A Part of Herningway's Paris
description: PARIS May 14  A cam paign has begun to preserve the charms of La Mouffe, the Left Bank neighborhood that Ernest Hemingway loved as young man and which he re called fondly in A Moveable Feast as that wonderful nar row crowded market street which led into the Place Con trescarpe.

title: What About America?
description: Comes the time for drooling over the alluring bargain rates offered by the airlines: low fare, plus hotel, plus entertainment, plus the use of a car, Lucullan meals, sybaritic seating space and hostesses as solicitous as Florence Nightingale and as beautiful as Nefertiti. And, almost simultaneously with the drooling, the conscience (of some) stages its dialogue for one.

title: Dartmouth Captures 15th in Row as Big Green Keeps Eastern League Title
description: HANOVER, N. H., May 16 Dartmouth defeated the Uni versity of Pennsylvania, 50, at Rolfe Field today to clinch its second straight Eastern Inter collegiate Baseball League championship.

title: Wheeler Sisters to Be Brides Of Virginia Graduate Students
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., May 16Miss Judith Ann Wheeler plans to be married on June 13 to Peter Hall Herwick. Her sister, Miss Elizabeth Jane Wheeler, has set Aug. 29 as the date for her wedding to Nicholas Giles Ceppi.

title: Ski Unit to Stiffen Rules Enforcement
description: AMSTERDAM, the Netherlands, May 16 On the Monday after a big ski race, there is a rush by hundreds of youngsters throughout the Alps to buy the same equip ment the winner used.

title: OPEN JUMPER LEAD TO THE IMMIGRANT
description: BUFALO, May 16The Iro migrant, ridden by Jim Elder, longtime captain of the Can adian Equestrian Team, look a commanding lead for the open jumper championship at the Buffalo international horse show tonight when he won the time event.

title: U.S. AIDE ATTACKS SUBURBAN ZONING
description: The Nixon Administration's top housing official in the Northeast has chided the New York State Urban Development Corporation for what he called erroneous and misleading comments about the importance of suburban zoning as an ob stacle to the construction of subsidized housing.

title: 15 NATIONS ENTER WEST INDIES RACE
description: With a record number of en tries (more than 50) signed to compete in this year's St. Vin centBequia British Overseas Airways Corporation yacht re gatta, the stiffest competition in the 10 years of organized sailboat competitions was ex pected for the sunandsea West Indies playland.

title: Music
description: THE New York Philharmonic is end ing its season this week with per formances of one of the morefor gotten choral works of the repertory. Lorin Maazel has chosen Robert Schu mann's Das Paradies and die Peri as the valedictory. This long work seldom turns up, in this country, at least, and the only public performance in New York that this writer knows about took place some years ago at City College. That was a nonprofessional performance in 1964, and was claimed to be the first New York performance since 1902. Paradies and die Peri was played a bit in this city during the previous century, when Schu mann was a more popular composer than he is today. This century has relegated a great deal of his music to obscurity.

title: Nixon's Southern strategy
description: THE Grand Old Party still lay buried under the debris of the latest Democratic landslide 1964when a young, selftaught ethnologist named Kevin Phillips emerged from his charts and maps to avow to skeptical hearers that just around the corner was an inevi table cycle of Republican dominance that would begin in the late nine teensixties and prosper until the advent of the 21st century. To the pure of heart it all sounded spooky and a bit repugnant because it was premised on the alleged hostility of Irishmen, Italians and Poles, whose ethnic traits were conservative, toward Jews, Negroes and affluent Yankees, whom history had made liberal. There were more of the former and they were ineluctably trending Republican.

title: Sale Nears Success For A.T. &T.
description: If a corporation were just setting out to sell the biggest bond issue in history, it almost certainly would not choose to schedule the financing between April 13 and May 18 this year.

title: New Rule on Drugging Passed By A .H .S .A. Board of Directors
description: THE final version of the new, stringent rule on drugs has been passed by the board of directors of the American Horse Show Asso ciation. It has been modified only slightly from the origi nal rule which was presented to the annual A.H.S.A. con vention four months ago and will go into ef fect with shows whose entries close after July 1. When many del egates protested that some sections of the original rule would he un workable and place unneces sary hardships on blameless competitors, the Association agreed to study the measure for another 90 days.

title: Students Get Out to Race Track To Find Odds on Getting a Job
description: WESTBURY, L. I., May 16 They were off and running at Roosevelt Raceway this week as 6,000 Nassau County high school students met with potential employers.

title: New AirBag Car System Demonstrated by Toyota
description: MILFORD, Mich., May 16 Toyota, Ltd., the largest Ja panese exporter of cars into the United States, this week un veiled a new airbag system that may have the answers to many of the problems encoun tered so far in developing safe effective alternative to the seat belt in protecting auto mobile riders from death and injury.

title: Masterpieces Of the Frick Collection
description: Among the most useful products of contemporary publishing are the many books that illustrate works of art in the great galleries of the world. These publications are the building material of Malraux's Mu seum Without Walls. For the first time the Frick collection joins this assemblage. Its volume of master pieces contains 24 excellent repro ductions in color and 96 black and white illustrations emphasizing paint ings, but also showing significant ex amples in other fields: sculpture, dec orative arts, porcelains, enamels, car pets, silver and drawings.

title: U.S. to Sell Jets to Latins
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP) The United States has agreed to sell 16 military jets to Argentina and has agreed in principal to the sale of 50 other jets to Brazil, Chile and Colom bia. The State Department made the announcement yes terday, adding that it was seek ing to counteract what it called the increasing dependence of LatinAmerican countries on European military suppliers.

title: U.S. QUINTET SCORES IN WORLD TOURNEY
description: LJUBLJANA, Yougoslavia, May 16 (UPI)Darnell Hillman scored 21 points and Mike Silli man added 16 to lead the United States to an 8860 rout of Czechoslovakia today in the opening game of the finals of the sixth world basketball championship.

title: Margaret Budd And Bruce Beh Wed in Suburbs
description: COLD SPRING HARBOR, L. I., May 16Miss Margaret Beekman Budd was married here at noon today to Bruce Michael Beh.

title: $2,600 AWARDED IN RIGHTS CASES
description: TRENTON. May 16The New Jersey Division on Civil Rights announced this week that two complainants in a housing dis crimination casea Malaysian Government official and a black woman from Camden County had been awarded a percedent setting $2,500 in compensa tory damages.

title: CARLOS J. WARNER
description: NORWALK, Conn., May 16 Carlos J. Warner, former con sul general in Zurich, Switzer land, died yesterday in Nor walk Hospital. He was 70 years old and had homes in Rome and in Wilton, Conn.

title: PIQUED NUREYEV STALKS OFF STAGE
description: Rudolf Nureyev's production of The Nutcracker had its first performance of the Royal Ballet season on Friday night at the Metropolitan Opera House. While it might be nice to gloss over a highly unpro fessional incident in that per formance, particularly as a major part of the audience seemed oblivious to it, it might be even nicer to explain why that audience was able to re main unaware of the incident.

title: Long Island and New York Clash in Lacrosse Today
description: The New York Lacrosse Club and the Long Island Athletic Club will meet today in a contest that could decide the championship of the Northern Division.

title: Miss Gail Lauter Prospective Bride
description: RYE, N.Y., May 16Rob ert I. Lauter, president of W. & J. Sloane in New York, and Mrs. Lauter have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Gail Ann Lauter, to Henry Dave Po dolsky, son of Mrs. Reuben Podolsky of Lynn, Mass., and the late Mr. Podolsky. The wedding is planned for Aug. 30 at the home of the future bride's parents.

title: Elizabeth Aall Wed To R. L. Johnston Jr.
description: BLUE MOUNTAIN LAKE, N. Y., May 16Miss Elisabeth Aall and Richard L. Johnston Jr. were married here this afternoon in the Episcopal Church of the Transfigura tion. The Rev. Ernest Gordon, dean of the Princeton Univer sity Chapel, performed the ceremony.

title: Rio Grande Stretch Placed Under Rivers Act Protection
description: TAOS, N. M., May 16 (UPI) The dircetor of the Bureau of Land Management Boyd L. Ras mussen, has set aside a 48mile stretch of the Rio Grande as the nation's first waterway pro tected by the Wild Rivers Act.

title: Electronics in the Wild, Blue Yonder
description: TAMPA, Fla.One of the penalties of this developing age of elec tronics and gadgetry is the carrot that is always being held out just ahead of the consumer, teasing him with the great new things that lie ahead if he will only be patient for a few more years.

title: Sawmill to Expand
description: TORONTO (UPI)  North wood Pulp, Ltd., which is jointly owned by Noranda Mines and the Mead Corp., announced it would spend $10.5million in the next 12 months to expand its saw mill and pulping facilities at Prince George, B. C.

title: Divisions of Acorn Go to Royal Signal And Cathy Honey
description: It cost Mrs. Lawrence W. Knapp Jr. $5,000 to make her chestnut filly, Royal Signal, a supplementary entry in yester day's first division of the Acorn at Aqueduct. But the investment paid big dividends. The daughter of Ahoy tri umphed by beating Alfred G. Vanderbilt's Cold Comfort to the wire by threequarters of a length.

title: Bombing Suspect Arrested At Bronx Recruiting Office
description: A man described by the po lice as a supporter of Puerto Rican independence was ar rested in the Bronx yesterday, reportedly as he was about to explode two pipe bombs at an armed forces recruiting office, at East 163d Street and South ern Boulevard.

title: A Lawyer Masters Ax, Saw and Adz
description: IN 1966, after a good vacation in Ver mont, my wife and I decided we had to have a summer and weekend house on lots of land close to New York City. But we did not want to bury our selves in mortgage debt to pay for it. We determined to build our own house.

title: HANOIPEKING TIES APPEAR STRONGER
description: HONG KONG. May 16Re cent developments appear to have left the Soviet Union more than ever an outsider in Indo china.

title: Mmmmmeringue
description: Ask a pastry chef to name the most fragile, tenderest and most delicate of desserts, and chances are he will mention vacherin, the gossamerlight, sculptured, baked meringue that is generally served with a mound or filling of whipped cream. Vacherin is the French word for the sweet; the Austrians and Ger mans have a special name for it. They call it Span ische Windtorte or Spanish wind torte, which is roman tic, indeed. Here is the recipe for this airy dessert.

title: Business Index Falls in Week
description: The New York Times Weekly Index of Business Activ ity fell to 342.8 from 352.2 a week earlier. A year ago it was 338.7

title: Personality Wins Preakness
description: Personality, a 92 shot, won the $203,800 Preaknoss Stakes at Pimlico Race Course in Baltimore yesterday. My Dad George was second, a neck back, and Silent Screen fin ished third. Dust Commander, the winner of the Kentucky Derby, was ninth.

title: The Drug Scene In East Egg
description: PORT WASHINGTON. There is so much dope in this town that if you tried to be a steady dealer, you'd go broke.High school student.

title: Washington: A Divided and Pessimistic Capital
description: WASHINGTONThis capital is more divided and more pes simistic today than at any time since the beginning of the Viet nam war.

title: AIRWAVES SHOW DUTCH DIVERSITY
description: AMSTERDAM, the Nether lands, May 12  Through combination of public and pri vate television and radio broad casting, the Dutch are trying to demonstrate that diversity and harmony can coexist in this crowded little country.

title: CLIFFORD ASSAILS CAMBODIA THRUST
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 Former Secretary of Defense Clark M. Clifford has accused President Nixon of reckless action in sending combat troops into Cambodia and of continu ing to give priority to Indo china policies while ignoring their consequences at home.

title: The Week in Dance
description: ROYAL BALLET

title: SHORTER COURSES LISTED AT TRIALS
description: Two and possibly three races a day, instead of the customary one, will be held for the 12 Meter yachts seeking to qualify for the America's Cup defense during the Long Island Sound portion of the trial sailing, said Devereux Barker 3d, the New York Yacht Club race commit tee chairman, last week. The number of races will, of course, depend upon wind conditions.

title: 2 AllBreed Shows Listed for Jersey Draw Big Entries
description: With this weekend lost to dog show competition, be cause of cancellations de veloping from the current wave of student unrest, the metropolitan area's allbreed outdoor season will shift to New Jersey next Saturday and Sunday.

title: Victoria Weber Is Wed in Capital To John Duff Jr.
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 Miss Victoria George Veber, daughter of Capt. William G. Weber, U.S.N., retired, and Mrs. Weber of Rochester, Minn., and Coronado, Calif., was married here this after noon to John Miller Duff Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Duff of Pittsburgh in the Holy Trin ity Catholic Church in Georgetown.

title: 7CLUB SAIL WON BY SEAWANHAKA
description: GREENWICH, Conn., May 16 The Seawanhaka  Corinthian Yacht Club of Oyster Bay, L. I., won the first interclub match racing regatta for the Green wich Cup today, when the two day roundrobin series in Soling Class sloops was concluded with three races on Long Island Sound off Indian Harbor Y. C.

title: GOVERNOR URGES LINK TO STUDENTS
description: ITHACA, N. Y., May 16 Governor Rockefeller today called on students at all college campuses in the state to elect representatives to a perma nent clearinghouse of ideas that would provide the students with a direct link to him, and through him to tire President.

title: Francis Tops Humm In Final, 3 and 2
description: HEWLETT HARBOR, L. I., May 16  Gene Francis, the Long Island amateur champion who traveled to Pebble Beach, Calif., in 1961 and gained the quarterfinal in the National Amateur, found honors in his own bailiwick today by winning the William D. Richardson tournament final.

title: Mrs. Parker Wed To Bernard Shakin
description: Mrs. Eleanor Parker, daughter of Bethuel M. Web ster, was married here yes terday to Bernard Shakin, son of Mr. and Mrs. Moses R. Shakin of Larchmont, N.Y., at the home of the bride's father. Judge Joseph A. Sar afite of the New York Su preme Court performed the ceremony.

title: Cranis and Mayer Reach Eastern HardCourt Final
description: WOODBURY, L. I., May 16 Paul Cranis of New York, seeded first, and Sandy Mayer of Woodmere, No. 4, reached the final of the Eastern hard court tennis championship at the Woodbury Country Club today.

title: Rutgers Trackmen Capture Metropolitan Crown
description: A redhaired freshman and a senior whose love affair with the mile run ended after three years of courtship spiced the 37th annual Metropolitan Inter collegiate track and field championships at St. John's University in Jamaica, Queens, yesterday.

title: A.B.A. Playoff
description: CHAMPIONSHIP

title: Senate Seen Influencing Nixon on War
description: WASHINGTON, May 16For all their constitutional differ ences over the war making powers of the Presidency, the stated positions of the White House and its Senate critics are in close agreement in opposing future American military in volvement in Cambodia.

title: Cambodian Balance Sheet
description: Desperately eager to head off a longoverdue reassertion of Congressional restraints over the Presi dent's warmaking powers, the Nixon Administration strove last week to put the best possible face on what it insists will be only a limited extension of the Viet nam war into Cambodia. It remains too early to tell how much or how little military success will attend the twoweekold Cambodian escalation, but it is already plain that it is a political disaster.

title: Speaking to Each Other
description: Everyone knowsto use a typically British exaggeration, designed to re veal social and intellectual superi oritythat the British are obsessed with class. Coming to America, we are always shocked (and some of us displeased) to be judged by what we say, not by the accent we say it in. At home, we are used to revealing our status to each other with Higgins like precision every time we open our mouths. Yet in spite of our insistence on the minutiae of social position, our history has largely been that of selfmade men gladly crashing the class barriers.

title: R. H. von Behr to Wed Miss Anson
description: CONOWINGO, Md., May 16Miss Virginia Monroe Anson, a biological research assistant at the Johns Hop kins School of Hygiene and Public Health in Baltimore, plans to be married in August to Robert Hans von Behr, a French teacher at the Carson Long Institute in New Bloom field, Pa.

title: Wounded in Cambodian Fighting
Miss Maureen E. Hanafin Wed To Charles Hall, Estate Planner
description: ENDWELL, N.Y., May 16  Miss Maureen Elizabeth Hanafin and Charles Shipley Hall were married here this afternoon in Our Lady of Angels Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. Charles Aylesworth.

title: Are We in the Middle Of the Second American Revolution?
description: ARE we in the beginning of a Second Ameri can Revolution? Yes and no. Paradox: revo lutions can occur only after they have occurred. Marx's call for revolution in 1848 was based on the revolutionary changes that had already occurredthe emergence of the proletariat. Revolution as we usually use the word means the violent effort to create new institutions to help share power among new social forces. In Eng land and in the Scandinavian countries, the creation of democratic political parties (a debt we owe the Marxists), trade unions and coopera tives all served to distribute political power to the proletariat without a violent convulsion. In Russia, the revolution occurred less because of the proletariata small group in 1917than be cause of the inflexibility of Russian institutions combined with the disaster of the war. When the Czar stumbled from power in April, 1917, it was a surprise to everyone, including Lenin. (Which suggests that while we may talk about revolutions, we cannot predict them.)

title: 3 PASSERS CLICK FOR PENN STATE
description: UNIVERSITY PARK, Pa., May 16When Penn State ended the last football season with an Orange Bowl victory that extended its unbeaten string to 30 games, it was generally felt that the Nittany Lions' offense would have to carry plenty of punch in 1970 if that streak were to be ex tended.

title: John Kingston Weds Emily R. Fuller
description: OYSTER BAY. L. I., May 16Miss Emily Rutgers Ful ler, who is with the depart ment of architecture and de sign at the Museum of Mod ern Art in New York, and John Kingston, who is with Coenen & Co., investment hankers in New York, were married at noon today in Christ Episcopal Church here.

title: Orangetown Police Seize Six as Sellers of Drugs
description: ORANGEBURG, N.Y., May 16  Six persons were arrested at dawn today by the Orange town police on charges of selling of drugs to the school children.

title: Opera: A Sentimental L'Amico Fritz
description: Mascagni's opera, L'Amico Fritz, was last given at the Metropolitan Opera in 1924, and not very many who at tended Friday night's per formance at the Borden The ater of the Manhattan School of Music had seen a staged performance. That included some who knew every note of the score through record ings.

title: Author's Query
description: I am preparing a biography of Rachel Carson, author of Silent Spring, and I would appreciate any information concerning her life and writing. I especially desire letters which might provide helpful sugges tions concerning her work and personality.

title: The Acorn Is Split for the First Time Since 1931, With 24 Fillies Running
Medicine
description: WASHINGTONA transis tor radio that played for more than three hours on a pinch of sugar may fore shadow a development im portant to many heart pa tients.

title: Movies
description: REMEMBER Breathless? Well, forget it. JeanLuc Godard has, and he's the guy who left us all gasping for breath, just 10 years ago, with his nervepounding, conven tioncrushing movie about a ruthless French thug and his casually depraved American mistress.

title: Dillman and Hogan Named Lehigh Swimming Captains
description: Tom Diliman of York, Pa., and Phil Hogan of Scarsdale, N. Y., will be cocaptains of Lehigh University's varsity swimming squad next season.

title: Flamboyant Soccer Style Suits Best
description: When England's George Best, possibly the most exciting soccer player in the world, left Manchester to play a few exhi bition games in North America, his depart ure almost pushed Cambodia off the front pages of British newspapers. But when he arrived at La Guardia Airport over a week ago, only two newsmen were there.

title: DC3 Is King East of the Andes
description: VILLAVICENCIO, Colom bia  Capt. Juan F. Meza taxied his DC3 around the tapir and out his engines by the bank of the Guaviare River.

title: News of the Binlto
description: CHARLES GORDONE, whose first produced play, No Place to be Somebody, made him the first black playwright ever to win a Pulitzer prize, complained the other day, I'm 50 things behind.

title: ExAttorney ReWeds Couple
description: DETROIT, May 16 (AP) Three years ago, Irwin H. Bur dick was Mrs. Florence George's attorney when she divorced her husband of 15 years, Houston George. Now a judge in the Wayne County Common Pleas Court, Mr. Burdick has remar ried the couple. This time it's forever, Mr. George told Judge Burdick after the couple was reunited.

title: Luncheons to Resume For Pro Football Fans
description: Weekly professional foot ball luncheons, highlighted by halfhour motion pictures in color, will resume Thurs day at Kenny's Steak Pub, Lexington Avenue and 50th Street.

title: WELFARE PROJECT BALKED IN NASSAU
description: MINEOLA, L. L, May 16 Comments ranging from an an gry warning of a potentially long, hot summer to the ques tion How angry must we be come before you decide to take positive action? were directed to the Nassau County Board of Supervisors this week over a plan to move welfare fam ilies from motels into converted barracks at Mitchel Field, a de activated military post.

title: Witnesses to Augusta Riot Say 3 of 6 Killed Were Bystanders
description: AUGUSTA, Ga., May 16 Three of the six Negroes killed by policemen here this week were unarmed bystanders who were not involved in rioting, according to several witnesses to the shootings.

title: State Studies Rental Policy Of Big Realty Agent Here
description: The State Division of Human Rights announced yesterday that it had started an investi gation into the tenant selection practices of Charles H. Green thal & Co., Inc., one of the city's largest real estate con cerns.

title: McGeorge Bundy Sees U.S. Chaos In New Incursion
description: McGeorge Bundy, who played a major role in President Lyn don B. Johnson's 1965 decision to increase American troop strength in South Vietnam, has warned that another action like President Nixon's Cambodian intervention would tear the country and the Administration to nieces.

title: Marleen L. Boudreau, Teacher, Bride of Stewart Gilman Flory
description: PELHAM. Mass., May 16 Miss Marleen Lynn Boudreau and Stewart Gilman Flory of Amherst were married at noon today in the United Church of Pelham. The Rev. Dr. William Dudley per formed the Protestant cere mony.

title: Time Stands Still In an IsraeliOccupied Town
description: THE main square of Ramallah has a fountain with seven lions heads, for the seven first families of this threecenturiesold town. But the water no longer runs. The Jews damaged it in the SixDay War. a resident says.

title: Outward Bound on the Inland Sea
description: KOBE, Japan  The Kansai Line steamships that ply between the islands of Japan's Inland Sea have four classes, but the cheap est class is the one that offers the most fun. And that is second class.

title: Science
description: There are whirlwinds a few inches in diameter that whip up piles of leaves and dust devils that swirl relatively harmlessly across an arid landscape. At sea an entire consortium of waterspouts may appear. Hur ricanes (in the Atlantic) and typhoons (in the Pacific) are massive replicas of these cy clonic systems. But none is more violent locally than a tornado and none is so little understood.

title: Last Free Ride Rejected
description: SPRINGFIELD, ILL., May 16 (UPI)  The Illinois Senate has rejected a resolution that would have permitted funeral processions to travel free of charge over the state's toll highways.

title: 44 PER CENT RISE SHOWN IN SURVEY
description: The growing popularity of the houseboat and pontoon boat is revealed in the annual product analysis of American stock boat builders released by the National Association of Engine and Boat Manufac turers, indicating a 44 per cent increase in the ranks of builders of stock houseboats and pontoon boats.

title: Dog Racing Growing as Gambling Man's Best Friend
description: MIAMI, May 16 (AP)  A stuffed rabbit speeds round the small racetrack at the end of a manually controlled electric arm. Eight bugeyed greybounds who never wise up or catch up to the bogus bunnypursue frantically.

title: NIXON MAY DROP MINING NOMINEE
description: WASHINGTON, May 16  President Nixon's nomination of Dr. J. Richard Lucas, a young professor of mineral engineer ing, to be the director of the Bureau of Mines has run into unexpectedly bitter opposition in Congress and may be with drawn, informed officials said today.

title: GOODELL REPORTS ON 1969 RECEIPTS
description: WASHINGTON, May 16.  Senator Charles E. Goodell dis closed this week that he re ceived $28,000 from the New York Republican State Commit tee last year to help defray his office expenses.

description: TRY as I will, I cannot find any common bond uniting the May shows at the three photogra phy galleries, so I shall take each one separately in geo graphical order, going from uptown to downtown and from east to west.

title: Cannon Picks Canisius Aide
description: ERIE, Pa., May 16 (UPI) Gannon College named Dave Markey, a assistant basketball coach at Canisius College for 11 years, head basketball coach today.

description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, May 16  In proportion to numbers )1 men involved, the war in Cambodia has probably been costlier to the press corps than to any of fighting armies: 151 newsmen have been captured by the North Vietnamese or Vietcong and four have been wounded.

description: It is a gratifying thing, in these anxious and contorted times, to bring good news.

description: WASHINGTON, May 15 Fred Peirce sat bolt upright and spoke with passion when the discussion got around to national leadership. He said there wasn't any.

title: Monica McGoldrick Is Married
description: NEW HAVEN, May 16  Miss Monica McGoldrick and Sophocles John Orfanidis were married here this morn ing in St. Barbara's Greek Orthodox Church by the Rev. George Keranes.

title: Sales Soar For Water In Bottles
description: Pollution, the addition of chemicals to water supplies and an affluent society are among the factors contribu ting to a boom in the bot tiedwater market.

title: Expert on Vietcong Says Killings at Hue In '68 Were Planned
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam. May 16 (AP)A research study says the killing of Hue citizens by the Vietcong in the 1968 TeL offensive was planned and Sys tematic rather than random slaughter.

title: Army Routs Hobart. 136: Cafaro and Cramblet Stai
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., May 16 Tom Cafaro scored six goals and Pete Cramblet added four more as Army's lacrosse team rolled to a 136 victory over Hobart today. The cadets gained a 123 lead early in the third quarter, and Coach Al Pisano went to his bench for the game's final 25 minutes.

title: Martha Beard Plans Nuptials
description: RYE, N. Y., May 16Mr. and Mrs. Josephus Simmons Beard 2d have anounced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Martha Lyndley Blaine Beard, to Peter Will liam Retchin, son of Mr. and Mrs. Norman Retchin of Greenwich. Conn.

title: C. L. Hull Fiance of Cary Schuler
description: LYME, Conn., May 16 Miss Cary Meriwether Schuler and Charles Lewis Bull of Tulsa will be married Sept. 19 in Old Lyme.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor: It is a highly dubious suppo sition that the incursion of American troops into Cambodia will speed an honorable peace or the safe return of our sol diers. One may legitimately challenge the President's judg ment, but our emotional revul sion should not becloud the fact that his action was neither un authorized nor illegal.

title: Susan Mahe Whittaker Is Bride Of Lieut. Edward W. Brancati
description: MANHASSET, L. I., May 16  In the Congressional Church of Manhasset this afternoon, Miss Susan Mah Whittaker and 2d Lieut. Ed ward William Brancati, U.S. A., 1969 graduates of Middle bury College, were married by the Rev. Dr. George G. Parker.
