Laird said today that both United States and South Viet namese forces had made brief incursions into Laos on specific, limited missions in the past, but he insisted that no Ameri cans were engaged in ground combat on Laotian territory now.

title: Saigon Denies Report
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 18South Vietnamese officials vigorously denied today reports that Foreign Minister Lam Said in Jakarta yesterday that South Vietnamese ground forces had struck in Laos along the Ho Chi Minh Trail.

title: 87 at Phillips Academy Ask Review of War by Congress
description: ANDOVER, Mass., May 18 Eightseven members of the Phillips Academy faculty have signed a petition urging Presi dent Nixon to seek the advice and consent of Congress in re viewing United States policy in Southeast Asia. There are about 125 members on the faculty roster.

title: US SEEKS SPEED ON BANKING BILL
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 (UPI)  The Justice Department asked the Senate today to speed legislation regulating nonbank ing activities of concerns that control a single bank. But it op posed the Housepassed bill aimed at controlling holding companies that own one bank as inflexible and unsound

title: Criminal Court Alarm
description: Edward R. Dudley, the respected administrative judge of New York's Criminal Court, has decided that the only way he can get his message acrossthat justice cannot be served properly in crowded courts with inadequate personnel opposite the benchis to be relieved of his job and return to the State Supreme Court. In threeandahalf years of beating at the doors of City Hall and Albany, he has sounded an alarm that must be heard.

title: 4 Months Ago, They Scoffed at the Midi
description: Just four months ago, on successive days, Pauline Tri gre and Ferdinando Sarmi announced, with feeling, that they were against long skirts. Yesterday both reneged.

title: Student Spends 80 Hours In a Palm Tree for Charity
description: fort lauderdale, fla. (AP)Clarence Paulka, a 15 yearold student at Pompano Beach High School, spent 80 hours in a palm tree.

title: War Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 (UPI)The following service. men from the New York area were identified by the Defense Department today as having been killed in Southeast Asia.

title: MEANY'S WAR STAND SCORED BY BUTCHERS;
description: CHICAGO, May 11  The national meat cutters and butt ers tradeunion has attacked George Meany, president of the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Or ganizations, for his support of the war in Vietnam.

title: LongHaired Marines Win Fight for CourtsMartial
description: SAN DIEGO, Calif., May 18 (AP)The Marine Corps has agreed to courtsmartial de manded by 15 reservists who refused orders to abide by regu lations against long hair.

title: Books of The Times
description: LOIS GOULD has written the ugliest book in years. Reading it is like being locked in a box, with a voice piped in that screams and sobs and whisp ers 24 hours a day, a voice that reviles. The voice belongs to Julie Messinger, a 31yearold mother of two and wife of a magazine art director. Her husband enters a hospital for minor surgery, reacts ad versely to the anesthetic and sinks into a coma. Julie, searching through his desk for medical insurance policies, finds a diary in code. It proves to be the record of Richard Messinger's extracurricular amours, all during the period in which he had accused Julie of emasculating him. Inspired by his example, she offers herself to his friends.

title: EyeOpener Sailing Series Won by Burtis in Gauchero
description: LARCHMONT, N. YY., May 17  Alan Burtis of Sea Cliff Long Island Yacht Club won his third straight race and fourth of the series today with Gauchero to capture the West ern Long Island Sound Star Class fleet's annual invitation EyeOpener regatta.

title: MITCHELL MEETS MISSISSIPPI AIDES
description: JACKSON, Miss., May 18 Attorney General John N. Mitchell conferred here today with the president of Jackson State College, where two Ne groes were killed and seven wounded last week in a clash with the Mississippi police.

title: Advertising: Cancer TV Spot Saves Lives
description: When the American Can cer Society, New York City Division, received an Andy Award for its TV spot on breast cancer detection, it was really just icing on the cake. The division already felt amply rewarded since it is convinced that the spot helped to save the lives of 24 women.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Okker Turns Back Nastase In 5Set Final at Brussels
description: BRUSSELS, May 18 (AP)  Tom Okker of the Netherlands defeated Ilie Nastase of Rumania, 63, 64, 06, 46, 64, in the singles final of the Belgian international open ten nis tournament today.

title: Bridge:
description: In a competitive auction a player should usually show support for his partner's suit in preference to taking some other action.

title: PRISON IN SWEDEN IRKS REFORMERS
description: OESTERAAKER, Sweden (AP)  Some visitors think Oesteraaker Prison, 70 miles west of Stockholm, is a fine one, with its escapeproof walls, but Swedish sociologists look to the day when such walls come tumbling down.

title: Search for Lizard Fruitless
description: GRAVESEND, England (UPI) Ronald Taffs, a pet shop own er, spent a weekend driving up and down a highway in a fruit less search for a lizard. He told the police the 3foot iguana had escaped from his truck while he was taking it to his shop.

title: Louis Schonceit, Ticket Broker For Years on Broadway, Dead
description: Louis Schonceit, owner of Mackey's, Inc., one of Broad way's bestknown ticket agen cies, died Sunday morning at Palma De Mallorca, Spain. He would have been 70 years old on June 5.

title: Ballonists Hit Greenhouse And the Owner Offers Tea
description: MILFORD, England (UPI) When three balloonists smashed into his greenhouse, Richard Parker reacted in the best Brit ish traditionhe offered them a cup of tea.

title: Tar Stops Leaners
description: AMBLECOTE, England (Ca nadian Press)Ivan Mocroft found a sticky solution to the problem of people leaning against his garden wall at a bus stop by his Staffordshire home. He coated the wall with gooey tar.

title: GRAIN FUTURES HAVE MIXED DAY
description: Favorable weather in the growing areas caused selling of grain and soybean futures on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday.

title: American Victory Captures Chicago Dash by 2 Lengths
description: CHICAGO, May 18 (AP) American victory led from the start today and won the $6,000 Pia Star Purse by two lengths at Washington Park.

title: LingTemcoVought Sets Layoffs of 40% of Staff
description: LingTemcoVought, Inc., the financially troubled conglomer ate, announced yesterday a sharp cutback in employes at the company's headquarters in Dallas.

title: GOLDBERG VISITS A PHOENIX HOUSE
description: Arthur J. Goldberg sat yes terday in the living room of the Phoenix House at 205 East 116th Street and talked with about two dozen former drug addicts about narcotics, alco hol, parental responsibility and the pervasiveness of bigness in American society.

title: ExPriests to Get Counsel
description: LONDON (AP)John Cardi nal Heenan has launched an official advisory and welfare service for priests leaving the ministry. It operates confiden tially through a London post office box number.

title: Sports of
description: FOR the second time in his life Yelber ton Abraham Tittle is leaving San Francisco to help the New York Football Giants. He won't be able to make the physical contributions he gave in the early years of the last decade when he led them to three straight championship play offs. But that ken football mind will be as sharp as ever in his new role as a member of the coaching staff.

title: Nixon Returns to the Capital
description: ANDREWS AIR FORCE BASE, Md., May 18 (UPI) President Nixon, his family and a few aides landed tonight after a twohour flight from Home stead Air Force Base in Florida and flew to the White House by helicopter. The President had spent the weekend at Key Bis cayne.

title: Post Office Center Opens To Help City's Businesses
description: The New York Post Office's Postal Information and orien tation Center opened officially yesterday. It's purpose is to assist in improving mail service by acquainting business mailers with postal procedures.

title: ENEMY ENCIRCLES CAMBODIAN TOWN
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 1SNorth Vietnamese and Vietcong forces were reported to have attacked a key high way junction in Cambodia to day and to have encircled the town of Tram Khnar, 25 miles south of Pnompenh, the capital.

title: Truck Driver Spots Auto Day After Theft From Son
description: MONROEVILLE, Pa. (AP) Harry Beatty Jr. of Newell in Fayette County worked all win ter to save enough money to buy an automobile.

title: 1913 Bulb Still Burns
description: LAMAR, Colo. (AP)  When Grover Carico went to work for a local Savings and Loan Com pany in 1913, lie put a new 32 candlepower light bulb in the socket in the vault of the bank. The bulb is still burning.

title: U.N. AGENCY PLANS SAMPLING OF AIR
description: GENEVA. May 19  The World Meteorological Organiza tion is planning to sponsor the establishment of stations for measuring air pollution in some of the most isolated clean parts of the earth to provide a stand ard for determining how bad pollution is elsewhere.

title: Note to Readers
description: The weekly listing or Amusements for Children, which appears on this page each Wednesday, is being omitted from today's editions because of composingroom delays caused by union meetings.

title: Bridal Is Planned By Maria B. Hincks
description: FARMINGTON, Conn., May 19Mr. and Mrs. John Mor ris Hincks have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Maria Birch Hincks, to Peter L. Milliken of Bloomfield, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Milliken of Hyannis Port, Mass. A Sep tember wedding is planned.

title: MARCOS SPINELLI, NOVELIST, WAS 65
description: Marcos Spinelli, a novelist and short story writer, died at St. Luke's Hospital Monday aft er a long illness. He was 65 years old and lived at 60 Glenwood Avenue, Jersey City.

title: COLLATERAL DOWN ON STOCK NIARGINI
description: The collateral in margin ac counts held by member firms of the New York Stock Ex change fell 13 per cent to $13.83billion in April, the low est level since the exchange began keeping track of such statistics on a comparable basis five years ago.

title: Ballet by John Clifford to Bow
description: Sarabande and Danse, a new ballet by John Clifford, will be given its premiere by the New York City Ballet at the State Theater tomorrow night. The ballet, whose title derives from two Debussy pieces, will he danced by Earle Sieveling, Violette Verdi, and Mr. Clifford.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Man Leads Dog's Life
description: BLACKPOOL, England (Cana dian Press)Doctors here, puz zled about why an apparently healthy 6foottall man weighed only 85 pounds, found the 60 yearold man was being starved by his wife who spent all the housekeeping budget on her home and on her Alsatian dog.

title: A.B.A. Playoff
description: CHAMPIONSHIP

title: Trading Is Halted In Consolidated Oil
description: At the request of Consol idated Oil and Gas, Inc., the company's shares were not permitted to trade yesterday on the American Stock Ex change.

title: Functional Illiteracy Found High in U.S. In Study at Harvard
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 Half the nation's adults may lack the literacy necessary to master such daytoday read ing matter as driving manuals, newspapers and job applica tions, according to a study just published at Harvard Univer sity.

title: Australian Hunter Discovers Police Behind Every Tree
description: MELBOURNE, Australia (AP) A 21yearold Australian who went hunting fainted when he encountered a posse of police men instead of a warren load of rabbits.

title: BANKYIELD RISES CALLED NIXON AIM
description: HOT SPRINGS, Va., May 19  The Nixon Administration has decided that Federal regu lation of interest rates on all types of bank deposits and savings accounts should be ended as soon as economic conditions allow, a former top Government official said here today.

title: VIETNAM PULLOUT CALLED DILEMMA
description: The pros and cons of Ameri can military withdrawal from South Vienam and South Korea, were spelled out by a William College political scientist, who found cogent arguments on both sides of the issue.

title: Broncos Get Charlie Gogolak
description: DENVER, May 19 (AP)The Denver Broncos said today they had signed Charlie Gogolak, a kicking specialist, as a free agent for the coming National Football League season. Go golak was released last season by the Washington Redskins, who made him their No. 1 draft choice in 1966. That year he scored 105 points.

title: Moon Called Cooling Effect
description: MOSCOW (AP)Sergei Timo feyev, a Soviet geophysicist. says that Europe has entered a period of colder summers and, winters because the moon is closer to earth than usual, cre ating an atmosphere tide that disturbs normal movements of warm and cool air.

title: WARNING SOUNDED ON A SULPHUR GAS
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 Sulphur dioxide pollution of the atmosphere may more than triple in the next 30 years unless vigorous action is taken by government an industry, a report published today suggests.

title: Police in Florida Disperse 200 Campus Demonstrators
description: OPALOCKA, Fla., May 18 (UPI)Policemen firing canis ters of tear gas routed 200 dem onstrators tonight at Florida Memorial College.

title: New Foreign Chief Named In Norwegian Cabinet Shift
description: OSLO Norway, May 19  Premier Per Borten announced tonight major Cabinet changes in his fiveyearold conserva tive coalition Government.

title: PRESSURE RAISED IN PAPER DISPUTE
description: The typographical union, now in the eighth week of its workstopping job action at The New York Times, length ened its daily chapel, or union, meetings yesterday to a total of 19 hours a day.

title: Guns Barred in Council
description: BARRETOS, Brazil (AP)The president of the City Council handed down the following order: It is expressly prohibit ed for City Councilmen to enter city hall carrying firearms or any other instrument of aggres sion. The same prohibition will also include members of the gallery.

title: Washington: The Revolt of the Civil Servants
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 Robert Finch, the Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, is caught in an awkward con flict between his convictions and his loyalties, but the up roar at H.E.W. is more compli cated than that and needs some explanation.

title: HOMICIDES AT HOME LED '69 LIST HERE
description: Of the 1,043 homicides in the city in 1969, almost half 465occurred in residences, a Police Department study showed yesterday.

title: BASIC SHIFT FOUND IN VIOLENCE TREND
description: Recent violence in America is of a different nature from the American past, according to a historian who assisted the in quiry by the National Commis sion on the Causes and Pre vention of Violence.

title: Briton Nags Robbers Away
description: LARKFIELD, England (Cana dian Press)When robbers tied up Mrs. Maud Jelly, 72 years old, and her husband, 68, in their Kent home, she nagged them for an hour until they left with only 74 ($177.60).

title: MT. SINAI HOSPITAL FAILS INSPECTION
description: Mount Sinai Hospital, one of the largest in the city, is oper ating with only provisional ac creditation, mainly because of poorly kept medical records.

title: Executive Changes
description: William M. Elimghaus executive vice president in charge of rate planning and government rela tions of the American Telephone and Telegraph Company, has been elected a director of J. C. Penney Company, Inc.

title: W.H.O. OPENS DRIVE ON YELLOW FEVER
description: GENEVA, May 19  The World Health Organization is mounting a campaign to coun ter serious outbreaks of yel low fever in Africa that pose a potential threat to other areas of the world.

title: Black Principal on His Own
description: The adjectives most often attached to the title of high school principal these days are embattled and be leagurered. Neither has been applied yet to James Boff man, who presides over Thomas Jefferson High School in the East New York sec tion of Brooklyn, but as he ends his first full year in his post he says he can forsee a day when they will have to beat the bushes to find new principals.

title: Termites Find Way to Sea And Settle in a Lighthouse
description: ATLANTA (AP)  Seagoing termites? And in a lighthouse? That was the problem facing Orkin Exterminating Company and the United States Coast Guard.

title: Susan Mudd To Be Bride
description: Robert C. Mudd, political counselor of the United States Embassy in Belgrade. Yugo slavia, and Mrs. Mudd have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Susan Mary Mudd, to Stephen Rich ard Kerbs, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward A. Kerbs of Rumson, N. J. The future bridegroom's father is a mem ber of the New York Stock Exchange and a senior part ner of Kerbs & Co., stock brokers in New York.

title: Company to Get Cash
description: LONDON, Mas 19A British Government agency will ac quire part ownership of Rolls Rovice, Ltd., in exchange for $18million in financial aid for the cashhungry company.

title: Note to Readers
description: The Government bond table, some foreign stock tables and corporate earn ings tables are omitted from this edition because of com posing room delays caused by union meetings.

title: Dutch Women's Lib: Whistling at Men
description: AMSTERDAM, the Nether lands, May 18They sit on bicycles and whistle at men. They swarm into the offices of sedate women's magazines dressed as cleaning women. They sip beer at men's bars, light cigarettes for startled customers and ask the pa trons to sit on their laps.

title: Two IND Trains With 400 Stalled an Tour in Tunnel
description: Two IND trains carrying a total of 400 passengers were stalled in a subway tunnel be low Prospect Park, Brooklyn, for 57 minutes yesterday after a southbound express train on the line developed mechanical trouble at 8:01 A.M.

title: English Found to Say LeftHanded 88 Ways
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn. (AP) Are ynu a ruddy water, mayhe kayneived, gibblefist ed or dollypawed?

title: Key Found in $9.50 Theft Nets Burglar $50 Bonus
description: ROME, N.Y. (AP)A bur glary at the Western Union of fice netted only $9.50, but a key in an envelope marked Key to the Record Shop led Io an ad ditional $50, the police said.

title: MRS. EDWIN N. CLARK
description: FALMOUTH, Mass., May 19 Mrs. Ethel Appleyard Clark, wife of Gen. Edwin N. Clark, died at Falmouth Hospital yes terday. She was 67 years old and lived in New York and at Aspetuck Corners in Easton, Conn.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Public Broadcasting Corp. Gets Two New Directors
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 (UPI)President Nixon today named two persons and re appointed a third to the board of directors of the Public Broad casting Corporation.

title: Pnompenh Paper Is Critical
description: Pnompenh, Cambodia, May 19 (Agence FrancePresse) The Pnompenh Courier, a pro Government newspaper today attacked the results of the Asian conference on Cambodia held in Jakarta last weekend.

title: Books of The Times
description: IT would be a richly ironic aftermath if one could review this chronicle of last fall's MailerBreslin siege of City Hall with the highmindedness usually wasted on less worthy political ventures. Because for all the levity with which it was greet ed, it may have been the most serious campaign around. Unfortunately or not, is not possible to pontificate. For Joe Fla herty has mended all too thoroughly the wounds he sustained as Mailer's campaign manager, and written a hugely entertain ing account of men and windmills. One is forced to smile, then giggle, then guffaw, then wipe one's eyes, blow one's nose and sigh for mercy.

title: NEW SYMBOLS PUT ON TICKETS JULY 1
description: Motorists will have three new symbols to learn starting July 1guides through new trafficsummons procedures' taking effect in New York City on that date.

title: SCHOOL WILL SHUT OVER KILLING OF 9
description: The Board of Education an nounced yesterday that all city schools would be closed on Fri day in memory of the nine young Negroes killed last week in Augusta, Ga., and Jackson, Miss.

title: Advertising: D.D.B. Wins 7 Clio Awards
description: Madison Avenue's answer to Hollywoodthe annual Clio awards ceremonywas held last night with the proper amount of pomp and glitter in the plush surround ings of Philharmonic Hall.

title: AGEE CLOUTS TWO AS SADECKI WINS
description: MONTREAL, May 19Five home runs, including two by Tommie Agee, generated a 74 victory for the New York Mets over the Montreal Expos to night as Ray Sadecki and Tug McGraw restored the stature of the world champions' pitching staff.

title: Stage: Rabelais Reaches City Center
description: It would be all too easy to suggest that as total thea ter, which is precisely what we are all expecting, Jean Louis Barrault's staging of his Rabelais at the New York City Center last night is virtually total disaster.

title: Tower of London Remains Top Attraction for Tourists
description: LONDON (UPI)The Tower of London, with its blood stained history, remains the top tourist attraction among Britain'sancient monuments, ac cording to the Ministry of Works.

title: Dance Planned For Deborah
description: The Bernard L. Jaffe League will give a dinner dance Sat urday in the St. RegisShera ton Roof for the benefit of Deborah Hospital in Brown Mills, N. J. A predinner cock tail reception will begin at 8 P.M.

title: Navajo Veterans Cemetery Is Given a Permanent Flag
description: WASHINGTON  Old Glory now waves every day over the humble Navajo Indians Vet erans Cemetery in the rolling pinon and juniper country of Arizona.

title: Governor Signs Bill Creating Optometry College
description: Governor Rockefeller signed a bill yesterday to create a State University College of Op tometry, with a memorandum declaring that need for the school was pressing.

title: Cabinet Receives Cambodia Briefing At Frank Session
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 President Nixon held his first Cabinet meeting today after a month of crisis. But there was no official evi dence that he had resolved his differences with Cabinet members who have criticized the substance and style of his Presidency.

title: The Politics of Art
description: Those artists, dealers and museum officials who have organized for joint antiwar action are pursuing the wrong course in a good cause. To close museums in the name of peace is as irrational as shutting down universities for the same purpose. Taking over museums to help politicize visitors is an abuse of cultural institutions, intolerable in the case of publicly supported ones.

title: Ray Schalk, White Sox Catcher Elected to Hall of Fame, Dies
description: CHICAGO, May 19 (AP) Ray Schalk, a former catcher for the Chicago White Sox who was elected to baseball's Hall lof Fame in 1955, died today of icancer in a hospital here. He was 77 years old.

title: 2 ON WALL ST. PAPER TAKE BERGER AWARD
description: Two reporters for The Wall Street Journal, Art Sears Jr. and Donald Moffitt, were named Monday as winners of Colum bia University's 1970 Mike Berger Award.

title: PRICES ARE STEADY ON LONDON BOARD
description: The London stock market held steady yesterday in very quiet trading.

title: Rockefeller Signs Program of Bills To Cut Car Thefts
description: ALBANY, May 19 (UPI)  Paperwork is seen as the key to discouraging professional automobile thieves in New York State under a program of bills signed by Governor Rock efeller yesterday.

title: GarbageCan Assault Costly
description: NOTTINGHAM, England (UPI) A judge found Frank Cram guilty of assaulting a neighbor Mrs. Gertrude Harisun, by emptying a garbage can over her head. Mr. Cram was order ed to pay Mrs. Harrison 35 ($84) in damages,

title: Landlord Responsibility
description: The welfare of building owners, tenants and work ers alike will be served by landlordunion agreement to extend the strike truce in New York City apartment houses for another month, as recommended by Mayor Lindsay and leaders of the City Council.

title: 25Cent Bet Pays Off
description: MINNEAPOLIS (AP)Charles Nichols, who made a 25cent Let with his roomate at the Dunwoody Industrial Institute that he could keep up at the ?? of Minnesota, has earned bachelor's and master's degrees there.

title: Venezuelan Illegitimacy Higl
description: CARACAS, Venezuela (AP) Dr. Pedro Liendo Coll, execu tive director of the Venezuela Planned Parenthood Associa tion, told an interviewer that 52 per cent of the children born in Venezuela were illegitimate.

title: Indonesian ExGeneral Executed as Coup Plotters
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, May 19 (AP)  Former Brigidier Gen eral Supardjo, once the military commander in Indonesian Bor neo, was executed by a firing squad last week for his part in the attempted Communist coup in 1965,the Defense Min istry announced today.

title: Britain's Consummate Politician
description: LONDON, May 19What ever else his critics may say, no one accuses Harold Wilson of lacking selfconfidence.

title: Council Passes Bill to Help Removal of Lead Paint
description: The City Council passed a bill yesterday that allows landlords to deduct most of the cost of removing or covering poisonous lead paint in their buildings from their realty taxes.

title: Congregation Is Challenged
description: KESSINGLAND, England (AP)The Rev. Bernard Mor gan, rector of the 15th century St. Edward's Church here, who: was criticized for delivering poor sermons, has challenged: his Anglican congregation of 300 to take the pulpit to see; if they can do better.

title: WHITE HOUSE AIDES SEEK COMPROMISE ON WAR FUND CURB
description: WASHINGTON, May 19The White House was working be hind the scenes today in an at tempt to reach an accommoda tion with a bipartisan coalition in the Senate that is seeking to impose legislative restrictions on future military activities in Cambodia.

title: War Protests Planned for Many Commencements
description: Antiwar activity somewhat muted by final examinations as the academic year draws to a close on many campuses, con tinued at colleges and univer sities around the country yes terday, with protest actions flaring only occasionally into violence.

title: ATHLETICS HEAD INVOLVED IN FEUD
description: IOWA CITY, May 19 (AP) The board in control of ath letics at the University of Iowa said today it had accepted the resignation of Forest Evashev ski as athletic director and re lieved Ray Nagel of his duties as head football coach.

title: Perrotta Heads Rockefeller's Campaign Drive in City
description: Governor Rockefeller named Mayor Lindsay's former Fi nance Administrator, Fi oravante G. Perrotta, as the New York City director of his campaign for reelection yes terday, but indicated he had little hope the Mayor himself would support his efforts.

title: MRS. HART'S TEAM GAINS 2SHOT LEAD
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L.I., May 19  An eagle 3 on the final hole by Mrs. A. S. Hart of Essex County enabled her and Mrs. Henry Cross also of Essex County, to post a 36, 33  69 and gain a twostroke lead today in the 36hole better ball tournament of the Wom en's Metropolitan Golf Associa tion at the Creek Club.

title: PRESIDENT CALLS DEFICITS LIKELY IN 1970 AND 1971
description: WASHINGTON. May 19  The small budget surpluses rorecast in early February for both the current and the new fiscal years have turned into small deficits, President Nixon disclosed today.

title: Bridge: Big Top Scoring Regarded As Aid to UnitWide Games
description: Tournament directors are a hardworking, efficient body of professionals, and they are generally willing to experiment with new meth ods of organization. But they are liable to turn pale if any one suggests using the big top that is popular in some European countries. Instead of splitting the field into sev eral sections for matchpoint ing purposes, all scores are counted together to give a top that may amount to several hundred points.

title: British Won't Bar South African Team
description: LONDON, May 19  Cricket authorities, spurning pleas from Prime Minister Harold Wilson and others, decided today to go ahead with a tour by a South African team here next month.

title: HOUSE TRUST UNIT BACKS PRESS BILl
description: WASHINGTON, May 19  The House Antitrust Sub committee approved legislation today that would immunize from antitrust prosecution most or all existing joint operations of separately owned news papers and many future agree ments for joint operations.

title: HALYARD LANCE, NORSE DIPLOMAT
description: OSLO, Norway, May 19 (Reu ters)Halvard Lange, former Foreign Minister of Norway, died here today of a cerebral hemorrhage. He was 67 years old.

title: Learning to Judge a Book by Its Cover
description: A small group of women in smocks or aprons were bent over work tables, as sun light poured into the studio and touched the books and folios in various stages of being bound.

title: DISPLAY CHANGED IN HE OF FAME
SAWMILL PARKWAY IS PARTLY CLOSED
description: A mile and a half stretch of the Saw Mill River Parkway just south of Tuckahoe Road and Hearst Street in Yonkers will be closed to traffic be ginning today for at least 10 days, according to the East Hudson Parkway Authority. The closing was necessitated by construction work on a pipeline connection under the south bound lanes and a part of the northbound lanes of the park way.

title: Strengthening the Economy: II
description: The Administration has at last issued the new figures showing that its projected thin surpluses for fiscal 1970 and 1971 have indeed become deficits. However, it still appears to be underestimating the size of the coming deficitsby holding to an unrealis tically high forecast of corporate profits and unrealis tically low estimate of defense expenditures. From the time it took office Mr. Nixon's Administration talked a great deal about the need for balancing the budget to check inflation and permit an easier monetary policy. Yet the President and his aides were indecisive in their support of a continuation of the 10 per cent surtax which Congress had adopted in the summer of 1968 as a mainstay of the Johnson Administration's effort to keep inflation under control.

title: U.N. Council, 11 to 0, Condemns Incursion by Israel Into Lebanon
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y. May 19She Security Council voted a resolution today that condemns Israeli's reprisal raid into Lebanon on May 12 and that said the Council would consider stronger action if any further raids took place.

title: REP. FORD FAVORS STUDENT DEFERMENT
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 (UPI)The House Republican leader, Gerald R. Ford, of Michigan, came out today in opposition to President Nixon's proposal to end student draft deferments, but Representative L. Mendel Rivers, Democrat of South Carolina, indicated his opposition was lessening.

title: Dissent at Harvard Reverts From College to Antiwar Protests
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., May 19 The bells of Memorial Church pealed above the greening elms as one by one Harvard stu dents climbed the church steps to hand in their draft cards.

title: JOB OF FIRE FIGHTER IS LESS ATTRACTIVE
description: AUSTIN, Tex., (AP)There was a time when young men were attracted by the excite ment and glamour of a fire man's life, a Fort Worth fire aptain says.

title: Great Unranked Prevail
description: Only two teams not ranked in the top 10 at the end of the regular season have captured N.C.A.A. basketball champion ships  California in 1959 and City College in 1950.

title: Measures to Be Debated
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 [UPI]The Senate is expected to debate the war in Southeast Asia for the next month. Following are the principal measures it will consider.

title: Art World Seeks Ways to Protest War
description: Petitions are circulating. Paintings are coming off gal lery walls. Posters are rolling off the presses. The city's art community is mobilizing for an allout protest, aimed at war, racism and oppression.

title: 300 Start a 5Day Protest March in Georgia, Despite Plea by Maddox
description: PERRY, Ga., May 19With shouts of Soul power! and I am somebody!, more than 300 demonstrators fol lowed a muledrawn coffin out of this Black Belt Georgia town of 11,000 persons to day to start a 110mile, five day march against repres sion to Atlanta. The sun bore down as the spirited and mostly youthful marchers all black except for five stu dents from the University of Georgiatrooped out of the dilapidated Negro community along redearthed Spring Street after a prayer. At 1 P.M., singing Oh, Freedom!, they swung onto Highway 341, a black ribbon of as phalt leading north to Atlanta through a succession of small towns, meadowlands, woods and swamps. Paced by three Georgia Highway Patrol cars, the march was without inci dent except when youngsters killed a fourfootlong rat snake during a rest period. Few white people were seen along the road and none Continued From Page 1, Col. 7 seemed hostile. With mar shals from the local Southern Christian Leadership Confer ence and the National Associ ation for the Advancement of Colored People, the marchers moved wearily at about 5 P.M. to the outskirts of Fort Valley a town of 8.000. They were still trudging behind the two mules a white one nicknamed Nix on and a brown one called Maddox.

title: Roosa Urges World Rules To Govern Capital Flows
description: GENEVA. May 19Interna tional rules governing capital flows and a new wa vof man aging the American balanceof payments deficit were proposed today by one of the leading American monetary authorities.

title: CREDIT MARKETS DISREGARD BURNS
description: The credit markets dismissed Arthur Burns's talk about an incomes policy to help restore price stability, and they also failed to be impressed by Presi dent Nixon's new estimates projecting a $1.8billion Foderal budget deficit for the year end ing June 30.

title: Minneapolis War Foes Hear Charges
description: MINNEAPOLIS, May 19 The Minneapolis Civil Liberties Union finally received today written complaints describing the crimes allegedly discovered by a Minneapolis police detail two weeks ago when it raided the home of a prominent Uni versity of Minnesota professor who was raising funds for a peace rally.

title: Dentist Pulls Wrong Tooth
description: CAPETOWN (AP)  When the Swedish tanker Artemis stopped at Trinidad, one of its engineers asked a dentist to extract a tooth that had been troubling him. Only when the ship was at sea again did he realize that the dentist had pulled the wrong tooth.

title: Greathouse Not a Candidate To Be Reuther Successor
description: DETROIT, May 19 (UPI)A United Auto Workers vice pres ident said today that he did not want to succeed the late Walter P. Reuther as president of the 1.8millionmember un ion, reducing to four the num ber of potential candidates for the lob.

title: TOP LABOR AIDE PUTS EMPHASIS ON WAGES
description: A top official of the labor movement said yesterday that unions would continue to seek substantial wage increases in 1970 because of the increased cost of living and despite a downturn in the economy.

title: Article 3  No Title
Agnew Does It Again This Time With a Racquet
description: WASHINGTON, May 19  Vice President Agnew, already a legend on the fairways, demonstrated the same smash ing aptitude for tennis today in a match in which he placed a serve with exquisite inaccuracy on the back of his partner's head.

title: Women in 35to39 Group Said to Average 3 Children
description: WASHINGTON  In 1969, women in the age group of 35 to 39 had given birth to an av crage of three children, more than any group of women born in the twentieth century, ac cording to a report by the Bu reau of the Census.

title: ROAD JOB REVEALS RELICS IN BRITAIN
description: ALTON, EnglandBeautifully preserved pots, coins, sherds, bones and other ancient and assorted bricabrac nearly 2,000 years old, from the early days of the Roman occupation, are being uncovered in north Hamp shire in the path of a new road.

title: Burns's Incomes Policy
description: HOT SPRINGS, Va., May 19It has been less than four months since Arthur F. Burns became Chairman of the Fed eral Reserve Board. But in this brief period, not only has the professorial, pipe  smoking former Presidential counselor enjoyed the honeymoon that would be accorded to anyone taking over a major govern mental responsibility, but al so he has moved quickly to establish his own position credibility, if you willwith the Congress and with Wall Street, his two most critical constituencies.

title: Patrolman Returns Fine
description: GRAND RAPIDS, Mich. (UPI) Patrolman William Miller gave a woman back her $19.50 traf fic fine on finding he had read the patrol car speedometer wrong.

title: Award Given Museum, ExPool Hall
description: A converted automobile show room and pool hall, now a neighborhood museum in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn, shared the Bard Award for Excellence in Archi tecture and Urban Design yes terday with the lavish concert halls of the Juilliard School in Lincoln Center.

title: Cable Cars Win New Lease on Life In San Francisco
description: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) The San Francisco cable car, a clanking but pollutionfree anachronism, is holding its own on the steep city streets it has battled for nearly a century.

title: A Decline in Power
description: The Detroit Tigers slugged 37 home runs against the Cali fornia Angels in 1968. Last year the Tigers hit only 12 against Angel hurlers.

title: CEAUSESCU LEAVES SOVIET AFTER TALKS
description: MOSCOW, May 19  Presi Went Nicolae Ceausescu and the other members of his Rumanian Communist party delegation. left Moscow tonight after two days of discussions with Leonid I. Brezhnev and other Soviet leaders on their differences in the Communist movement.

title: UNION ENDORSES CURBS ON IMPORTS
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 (AP) The A.F.L.C.I.O. today en dorsed quotas on imported goods deemed to be harming United States industries.

title: DEMOCRATS SEEK RIGHT TO TV TIME
description: WASHINGTON, May 19The Democratic National Commit tee, which was recently denied network advertising time even when it offered to pay com mercial rates, asked the Fed eral Communications Commis sion today to guarantee it ac cess to television audiences.

title: Personality Tale at the Big A
description: The track was sloppy, the weather cloudy and the fields small at Aqueduct yesterday. It was one of those quiet afternoons in which few in the crowd of 25,862 ventured to the rail.

title: Bride Gets GoodLuck Kiss From British Disk Jockey
description: LONDONA young couple drove straight frons their wed ding at a Wigan, Lancashire, church to a house in the town to meet Jimmy Young, a disk jockey.

title: U.S. Lends $86.6Million To India for Major Projects
description: NEW DELHI (AP)  The United States has signed an agreement with the Indian Governnment to provide $86.6 million in rupees this year to help finance major develop ment projects.

title: COAST UNIONISTS SCORE WAR MOVE
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 19 The shattering of labor union support in this area for Presi dent Nixon's Indochina policies was signaled yesterday in full page advertisements in both The San Francisco Chronicle and The Examiner.

title: President Rejects Meeting With 9 Negro Congressmen
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 (AP) President Nixon has refused a request to meet with nine Negro members of Congress to discuss problems concerning black America, Representative William Clay, Democrat of Mis souri, said today.

title: Batting Averages in Majors Show Increase of 7 Points
description: Major league hitters are con tinuing a resurgence htat be gan with the lowering of the pitchers mound and decreasing of the strike zone at the be ginning of the 1969 season, ac cording to a report released yesterday by Bowie Kuhn, the baseball commissioner.

title: Artists' Colony Formally Opens
description: Mayor Lindsay called the formal opening yesterday of Westheth, the world's largest housing project for artists, a very happy occasion that recognized the role of the ar tist in society.

title: Mexican Women Take Pill
description: MEXICO CITY (AP)About 250,000 Mexican women took birth control pills in 1969, the National Academy of Medicine reported. The 1960 census showed that Mexico had 17, 507,809 females.

title: PSYCHIATRIC CARE FOR CHILDREN HIT
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 (AP) Not a single community in the United States provides ac ceptable services for the 10 million children believed to he mentally ill, the Joint Commis sion on Mental Health of Chil dren contends.

title: In a Used Car Lot, A Studio for Batiks
description: LEORA'S batik scarves have already become an open secret in the chic under ground even though they are designed and produced in a converted refrigerator truck on a used car lot in South Amboy, N.J. Leora Korb is one of those international beautiestawnyhaired, slender and current ly packaged in snug, suede pants suits with rings on all fingers but thumbs. She was born in South Africa, educated in Israel, appren ticed for a year to a German fashion house and is now married to an American and living in the suburbs of New York.

title: TRUMAN VICTORY IS TIED TO RIGHTS
description: The issue of civil rights has created strains in the Demo cratic party for more tthan 20 years, according to two histori ans who recalled the effects of the issue on the election cam naiens of 1948 and 1952.

title: Pearl Bailey Is Ill; Dolly! Is Forced To Suspend Tour
description: The road company of the longrunning musical Hello, Dolly! failed to open last night in Milwaukee because its star, Pearl Bailey, was unavailable. She had become ill in Houston Sunday night. The allNegro road company was in danger of being disbanded.

title: Flood Is First at Bat as Baseball Antitrust Suit Starts
description: The trial that may pass judgment, for the, first time, on the reasonableness as well as the legality of base ball's reserveclause system began yesterday in Federal Court here with a visibly nervous Curt Flood on the witness stand.

title: Big Financing Spur For Homes Unlikely
Burger Decries Demands For a Curb on Freedoms
description: WASHINGTON, May 19Chief Justice Warren E. Burger declared today that the American system of justice is re silient enough to meet the current crisis of public discipline without cutting back on con stitutional guarantees.

title: Pressure on Finch
description: WASHINGTON, May 19In 1946, a 20yearold college senior and former Marine named Robert H. Finch first met Richard M. Nixon, a Con gressional aspirant then in his first political campaign. A friendship developed and Mr. Finch has loyally followed Mr. Nixon for almost a quarter of a century since then. But observ ers here are say ing that the pres sures of loyalty have begun to tell on Mr. Nixon's Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, who entered the Walter Reed Army Hospital yesterday for treatment of a puzzling numb ness in his left arm.

title: Tuesday Baseball
description: AMERICAN LEAGUE

title: Grope Fest Honors Gropius
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., May 19Two nearly naked wom en and a man painted in silver from head to toe slithered across the room as eerie electronic music and flashing strobe lights rever berated against walls and ceilings covered with silver paper.

title: Spain Fines Industrialist $24Million in Scandal
description: MADRID, Spain, May 19 (Reuters)The special court for monetary offenses today im posed a fine of 1.658 billion pesetas ($24million) and a threeyear prison sentence on a leading industrialist involved in a financial scandal that shook Spain last summer.

title: PROGRAMS A TOPIC OF A.B.C. MEETING
description: Leonard H. Goldenson, presi dent of American Broadcasting Companies, Inc., received all sorts of free, unsolicited and some might saygratuitous ad vice yesterday about the news programing on his company's television network.

title: POLAND ABANDONS FEDERATION CUP
description: FREIBURG, West Germany, May 19 (AP)  The women's Federation Cup tennis tourna ment opened today with Poland dropping out in protest against South Africa participation.

title: Lon Nol Assures Chinese in Cambodia
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, May 19Premier Lon Nol told the Chinese minority in Cambodia today that despite Communist China's rupture of diplomatic relations and its support of the exile government formed by Prince Norodom Sihanouk in Peking, they need not fear for their safety or their livelihood.

title: Campus Ban on Ammunition For Guards Urged in Bill
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 (UPI)Representative Leonard Farbstein, Democrat of Manhat tan with five cosponsors, in troduced legislation today pro hibiting the use of live ammu nition by the National Guard on college campuses unless their lives were in danger.

title: Entertainment Events
description: Films

title: Bosses Urged Not to Turn Blind Eye to Thefts by Staff
description: LONDON  Store managers who turn a blind eye to thefts by their employes were sharp ly criticized by Michael Ban ton, a professor of sociology, at Bristol University.

title: Foreign Affairs: A Mediterranean Pact?
description: MADRID  Spanish foreign policy, in tandem with Paris, is exploring the possibilities of a formal West Mediterranean grouping among nations on both the northern and southern shores. The United States has been kept informed but appar ently has not been officially consulted.

title: Israelis Report They Repelled Egyptian Foray Across Canal
description: JERUSALEM, May 19Is raeli forces reported driving off a landing party of Egyptian troops at the Suez Canal this morning with fire from tanks, artillery and aircraft.

title: College, School Results
description: BASEBALL

title: Prepaid DentalCare Plan Is Offered by Blue Cross
description: Greater New York's Blue Cross nd Blue Shield an nounced yesterday a program, of prepaid dentalcare benefits, for qualified organizations with 100 people or more.

title: Japan to Dispatch Envoys
description: TOKYO, May 19The Japan ese Government decided today to send special envoys to Brit ain, the Soviet Union and the United Nations to promote the Jakarta conference's proposal of a broad international con ference to deal with the prob lems of Indochina.

title: 61 Days for Delaware
description: Delaware Park's 1970 thor oughbred meeting will run 61 days from Saturday, May 30 through Saturday. Aug. 8.

title: Cards Acquire Linzy Of Giants for Johnson
description: ST. LOUIS, May 19 (AP) The St. Louis Cardinals made a straight player trade today, sending 27yearold Jerry, Johnson, a right handed relief pitcher, to the San Francisco Giants in ex change for 30yearold Frank Linzy, also a righthanded reliever.

title: CHUCK DAVIS SHOWS DANCE IMAGINATION
description: Taking off imaginatively from the rhythmic accompani ment of a small percussion en semble, Chuck Davis created a propulsive series of dances for his group last night at the Cu biculo. The works were of uneven quality, and some overstayed their welcome, but most were soundly conceived.

title: Sports Car Club Opts for Modern Image
description: The wire wheels of the Sports Car Club of America was born in the 1940's, dur ing the club's age of inno cense. For all these years the insigna has had a senti mental hold on the members.

title: PALMER IS VICTOR WITH FOURHITTER
description: Rain has been following the Yankees around for nine days but last night it was its mean est night of all.

title: An Asian Peace Plea
description: The eleven Asian nations that met in Jakarta last weekend to discuss the Cambodian crisis showed good judgment in focusing their efforts on a broader search for a peaceful settlement of the overall Indochina problem.

title: Note to Readers
description: The Treasury statement and some of the Midwest and Pacific Coast Stock Ex change quotations are omit ted from this issue because of composing room delays caused by union meetings.

title: Samuels Gets Top Line In Democratic Primary
description: and J. Samuel ALBANY, May 19  How ard J. Samuels's name will appear in the top position on the Democratic guberna torial primary ballot June 23.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International

title: SEVER FUTURES SHOW A DECLINE
description: Silver prices dropped yester day both on the New York Commodity Exchange, where futures are traded, and at the Government's silver auction in Washington, where silver itself is sold.

title: PRIMARY VICTORY CLAIMED BY SHAPP
description: PHILADELPHIA, Wednes day, May 20  Milton J. Shapp claimed a victory early today over State Auditor Gen eral Robert P. Casey, the party's endorsed candidate in yesterday's Democratic gov ernorship primary.

title: Berkeley Faculty Opposes Credit for R.O.T.C. Courses
description: BERKELEY, Calif, May 19 The Berkeley Academic Senate voted yesterday to recommend an end to academic credit for Reserve Officer Training Corps courses on the Berkeley cam pus.

title: Some Landlords Vote to Extend Pact With Service Employes
description: Negotiators for cooperative apartment houses and nonrent controlled residential buildings agreed yesterday to a 30day extension of their contract with Local 32B of the Building Serv ice Employes Union, which was to expire at midnight tonight.

title: 2d Object in Orbit With China Satellite, U.S. Aide Discloses
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 19 Communist China last month launched a second space object of considerable size together with its first space satellite, a Defense Department official disclosed here today.

title: Miss Austin 64. 60 Victor, Gains 3d Round in England
description: WOLVERHAMPTON, Eng land, May 19 (Reuters)Pam ela Austin of Rolling Hills, Calif., scored a 64, 60 victory over Janet Fayter of England in the second round of an inter national tennis tournament here today. Miss Austin ranks eighth in doubles in the United States.

title: PROSPERITY IS RISING IN SOUTH AUSTRALIA
description: WASHINGTONOnceback ward South Australia is enjoy ing a new era of economic pros perity.

title: NET UP SLIGHTLY AT CARRIER CORP
description: Earnings of the Carrier Cor poration in the second fiscal quarter, ended April 30, rose slightly to $7,154,000, or 45 cents a share, the company re ported yesterday in Syracuse.

title: Brabham's Shakedown Run Thwarted
description: INDIANAPOLIS. May 19 (AP)Jack Brabham capped more than 48 hours of round theclock labor today by al most getting his new car on the Indianapolis Motor Speed way. An early shutdown of the course thwarted him.

title: Blonde Is HousePainter
description: COLORADO SPRINGS (AP) Miss Peggy Patrick, a 21year old blonde, got tired of working on women's hair in a beauty shop, and has become an ap prentice housepainter, hoping to become a journeyman in three years.

title: Fugitive Seized at Hospital
description: PUEBLO, Colo. (AP)Willie Dee Gonzales, 36 years old, was apprehended during a visit to the recreation center at the Colorado State Hospital when Walt Strozier, a security guard, recognized him as an inmate who escaped in 1962.

title: Muskie to Head Delegation
description: WASHINGTON, May 19Sena tor Edmund S. Muskie, Demo crat of Maine, announced today that he had chartered a plane to carry 60 to 70 persons to a funeral service in Mississippi for a Jackson State College stu dent killed in a clash last week with the police.

title: U.S. CONFIRMS SALE OF BOMBS TO ISRAEL
description: WASHINGTON, May 19, (Reuters)  State Department officials confirmed today that the United States was supply ing bombs to Israel as part of a continuining military assist ance program.

title: POLICEMEN HONORED BY A TOWN ON COAST
description: ESCONDIDO, Calif., (AP)  Escondido's 51 policemen and their wives were honored in a musical salute by the 200voice concert choir of Orange Glen High School.

title: School Schedules Its Tres Bien Ball
description: The annual Trs Bien Ball will be held by the Convent of the Sacred Heart on Friday evening for the benefit of the school's general fund.

title: Amid the Commuters' Yawns and Snoozes, a Touch of Fashion
description: The Long Island Railroad is trying to cheer things up for its commuters. Not by running all trains on time or keeping car temperatures below stifling or above freez ing. Nothing so drastic as that.

title: Soviet Handicraft Is Tiny
description: MOSCOW (AP)  Tass the official Soviet Press Agency, re ported from Kiev that Ukrain ian artists had opened an exhi bition of miniature handicraft that can be seen only through a microscope. Among the arti cles are 60 golden objects placed on a poppy seed and a working electric motor smaller than a pinhead.

title: Art: African Sculptures in Brooklyn
description: African Sculpture, a beau tiful exhibition opening to the public today at the Brooklyn Museum, is hardly recogniz able as the same rather dis appointing show that played the National Gallery in Wash ington last February.

title: At Red Line, U.S. Advisers Turn Back
description: NUI SAM, South Vietnam, May 18We call it the White House red line, the South Viet namese officer said, pointing to an irregular line marked in red greasepencil on his operational map.

title: I.T.T. and Mobil Highlight Annual Meetings
description: The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation confidently expects that its 1970 sales and earnings will show gains over the 1969 levels.

title: Market Place
description: Add up April losses in the overthecounter market and you'll discover that that's the month the bottom fell out.

title: Attitude of Whites on Negroes Is Believed Moderating in Cities
description: WASHINGTON, May 19In Webster Groves, Mo., a city of 30,000 near St. Louis, the school board decided on a new approach to desegregation. It Cook an allblack elementary school, Douglas, and staffed it with outstanding teachers. In a few months 40 per cent of the students were white. Their par ents had volunteered for them to be bused from outlying areas.

title: Rebecca Schrom To Wed in August
description: MILLERSBURG, Pa., May 19David A. Schrom, presi dent of the Rube Brubaker Tool Company here, and Mrs. Schrom have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Rebecca Ann Schrom, to Robert Earl Dewar Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Dewar of Birmingham, Mich.

title: Opener Is Set for Sept. 5 In Atlantic Coast Football
description: The Atlantic Coast Football League will open a 12week season on Sept. 5. The cham pionship playoff between the Northern and Southern Division winners is scheduled for Nov. 28, with the Southern Division city the host.

title: Fraternity Hazing Becomes A Study in Pollution Control
description: MANCHESTER, N. H ??(AP) Pledges in Phi Delta Psa frater nity at New Hampshire College are getting a new twist in haz ing.

title: MONROE IS SECOND ON JERSEY LINKS
description: DENVILLE, N. J., May 19 The seventh annual Dodge open golf tourney began its 72hole run today over the Rockaway River Country Club course as SO New Jersey professionals and a few invited guest pros took aim at Dick Sarta's 282 winning effort of last year.

title: Brewers Get Gus Gil, Send Kennedy, Goossen to Farm
description: MILWAUKEE, May 19 (PUI) The Milwaukee Brewers have acquired Gus Gil, a second basemann, and sent John Ke nedy and Greg Goossen to the. Portland club of the Pacific Coast League.

title: Beard on TV Prompts Call
description: DENVER (AP)After State Representative Richard Lamm was interviewed on a national television news show, he re ceived a telephone call (from his mother in Florida who asked him,) When did you grow that beard

title: F.C.C. RULE TO SPUR PAY TV ON CABLE
description: The Federal Communications Commission, as part of its plan to expand the opportunities for cable television, will allow the use of one channel for pay TV under restricted conditions, it was learned in Washington yes terday.

title: Computers to Mix Drinks?
description: TORONTO (AP)  William Uerrigan, a management con sultant, predicts that restaurant waitresses will be replaced by microphones and computers. Computers can mix drinks, heat preprocessed foods and write checks, he said.

title: N.A.C.P. Official Found Shot to Death in Savannah
description: SAVANNAH, Ga., May 19 (UPI)James M. Floyd, an offi cial of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People, was found shot to death tonight outside the local N.A.A.C.P. headquarters.

title: SEOUL RENEWS TIE WITH CAMBODIANS
description: SEOUL, South Korea, May 19  The South Krean and Cambodian Governments an nounced today an agreement to resume official relations, pav ing the way for Seoul to pro vide assistance to the Pnom penh regime of Premier Lon Nol.

title: Article 4  No Title
TODAY'S PROBABLE PITCHERS
description: Washington at New York (8 P.M.) Bosman (33) vs. Bahnsen (33).

title: Japan Tallies Passports
description: The Japanese Foreign Minis try issued a total of 483,447 passports to Japanese overseas travelers during 1969, an in crease of 46 per cent over 1963, according to a report in the Japanese Travel Journal, the publication The Travel Agent reports.

title: Mrs. Rathmell Wins on 20th In Southern Amateur Golf
description: PINEHURST, N. C., May 19 (AP)The medalist and defend ing champion, Mrs. John Rath mell of Houston, and her op ponent, Paulette Lee of Coral Gables, Fla., were the only players to see action on the 18th green today in the first round match play of the wo men's Southern amateur golf championship on the 5,910 yard, par 373673 Pinehurst No. 2 course.

title: Sports of The Times
description: When Jim Palmer of the Baltimore Orioles pitched a fourhit shutout against the Los Angeles Dodgers in the 1966 World Series at the tender age of 20, he was the youngest ever to perform so signal a feat. Since he already had established himself as a 15game winner that season, he had the look of a fastrising star with a limitless horizon. Almost without warn ing, disaster struck. Arm and shoulder miseries snatched two years from his base ball life.

title: AMEX LIST FALLS IN LIGHT TRADING
description: The twoday upswing on the American Stock Exchange end ed abruptly yesterday as prices declined in very light trading.

title: Computer Aide Plans to Marry Millicent Cross
description: FAIRFIELD, Conn., May 19 Mr. and Mrs. Jackson Cross have announced the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Millicent Anne Cross, to Michel Andrew Skrzywan of New York, son of Mrs. Michel Skrzywan of Los An geles, and the late Mr. Skrzy wan.

title: Soviet and France Sign An Agreement on Patents
description: MOSCOW, May 19 (Reuters)  France and the Soviet Union signed an agreement here today on the protection of industrial patents.

title: Teachers Like Counsellors
description: EDMONTON, Alberta (Cana dian Press)Counsellors are es sential or helpful in the school, 81 per cent of teachers think, while 11.3 per cent believe they are innocuous or a hindrance, the Alberta Teachers' Associa tion says.

title: Xerox, No Copycat, Plans New Devices
description: The Xerox Corporation yesterday fired a strong an swering salvo to the recent entry of the International Business Marchines Corpora tion into the copying industry.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: RAPID CITY, S. D., May 19 (AP)Gov. Frank L. Farrar has called in 25 National Guards men to provide fire protection for this city of 50,000 follow ing the mass resignation of all 60 of the town's firemen in a salary dispute.

title: COATING IN GLASSES COMES OFF IN DRINKS
description: HONOLULU (AP)The mys tery of Mrs. Edward Jensen's lead poisoning has been solved:, Her cocktail glasses were loaded.

title: Garden State Results
Good Chase Draws No. 2 Post For $50,000 Pace on Friday
description: YONKERS, May 19  Good Chase, who finished second and third in the first two legs of the international pacing series at Yonkers Raceway, will be favored for the third straight time when the standardbreds get together for the $50,000 Na tional Championship Pace Fri day night.

title: City Will Use Its G.M. Stock To Vote for Nader's Campaign
description: The 160,000 shares of General Motors stock held by city pen sion funds will be voted against the corporation's management in an effort to make General Motors more socially responsi ble, Jerome Kretchmer, the Environmental Protection Ad ministrator, said yesterday.

title: Turks Use British Dailies For Rolling Own Cigarettes
description: ANKARA, Turkey  More and more Turkish villagers are smoking cigarettes rolled in paper from airmail editions of The Times of London and The London Daily Telegraph.

title: SEA LIFE PICTURED ON ARCTIC BOTTOM
description: SUITLAND. Md.A scientist at the United States Naval Oceanographic Office has pre sented photographic evidence to, show that marine life will flour ish almost anywhere  even in nearfreezing conditions on the bottom of Artie waters.

title: Hagen Week ProAmateur Golf To Aid Cancer Fund Sept. 1420
description: Golfers will tee off against cancer the week of Sept. 14 through 20 as part of a new joint program of the Profes sional Golfers' Association of America and the American Can cer Society.

title: WRIGHT MEDALIST ON 70 IN L.I. OPEN
description: INWOOD, L. I., May 19  Jimmy Wright of the home club, who won last year's event, took the medal today in the Long Island Golf Association open championship with a two underpar 36, 3470 at the In wood Country Club. Par for the 6,609yard course is 37, 35 72.

title: Lindsay Bids 4 Lawyers Conduct Inquiry Charges Into Police Corruption
description: Mayor Lindsay has ap proached at least four New York lawyers and asked them to take on the task of investi gating allegations of wide spread corruption in the Police Department, sources close to the Lindsay administration re ported last night.

title: Candidate on Coast Runs On MoneyBack Pledge
description: NAPA, Calif. (UPI)Rohert Hampel, a 39yearold school teacher, has given the voters a moneyhack guarantee is his first try for public office.

title: Prices Are High in Chad; French Alone Pay Them
description: By WILLIAM BORDERS Special to The New York Times FORT LAMY, Chad, May 30Five times a week, an airplane leaves for Paris, and for the foreigners of FortLamy, it is a big occa sion every time. With start ling regularity, they stage airport bon voyage parties and meet one another's ar riving flights, reminding themselves in the process that this is one of the most remote capitals in the world.

title: CITY BALLET BOWS WITH SWAN LAKE
description: Some will say that the New York City Baleet has presented more exciting programs in the past than it did last night at the State Theater, but few of its programs will produce as exciting a fourweek old de layed first night as this one. Even the orchestra got a hand.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor:

title: Roundup: Short's 4Hitter Ends Phils' 10Game Skid
description: Chris Short, who was named by Philadelphia Phillie fans last year as the greatest lefthanded pitcher in tht club's history, lent his club a touch of that greatness last night when he halted its los ing streak at 10 games.

title: A Booklet on Dental Health Places Stress on Nutrition
description: WASHINGTON  A booklet on Research Explores Nutri tion and Dental Health has been published by the National institute of Dental Research.

title: Coop Is Rising Over the L.I.R. Tracks in Brooklyn
description: The first column was poured yesterday for the Towers of Bay Ridge, an 811 apartmet, $22,016,000 co operative to be built over the Long Island Railroad tracks in Brooklyn.

title: War Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 [UPI] The following servicemen from New York area were iden tified by the Defense Depart ment today as having been killed in Southeast Asia:

title: CRIMINALS OFFER BOUNTY IN INQUIRY
description: State Senator John H. Hughes said yesterday that organized crime had offered $100,000 to any hoodlum who would ask sassinate an investigator work ing for the Joint Legislative, Committee on Crime.

title: Church Papers Off 60,000
description: LONDON (AP)  Statistics compiled by; the Church of England Newspaper show that the circulation of Britain's 22 official religious papers has dropped by 60,000 over the past year.

title: Hickel Postpones Leasing Land for Oil Shale Output
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 (AP)  Secretary of the Interior Walter J. Hickel said today that he had decided that it was not economically feasible, for the present, to lease Fed eral lands for oil shale produc tion.

title: Barmaid's Wages Pay Her Expenses At Taiwan College
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan (Reuters) Behind the bar among the whisky bottles in night clubs here you can sometimes spot a university textbook, and the woman who smiles enticingly at you as she pours your drink may be working her way through the university.

title: Complaint Is Overdue
description: BOMBAY, India, (AP)Rail ways Minister G. L. Nanda dis covered a complaint from a traveler dated June 5, 1968, during a recent visit to a su burban railroad station. Offic ials admitted the complaint box had not been opened for along time.

title: Foxes Raid London Suburbs
description: LONDON (AP)  Foxes are moving in on London's suburbs, the Ministry of Agriculture an nounced, reflecting a shortage of rabbits in the countryside. The foxes raid garbage cans and chicken coops, and attack stray cats.

title: MARKET LIST SAGS ON A BROAD FRONT
description: A portfolio manager took One glance at the stuttering stock tape just before noon yesterday and declared: This market looks weak.

title: MITCHELL REGRETS CAMPUS GUNFIRE
description: CLEVELAND, Miss., May 19 Attorney General John N. Mitchell said today that Amer ican education was experienc ing the saddest semester in its history.

title: BUILDING TRADES SET RALLY TODAY
description: Declaring that he was satis fied with the efforts of spon sors of today's rally at City Hall by construction workers to maintain order, Mayor Lindsay yesterday appealed to citizens of all political views to make it a peaceful day.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Activities. President Nixon met with Republican Con gressional leaders and then with his Cabinet. Mr. Nixon saw Ambassador Bunker and former West German Chan cellor Kurt George Kiesinger. He met with his Urban Af fairs Council, and saw Henry Ford 2d and Bud Wilkinson about the volunteer action program.

title: King Auto
description: Hearings now being held by the House Public Works Committee provide a perfect opportunity to reopen the question why at this point in history the American people should be paying sixteen times as much for highways each year as they do for mass transportation. The disparity would be great even if the population were ideally dispersed throughout this vast country. With close to 80 per cent of the people jammed into urban areas, it is wildly irrational.

title: CHOMSKY TELLS OF TRIP TO HANOI
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., May 19 For four years Noam Chom sky, the scholar in linguistics and antiwar crusader, has filled publications and campus lecture halls with relentless argument against United States involve ment in Asia and exhortations to American intellectuals to op pose the war.

title: Jakarta and the West
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, May 19 President Suharto and his Foreign Minister, Adam Malik, in addresses before the Asian conference on Cambodia last weekend, took pains to empha size Indonesia's adherence to nonaligned diplomacy.

title: COLORADO TEST SET ON DESALTED WATER
description: WASHINGTON  The Office of Saline Water of the United States Department of the In terior will study the technical and economic feasibility of us ing desalting processes to im prove the water quality of six communities in Colorado.

title: New Books
description: Body Language, by Julius Fast (M. Evans: Lippincott, $4.95). Of Kin esics, a science of nonverbal communication.

title: BOMBING SUSPECT LINKED TO ALIENS
description: A suspect charged with nu merous bombings throughoil New York State was reorpted yesterday to be affiliated with an alien government.

title: Frosted Windows Sought
description: NEWMARKET, England (UPI) Builders of a new housing de velopment have agreed to re place plain bathroom windows with frosted ones after com plaints from a group of women tenants.

title: India's Students Seek Right to Cheat
description: DELPHI, IndiaEducators in the West who are troubled by student militancy might still spared a thought of pity for their colleagues in India, where students are fighting for the right to cheat at examinations.

title: CAMPBELL CITES FINANCIAL WOES
description: Charles O. Finley, whose name doesn't crop up often when people discuss hockey, emerged yesterday as the fa vorite to take control of the Oakland Seals, a team in fi nancial trouble since the day it opened for business.

description: SAN DEIGO, May 19 (AP) Firemen returned to work ear ly today after the City Council accepted an agreement ending a fiveday walkout.

description: LONDON (AP)  Britain's construction workers lose 45 minutes of every working hour on a building site, a countrywide study says.

description: LONDON (UPI)It was once fashionable to poohpooh a longwinded Anglican bishop as just all gas and gaiters.

title: BROOKLYN BOY, 6, KILLED BY GYPSY CAB
description: A 6yearoldboy was killed and his brother and a friend were critically injured last night when they were struck by what witnesses said was a gypsy cab in the BedfordStuy yesant section of Brooklyn.

title: Lead Content Cut Seen in Gasoline, Not Elimination
description: The chairman of the Mobil Oil Corporation said yesterday that a reduction in the lead content of gasoline, rather than the elimination of lead, offered the quickest and most effec Itive way to reduce automotive lair pollution at the lowest cost: to the consumer.

title: Around Country, FM Turns to Rock
description: The most rapidly expand ing development in broad casting is underground radio. which transmits a broad diversity of rock music for FM listeners from their late teens to their middle 30's.

title: TEACHERS UNIT FINED FOR STRIKE IN JERSEY
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., May 19The Sayerville Educa tion Association was fined $450 and its president, Robert Deck er, a schoolteacher, drew $350 fine today after they were convicted of contempt of court in refusing to obey a backto work order in the Sayreville teachers strike in March.

title: Street Musicians And Hotel Runners Get Free Rein Here
description: Fragments of the city's past drifted into history yesterday as the City Council abolished, the requirement for licenses for street musicians and for hotel runnersthose raucus, hustling operators who meet newcomers at trains and steam ships to guide them to the city's hotels.

title: Prisoner No. 7432 Weds Prisoner No. 7433 in Jail
description: MOUNT PLEASANT, Mich. (AP)There were no tears, nor rice, no musicjust solid jail barsas prisoner No. 7433 was married to prisoner No. 7432 in the Isabella County Jail.
