description: The appointment of Miguel A, Rondina as vice president, technical aincl purchasing, has been announced by Incres Line, operator of the cruise ship Vic toria.

title: Continental Drops Franklin Life Bid
description: The Continental Corporation has decided not to pursue its plans to make an offer for the stock of the Franklin Life In surance Company at this time, N. H. Wentworth, chair man of Continental, announced yesterday.

title: KOOSMAN LIFTED AS ARM TIGHTENS
description: The New York Mets and Chi cago Cubs resumed hostilities last night before 50,586 persons in Shea Stadium and Chicago won the opening round. 64.

title: Syracuse Coach to Retire
description: SYRACUSE, N. Y., May 22 (AP)Roy Simmons, who has been the lacrosse coach at Syr acuse since 1932, will retire on June 30. Simmons played quar terback on the Orange football team from 1922 to 1924 before joining the coaching staff in 1925. Simmon's lacrosse post will be filled by his son, Roy Jr., also a Syracuse graduate.

title: Art: Delightful Trompe l'Oeil Exhibit
description: The Whitney Museum's new exhibition, The Reality of Appearance, carries the sub title The Trompe l'Oeil Tra dition in American Painting. Whether or not your eye realty gets Tooled, it is cer tain to be delighted. It may also be surprised to discover that these sharply defined, meticulously detailed paint ings, ostensibly photographic in character and, no doubt, just as photographically ac curate as the painters knew how to make them, are not only unphotographic but an tiphotographic to the 20th century eye.

title: FINCH'S ARM BETTER; HE'LL GO TO FLORIDA
description: WASHINGTON, May 22  Robert H. Finch, the Secretary of Health. Education and Wel fare, was discharged from Wal ter Reed Medical Center today. He will fly to President Nixon's home in Key Biscayne, Fla., for a week's rest.

title: Window Controls Light
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 A New York engineer and businessman was granted a patent this week for Varad, a window that controls light. The panel can be changed gractually from transparent to opaque and hack again, Patent 3,512,876 awarded to Alvin M. Marks, covers the eleetrooptic de vice. The transmission of light Is regulated by sub microscopic needlelike par ticles called dipoles, sus pended between two panes of glass in a liquid such as sili cone oli.

title: Cairo Aide Finds War Has Reached A Turning Point
description: CAIRO, May 22  Cairo's most authoritative editor de clared today that a turning point had been reached in the ArabIsraeli conflict, with the war now in the beginning of the end.

title: On 7th Avenue, They Think Blair Sabol Is Abbie Hoffman
description: Blair Sabol is not a beard ed young man who shares an East Village pad with a hippie commune and talks in fourletter words.

title: THE CHIEF AWARDS
description: Small Pony HuntersLindsay Scott's Trough ill Dragon Fly.

title: FONTEYN CONTINUES REFINING SWAN ROLE
description: There are few performances that remain comfortably be yond critical question and Mar got Fonteyn's swan queen is one of them. Thursday night, the Royal Ballet presented Swan Lake at the Metropoli tan Opera with Rudolph Nure yev as Siegfried and Miss Fon teyn as the inevitably doomed heroine.

title: Weekend Ban on Cars Set for Prospect Park
description: August Heckscher, Admin istrator of Parks, Recreation and Cultural Affairs, has an nounced that Prospect Park will be closed Saturdays be ginning today, to automobile traffic from sunrise to sun set. In past summers, the park was closed to car traf fic only on Sunday.

title: Brooklyn School Board Gets Early Start
description: Edward J. King is a 29 yearold transit patrolman for whom civic action is a con suming avocation. In fact, he keeps a mimeograph ma chine in his BedfordStuy vesant residence and carries a polished gavel in his attach case.

title: The American Way
description: The demonstration at City Hall this week by stu dents and workers opposed to President Nixon's poli cies in Indochina followed by a day a far larger demonstration, led by construction workers, supporting these policies. A nation that rests on the will of the people moves by consensus, but implicit in this is the need to respect differences of opinion and to defend freedom of expression and assembly as the basis democracy.

title: Talking Parrot Is Stolen
description: FALL RIVER, Mass. (AP) Thieves who broke into the Marine Aquarium pet shop might have a stool pigeon on their hands. The police said that the burglars had taken a South American parrot de scribed as capable of talking.

title: Fire Kills 41 in Egypt
description: CAIRO, May 22 (UPI) Brush fires destroyed 660 houses and killed 41 persons on the hottest day in 60 years in the United Arab Republic. The newspaper Al Ahram said that temperatures reached 118 de grees.

title: 120 Yachts Start Long Island Sound Overnight Passage
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., May 22 The Lar chmont Yacht Club's 15th annual distance race, the first major overnight sail of the season on Long Is land Sound, began early this evening off Larohmont Break water with a fleet of 120 cruis ing yachts heading eastward in a steady 10knot southerly breeze.

title: SALES UP IN APRIL FOR CHAIN STORES
description: Sales at chain stores and ca talogue houses rose 8.3 per cent in April from the yearearlier level, according to a monthly survey by The New York Times. It was the lowest dollar volume increase so far this year, re Iflecting a lag in retail buying and the fact that the figures Iwere compared with the Easter month of 1969. This year Easter fell in March.

title: Mrs. Lyman Is Wed To James B. Crosby
description: Mrs. Elizabeth Gilbert Ly man, widow of Dr. Alexander Victor Lyman, was married in the chapel of St. Thomas Episcopal Church yesterday to James Blanchard Crosby, a stockbroker with Horn blower & WeeksHemphill, Noyes. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Dr. Frederick M. Morris.

title: A.B.A. Playoff
description: CHAMPIONSHIP

title: Thursday Night Fights
description: Los AngelesJose Luis Mar tinez, 128 pounds, Mexico City, outpointed Rodolfo Lobat 126, Juarez, Mexico, 10 rounds.

title: Gas Shipments Opposed
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (AP) Senator Mike Gravel, Demo crat of Alaska, protested today a Defense Department proposal to ship lethal nerve gas from Okinawa to Kodiak, Alaska. He said he would cosponsor legis lation with Senator Warren G. Magnuson, Democrat of Vir ginia, to prohibit gas shipments either to Alaska, Hawaii or the continental United States.

title: Old Winners at Hialeah
description: HIALEAH, Miami, (AP)  Primordial II, an 8yearold Ar gentinebred, became the oldest horse to win the Widener Handi cap at Hialeah Park when he scored in 1965. However, in 1969 the Chileanbred Yumble matched that record. He also was eight.

title: Cucumbers for Sandwiches
description: If you loved waferthin cucumber sandwiches and tea in England or cucumbers in cream with poached sal mon in France, those dishes will be easier to duplicate here starting next week. That's when the first crop of seedless, Europeanstyle cu cumbers, grown under class by the West Vir ginia Best Cor poration, will be arriving at the markets. The slen der, footlong cu cumbers have a dark green, thin, ridged skin and tender, crunchy flesh with no seeds and no unpleasant bitter aftertaste. Each cucumber is identitied by a green paper sleeve with recipes for such delicacies as cucumber mar malade and an American cu cumber and spinach salad.

title: U.S. Official Says SST Will Arrive on Schedule
description: WASHINGTON, May 22  The head of the supersonic transport program said today he was absolutely confident that the two projected SST prototypes could be produced and tested on schedule without any cost overruns.

title: Steel Executives Vexed by Inflation and Profit Drop
description: Steel Executives Vexed by Inflation and Profit Drop

title: 6 STARTING SPOTS OPEN FOR INDY 500
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 22 (AP)  Mario Andretti, 1969 winner of the Indianapolis 500 mile race, drove at more than 167 miles an hour today in a practice run, while unqualified drivers were struggling to reach 165 m.p.h. for final time trials tomorrow and Sunday.

title: Stoph Puts Condition on Talks
description: BERLIN, May 22 (Reuters) Premier Stoph said today that he was prepared for another meeting with Chancellor Brandt only if Bonn adopted a realis tic attitude and granted East Germany full diplomatic recog nition.

title: Pact Is Near at N.B.C.
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (AP) A tentative agreement was reached early today on a labor contract covering the coastto coast television and radio fa cilities of the National Broad casting Company. The settle ment, subject to ratification by members of the National Asso ciation of Broadcast Employes and Technicians was announced by J. Curtis Counts, director of the Federal Mediation and Con ciliation Service.

title: Iowa Reinstates Nagel as Head Football Coach
description: IOWA CITY, May 22 (AP) Ray Nagel was reinstated as Iowa's football coach tonight by the university's Board in Control of Athletics four days after it had voted to relieve him of his duties effective June 30.

title: Foot of Snow Falls in Poland
description: WARSAW, May 23 (Reuters)  More than a foot of snow covered the Tatra Mountains of southern Poland today follow an overnight return to win ter. Temperatures dropped to minus 23 degrees, P.A.P., they official press agency, reported.

title: Open Policy Advocated For Trade
description: Developed nations should either go allout in opening their markets to exports of lessdeveloped countries, or shelve this aid effort en tirely, according to a former chief United States trade agreements negotiator.

title: TWIN RALLY IN 8TH DOWNS ANGELS, 54
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., May 23 (AP)Jim Holt doubled with two out in the eighth inning and then scored Minnesota's winning run on a single by Leo Cardenas as the Twins topped the California Angels, 54, today.

title: Planes Hold the Balance In Mideast War
description: JERUSALEMIn the war in the Middle East, planes still count most. Three years ago, in the sixday war, Israel's Air Force provided the massive, pre emptive strikes that crippled her enemies before they could get started. Since then, the Air Force has been the chief means of dealing out heavy reprisals, and the least expensive to Israel in terms of Israeli lives lost.

title: PIANO SKILL SHOWN BY EILEEN DICKINSON
description: Eileen Dickinson, a pianist of considerable facility and tem perament, made her New York debut in a recital Friday night at Carnegie Hall. The event was a benefit for the Guild for Exceptional Children, a Brook lyn organization. Herself a Brooklynite, Miss Dickinson studied with Jan Gorbaty at the New York College of Music.

title: Illinois Pay Increased
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., May 23 (AP)Gov. Richard B. Ogilvie has agreed to a 6 per cent wage increase for state employes, ef fective Sept. 1.

title: The Armed Forces Championship
description: THE recent Armed Forces Chess Tournament, played in the Amer ican Legion's Hall of Flags, at Washington, D. C., was an inter service competition and an individual championship.

title: A Bonus for Woodland Wanderers
description: ANY season is a good time for visit ing Teatown Lake Reservation, near Ossining, in Westchester County, but spring generally yields the most lavish naturalhistory bonuses. Whether it is migratory or nesting birds, or native woodland wild flowers, or the plants and animals of wetlands, or the sheer physical exhila ration of tramping woodland trails in a time of renewal and growth, a spring time visit to this naturerich area is sure to be rewarding.

title: U.S. Tea Buying From Ceylon Rises
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, May 23The United States was Ceylon's second best cus tomer for tea last year. United States purchases tot aled 45.4 million pounds compared with 30 million pounds in 1968.

title: Images of America: Racial Feeling Remains Strong in the Cities
description: The words nigger and whitey kept appearing in angry scrawls on the walls of the restrooms in the inte grated Boeing Company plant in Seattle.

title: 3 Ministers Are Appointed In Norway Cabinet Shuffle
description: OSLO, Norway, May 23 (Reu ters)Norway's Defense and Foreign Ministers have been re placed in Premier Per Borten's first Cabinet reshuffle since his fourparty coalition Govern ment came to power in 1965.

title: Rent Plan Detailed
description: CITY officials described in detail for the first time last week the process by which they plan to cal culate new economic rent levels in 1.3 million con trolled apartments under Mayor Lindsay's proposed revision of the rent control law.

title: NIXON AIDES SPLIT ON SENATE CURBS
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 While Senators debate the Cambodian issue, a struggle is reported going on in the White House for the mind of President Nixon on the proposed Cooper Church amendment to the for eign Military Sales Act, now before the Senate.

title: Turkish Leader Defers Visit
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (Reu ters)  The White House an nounced today that Premier Suleyman Demirel of Turkey asked for a postponement of his official visit to the United States next month because of pressure of work. He was to have met with President Nixon.

title: Becker Is Fourth to Score 1,000 Points for New Mexico
description: ALBUQERQUE, N.M., (AP) The University of New Mexi co's Ron Becker, a 64 forward, recently became the fourth Lo bo to score more than 1,000 career points.

title: Husband, wife and mothermotherinlaw
description: Julian, a senior lecturer at an Eng lish university, lies near to death with an amoebic infection in a London hospital. His estranged wife Ange lique and his mother both arrive to nurse him back to health, first in the hospitai and later in a large apart ment. Julian is selfcentered and dedi cated entirely to his own survival and comfort. Angelique is almost supernaturally graceful, welleducat ed, a good cook but an inept house wife. The unnamed mothermother inlaw records their every move and emotion in undated diary form.

title: Weiskopf, on 204, Retains Shot Lead In Atlanta Classic
description: ATLANTA, May 23  Tom Weiskopf, whose best drives often travel 350 yards, found the closing holes of the Atlanta Country Club rugged today. After leading by five strokes with four holes to go in the third round of the $125,000 Atlanta Classic, the slim Ohioan ran into a double bogey, a par and two successive bogeys. However the resulting one underpar 71 enabled him to keep the. 54hole lead by one stroke with an aggregate of 204.

title: Pamela Moore Becomes Bride
description: SALISBURY, Conn., May 23Miss Pamela M. Moore, export manager for Vanity Fair Mills, Inc., was married here today to Farrell William Bushing Jr., assistant con troller for the Columbia Broadcasting System's tele vision network.

title: COMMISSARY WINS BY NOSE ON COAST
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., May 23 (UPI)Frontrunning Commis sary turned back the challenge of heavily favored Pattee Can yon in the stretch today and scored a nose victory in the 29th running of the $80,250 Vanity Handicap at Hollywood Park.

title: Is There Vestige Of Hope In Paris Talks?
description: WASHINGTON  Yet again in this Indochina War, the mer its of a military venture are be ing calculated here in terms of enemy killed, weapons captured, difficulties imposed, attacks de ferred, allied lives saved. The debate over the move into Cam bodia, like the past debates over the bombing of North Vietnam, the commitment of combat troops to South Vietnam and the decision to searchanddestroy the countryside, has become sta tistical when the avowed objec tive, as always before, is in fact political.

title: Spotlight:
description: Is this any time to start a mutual fund? The stock market has been battered for the last 18 months, many investors have gone into hiding  or shock  and the perfor mances of most mutual funds these days is better forgotten than flaunted.

title: Researchers to Seek the Reasons for Differences in Hospital Death Rates
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 First steps are being taken here toward a major study to find out why postoperative death rates at some hospitals are sev eral times higher than at others, even when comparable opera tions and groups of patients are compared.

title: M'CORMACK SEAT SOUGHT BY MANY
description: BOSTON, May 23A scram ble among a number of candi dates is shaping up in the contest for the Democratic nomination for the Congres sional seat being vacated by Speaker of the House John W. McCormack.

title: Steel Haulers Vote to Return To Work After 7Week Strike
description: PITTSBURGH, May 23 (AP) The strike by some 10,000 independent truckers that crippled highway steel ship ments throughout the East and Midwest for nearly seven weeks has ended.

title: U.S. TV PROGRAMS CURBED IN CANADA
description: OTTAWA, May 23An order that will reduce the amount of, United States programing carried by Canadian radio and television stations went into effect this week.

title: Man, in Jail for 17 Months, Freed on Murder Charge
description: A murder charge was dis missed yesterday against a man who spent nearly 17 months in jail.

title: Joy Boutilier Shows Bizarre Whimsey In Dance Program
description: The choreographic world of Joy Boutilier is full of eccentric motivation and bizarre whim sey. At its best it organizes disparate elements into a charming and unexpected har mony and at its worst scatters shards of protoideas in dis ordered profusion. On Friday evening at Henry Street Settle ment Playhouse she presented a program of her works along with a solo choreographed by Gladys Bailin.

title: 3 Students Seized On Felony Charges Made by Columbia
description: For the first time as a re sult of a university investiga tion, Columbia University has lodged felony charges against three students involved in demonstration on the campus.

title: Jacqueline Hand Bride in Jersey
description: PLAINFIELD, N. J., May 23 Miss Jacqueline Neumann Hand of New York, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas J. Hand of West Nyack, N. Y, was married here today to John Milton Lacey, son of Mrs Florence E. Lacey of Brooklyn. The ceremony was performed by Howard A. Ra dest, an Ethical Culture leader, in the home of the bride's brother, Dr. James Henry Hand.

title: Caroline Floyd Is Wed to Richard Hudson Sutphin
description: GATES MILLS, Ohio, May 23Miss Caroline Chalmers Floyd and Richard Hudson Sutphin were married here today at St. Francis of Assisi Roman Catholic Church. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Peter J. Lenahan.

title: RENE CAPITANT, 68, GAULLIST DEPUTY
description: PARIS, May 23Ren Capi tant, a leader of Gaullism's left wing who had been an active Resistance fighter and a former Minister of Justice under Pres ident Charles de Gaulle, died here today at Foch Hospital. He was 68 years old.

title: The Ladies Take Their Places on the Rails and Trackside as Long Island Tracks Open Tomorrow and Tuesday
The sexiest skirt of all
description: The midi may very well end up as the sexiest skirt ever. Leg conscious designers are slitting it smack up the front or some times up the side  thighhigh. The slit midi looks strong for summer and promises to cres cendo in the fall. It can be un buttoned to the individual's taste. Wear the slit midi now in cool black with dark tights and black patent shoes. And think of wearing it next fall with kneehigh laced boots.

title: ROCKETS STRIKE AT ISRAELIS AGAIN
description: TEL AVIV, May 23 (Reuters) Sovietbuilt Katyusha rock ets fired from Jordanian terri tory crashed early today in the Nahal Meshua and Damiya bridge sectors of the Jordan Valley, a military spokesman said here. There were no cas ualties and the fire was re turned, he added.

title: SINGING RAIN 2D
description: Shuvee, Mrs. Whitney. Stone's fine chestnut 4yearold, gained satisfactory revenge on Walter M. Jeffords's Singing Rain in the $57,500 Top Flight Handi cap at Aqueduct yesterday.

title: Westchester Apartment Owner Charged in Fair Housing Case
description: The United States Attorney's office has named the owner of two Westchester apartment buildings in the first suit it said had been filed in the metro politan area under the fair housing provision of the Civil Rights Act of 1968.

title: Barnes on Dance
School Busing a U.S. Tradition
description: LANSING, Mich.  Nearly all the turmoil in the country over busing pupils to school has come with its use for racial integration, even though busing for that purpose ac counts for less than 3 per cent of the centuryold, bil liondollar program of student transportation.

title: War Foe Apparent Leader in Democratic Senate Primary on Coast
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 22 Representative George E. Brown Jr., who was a dove on Vietnam before the term was adopted, appears to have taken a narrow lead in the race for the Democratic senatorial nom ination in California.

title: Recordings
description: EVEN if there were not governments, this new generation would have to make a revolution. For only the new generation, worldwide but especially in the U. S., truly comprehends that financial wealth is not heaven, that the world is small, that you can go to the moon, that each human being should be free. Growing up between 1950 and 1970 with rockets, TV, drugs, affluence, Dr. King, and the various pol lutions as facts rather than things in the making, the young person who is now at most 35 is locked in a strug gle for survival with his eld ers whose wars, religions, laws, financial depressions and family structures had all dictated that most of the things one might want in life can't be had, and that only an ungrateful fool would try to get them. Today's youth was born, in a sense, without a home, so he has no place to return to. In place of the older generation's confidence that its homes are its castles and that God looks out for it, youth has been willed more possibilities than he can put into action, and from them he must select a life or fall apart. Get your thing together is today's hippest phrase with good reason.

title: In the Sports Editor's Mailbox
description: About Amateurs and Pros

title: JOCKEY IS LOSER IN FRENCH COURT
description: PARIS, May 19A civil court awarded $2,730 today to a race horse owner who brought suit against the French champion jockey, Ives SaintMartin, after the rider was disqualified as winner in a handicap for being above the allowed weight.

title: In Indianapolis, Everybody Loves the Romantics
description: A BOUT a week after the conclusion of the sec ond Festival of Ro mantic Music in In dianapolis, in May, 1969, Frank Cooper started think ing about the third festival. Cooper is the young man who teaches piano at the Jordan College of Music in Butler University, and he knows more about the forgotten music of the 19th century than anybody around. He also has the biggest personal library of romantic music outside of a major research center.

title: The Week in Dance
description: ROYAL BALLET

title: Officer Weds Nancy C. Culbertson
description: KENT, Conn., May 23 Miss Nancy Cosgrave Cul bertson and First Lieut. Sean Crombie Connor, U.S.A., were married here at noon today, at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Wil liam Howard Culbertson. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Lowell Russell Dit zen, director of the National Presbyterian Center in Wash ington.

title: PENN CREW TAKES MADEIRA CUP RACE
description: ITHACA, N. Y., May 23 Pennsylvania's powerful crew won the Madeira Cup for the fifth straight year here today, despite a surprising challenge from Cornell.

title: LAVER BEATS ROCHE IN TENNIS CLASSIC
description: WEST ORANGE, N. J., May 23Rod Laver defeated Tony Roche tonight in a $10,000 challenge match of the $200, 000 Tennis Champions Classic, setting up a semifinal contest that fans consider a natural: Laver against Pancho Gonzales for $15,000 on June 2 at Madi son Square Garden.

title: Economy: Still No Grounds For Much Cheer
description: WASHINGTONThe crisis of confidence over the state of the nation's economy deepened last week. Stock prices were bat tered to their lowest level in seven years. The Chase Man hattan Bank Calculated that the market value of all securities has dropped by more than $150 billion since the start of 1970 and by $280billion since Presi dent Nixon took office.

title: Aurelio Emerges As Top Aide And Strategist for Lindsay
description: The city's offtrack betting plans? That's a big one, the man in the Budget Bureau said hesitantly. We refer it to Dick; Aurelio.

title: Bridge
description: THE extent to which postmor tems are desirable or acceptable varies according to the wishes of the players and circumstances in which the game is played. For some, the failure to discuss an interesting deal takes away a large part of their pleasure in playing, while for others any delay in continuing with the next hand is a source of irritation.

title: The Face Of The Third Reich
description: As rewriting history pour pater les bourgeois has become something of a sport, it seems only a question of time before some enterprising spi rit will have a second look at that much maligned movement, German National Socialism.

title: Dissimilar Buildings, Similar Awards
description: Seven years ago, the City Club of New York stirred, up a considerable fuss because it could find no civic structure worthy of its Bard Awards. The reac tion, surprisingly, was headlines and kind of stunned, municipal shame. The Awards Program, established in 1961 in the name of Albert S. Bard, a gentle and persistent crusader for 60 years for a better city through design, got off the hook the next year by judging pri vate structures. It has alternated the two categories ever since.

title: Ottinger Says Army Developed Inhumane Dart Gun in Secret
description: A diabolical and Inhumane gun that shoots, fleshripping darts instead of bullets has been developed by the Army without the knowledge of Con gress, Representative Richard L. Ottinger charged yesterday.

title: The Gerbil Ate the Plate
description: A casual inventory of the wildlife in my Manhattan block yields the following: one mean monkey whose portrait regularly appears in the cor ner photographer's window along with those of other less distinguished neighbors; one sixtyfive pound cat; a number of nondescript mutts as well as a Great Dane in a perpetual state of false pregnancy; a pack of scruffy homeless cats that constitute a public charge; an untold quantity of tanks full of tropical fish and snails; and the minizoo which is in the custody of one small boy. He has in his room at the moment one water turtle, one desert turtle, two swifts, one water snake, one frog and one toad (both of which sing all through the city night) and one boa constrictor. For the suste nance of the latter he raises mice, and since the rate of mouse repor duction fails to keep pace with the diner's appetite, he scours the com munity for other mouse farmers. Such an entrepreneur has been located, but the second boy refuses to sell his newborn cropNOT FOR A SNAKE TO EAT. The first boy also shares with his sister a cat named Fred (when Fred ate half of the first resi dent snake, a garter, the remains were boiled in the spirit of inquiry but the skelton dissolved) and the sister owns a meek and nameless gerbil. The mother adds that the household also maintains 365 roaches.

title: Business Index Rises in Week
description: The New York Times Weekly Index of Business Ac tivity rose to 352.8 from 343.8 a week earlier. A year ago it was 337.4

title: FIKES SETS MARK IN TWOMILE RACE
description: Denis Fikes, of Rice, who ad mits he likes the twomile event over the onemile, showed why yesterday in the 12th annual New York sectional track and field championships of the Cath olic High Schools Athletic As sociation.

title: And Now, Here's Raquel on Women's Lib
description: FOR most of us, the term dog days refers to a listless period of about five weeks at the height of the summer. The television industry, however, always alert to opportunity, reaches the dogdays slump by midApril. Before the rest of us are running on daylight saving time, television is run ning reruns.

title: W. C. Bissett Marries Elizabeth M. de Veer
description: SHORT HILLS, N. J., May 23 Miss Elizabeth Mulcare de Veer and William Chapman Bisset were married here to day at Christ Episcopal Church by the Rev. Richard B. Andersen.

title: TV Antismoking Series Said to Convince 1 of 20
description: ATLANTA, May 23 (AP)A survey made in 11 cities shows that one out of 20 people who watched the television series Why You Smoke gave up cigarettes, the American Cancer Society says.

title: Barbara E. Doty Married at Rye To J.B. Dwyer 3d
description: RYE, N. Y., May 23Miss Barbara Elisabeth Doty and James Bernard Dwyer 3d were married here this morn ing in the Roman Catholic Church of the Resurrection. Msgr. William L. Doty, uncle of the bride, and the Rev. John Slater of Erie, Pa., per formed the ceremony and con celebrated the nuptial mass.

title: Leo M. Charm. Dies at 70; Retired Engineer for Navy
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., May 23Leo M. Charm, who retired three weeks ago as a civilian engineer with the Navy De partment and who formerly had been a construction engi neer in New York, died Thurs day in New Rochelle Hospital. He was 70 years old and lived at 118 Victory Boulevard.

title: PHILIP LEVY, 61, DIES; WASHINGTON LAWYER
description: WASHINGTON, May  Philip Levy, a lawyer here, died last night at his hone at the age of 61.

title: Webster Learns What Made Allie Run
description: Behind Alex Webster's head there was a panorama of Central Parkthe lush trees, the zoo, the young couples grazing in the grass.

title: Philympia, London
description: American stamp collectors who have been allotted frames at Philympia 1970, the international stamp exhi bition in London, Sept. 1826 have been notified, accord ing to Ronald A. G. Lee, the show's executive chairman. He reports that there were more than 7,000 frame re quests for the 3,600 frames available. Some exhibits had to be turned down, others had to be cut in size.

title: The Same Justice Can Be Both a Strict And a Loose Constructionist
description: THE year is 1972, and the Supreme Court has before it the first case testing the Preventive Detention Act of 1971. Passed by Congress at the urging of President Nixon, the act allows Federal judges to order persons accused of serious crimes to be held in prison until trial if their record indicates that they might commit further crimes while on bail. Hubert Johnson, a District of Columbia Negro charged with armed robbery, is being held under the act because he has several other felony convictions on his record. He wants the Supreme Court to declare his de tention without bail unconstitutional.

title: Heather B. Dillingham Is Bride Of James J. Bradley 3d, a Broker
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 23 Miss Heather Barbour Dil lingham and James J. Bradley 3d were married here this afternoon in the Swedenbor gian Church by the Rev. Othmar Tobisch.

title: If the Dodgers Left Brooklyn..
description: WHATEVER became of Manhattan Festival Ballet? Well for a start it left Manhat tan and has relocated in Youngstown, Ohio. Iguess if the Dofgers could leave Brooklyn there could be no really good reason why the Manhattan Festival Ballet should not leave Manhattan. But it has been missedit was our only neighborhood company, it developed many friends and its warmth, un pretentiousness and taste gave it a quality all of its own.

title: MISS PETROWSKY IN PIANO RECITAL
description: Christina Petrowsky, a stage shy slip of a girl with a gamin haircut, played Messiaen to per fection in the recital she gave at Carnegie Recital Hall on Fri day night. She had selected seven of his Vingt Regards sur L'Enfant Jesus for the first half of her brief program of 20thcentury piano music, and her introspective approach to them resulted in interpretations filled with the shifting colors and moods that express Mes siaen's personal mysticism.

title: Columbia's Battleground Is Shifting From Campus to Its Senate and Tribunals
description: The police were called on campus to end window smashing were praised. Students protected a college building against rockhurling radicals. A strike call by extremists to shut down a university drew a total of 36 persons and became a joke.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Indochina's biggest rubber plantation was attacked from two sides by about 10,000 South Vietnamese troops yesterday in a drive against what was described as an enemy regiment. The plantation is about 50 miles northeast of Pnompenh. The South Vietna mese force, supported by tanks and armored vehicles, was opposing the 272d Vietcong regiment, believed to be made up of about 2,000 men. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: Four reviews by Eudora Welty
description: Maxie Picheisteiner, the hero of an earlier book, The Little Man, is a Bohemian gymnast and acrobat two inches high, who sleeps in a match box. He is famous now, and his life story is being made into a film for

title: We Needed ThisA March Through Georgia
description: ATLANTA  Through cen tral Georgia for five days last week, from tiny rural Perry to urban Atlanta, wended a slow line of marchers. At the head were two mules pulling a black casket on an old farm wagon, the casket symbolizing 12 Amer icans  black and white  slain by authorities in recent weeks in Augusta, Ga., at Jack son State College in Jackson, Miss., and at Kent State Univer sity in Ohio.

title: Reader's Report
description: A Measure of Dust

title: REDMEN CAPTURE 10 OF 18 EVENTS
description: St. John's Redmen played host to Fordham and New York University in the 11th Crock o' Cheese track and field meet on their Jamaica reservation yes terday and, as expected, charged to an easy victory.The redandwhite shifted In dians captured 10 of the 18 events and finished with 93 points. Fordham, with four first places, was second with 57 points and N.Y.U. trailed with 42.

title: New Products for the Home
description: AUNIQUE garden hose that collapses into a flat ribbon when it is not in use becomes round (inch inside diame ter) to deliver a full flow when the water is turned on. When the water is turned off the hose collapses into a flat rib bon again. This automatically causes it to drain so that it is lighter to carry around or store. In addition, the self draining feature makes it easy to coil the hose up with out getting wet. It is made in lengths of 25 and 50 feet, and comes in green and a special nontoxic white for use when carrying drinking water (boats, mobile homes, etc). Both remain flexible in freezing temperatures, and both can he left under pres sure in the sun without burst ing. Flat Hose, $9.50 for the 50foot green. (Colorite Plas tics Company, 101 Railroad Avenue, Ridgefield, N. J. 07657).

title: MILLIARD STUDENTS OFFER 2 PREMIERES
description: Almost two dozen Juilliard students participated in a free concert of chamber music at Tully Hall Friday, night. Par ticipated is perhaps too weak a descriptionthese young mu sicians fairly threw themselves into their work with a winning abandon that set lines of communication tingling even when the music at hand seemed some thing less than compelling.

title: He couldn't see things through
description: Had William Jennings Bryan won the three times he ran for the Presidency, no doubt his torians would have termed America's turnofthecentury years the age of Bryan rather than the age of Roosevelt. Even as matters stand, it was Wil Liam Jennings Bryan who called striking attention to the over concentration of industry in the hands of a powerful few (plutocrats, he called them); Roosevelt, the trustbuster, only responded to the demand that Bryan had done so much to promote.

title: Steeplechase to Scolvin
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., May 23 (UPI)A late charge and in telligent riding enabled Augus tin Stabe's Scolvin to win the 26th running of the Oxmoor Steeplechase today at the es tate of Thomas W. Bullitt, vice presiden of the Kentucky Hunt Race Association.

title: 3,000Mile Saga of FamilyBuilt Vessel
description: When Leslie Bates, who is 15 years old, read an article in the newspaper one Sunday about a man who had built a boat and was about to launch it, she nearly flipped. If people can read about that man and his boat, she thought, they ought to hear about my father and his boat. Now there's a story!

title: ITALIANS BUILDING STORES IN SOVIET
description: MOSCOW, May 23 An Americanstyle supermarket, with shopping carts, checkout stands, and signs in English, opened its doors in downtown Moscow the other day. It was a hit with the Westerners per mitted to shoo there and a subject of curiosity for Rus sians peeking in the windows.

title: Where the Rush Hour Is 3 Men Going Home
description: ALARCON, SpainThe main high way bypasses this small village midway between Valencia and Madrid, but not by so much that the traveler would fail to notice, just off to the south, the dazzling huddle of whitewashed houses and the towers of an ancient castle that rise sharply above the harsh plain.

title: Nixon Rests at Camp David
description: THURMONT, Md., May 23 (UPI)President Nixon rested at his Camp David mountain retreat today while some citi zens of this nearby factory town ciruculated petitions of tion's Indochina policies. We think your decisons in Viet nam and Cambodia are in the best nterests of America, the pettion said.

title: It's MayhemontheHighway Time Again
description: EVERY season has its harbinger, but the summer motoring season has two (1) Memorial Day, which, falling next Saturday, will make this another murderous weekend on the country's highways, and (2) the glassy eyed, limpwristed motorist, a genus pe culiar to North America.

title: How to Be Naughty and Succeed
description: It would be nice if Marty Liguori ran his races without incident, smiled at everyone, signed autographs and behaved the way amateur officials say he should.

title: Graduations This Year Reflect The Air Of Crisis
description: Traditionally, commencement speeches tended to offer the be nevolent view from the Establish nient. But if there has been a rev olution on the nation's campuses, this year's commencements where they can be held at all tell the story. Speakers from the Establishmentwith special dis pensation for Interior Secretary Walter Hickel and possibly Health, Education and Welfare Secretary Robert Finchwill be hard to find on major campuses.

title: Raster Rolls 1,857 Total In A.B.C. AllEvents Play
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., May 23 (UPI)Martin Raster of Co lumbus, Ohio, rolled an 1,857 total in regular allevents today for high schore on the 78th day of the American Bowling Congress tournament.

title: ALLIED PARADE STIRS WEST BERLIN CLASH
description: BERLIN, May 23  Strong West Berlin police forces clashed with hundreds of dem onstrators here today in the wake of an allied military pa rade in downtown West Berlin.

title: Troubled Times
description: Revolution, pollution, mili tarism, imperialism, politics, student rebellion, riots  these are the jarring themes of the nine books under review here. They reflect not only the dis temper of our times but also the new maturity of the 12 andup reader for whom they were written.

title: Activism Arrives at U. of Alabama
description: TUSCALOOSA, Ala., May 19 When the University of Alabama football team endured one of its worst seasons in re cent history last fall, some people on the campus began to suspect that this would not be just another academic year.

title: Cabinet Group Compromised on Integration Policy
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 The twomonth drafting proc ess that produced President Nixon's message this week ask ing Congress for $1.5billion in new money to desegregate the schools produced some surpris ing and ironic alignments with in the Cabinet.

title: BENEFITS
description: Tickets for the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless other wise indicated:

title: For Foundation Trustee
description: William Henry Donaldson, president and chief executive officer of Donaldson, Lufkin & tenrette, investment bankers, has been elected a trustee of the Ford Foundation.

title: Miss Diana Greenwood Wed To James Gordon Harrison
description: GLADWYNE, Pa., May 23  Miss Diana Greenwood, a member of the class of '73 at the Boston University School of Fine and Applied Arts, was married here this after noon to James Gordon Harri son, a member of the class of '72 at the school. The cere mony in St. Christopher's Episcopal Church was per formed by the Rev. Warren H. Davis.

title: The Designs of E. B. White
description: Back in 1938, with his tongue in his cheek, E. B. White wrote, Close physical contact with the field of juvenile literature leads me to the conclusion that it must be a lot of fun to write for children  reason ably easy work, perhaps even im portant work. He had just been sampling the children's books which flooded his house in those days jost ling for a place in his wife's annual New Yorker column, and he had come away gibbering. Yet even then, as he later admitted, he had tucked away in his desk drawer a dozen episodes in the continuing story of a boy named Stuart, who was only two inches high and looked like a mouse. The character had come to him in a dream back in the 1920's, he said, and had been com mitted to paper for an audience no larger than any favorite uncle might command.

title: W. Michigan Wins Title
description: OXFORD, Ohio, May 23 (AP) Western Michigan University captured the MidAmerican Conference outdoor track and field title today.

title: HALT IN PHONE WORK IN JERSEY IS ENDED
description: NEWARK, May 23  An agreement to end a oneday work stoppage by 11,000 em ployes of the New Jersey Bell Telephone Company was reach last night between the company and the Telephone Workers Union of New Jersey.

title: Eastern Tennis Named North American Open
description: The Eastern grass courts tennis championships have been renamed the North American open champion ships and scheduled for the Orange Lawn Tennis Club, Orange, N.J., from Aug. 24 to 30.

title: Daniel B. Frost to Wed Susan Foster Reynolds
description: Miss Susan Foster Rey nolds, a senior at Vassar, and Daniel Blackburn Frost, a senior at Williams, plan to be married.

title: Lyrics for little ones
description: My own first poem (written at age 8) was a plodding trib ute to the horse, lacking any hint of the imaginative freedom that is supposed to be childhood's major creative as set. As for my son (aged 2), he barks Stopitstopitstopit! whenever I recite or read to him. No help he. All the same, I know (as an adult) what I like. And what I like includes, though not to the same extent, all five of the books dealt with below.

title: Cambodia Passive Witness To Its Fate
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia The failure of the Jakarta Conference to offer concrete assistance to Cambodia to repel Vietnamese Communist invaders leaves Cam bodia at the mercy of the United States and South Vietnamthe countries already at war with Cambodia's enemies.

title: Camera Doings
description: BECAUSE most 35 mm single lens reflex cam eras are equipped with eye  level viewers, they call for considerable gymnastics when one is shooting from a low angle. Or an optional viewing ac cessory can be purchased to provide waistlevel viewing.

title: Budget Defeat Is a Surprise in Scarsdalel
description: SCARSDALE, May 23  Wealthy Scarsdale has been known for its community con cern for the excellence of its public schools, and so it sur prised many here and in the rest of Westchester when the voters defeated a proposed school budget two weeks ago, for the first time in the village's history.

title: Warren to Get Degree
description: NEWTON, Mass., May 23 (AP)Former Chief Justice Earl Warren will be the com mencement speaker at Boston College June 8, the school an pounced today. Mr. Warren will be one of nine persons receiving honorary doctorates from the 107yearold Jesuit school.

title: Ramu the Killer Whale Is Dead in Australia
description: COOLANGAITA, Austra lia, May 23 (Reuters)Ramu, the captive killer whale bought from its American owners for $22,000, has died here despite a long battle to save its life.

title: Police Are Posted Outside Arab National and Business Offices Here Following Beating of 3 Activists
description: Police details were posted outside Arab consulates, United Nations missions and business offices here yesterday follow ing the beatings of three Arab nationalists in their offices near the United Nations on Friday.

title: Eleven Who Think Alike
description: TO what extent does an artist's subscription to a particular philosophy not his own person ally evolved (and perhaps unverbalized) beliefs, but an acquired, codified system of thoughtaffect his art?

title: Workers For Nixon And Flag Come Out In Force
description: Those who view modern labor as complacent discovered last week that the right causede fense of the flag and the Estab lishment, for example,  can bring union men out in startling rank and file. Lower Broadway from the middle of the road to both curbs carried a river of blue collars that surged from City Hall to Bowling Green.

title: MassachusettsRaceEntered
description: FALL RIVER, Mass., May 23 (AP)Bertram Yaffe, 50year old Fall River businessman, has announced that he will seek the Democratic nomina tion for the 10th Congressional seat now held by Representa tive Margaret M. Heckler, Re publican of Wellesley.

title: Subaru Names Distributors
description: Malcolm Bricklin, president of Subaru of America, Inc., has announced that distribution rights for the company's line of automobiles has been granted to Kemmons Wilson, chairman of the board of Hol iday Inns, Inc., and Frank Pipe, a former Volkswagen dealer. The new distributors have agreed to purchase $9million worth of automobiles the first year.

title: Freedom Under Fire
description: The nation is in disarray. The Federal Government is divided over policies and principles. The loyal opposi tion is fragmented, more concerned with winning than with leading. Even more alarming, the academic com munity as a whole is lacking in the courage and con viction necessary to mount a successful battle against unreason and coercion within its own domain.

title: CONCERN VOICED OVER CRIME BILL
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 Rising concern over a pending anticrime bill for the District of. Columbia has focused on a few controversial provisions, but a, city attorney for the District contends that many unpubli cized provisions of the bill could also threaten the civil rights of District residents.

title: 15YearOld Runaway Flies Home to Miami
description: MIAMI, May 23 (AP) Mary Ann Vecchio, the 15 yearold runaway found by her parents after they noticed her in a photograph taken when four Kent State Uni versity students were killed during a clash with Ohio Na tional Guardsmen, came home today to a joyous family, greeting.

title: Fresh Threats By the Communists In Laos
description: VIENTIANE, Laos  At the Laotian Defense Ministry, a peeling yellow building on Rue Sam Sen Thai here, the lobby is occupied by six soldiers play ing cards, their shirts off be cause of the heat.

title: EXHIBITIONS
description: HUDSON PARK BRANCH, NEW YORK PUBLIC LIBRARY10 Seventh Avenue South. Photographs by Geoffrey Gove, Ellen Levine and Robert Lisle. Through Friday. Hours, 10 to 9, Monday and Wednesday; 10 to 6, Tuesday, Thursday and Friday.

title: Roy Killed in Elevator
description: Tenyearold Kenny Price of 760 East 166th Street, in the Morrisania section of the Bronx, was decapitated by a moving elevator yesterday aft ernoon, and died instantly, the police said. The boy was look ing through The broken glass in a window of the elevator when the accident happened.

title: RUMANIA SCORES DAVIS CUP VICTORY
description: Rumania advanced to the semifinals of the European Zone Davis Cup tennis com petition yesterday by taking a clinching 30 lead over Greece as Ion Tiriac and lie Nastase defeated Nick Kalog eropoulos and Nontas Arghiriu in doubles, 64, 61, 62.

title: FINAL PAY OFFER MADE TO PRINTERS
description: The New York Times made what it called a final money offer to the Typographical Union yesterday and told the union that operations would be continued if the printers ac cepted the proposal.

title: C H NO A primer for parents and children
description: ONE evening a few weeks ago a car roared up to the emer gency ward of Stamford Hos pital in Stamford, Conn. Two teen agers got out. Looking around fur tively, they lifted a third youth from the car and dragged him to the ward.

title: Menus at Charity Benefits Are Beginning to Reflect Effects of Recession
description: Suddenly the crab meat crepe with mornay sauce is just a bit heavy, don't you think? and everybody is tired of the rich beef Wel lington.

title: James Krauskopf Weds Miss Siegal
description: Miss Marian Ruth Siegal and James Arthur Krauskopf were married here last night at the Harvard Club by Rab bi David Seligson of the Cen tral Synagogue.

title: JERSEY BAR REJECTS CHALLENGE TO NIXON
description: ATLANTIC CITY, N.J., M.ay 23The New Jersey Bar Asso ciation rejected a resolution to day to oppose the United States military action in Cam bodia and to challenge the le gality of President Nixon's decision.

title: Bear Market Is Gnawing at the Rich
description: LOS ANGELES, May 23 The rich may be different from the merely affluent Americans, but their spend ing patterns are beginning to show things in common be cause of the slump in the stock market.

title: GUNMEN IN CYPRUS RAID POLICE STATION
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, May 23 (UPI)Seventy masked gun men seized the police head quarters in Limassol early to day, locked the policemen in cells, and escaped with all the guns and ammunition in the armory.

title: A Brief Taste of Ecstasy At the Smiling Moon Inn
description: IMPHAL, India  The road is pure chalk, set against rolling, duncol ored hills. It winds in interminable S's until, suddenly, there is a straightaway and you can dip, coasting on the clutch, to the door of what may be the oldest inn in the world, the Smil ing Moon Tavern.

title: Investment Syndromes Growing, as Reason Decays
description: In these days of fortunes now glimmering, and in earlier days of stocks going steadily upward, men have bought for reasons irrational as well as rational. In and out of Wall Street, there are many who see the irrational ity rather plainly.

title: Whites In South Feel Less Pressure On Rights
description: JACKSON, Miss.  Impercep tibly at, first,, then faster and more menacingly, the mood of the white Southerner has slipped into a preSelma psy chology that winked at white violence when committed in thename or preserving our way of life. It was as if all the lessons and convulsions of the past decade had never existed; as if the cries of the Negro for social justice could be muted by the explosions of shotguns.

title: Westport Warms To Apartments
description: WESTPORT  Conn.  In this suburban bastion of the single family home there is a growing feeling that zon ing regulations should be modified to open the door even If only a crack  to apartment builders.

title: The fiery magma became coated with dogma
description: Man ceased to be an ape, van quished the ape, on the day the first book was written. The ape has not forgotten it to this day: try to give it a bookit will immediately spoil it, tear it up, befoul it.

title: Shift in Military Balance To Arabs Seen in NATO
description: BRUSSELS, May 23Recent developments in the Middle East have indicated to authori tative military sources in the North Atlantc Treaty Organi zation that the character of the fighting there has changed to the point where Israel's capac ity to defend all her frontiers must be seriously questioned.

title: News of the Rialto
description: THOSE who, during the summer, prefer to park their thinking caps on the nearest hickory limb and go in search of such cooling bubbles as Up in Mabel's Room and Char ley's Aunt, have learned by now to make a wide detour of the Berkshire Theater Fes tival in Stockbridge, Mass.

title: East GermanMaldive Tie
description: BERLIN, May 23 (Reuters) East Germany and the Maldive Islands Republic in the Indian Ocean have agreed to establish diplomatic relations, the official East German agency& A.D.N., reported today. It said repre sentatives of the two govern mets had signed the diplomatic agreement in Colombo, Ceylon.

title: Brooklyn Automotive Gains P.S.A.L. Novice Track Title
description: Brooklyn Automotive High won its first Public Schools Athletic League novice track and field championship in the 68year history of the meet yes terday at Downing Stadium, Randalls Island.

title: I Am the Music Fountain! Welcome!
description: GRAND HAVEN, Mich.A 250foot long fountain, which blends water, colored lighting and music here, is described by the city fathers as the world's largest electronically controlled musical fountain. No one seems to have disputed the claim.

title: England Soccer Favorite
description: LONDON, May 22 (UPI) Ladbrokes, a leading London bookmaker, quoted England an early 31 favorite today to win the World Cup in soccer in Mexico next month.

title: Movies
description: MOVIES have been a powerful influence in keeping woman in her place. In an in dustry run primarily by men as studio heads, directors, writers and producers  for the amusement of and in the interest of men, an independ ent woman has always beenportrayed on screen as an unattractive crusader, the ca reer girl left on the shelf. Even as early as 1912, in a film called The Suffragette, women were being ridiculed as tough and overbearing.

title: Money, Not Vietnam, Key Issue At a Small College in Nebraska
description: WAHOO, Neb., May 15The unease at John F. Kennedy College is different.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: Champion Keeps Away

title: RUSSIANS WORRY THE ITALIAN NAVY
description: NAPLES, Italy, May 19 The wiry Italian Navy ensign gazed at the azure bay and pointed at the island ahead.

title: Nixon Proposes Pact to Exploit Ocean Floor's Resources for All
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 President Nixon proposed to day that the coastal nations of the world waive their claims to the ocean floors beyond the continental shelf and preserve this vast region as the com mon heritage of mankind.

title: Two American ModernistsWhistler and Weber How They Drew
description: FIFTY YEARS  and a much changed artistic situation  separated James McNeill Whis ler's first important artistic encounter with Europe and that of another American ar tist, Max Weber. Whistler went to Paris in 1855. In the course of his life there and subsequently in England (where he eventually settled), his work was influenced by the major artistic develop ments of the period: the art of Courbet and Manet and,  somewhat later, the radical work of the Impressionists. As a child, Whistler had pre viously traveled in Europe (His father was a civil engin eer who worked for 7 years in St. Petersburg, Russia), but his midcentury journey to Paris marked his final sep aration from the United States. Thereafter, he was to remain a permanent ex patriate, one of the most cel ebrated and cosmopolitan Americans of his time, an ar tist of obvious and impressive talents who found it advisable to conduct his career abroad.

title: Vorster Assails British Ban Qn Springboks'Cricket Tour
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, May 22 (AP)Prime Minister John Vorster of South Africa said at a news conference here to day that he found it unbeliev able that a country like Britain could submit so easily and so willingly to open blackmail by opponents of apartheid.

title: Ages 912: Stories of adventure and adversity
description: Know what happned to good clean fun? In this book, at least, it's alive and well, thanks to Jean Russell Larson's hearty storytelling and the highspirit ed illustrations of Mercer May er.

title: MISS CAPONI'S 141 LEADS BY 2 SHOTS
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., May 23 (UPI)Donna Caponi sank a 210yard fairway wood shot for an eagle today and took a two stroke secondround lead in the $20,000 Bluegrass invitation golf tournament.

title: SENIOR GOLF LISTED BY JERSEY WOMEN
description: The Women's State Golf Com, mittee of New Jersey is start ing its second year. This Asso ciation was farmed to take over the running of the New Jersey. State women's golf champion ship when the Women's New Jersey Golf Association rain, quished the job.

title: Margaret C. Hooker Is Fiancee Of 2d Lieut. Robin L. Taliaferro
description: The engagement of Miss Margaret Cartwright Hooker to Second Lieut. Robin Lee Taliaferro, U.S.A., has been announced by Mrs. Edward Gordon Hooker of New York, mother of the prospective bride. Lieutenant Taliaferro is a son of Mrs. H. Stillman Taylor of Oyster Bay, L. I., and C. Champe Taliaferro of Hobe Sound, Fla., and Oyster Bay.

title: Children's Books
description: An article in the Book Review last season prompted the following let ters between Julius Lester, author, and George Woods, The Times chil dren's book editor.

title: Allergy to Hay and Oats Spells Trouble for a Horse
description: For the longest time, the training of Tioga's Cardigan, a 2yearold facing colt in Jack Bailey's barn at Vernon Downs upstate, was impaired. Hardly a workout was completed with out the standardbred finishing with tearing eyes, a running nose and obviously gasping for breath.

title: Bridal for Miss Sibyl Fulenwider
description: NEW CASTLE, Del., May 23  Miss Sibyl Fulenwider, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. fohn J. B. Fulenwider of Chadds Ford, Pa., was mar ried here today to Christo pher Barry Cohane in the Immanuel Episcopal Church on the Green. The Rev. Myles W. Edwards per formed the ceremony.

title: Beacon Rail Ticket Sales
description: ALBANY, May 23 (AP)The Public Service Commission or dered the Penn Central today to restore weekend ticket sales at its Beason station immedi ately. William McDermott, a Commission Examiner, ruled after an investigation of com plaints that tickets should be sold a the station seven days a week, a least from 8 A.M. to 4 P.M.

title: GARTNER DISPLAYS GUSTY PIANO STYLE
description: Kenneth Gartner is a young junior high school teacher in the New York City school sys tem. He is also a composer, conductor and theatrical pro ducer, and Friday night at Town Hall, he gave what was billed as his Second Annual Piano Recital.

title: A:
description: Teacher RUTH M. GOLDSTEIN, New York, writes that the passage requested by P.S.G. on April 26 is by Martin Buber from the essay The Education of Character in the volume Between Man and Man.

title: Company Teaches Slow Pupils for Profit
description: TEXARKANA, Ark., May 20 Billie Bouland, a ninth grader at the LibertyEylau High School on the Texas side of this borderstraddling town, started the school year last September with the skills in reading and arithmetic expected of a third grader.

title: Alcoa Gets Japanese Competition
description: OKINAWA, May 23  Japan's five aluminum com panies, which had voiced a strong opposition to the Alu minum Company of Ameri ca's proposed move into Okinawa, have agreed among themselves to establish a competitive venture.

title: Memorial Day Race On ClosedCircuit TV
description: The Indianapolis 500 will be carried on closedcircuit television next Saturday to theaters throughout the coun try. It will also be broadcast by a selected list of radio stations.

title: Blackmun Oath June 9
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (Reuters)  Judge Harry A. Blackmun will take his oath as the Supreme Court's ninth Justice and join the Court June 9, Chief Justice Warren E. Burger has announced. The oath will be administered at a special sitting of the Court.

description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. Women Upset By West Germany In Cup Tennis, 21
description: FREIBURG, Germany, May 23The United States was upset by West Germany, 21, in the semifinals of women's Federation Cup tennis tourna ment today. The event is the equivalent of the men's Davis Cup.

title: G. W. Wolf 3d Weds Karen Peterson
description: SHELBURNE, Vt., May 23  Miss Karen McFarland Peterson, a graduate of the University of Vermont, and George Wheeler Wolf 3d, who will begin his senior year there in the fall, were married here today in Trinity Episcopal Church. The cere mony was performed by the Rev. Linwood Smith.

title: Son to the Lewisohns
description: A son was born on May 6 to Mr. and Mrs. Richard Lew isohn 3d at the Lenox Hill Hospital. Mrs. Lewisohn is the former Miss Sandra Kay Saine, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Presley K. Saine of Lin colnton, N. C. The child, who has been named Brandon Kermit, is the grandson also of Mrs. Richard A. Feldon of New York and Richard Lew isohn, the Economic Develop ment Admininstrator of the City of New York. The child's father is vice president in charge of corporate finance at Aibel & Co., Inc., mem bers of the New York Stock Exchange.

title: French Pipeline Sabotaged
description: VIENNE, France, May 23 (Reuters)An explosion cut a gas pipeline near here today. It was the 25th sabotage blast reported in France this month. The damage to the pipeline was repaired quickly.

title: An Incomes Policy Divides Business
description: The business community, although sharing the Govern ment's concern over infla tion, seemed deeply divided last week over the wisdom of using an incomes policy to help speed the return to price stability.

title: KAZAKH CAPITAL FIGHTING FLOODS
description: ALMAATA, U.S.S.R. May 17 This sunny, treegreen capi tal of Soviet Kazakhstan, bor dered by 14,000foot mountains on the south and the arid Cen tral Asian steppe on the north, is struggling to solve the prob lems that man and nature cre ate for it.

title: Gail Warren Thayer Is Bride Of Michael John Candela Jr.
description: RYE, N. Y., May 23 Christ's Episcopal Church was the setting here this afternoon for the marriage of Miss Gail Warren Thayer to Michael John Candela Jr. The ceremony, performed by the Rev. Dr. Wendell Phillips, the rector, was followed by a reception at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Walter N. Thayer, parents of the bride.

title: 8 Negroes Face Runoffs In Alabama on June 2
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., May 23 (AP)At least eight Negro candidates face runoff elections June 2 in Alabama. Four others were nominated May the Demo cratic primary May 5.

title: Susan Catron Bride on L.I.
description: COLD SPRING HARBOR, L. I., May 23,Miss Susan Hendry Catron and Lieut. Alan Maurice Marshall Irv ing, U.S.A., were married here this afternoon in St. John's Episcopal Church by the Rev. Lyman Bleecker, rector emeritus. He was as sisted by the Rev. Carleton Lee, the rector.

title: Sheila Lipson a Bay State Bride
description: ARLINGTON, Mass., May 23Miss Sheila Louise Mc Cord Lipson was married this afternoon to Steven Michael Auerbach of Arlington. George Gordon Whitehouse, a student minister of the Ar lington Street Church, Uni tarianUniversalist, in Boston, performed the ceremony in Menotomy Rocks Park.

description: Mary Connor is a rich 16 yearold with her own checking account, charge accounts, and car. She also marches in peace

title: The subject is the struggle
description: Thanks to The New Yorker, I think, more than to anything else, one can speak of a sort of prototype Irish short story which strikes first as being Irish and only secondly as the work of an individual. Mary Lavin is a frequent contributor to The New Yorker; at least one of the five stories in this slim collection was previously printed there, and her work is richly representative of Ireland. But it is also richly, uniquely, individual.

title: Single Party for the Congo
description: KINSHASA, The Congo, May 23 (Reuters)The Peoples Rev olutionary Movement declared itself the sole political authority today and outlawed all other parties in the former Belgium Congo.

title: Remains of Child Found In Suitcase in the Bronx
description: The remains of what the po lice thought to be a child from 5 to 10 years of age were found early yesterday in a vac ant lot in the Bronx by two passersby.

title: GOLDBERG BACKS WAGEPRICE CURB
description: Arthur J. Goldberg, a candi date for the Democratic nom ination for Governor, declared yesterday that this country faced a galloping recession unless it imposed selective wage, price and credit controls and developed a job program for the unemployed.

title: PICTURE CREDITS
description: 1TIM KANTOR.

title: RELIGIOUS LEADERS PLAN PEACE DRIVE
description: Sixty Protestant, Roman Catholic and Jewish religious leaders have announced the convening of an emergency religious convocation in Wash ington this week to mobilize support to end the war in Indo china.

title: Filipino Senate Unit Finds Country at a Crossroad
description: MANILA, May 23 (AP)A Senate committee has said that deeply serious social ills have generated an upsurge of unrest in the Philippines and have put the nation at a crossroads in its national life.

title: ManEating Tiger Hunted
description: LUCKNOW, India, May 23 (REUTERS)A maneating ti ger, said to have killed persons, is stalking the Almora district in the Himalayan foothills with a price of 2,000 rupees, about $265, on its head.

title: Capital Knee Deep In Mail on Kent and Cambodia
description: WASHINGTON  On an in side corridor of the ground floor of the Executive Office Build ing, next to the White House, there is a big room awash with mail. Two hundred and fifty thousand letters were backed up there the other day, letters to the President of the United States on the issues of Cam bodia and Kent. At least an other 100,000 already had been processed, and about 75,000 more were in the pipeline.

title: Kosygin Links Space Gains To Rise in Peace on Earth
description: MOSCOW, May 23 (UPI) Space cooperation between na tions depends on better rela tions on earth, Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin says.

title: I.T.T. AND INSURER GRANTED MERGER
description: HARTFORD, May 23The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation today received the approval of the Connecticut Insurance Com missioner to acquire the Hart ford Fire Insurance Company for about $1.5billion in stock.

title: Letters: A Visit to Ponza Is Recalled
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: G. M. Developing Device to Test Drunks
description: General Motors is developing a numbers game with an auto motive safety twist.

title: S. E. Mudrick Fiance Of Joan Van Sinderen
description: BEDFORD VILLAGE, N.Y., May 23Mr. and Mrs. Adri an Van Sinderen Jr. have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Joan Van Sinderen, to Stephen Edward Mudrick, son of Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin Mudrick of Silver Spring, Md. The wedding is planned for fall.

title: DR. SIEGMUND MAY, CARDIOLOGIST, DEAD
description: Dr. Siegmund H. May, a spe cialist in internal medicine and cardiology, who had been medi cal director of the Nassau County Patterson Home for the Aged and Infirm in Uniondale since 1964, died Friday here of a heart attack. He was 73 years old and lived at 58 West 56th Street.

title: Cambodian Drive Called Success by U. S. Commanders
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 23Nearly a month after American and South Vietnamese troops began attacking Commu nist sanctuaries inside Cam bodia, allied commanders are describibg the campaign as an outstanding military success.

title: Georgia Walsh Becomes Bride Of Navy Officer
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., May 23  Miss Georgia Walsh, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Fred R. Walsh Jr. of Plandome and granddaugh ter of the late Mr. Walsh, cofounder of Cunningham & Walsh, Inc., the New York advertising agency, was mar ried here this afternoon to Lieut. (jg.) Richard H. Mil ler, U.S.N.R. The bridegroom, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur R. Miller of Falmouth, Mass., is serving with the Disaster Recovery Control Unit of the SeaBees in Davisville, R. I.

title: WNEWTV IS STRUCK BY STUDIO ENGINEERS
description: About 75 studio engineers struck WNEWTV shortly after midnight yesterday morning in a contract dispute with the Metromedia station.

title: May Rain
description: May's rainy weekends can be as dreary to the countryman as to the suburbanite, but there is still a good deal to be said for them. May rain, of course, is most welcome in AprilApril showers, May flowers. But it is least welcome in June and July. So May is the best time to get it and be done with it.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Daylight Saving Time

title: Sykes, Dorsey Sail Victors
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., May 23 James Sykes, sailing Dixie in the Shields Class, and Joseph F. Dorsey, with his Internation al Class sloop, Sheila, were among the winners today as Horseshoe Harbor Yacht Club conducted the first half of its 82d annual regatta. It opened the Yacht Racing Association championship season on Long Island Sound.

title: NIXON AIDE DENIES CHARGE ON TANKER
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 Peter M. Flanigan, an assistant to President Nixon, has formally denied charges that he had intervened with the Treasury Department to gain a special exemption from Federal mari time rules for an oil tanker he once owned.

title: Hirohito and Selassie Dine at Tokyo Palace
description: TOKYO, May 23 (UPI) Two Of the world's longest reigning monarchs, who were enemies in World War II dined together today in the Imperial Palace.

title: Leigh Cross Is Wed To Alan G. McLean
description: WEST ORANGE, N. J., May 23Miss Leigh Douglas Cross and Alan George McLean of New Vernon were married here this afternoon in Holy Innocents Episcopal Church by the Rev. Richard School master.

title: The dark, obverse side of the shining myth
description: As the uprising of blackpower dis sidents against the government of Eric Williams takes place and puz zles outsiders, this deeply forebod ing book on the early years of Trin idad  under the Spanish during the 16th and 17th centuries and the Brit ish at the start of the 19th  be comes all the more revealing. It is history as literature, meticulously researched and masterfully written, as in the manner of Thucydides. So often has the story of the lands of the southein Americas been the en hancement of myth in the name of national glory, that V. S. Naipaul's chronicle is most welcome as a block against sliding back into shallow fan tasy.

title: CHINA IS ADAMANT ON INTELLECTUALS
description: HONG KONG, May 23A policy editorial made public by Peking today emphasized that there would be no easing of the drive to keep millions of intellectuals and officials la boring as peasants and fac tory workers.

title: The revolution that failed, and yet...
description: In the fall of 1967 Henry Resnik, a 27yearold freelance journalist, went to Philadelphia to do a story on an experimental school for sev enth and eighth graders. He found the whole city in a ferment or edu cational reform, and stayed to ob serve and participate in it (briefly as a teacher) for one and a half years. In that period he prowled the city covering as best he could the various manifestations of a reform school administration. This book is the result.

title: 7 West African Nations Plan An Economic Community
description: BAMAKO, Mali, May 23 (Agence FrancePress)  Seven African heads of state signed a protocol here this week agreeing to create a West African Economic Community. The regional grouping is to re place the 10yearold West African Economic and Customs Union, which the seven nations indicated was not satisfac tory.

title: Lucy Page Eshleman Is Bride Of Peter Henry Sprayregen
description: VILLANOVA, PA., May 23 Miss Lucy Page Eshleman, a research assistant with the urban design group of the New York City Planning Com mission, was married here to day to Peter Henry Spray regen, who is with the invest ment banking firm of Bear, Stearns & Co. in New York.

title: Dance: City Troupe's Sweet Integrity
description: It is a lovely thing New York City Ballet. It dances with a sweet and special in tegrity, with the freestyle style of its own. Friday night, continuing its sadly delayed season at the New York State Theater, it of fered a double bill of George Balanchine's Who Cares? and Jerome Robbin's Dances at a Gathering.

title: The Singing Cicadas Are Coming
description: DURING the next few weeks, Brood X of the periodical cicadas will emerge. It is expected in the metropolitan area the first week of June. This is the largest Brood of these 17year cicadas and the area of infestation stretches from New England to Illinois and from Michigan to Georgia.

title: LIMITATIONS SEEN IN CITY RENT PLAN
description: Some City Councilmen and Lindsay administration offi cials are worried that the Mayor's proposals for revising rent control will prove to be confusing and inadequate for some of the landlords who need help the mostthose who each own only one or two small, lowrent buildings.

title: Emily G. Lay To Be a Bride
description: FALLS CHURCH, Va., May 23Miss Emily Graham Lay and Paul Ignatius O'Connell plan to be married in August.

title: Miss Russell Wed To W.F. Green Jr.
description: The marriage of Miss Mar tina Russell to Warren F. Green Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Green of Wolcott, Conn., took place in the chantry of Grace Episcopal Church here yesterday. The Rev. Michael Koonsman performed the ceremony.

title: TV Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Children's Best Sellers
description: 1 CHARLOTTE'S WEB. E. B. White. This charming classic fable has deservedly been a best seller since 1952.

title: Home Improvement
description: MODERN epoxy paints dry to one of the toughest and most chemically  resistant painter can apply. They finishes that the home home painter can apply. They also have exceptional ad hesive power that en ables him (or her) to do an amazingly good job of paint ing over such difficult sur faces as tile, porcelain and plastic laminates  but they are by no means foolproof in application.

title: M'GOVERN PUSHES CONVENTION PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, May 23  Senator George S. McGovern urged today that all the con vention reform proposals draft ed by the commission he heads be written into the official call for the 1972 Democratic Na tional Convention.

title: Sheriff Stonehead And the Teenage Termites
description: By Jerome Beatty Jr. Illustrated by Gene Holton. 220 pp. New York: Young Scott Books. $3.95.

title: Ten About Japan
description: Ever since Expo '70 began being bruited about, books on Japan have appeared like pollen in the air, and like pollen a number of them merely irritate the nose or redden the eyes.Those geared to the young, however, turn out on the whole to be careful, welcome introductions to a subject which so far hasn't diminished in in terest for us over here.

title: Amex and Counter Prices Fall Again
description: Prices continued to decline last week on the American Stock Exchange and on the overthecounter market in comparatively quiet trading.

title: SCIENTISTS DEBATE ROOT OF VIOLENCE
description: PARIS, May 23  People act violently because they have been taught to do so or made to do so, not because they were horn aggressive, according to an international meeting of re searchers that ended here to day.

title: I Never Loved Your Mind
description: How do you reach the teen ager? Somehow, whatever you try to do seems wrong. Should you talk up to him? Down to him? Or across to him? Should you use your own idiom or should you (like) coopt his? Should you sink to his taste levels or try to get him to rise up to yours? Should you try to slip a chunky adult value or two into his peanut butter spread? Or place a pen cilpoint blackhead or pock mark on your own face values to make them seem more palp ably familiar and acceptable to him?

title: 21 Tennis Pros Compete In St. Louis This Week
description: ST. LOUIS, May 23 (AP) Ron Holmberg of Brooklyn and Andres Gimeno of Spain have entered the $30,000 St. Louis Tennis Classic, bringing the en roliment to 21 professionals. It will be held Wednesday through next Sunday.

title: Fritz Pollard: Pioneer Pro Black Coach
description: When Allan Webb was named head coach of the Long Island Bulls football team a few weeks ago, some body could have spared him the embarrassment of being a first if they had remembered Frederick D. (Fritz) Pollard.

title: College Head Says He Quit Over Dispute With Bowker
description: Murray H. Block, who re signed last Monday as presi dent of Manhattan Community College, said he did so because he disagreed with the decision of Chancellor Albert H. Bow ker of the City University to keep the college open after a series of student demonstra tions.

title: Warren Heads U.N. Group
description: Former Chief Justice Earl Warren has been elected chair man of the United Nations As sociation, which held its bien nial convention yesterday at the Commodore Hotel. Mr. Warren succeeded Arthur J. Goldberg, who resigned because of his candidacy for the Democratic nomination for Governor of New York.

title: Andrew Lockhart Jr. to Wed Susan B. Shepardson Aug. 29
description: LLOYD HARBOR, L. I., May 23Miss Susan Barret Shep ardson and Andrew Alex ander Lockhart Jr., son of Mrs. Lockhart of Harrow, England, and the late Mr. Lockhart of London, will be married Aug. 29 in Cold Spring Harbor.

title: YOUTHS PROTEST IN SOUTH AFRICA
description: CAPETOWN, May 23In the latest of a newborn series of protests by students in South Africa, hundreds of students in Durban began a doorstep ping campaign this week by calling on houses in the city to seek support for the right of nonviolent protest.

title: ARMY 138 VICTOR IN LACROSSE PLAY
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., May 23 Army's lacrosse team sharpened its sticks today for next week end's clash with Navy by dispos ing of the Mount Washington Club, 138, in Michie Stadium.

title: Report from Wasteland
description: In late 1945 a substantial number of us who had worked on the devel opment of the atomic bomb lobbied intensively against a proposed piece of Federal legislation known as the MayJohnson Bill. Had the bill become law, the military would have been given virtually complete control over United States nuclear programs. Those of us who opposed the bill were fighting for civilian control.

title: Editorial Cartoon 1  No Title
Ridley of Ontario Eight Keeps National School Title
description: PRINCETON, N. J., May 23 Ridley College High School of Ontario, Canada, defeated four high school crews from the United States today to defend its senior eighoared title in the finals of the 36th annual Na tional Schoolboy Rowing Re gatta here.

title: 7 SENATORS URGE PLANES FOR ISRAEL
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 Seven leading Senate opponents of the war in Indochina assured the Nixon Administration today of their support for a policy of American firmness against the ominous and provocative Soviet thrust against Israel.

title: MORSE URGES STRESS ON LIVING STANDARDS
description: GENEVA, May 23David A. Morse, in a farewell report as Director General of the Inter national Labor Organization, has urged the developing coun tries to give priority to improv ing standards of living.

title: Churches Get Banjo Player
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind. (AP) J. A. Hoots, 89 years old, used to play his banjo in saloons, now sings church songs and plays the banjo at various churches in this area.

title: Zambia Plans Steel Plant
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, May 23  companies are among the international concerns that will be invited to bid on construction of $56million iron and steel plant in Zambia.

title: The Second Sex, Junior Division
