description: We live in a sexist society. Almost from birth we are indoctrinated with the notion of male superiority and female inferiority, male rights and female duties. It is in the earliest years that children form images of their worth, their future roles, the conscious and unconscious expecta tions placed upon them. Investigating books for young children in book stores and libraries I found an almost incredible conspiracy of conditioning. Boys' achievement drive is encour aged; girls is cut off. Boys are brought up to express themselves; girls to please. The general image of the female ranges from dull to de grading to invisible.

title: Baseball Negotiator Reports Tentative Pact
description: Marvin Miller, executive director of the Baseball Play ers' Association, said last night that a preliminary set tlement on a new contract had been reached between players and owners.

title: 19 Airlines Report Net Loss Of $58Million for 3 Months
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (AP) Nineteen scheduled airlines have reported an aggregate net loss of $58million in the first three months of 1970, accord ing to the Air Transport Asso ciation.

title: TUSCALEE TAKES FAIR HILL CHASE
description: FAIR HILL, Md., May 23 (AP)Tuscalee, a 10yearold gelding, won the $3,000 added National Steeplechase at Fair Hill today and moved to within one victory of tying Elkridge as the top steeplechase winner.

title: WRY POLISH HUMOR SPICES DAILY LIFE
description: SZCZECIN, Poland, May 15 To buy a bicycle in this Polish port city is a task re quiring considerable imagina tionespecially since the sign On the door of the main bicycle shop declares: Closed until we open.

title: RIGHTIST DRAWS IRE OF SWISS WRITERS
description: GENEVA, May 23Twenty one wellknown Swiss writers, including Friedrich Dtirrenmatt, one of Europe's leading play wrights, have resigned from the Swiss Society of Authors with a biter attack on the so cietv's rightwing president, Maurice Zermatten.

title: U.S. Business:
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 23 About three years ago Phila delphia's managing director, Fred T. Corleto, who is also an automobile dealer, dis cussed a business problem with Paul d'Ortona, presi dent of the City Council.

title: In Brief: Students
description: The treacheries of nostalgia have never been more evident than in E. J. Kahn's fulllength report on the state of Harvard today. It is not that Mr. Kahn, tripling his roles as alumnus, Harvard parent and reporter, has given us a whitewash; its that the report is soft around the edgescomplacent when it should have been biting, charm ing when it should have been inquiring.

title: AMERICAN EAGLE IS FIRST TO FINISH
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., May 23 American Eagle, the convert ed 12meteryacht, was first to finish in the annual 125mile event of The Larchmont Yacht Club today, and added two prizes to Ted Turner's fabulous collection. The prizes were the Black Watch Bowl and the Nyala trophies. Both went to the young Atlantan because his Eagle was fastest around the course for the second successive year.

title: Italians Apprehensive Over New Labor Troubles After Week of Work Stoppages and Violence
description: ROME, May 23  The large oak doors of the old convent in the Piazza San Silvestra that is Rome's central post office were closed, and a sign said that the public employes' strike had been extended for another day.

title: Suburban Bridal For Miss Prial And T.A. Petrie
description: GREENWICH, Conn., May 23  Miss Marguerite Ann Prial and Thomas Albert Pe trie were married here this afternoon in St. Agnes Ro man Catholic Church by the Rev. Thomas P. Guinan. The bride is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Frank Joseph Prial 2d of Manchester, Vt. The bridegroom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Paul John Petrie of Manhasset, L. I.

title: LAIRD ADVOCATES RELIGIOUS VALUES
description: CHICAGO, May 23Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird told 500 Presbyterians this morning that Christianity demanded that men in public office be dual servants of both God and of the people.

title: STATE COMPUTERS TO AID SENTENCING
description: Computer screens in each hearing room will summon a motorist's driving record into view before a hearing examiner of the New York State Depart ment of Motor Vehicles decides the penalty for a moving vio lation under the new procedure effective July 1 in New York City. But, in fairness to the person on trial, not until atter the facts of the immediate case have been determined.

title: From threetoed Glisson Glop to sixeyed Galaplop
description: They were probably there before the storytellersthose creatures unnaturally marvel ous of strange and terrifying shapeeerie perhaps, frighten ing or just irregular. Someyears ago, their place in pic ture books was most satisfy ingly reaffirmed with the ap pearance of Maurice Sendak's Where the Wild Things Are. Since then, they have been presented with increasing fre quency on each season's book scene. Some few fascinate but most fall painfully short of that mark. I was quite taken with the fantastic inhabitants of Wil liam Steig's The Bad Island. And Harve and Margot Ze mach's horrible thing in The Judge catered to a primitive sense of humor that delights in Itoldyouso's.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: OFFICE leases in new Manhattan buildings took a sharp dip last month as the 1970 market continued to soften.

title: Exit a Speaker: How Much Will It Mean?
description: WASHINGTON  Today the fullest power lies in the personal influence of the occupant of the Speakership. It is relied upon far more than a legitimate share of authority. To maintain personal influence, the Speaker is forced to engage in a savage political scramble involving sec tional interests, local claims and personal advancements, all of which are more fondly regarded by the inner circle of the House than party loyalties or vital na tional issues.

title: N.F.L. Coaches Huddle Here Today
description: The 26 head coaches of the National Football League assemble here today for a twoday meeting and they are to be followed by the owners whose conclave begins tuesaay ana runs through Thursday. The es tablishment will come to gether, resplendent in din ner jackets, to morrow night at the annual din ner of the New York Chapter of the Pro Football Writers Association in the Americana Hotel. The live subjects for meetings are few and the theme might well be business as usual despite the sagging economy, the source of gate receipts and television income, and turmoil on the campuses, the source of the players.

title: KLASSY POPPY, $4.40, SUFFOLK TURF VICTOR
description: BOSTON, May 23 (AP)Har ry Minassian's Klassy Poppy outraced her seven rivals in the stretch and won the $20,000 John R. Macomber Memorial Handicap today at Suffolk Downs.

title: U.S. Cardinal Sees Pope
description: ROME, May 23 (Reuters) Pope Paul VI gave a private audience today to John Cardinal Carberry, Archbishop of St. ouis.

title: Ages 912...
description: Thank you Lord for sending the Garber family this Great DoGooder, Winifred. Now that she's discovered us, she's going to save us, Lord. All by her self

title: Two Drivers Escape Serious Injury in Crash in North Carolina Race
Hall Johnson, 18881970
description: HALL JOHNSON was a unique genius. For al though he invented no new harmonies, designed no new forms, orig inated no new melodic styles, discovered no new rhythmic principles, he was yet able to fashion a whole new world of music in his own image.

title: Bryon, Skipper of Impulse, Takes Soling Class Honors
description: GREENWICH, Conn., May 23 Benjamin H. Bryon Jr. won with Impulse in his debut in the Soling Class today off Indian Harbor Yacht Club in the Yacht Racing Association championship regatta for fleets based east of Rye.

title: Late Listings for Today's TV and Radio
description: The following information about today's television and radio programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: Montreal's Olympic Bid a Shrewd Ploy
description: MONTREAL, May 23To the surprise of much of the world, the 1976 Summer Olympic Games have been awarded to this enthusiastic Canadian me tropolis.

title: THE OPENINGS
description: CHICAGO 70  Tomorrow, Martinique, 7. The Toronto Workshop Company in a topical play.

title: Andretti Seeking 2d Indy 500 Victory
description: All around Indianapolis there are STP posters showing Mario Andretti receiving that sloppy victory kiss from Andy Grana telli at the end of last year's Indianapolis 500. The caption is brief and to the point: ONE MORE TIME!

title: U.S. Back Goes to Canada
description: EDMONTON, Alberta, May 22 (AP)Rusty Clark, a quarter back from the University of Houston, signed today with the Edmonton Eskimos of the Cana dian Football League.

title: Elliott Has Everything
description: WHO'S afraid of sex? Not Elliott Gould and Jack Brodsky. Just last week they vowed that their production company would join Para mount Pictures in a fearless effort to film Dr. David Reu ben's scientific sizzler, Everything You Always Wanted to Know About SexBut Were Afraid to Ask.

title: Cara Wells Is Wed To Briggs Twyman
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR, N. J., May 23Miss Cara Joanne Brogan Wells, daughter of Mrs. William Howell Wells and the adopted daughter of Mr. Wells, was married here this afternoon to Briggs Leon Twyman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph William Twyman of Overland Park, Kan. The Rev. John C. Owens per formed the Episcopal cere mony at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Wells.

title: Federal Court Orders Denver To Integrate Minority Schools
description: DENVER, May 23A Federal judge has ruled that the Denver school system must desegregate 15 minority schools by 1972 and make changes at two others.

title: Students Help Workers in Coast Strike
description: CITY OF COMMERCE, Calif., May 20Radical leftists have long talked about a worker student alliance, but here in this industrial suburb of Los Angeles their talk is slowly turning into action.

title: Walking Through Masterpieces In Low Countries
description: AMSTERDAM, the NetherlandsThe easy way to travel, is to keep a list of museums In your pocket, crossing them off as you finish each visit. But the traveler who does no more than that is sure to return home dissatisfied.

title: 15 More Are Arrested In Rahway Disorders
description: RAHWAY, N. J., May 23 (AP)  Fifteen persons, including four juveniles, were arrested here on curfew violation and other charges related to spo radic disorders, the latest of which ended early today after the third consecutive nigtt of trouble in this Union County community.

title: Blue Hill Resumes
description: Construction resumed last week on Blue Hill, the $100 million office development in Rockland County that was stalled for nine months by the lack of sufficient con structionstage financing.

title: CLEAR ASPIC
description: 3 cups chicken broth 1 cup tomato juice 4 envelopes unflavored gelatin Salt and freshly ground black pepper 1 teaspoon sugar 2 egg shells, crushed 2 egg whites, lightly beaten 2 tablespoons cognac.

title: Nixon and Congress: Collision Course on Cambodia
description: WASHINGTON  As so often happens when Congress and the executive branch are headed for one of those irreconcilable con stitutional confrontations, both sides began to back down last week over the issue of whether the President or the Congress has the power to commit the nation to war in Cambodia.

title: Singleton Snaps Two Records In Hurdles at Schoolboy Meet
description: SCHENECTADY, N.Y., May 23Fred Singleton of Mount Vernon High School emerged to day as one of the nation's finest scholastic hurdlers as he won twice in the William F. Eddy Jr. Memorial track games at the Mount Pleasant High School all weather track.

title: Boys on the run
description: These seven books vary widely in quality and in style, in depth and subtlety. Three, at best, can only be described as lightweight entertainment. One is a rather ponderous fan tasy. Three others achieve a roundness, a fullness; they have dimensions.

title: A Young Militant's Path to Prison
description: Back in the heyday of the civil rights movement, when 11yearold Ben Chaney Jr. stood tall in the shabby, back water churches of Mississippi and told Uncle Tom preach ers to stand up and be counted and not to be afraid.

title: Speedy Qualifiers Threaten Record For the Indy 500
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 23 A recordsmashing field for the 54th 500mile auto race next Saturday at the Indiana polis Motor Speedway was filled today, subject to one more 6hour session of 10 mile qualifying runs tomor row.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Striped bass are being caught in New York and New England waters from the Hudson River to Maine.

title: British Elections AreWell, Rather British
description: LONDONAll those who have suffered through the endless Months of an American Presi dential electionthe primaries, the conventions, the campaign must look with envy on the brevity of a British general elec tion By statute, the election oc curs just 17 days, plus Sundays and bank holidays, after Parlia ment is dissolved at the Prime Minister's request.

title: Bentley President Named
description: WALTHAM, Mass., May 23 (AP)Dr. Gregory H. Adami an, chairman of the Depart ment of Law, has been elect ed president pro tem of Bently College. He succeeds Thomas L. Morison, president for nine years, who asked to be re lieved of his duties.

title: ROME IS VICTOR IN DEVON JUMPING
description: DEVON, Pa., May 23Even when he isn't on the premises, Rod Jenkins has a hold on a horse show.

title: U.S. Mail Service
description: Carl H. Scheele, associate curator of he Smith sonian Institution, Washington, who directs that repository's Division of Philately and Postal History, has produced a concise, fac tual and interestingtoread book on the mails. Entitled A Short History of the Mail Serv ice, it is not given over to the stamps that have been is sued, but to the development of mail services, primarily in the United States.

title: Savings Gain At Thrift Units
description: Savings deposits at the na tion's savings and loan as socitions rose for the second consecutive month in April, the United States Savings and Loan League reports.

title: McMillan Captures Final In English Grass Tennis
description: WOLVERHAMPTON, England, May 23 (UPI)Topseeded Frew McMillan of South Africa over came Hank Irvine of Rhodesia, 64, 46, 64, in the final of the Biostrath grasscourt tennis tournament today.

title: Foreign Affairs: NATO Does as the Romans Do
description: PARIS  As its ministers gather in Rome for their an nual spring conclave, NATO finds itself in a condition simi lar to that of the New York stock market. Both proclaim they are not engulfed by de pression but few people are wholly convinced.

title: Humm, Wise, Cox and Edwards Reach Semifinals in Travis Golf
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., May 23 Johnny Humm, who won the Walter. J. Travis Invitation golf tournament in 1950 and twice thereafter, had his short game working perfectly today as he moved through the first and quarterfinal rounds of the 59th annual matchplay amateur event.

title: Koegel, Ham Elected By Penn State Eleven
description: Warren Koegel, formerly of Seaford, L. I., and now living in Glasco, N.Y., and Jack Ham of Johnstown, Pa., have been elected cocaptains of Penn State's football squad for the 1970 season.

title: Swedes Protest U.S. Envoy
description: OREBRO, Sweden, May 23 (Reuters)  Young demonstra tors today hurled eggs at the car of the United States Am bassador, Jerome H. Holland, during his visit to the nearby village of Glanshammar. Ten youths were arrested after the eggs spattered against the car. The ambassador was not hit.

title: Record Cup Spectator Fleet Likely
description: Coast Guard officials are pre paring to ride herd on a record fleet of pleasure boats at this year's America's Cup match.

title: Festival Hits? Bunuel and Bergman
description: Cannes, France. THE Carlton Hotel, the seat of the annual Can nes Film Festival, is no longer the elegant pa lace it was when people like Scott Fitzgerald and Michael Arlen stopped here with their wives and children and the children's nannies. During the film festival at least, a certain sense of form gets lost. The Carlton is old but not ancient. Loafshaped and off white, it looks like a huge abandoned wedding cake, something that has been sit ting too long in the baker's window. The other night in the main dining room, which has the air of lost empire and lost tea dansants, a young, beardless waiter stared with fascination at the round head of frizzy, hippie hair on a British rock performer. The waiter simply could not re sist the temptation. Without warning he walked over and ran his fingers through the extraordinary coiffure. The musicians and the other din ers were startled but not re ally surprised. It was at that time during the festival when one was ready to believe al most anything, including the terrifying rumor that The Strawberry Statement, a serious script about youthful revolution directed with all of the nitwit devices usually found in a hairspray com mercial, was the oddson favorite to win the Palm d'Or. (As it turned out, the first prize went to M*A*S*H, which is as it should have been, considering the mostly ordinary films that were in competition.)

title: EXCONVICT SEEKS PRISON REFORMS
description: The City and State Correc tion Departments made bids for Federal funds to run their prisons yesterday, but a spokes man for former convicts said the important problem was change of attitude and em phasis on rehabilitation.

title: Grab'tz Is a Good Fit Anywhere
description: LOS ANGELES, May 23The first Dodger to wear uniform No. 1 since Pee Wee Reese retired is becoming Numero Uno with Los Angeles fans.

title: The Rosenberg Case:
description: ABOUT halfway through a per formance of Inquest, the play about the Rosenberg case that arrived on Broadway a few weeks ago, it occurred to me that I was at moments being moved, but never for a moment convinced. An uncomfortable feeling, with its sug gestion that one is being worked on rather than communicated with, yet appropriate to the play's subject.

title: Athletes should never grow old
description: Every now and then there appears a book that makes one want to shake its author until his teeth rattle. William Wet more's Here Comes Jamie is just such a book.

title: Joyce Carlton Becomes Bride
description: SPRINGFIELD, Pa., May 23 Miss Joyce Ann Carlton was married here today to Lieut. Douglas Welzin John son, U.S.A., in the Covenant Methodist Church. The Rev. Harvey Marsland performed the ceremony. Mr. and Mrs. Miles N. Carlton of Spring field are the bride's parents: Her father is a planning su pervisor for the Bell Tele phone Company of Pennsyl vania. The bridegroom's pa rents are Mr. and Mrs. Herbert C. Johnson of Don gan Hills, Staten Island, New York. His father is president of Consolidated Natural Gas Company in New York.

title: RAFFERTY VIEWED AS COAST WINNER
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 23 Dr. Max Rafferty, a conserva tive, appears to be well on his way toward reelection as Cali fornia's Superintendent of Pub lic Instruction. He is heavily favored to defeat a Negro and a MexicanAmerican, his chief rivals for the post, in a primary election June 2.

title: A Cash Cushion Found In Junked Chair on L.I.
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. L, May 23 (AP)A garbage col lector refused this week to pick up a battered old chair Mildred Occhipinti was throwing out unless she first broke it up.

title: Brandeis Building Is Center for Student Strike Data
description: WALTHAM, Mass.  In the montage of student activism that papers the walls of a small building on the green, sloping campus of Brandeis University, the photograph of a darkhaired girl screamng above the body of a Kent State student is taped next to a computerarawing or Snoopy, the insouciant beagle.

title: 40 Are Hurt in Collapse Of Bleachers at Ann Arbor
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., May 23 (AP)  At least 40 spectators were injured today when bleachers collapsed at a high school track meet on the cam pus of the University of Michi gan.

title: Giulio's complaint was incurable
description: Giulio is a Roman bachelor, nearly 40, a successful lawyer with a posh apartment com plete with manservant, and a slew of sleek, expensive wom en at his disposal. Ivana is 17, a student of shorthand and typing, decidedly on the meaty side with large hips and bust to match. Her conversation is, at best, sluggish, her attitude sullen, her polish and taste nil. She lives with her parents in a situation somewhere back in a time where girls are courted in the presence of chaperones, and heavily corseted to pre vent intimacy should a chap erome ever be outwitted by the current suitor. Ivana is La Rambolona, the great big doll of the title.

title: Point of View
description: AYEAR ago the New York City Council enacted legislation that had the avowed purpose of prevent ing oppressive rent increases in noncontrolled housing dur ing a tight rental market. In this act, the Rent Stabiliza tion Law, a, littlediscussed provision opened wide the path to the conversion of rental buildings to coopera tives.

title: Health
description: WASHINGTONIn recent years, medical science has made great strides in sav ing the victims of heart at tack. But in general, the heart sufferer can only ben efit from those advances if he lives long enough to reach a hospital.

title: Villanova Sets 4Mile Relay Mark in Coast Meet
description: MODESTO, Calif., May 23 (UPI)  Marty Liquori, the world's top current miler moved past John Mason 400 yards from home today to give Villa nova an easy victory over the Pacific Coast Club in the four mile relay and launch the Cal ifornia relays in fine style.

title: Calendar of Motor Sports Events
description: May 30Suburban Sports Car Club 40mile rally; start at Acme Market rear parking lot, junction of Passaic and Bloomfield Ave nues, West Caldwell, N. J. Regis tration: 7 P.M., first car off 8:01. Information: Myril Woodward, phone (201)9940668 after 6 P.M.

title: INDIAN PORTRAITS DRAW $251,500 HERE
description: A rare collection of Ameri can Indian portraits, most of them of tribal chiefs who played historic roles during the advance of the white settlers into their territories, was auc tioned on Thursday evening for $251,500.

title: ANTIWAR YOUTHS IMPRESS SENATOR
description: WASHINGTON, May 23  Senator William B. Spong Jr. sat patiently at the head of a long table the other day as stu dents poured into the small conference room of the Senate Agriculture Committee.

title: Federal Outlays in '69 Totaled $918 a Person
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (AP)Federal outlays totaled $918 for every man, woman and child last year after more than doubling since 1950 in real dollar terms, a private research organization reports.

title: MERGER ANNOUNCED FOR BALLET GROUPS
description: The Harkness Ballet, formed in 1964, and the yearold Hark ness Youth Dancers have merged, according to the Re bekah Harkness Foundation.

title: Doctors Prescribing Drug Without F.D.A. Approval
description: Many American physicians are prescribing as standard practice a toxic, anticancer drug to treat severe cases of a noncancerous and rarely fatal skin ailment, psoriasis, though the Food and Drug Administra tion had not approved the medicine for such use.

title: Norris Forman Jr. Weds Linda Harley
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L.I, May 23Miss Linda Anne Harley, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John James Harley of Port Washington and Point Lookout, was married at noon today to H. Norris Forman Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Harry N. Forman of Manhasset. The ceremony was performed in St. Peter of Alcantara Roman Catholic Church by Msgr. James King of the Diocese of Brooklyn.

title: Five men above the crowd
description: These initial volumes in the Crowell Biographies Series, (Thomas Y. Crowell, $3.75 each) aimed at children from 7 to 10, focus on minority group heroes. They fill a critical gap in hero literature. For non white readers, they provide a recognizable view of the prob lems and frustrations faced by young men growing up in urban and rural poverty. And they enable the advantaged middle class child to move into a world no less strange to him than the prettified surburban milieu is to the slum dweller.

title: SIHANOUK VIEWED AS ASSET FOR MAO
description: WASHINGTON, May 23A highly profitable political part nership appears to have bloomed in Peking over the last two months between Mao Tsetung, Chairman of the Chi nese Communist Party, and Prince Norodom Sihanouk, who was ousted as Cambodia's Chief of State last March 18.

title: Chichester Theater Mounts Bolt Play About Elizabeth
description: CHICHESTER, England, May 21Ten years after A Man for All Seasons, Robert Bolt returns to Tudor history with Vivat! Vivat Regina! Open ing at the Chichester Festival Theater, it is a study of Eliza beth and Mary Queen of Scots, projected with the full cere monial flourish the British re serve for national idols.

title: CITY SCHOOL HEAD ASKS $605MILLION FOR CONSTRUCTION
Picture Books
description: There seems to be a growing schism of some importance in the picturebook field. On one hand, the picture book set gets more sophisticated every year, with books like Eugene Jones co's STORY NUMBER 2 for Children Under 3YearsofAge, pictures by Etienne Delessert, (Harlin Quist, $3.95). On the other, there is a trend towards simplemindedness and banality, as if a wary hesitation to enter tain the radical innovation sig nalled by Ionesco had pushed publishers back into the Run Spot Run category. There is also, as always, the irritating problem of sensitive texts and insensitive pictures, or vice versa, unfortunate tandems causing at least one body in the partnership to suffer. And there is the additional compli cation of exhausted conven tions. Must so many children's books draw so relentlesly on a kind of coy childlike innocence that is an insult to any self respecting age group?

title: Blacks In South See Reprise Of Violent Past
description: NEW ORLEANS  A recent incident in New Orleans illu strated with comic precision the direction that the theory of rising expectations is taking among black Southerners.

title: About the Beatles
TERRY AND M'GHEE SINGING FOLK BLUES
description: Sonny Terry and Brownie McGhee, perhaps the greatest living exponents of black folk blues, are playing through to morrow at the Gaslight Cafe, 116 Macdougal Street.

title: Peru Is Attempting to Improve Her Image Abroad
description: LIMA, Peru, May 23 (AP) Peru's military Government has become concerned about its image abroad. The Foreign Minister, Edgardo Mercado, says measures are being prepared to halt the attack on Peru.

title: An Anniversary For Iris Society
description: SELECTED GARDENS in taten Island, on the nrth shore of Long Island, in Westchester County, New Jersey and Connecticut are being carefully groomed for a four day birthday party from Friday to June 2 mark ing the Golden Anniversary of the American Iris Society. neaaquarters for the Jubilee Convention is the StatlerHil ton Hotel in New York.

title: Police in Crete Order Hippies to Leave Caves
description: CANDIA, Crete, May 23 (Reuters)The Greek Gov ernment has ordered a col ony of hippies living in prim itive caves in Matala, Crete, to evacuate the area by May 31, a police spokesman said.

title: Criminals At Large
description: These are years of license and violent protestand the ad vance of the fearful concept that, after all, the end does justify the means. So I can eas ily understandwithout com mending his raison d'trethe protagonist in Ken Jackson's THE CUTTING EDGE (Simon & Schuster, $4.95). F.B.I. agent Jud Blade was forced to watch, helplessly, the rapeslaughter of his wife. The guilty were never caught. Blade, now resigned from the Bureau, has set him self to avenge and avenge again his wife's death by personally nailing the perpetrators of sim ilar crimes across the country. Now he's at a club in Okla homa where the shattered body of a young woman has been found. His role is ambiguous, his acceptance much less than complete. Yet, before this fast paced novel ends, Blade has bared much ugly corruption of spirit in the course of exposing a killer. This is not a pretty story, but it's one of force and insight.

title: Williams Steps Up Opposition to War Policies as Vietnam Becomes a Dominant Issue in Jersey Race
description: TRENTON, May 23With the war in Vietnam one of the dom inant Issues in New Jersey's Senatorial primary election, Senator Harrison A. Williams, a democrat, has spoken out more and more in opposition to the United States military in volvement in Indochina.

title: Governor Signs Bill Mandating Overhaul of Assessment System
description: ALBANY, N. Y., May 23 (AP) Governor Rockefeller signed a bill his week designed to as sure homeowners of fair prop erty taxes by overhauling the present system for determining assessments in the state.

title: Stars Get Leafs' Oliver
description: TORONTO, May 23 (AP)  The Toronto Maple Leafs of the National Hockey League traded Murray Oliver, a center, to the Minnesota North Stars today. The trade was for future con siderations, but no details were released.

title: TOWN WINS FIGHT OVER PLANT ODOR
description: SELBYVILLE, Del., May 21 As long as they're down there stinking, this town is dead, Mayor Carl Lekeites said today as he gestured to ward the Maryland border just down the road.

title: Old English Sheepdog Named Best in Show at Monmouth County Club Fixture
Sports Fishing Ban At Michigan Lake Ends After 5 Weeks
description: LANSING, Mich., May 23 Gov. William G. Milliken has lifted a fiveweek ban on sports fishing in Lake St. Clair; effec tive May 30, but only a catch and release basis.

title: DR. OSCAR WINTHER, HISTORIANAUTHOR
description: BLOOMINGTON, Ind., May 23Dr. Oscar Osburn Winther, historian and author, who was university professor of history at Indiana University since 1965, died last night. He was 66 years old.

title: Enchanted Objects
description: GEORGES VANTONG ERLOO once wrote: A work of art un veils the state of the author's soul. Whether the motive of the creation is nature, a philosophical or poetic idea, it is the expres sion that counts. The subject never participates in the ar tistic value of a work. I be lieve this to be true. But is it the whole truth? Are there no significant forms of the ar tistic imagination that lie beyondeven the tiniest bit beyondthe reach of this truth? I sometimes wonder, and never more so than when looking at the art of Joan Mir.

title: Cab Drivers Oppose Survey
description: BUENOS AIRES, (AP)Taxi cab drivers here staged ear splitting horn demonstrations against a proposed city study that would require them to rec ord names and destinations of all passengers for three days. The ciity says the study is for transport planning; the cabbies contend that it is for spying on them.

title: Estimate Board Plans Hearings On Regaining Transit Control
description: Top city officials have agreed on a plan to stir up public sup port for the city's regaining control of its public transit sys tem from the state.

title: Sports Today
description: AUTO RACING

title: PORTUGAL AND SPAIN RENEW IBERIAN PACT
description: MADRID, May 23Premier Marcelo Caetano wound up a fourday visit to Spain today by signing an agreement to ex pand the scope of the Iberian pact, which was signed in 1939 and extended in 1940.

title: Stranger in a Brutal Paradise: On the Trail of the Cheetahs
description: WHAT animals do you hope to see today? G. G. Mbuyanda, our Kikuyu driver, asked my wife and me as he guided the Toyota across the vast, potterycolored plains of the Masai Amboseli Reserve in southern Kenya. Cats, we answered, we wanted to see cats. Perhaps a maned lion striding imperiously through the low grass, or a leopard crouched in a tree at the foot of Kilimanjaro, that movieset mountain now gleaming above us.

title: Report Card On Sesame Street
description: FROM Watts to Westchester County, one recent Monday morning, preschoolers were watching a Batman cartoon on television. Batman and Robin were up in a tall building watching a crook over in the next building through open windows in their room and his. The problem perplexing the dynamic duo was how to get around the thugs who were guarding the crook's hideout. Readers of The Gotham City Times Magazine can presumably picture this scene be cause of our familiarity with the re lational concepts up, through and around. But preschoolers often do not understand these terms un less they can see them demonstrated which is exactly what the Caped Crusader and Boy Wonder did next:

title: Mitchell Aide Flies to Jackson At Night to Avert a New Clash
description: JACKSON, Miss., May 23  A dangerous new confrontation between the Mississippi police and students at Jackson State College was averted today when a high official of the Nixon Administration flew to Jackson from Washington in the middle of the night to calm both sides.

title: For G.I., It's War as Usual in Cambodia
description: QUANLOI, South Vietnam Most of the G.I.'s went into Cambodia without say ing anything. Like all the combat assaults they had been on before, when muscles knot, throats dry and stom achs seem to go berserk, this assaultinto another coun trywas greeted mostly with silence.

title: Just Morgan
description: There's lots of fast, fresh, often very funny dialogue in this book. Its characters, both teenage and adult, are inter esting, individual and hip. Its

title: Mashpee's Bittersweet Birthday
description: MASHPEE, Mass.The Indians of this Cape Cod community will celebrate its 100th anniversary as an independent, selfgovern ing town this summer, but they complain that the trail to the centennial observ ance has been a rough one.

title: BOGUS SECURITIES BELIEVED ON RISE
description: As assistant district attorney predicted here last week that the counterfeiting of financial securities would increase be cause counterfeiters could now turn out very good bogus bonds with modern photooff set equipment worth only a few thousand dollars.

title: CITY SCORES CON ED ON RATE RISE PLEA
description: The city's Law Department and Housing Authority, in a joint brief filed with the Public Service Commission last week, attacked Consolidated Edison's request for electricity rate in creases to yield about $117.5 million a year as excessive and unreasonable on the basis of the utility's own testi mony.

title: OREGON TO SETTLE VOTING AGE ISSUE
description: PORTLAND, Ore., May 23 Oregon voters will decide Tues day whether to lower the vot ing age to 19 years, a measure whose future has been clouded by three weeks of turmoil on the state's college campuses.

title: Central AfricanAlbania Tie
description: BANGUI, Central African Re public, May 23 (Agence France Presse)This former French colony has established diploma tic relations with Albania at embassey level, the Foreign Ministry announced here yester day.

title: The Week in Finance:
description: WALL STREET looked vainly to Wash ington again last week for some con structive news to help restore public con fidence and stern the steep slide in the wobbling financial markets.

title: Television
description: IN a time of national divi sion the practice of au tomatically according the President such free tele vision time as he asks clearly needs careful review. Since the President is Commander in Chief of the country's armed forces and the nation's duly elected leader, there is no question of television's obligation to carry his speeches and major deci sions.

title: Yugoslav War Toll Still High
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, May 23 (AP)About 600 Yugoslavs are still killed each year by ac cidental explosions of World War II bombs and land mines, according to official statistics.

title: The Merchant's View:
description: What ails the economy to day? Economists have lengthy answers that deal with inflation, high interest rates, and the unbalanced budgets. Retailers, however, hold that it is the lack of confidence on the part of consumers that has caused the lag in buying. They point out that it is fear of un employment, rather than ac tual unemployment that tends to make the public hold back in buying the socalled dis cretionary item.

title: Lorna Grand Wed to William Stengel
description: GREENWICH Conn., may 23Christ Episcopal Church was the setting here this afternoon for the marriage of Miss Lorna Grand to Wil liam Pepper Stengel, who has completed his senior year at Princeton and been accepted at the Columbia University Graduate School of Business. The bride is a daughter of Gordon Grand, president of the Olin Corporation, and Mrs. Grand. The bridegroom's parents are Mr. and Mrs. Geoffrey Stengel of Rose mont, Pa. His father is treas urer of the Insurance Com pany of the Insurance Com pany of North America.

title: M.T.A.  Blames Three Workers For Fatal IND Crash in Queens
description: The Metropolitan Transporta tion Authority yesterday blamed the motorman, conductor and a road car inspector who were aboard a disabled and empty IND subway train Involved in a collision last Wednesday with a passenger train. Two persons were killed and about 70 in jured in the Queens accident.

title: Advertising:
description: Among the people most up set by the proliferation of sex in advertising are the country's increasingly mili tant feminists.

title: Administrator of the Estate Of Reuthers Is Appointed
description: PONTIAC, Mich, May 23 (AP) A probate judge has approved the appointment of Irving J. Bluestone as special adminis trator of the $180,000 estate of Walter P. and May Reuther.

title: Sea Force, $22.40, Captures $31,825 Cherry Hill Handicap at Garden State
description: CHERRY HILL, N. J., May 23 (AP) Ronald Seaman's Sea Force led all the way today and won the $31,825 Cherry Hill Handicap for fillies and mares at Garden State Park.

title: RACING AT DELAWARE TO BEGIN SATURDAY
description: Delaware Park, the 700acre thoroughbred horse racing plant famed for its greenery and coun try club atmosphere, opens this Saturday for a 61day meeting.

title: In the beginning there was Little Bear
description: The best approach to Har per's I Can Read books is to forget that they are part of a series. Parents are too often be wildered by the gaggles in this genre that waddle and honk in unison, lookalikes that goose step down the road to the Land of Ultimate Boredom.

title: Rumania Expands Rescue Effort As Toll in Floods Is Put at 200
description: ORADEA, Rumania, May 23 (Reuters)Efforts to save peo ple, homes, farms and factories from the most devastating floods in centuries moved to day from the central region of Rumania to the southern and eastern areas of the country.

title: In The Nation: Who Is Saving Whom From What?
description: WASHINGTON  Vice Pres ident Ky, who is South Viet nam's Agnew, has called the statement that South Vietna mese troops would withdraw from Cambodia when Ameri ca's troops did a silly argu ment of silly people. This is a harsh way for an ally to speak of President Nixon, who said on May 9 that he would expect that the South Vietna mese would come out approxi mately at the same time that we do because when we come out, our logistical support and air support will also come out with them.

title: Arrest Of a Writer
description: For some time, observers of the Soviet scene had been puzzled by the case of Andrei Amalrik, a dissident Russian author best known for his book, Will the U.S.S.R. Survive Until 1984? Mr. Amalrik's writ ings, smuggled out to the West and circulated under ground in Russia, were more critical of the Soviet regime than the work of other writers who had been im prisoned, yet he remained free. Some observers specu lated that Mr. Amalrik might be an accomplice of the se curity police. The reasoning went that since Mr, Amalrik had harsh things to say not only of Communism but of Russians in general, his writ ings would serve to discredit the dissident cause among the Russian people.

title: Conference To Open On Patents
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 A diplomatic conference, called to negotiate the final version of the patent co operation treaty, will open here Monday. More than 50 governments are expected to be represented by delegates or observers.

title: In Israeli Border Kibbutz, Mortar and Rocket Attacks Are Part of Daily Life
description: KFAR RUFFIN, Israel, May 16Three or four years ago, the children of this kibbutz in the Jordan Valley would paint pictures and send them to the kibbutzim east of the Sea of Galilee to hang in the underground shelters.

title: Will They Awake And Sing in 1970?
description: READING the announcement of the Off Broadway revival of Clifford Odets' Awake and Sing caused me to speculate on what the re action to it today might be. Much, of course, depends on the quality of its stag ing. Still I could anticipate that many might find it datedalways an easy out for the careless spectator. After all, the play was first presented in New York on Feb. 19. 1935.

title: Sports of The Times
description: It's gone, said Gale Sayers of the Chicago Bears to Kermit Alexander of the San Francisco 49ers as soon as they had stopped rolling on the Wrigley Field turf in the ninth game of the 1968 season. They had collidedviolently.

title: The Lordly And Noble Beeches
description: THE beech, a magnificent tree, is as lordly and noble as any tree can be. About ten species exist but only two are prominent. Ameri con beech (fagus grandifolia) is best known to most homeowners, but the European beech (F. sylvatica) has more variations in form and foliage. Hedges of this beech exist in Scotland that were planted more than 250 years ago. Large beeches are present today in America under whose branches Indians and travelers camped.

title: John Kerry Weds Miss Julia Thorne
description: BAY SHORE, L. I., May 23 Miss Julia Stimson Thorne, whose ancestors helped to shape the American Republic in its early days, and John Forbes Kerry, who wants to help steer it back from what he considers a wayward course, were married here this afternoon at the 200 acre Thorne family estate.

title: 15 Reported Dead at Chup
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, May 23Witnesses reported today that five fighter planes of the South Vietnamese Air Force bombed and strafed the rubber processing plant at Chup this morning, leaving it aflame and causing at least 15 deaths among the 550 workers. Eighty persons were said to have been wounded.

title: Oh, Dear, the Trouble It's In
description: IF the Vivian Beaumont, under the direction of Jules Irving, really wish es to compete with the Radio City Music Hall, it's going to have to add films. The stage shows alone won't do the trick.

title: Another Lake, Another Dollar
description: Natural beauty is no longer so abundant in the United States that Americans can afford to be com placent about a threat to it anywhere in the country. Those who have seen Lake Tahoe in the Sierra Moun tains, or even flown over it, know that it is a rare gem. Few know that a halfmile of its magnificent shoreline is already blighted by a rabbitwarren of tasteless houses, rows of garages, and even a wretched highrise apartment building.

title: Art
description: HEREWITH a few final notes, final as far as this column is concerned, about art in Japan, the con clusion being that in at least one art the Japanese are without question preeminentthe art of the neon sign. Literally and figuratively, Japanese neon out shines anything the galleries have to offer, as well as anything that Broadway has to offer in the same field.

title: Computers at a Crossroad
Not Just Ozawa But Tom Jones, Too
description: THE American summer scene has not changed noticeably this year over previous years. There is no new festival of consequence. The one at Daytona Beach, Fla., has dropped out with every sign of per manence. Two, those at Stan ford University in California and Dartmouth College in New Hampshire, are dormant but expected to be revived next year.

title: Suharto Fears a Widening of War in Indochina
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, May 23  President Suharto has ex pressed concern that if the big powers cannot control the In dochina conflict, it could lead to a third world war.

title: Relaxation of Restrictions on Foreign Aid to Haiti Is Expected by U.S. Officials in PortauPrince
description: PORTAUPRINCE, Haiti, May 23A relaxation of the virtual blockade of foreign economic aid to the regime of President Francois Duvalier is expected soon by United States officials here.

title: Judy Spiegel Fiancee
description: LAWRENCE, L. I., May 23 Mr. and Mrs. George Spie gel have announced the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Judy Lynn Spiegel, to Jerome Howard Landers, son of Mr. and Mrs. Mitchell Levitsky of Rego Park, Queens. The future bride groom changed his surname. He teaches mathematics in the New York schools. His fianc teaches in the Hewlett Woodmere school system.

title: Aerospace Engineers on Coast Design a LongLife Spacecraft
description: PASADENA, Calif., May 23 Engineers at the Jet Pro pulsion Laboratory here be lieve they have succeeded, after nearly two years, in solving one of the toughest problems in aerospace de sign: How to build a space craft to fly through the asteroid belt, past the radia tions of Jupiter and the rings of Saturn, and still return usable data 10 years later from the outermost fringes of the solar system.

title: Scolvin Wins by 7 Lengths In Oxmoor Steeplechase
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky. May 23 (AP)With a burst of speed in the fianl qaurtermile, Scolvin, owned and ridden by George Strawbridge Jr., of Middletown, Del., won the 26th annual Ox moor Steeplechase today by several lengths.

title: UEXTALL, CANADIENS, ACQUIRED BY SEALS
description: OAKLAND, Calif., May 23 (UPI)The Oakland Seals have purchased Dennis Hextall, a center from the Montreal Canadians of the National Hockey League in a straight cash deal today.

title: Coins
description: IF early registrations are an indication, the 79th anniversary convention of the American Numis matic Association at St. Louis, Aug. 18 through 22, will be the most successful in ANA history.

title: U.S. POLICY ROUSES AFTRA CONTROVERSY
description: Efforts by the New York local of the American Federa tion of Television and Radio Artists to arrive at o public position on United States in volvement in Indochina have provoked bitter controversy within the union.

title: Architecture
description: THE subject today is an area called SoHo, a 20 block section of lower Manhattan bounded roughly, north and south, by Houston and Canal Streets, and east and west, by Broad way and West Broadway.

title: China and Russia Argue but Hanoi Runs The Show
description: Moscow and Peking are at each other's throats again in an effort to gain influence in Indo china. These greatpower shout ing matches dominate the head lines; but it is the country they are seeking to influence, North Vietnam, that runs the show in Indochina.

title: 71 Westminster, Cruft's Dates Permit Fancier to Attend Both
description: For the first time In years, Westminster in New York and Cruft's in London, the foremost dog shows of their countries, will be separated sufficiently in time next Feb ruary to make a visit to both events comfortably possible. The Dog. Fanciers Club, a group based in New York, in tends to take ad News vantage of the scheduling by or ganizing a six day package trip that will include Cruft's, visits to English ken nels and sightseeing.

title: Ages 69: Some tales, long, short and tall
description: The suspense is almost more than one can bear. The young hippopotamus, Edward, has en tered the big swimming race, 14 miles along the Zamboola River. His grandfather, who placed third in the contest many years ago, trains Edward.

title: Toledo Tennis Team Takes 5th League Title in Row
description: OXFORD, Ohio, May 23 (AP) The University of Toledo took five of six singles titles and a doubles crown Saturday to win its fifth straight Mid American Conference tennis chamiponship.

title: FAVORED SUN LOVER WINS BY 10 LENGTHS
description: MIAMI, May 23 (AP)Happy Valley Farm's heavilyfavored Sun Lover scored his fourth straight victory and David Hi dalgo rode three winners at Tropical Park today.

title: Can Teddy Kennedy Survive His Reputation?
description: HOW grave is the wound? That is the question. Not just po litically, but personally, in wardly, in terms of his selfesteem and commitment to public life.

title: Son to the Feinbergs
description: A son was born on May 16 to Mr. and Mrs. Gerald Fein berg of East End Avenue in Beth Israel Hospital. Mrs. Feinberg is the former Miss Barbara Silberdick, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Norman Sil berdick of New York. The child is named Jeremy Rus sell. His father is a professor of physics at Columbia Uni versity.

title: Master of the clear, expressive line
description: Make no mistakes about it, the world of Al Hirschfeld is a far better one than that dreary mess lying all around the rest of us. Its citizens are Ray Bolger, dancing on for ever; Ethel Merman, belting out a note to the most remote solar plexus of the second balcony; Barbra Streisand, Alec Guin ness, John Gielgud, Mary Mar tin. You will have first met many of them in his caricatures on the drama pages of this newspaper. Now in The World of Hirschfeld they are seen again, with others, in a sort of spring Town Meeting. But there are no bores at this meeting and obviously no niggardly budget, for Abrams has given them a wonderful gathering place.

title: M'PHERSON QUARTET ECHOES BEBOP DAYS
description: Distant echoes of Charlie Parker drifted through Judson Hall Friday night when the Charles McPherson Quartet gave the first in a series of weekly concerts to be presented there by Jazz Spotlite.

title: Rose Frank Affianced
description: Mr. and Mrs, John Harrison Frank of New York have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Rose Mary Frank, to Stephan Mark Schmelkin, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Isaac Schmelkin, also of New York. Miss Frank at tends New York University, of which her fiance is a grad uate.

title: Miss Martha Frances Hamilton Married to I. Wistar Morris 3d
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla. May 23  Martha Frances Hamilton, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Andrew Benedict Hamilton, to I. Wistar Morris 3d took place here this even ing. The Rev. George La Bruce performed the cere mony in St. Thomas. Episco pal Church.

title: JENKINS IS VICTOR
description: The Chicago Cubs overpow ered the New York Mets, 148, yesterday and made up for a lot of those long, lonely eve nings last winter when they sat around brooding about their lost summer of 1969.

title: He Said: Tourists Never Take The Mail BoatThat Clinched It
description: NASSAU, the Bahamas  But tourists never take the mail boats, said the hotel manager. That clinched the matter. The next afternoon, I jumped from the dock at Potters Cay in downtown Nassau to the rusted deck of the Deborah K., swinging idly at her spring lines.

title: Letter to the Editor 1  No Title
description: RIVERSIDE

title: Prohibition Is Repealed For Ohio College Area
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, May 23 (UPI)The State Senate has agreed to repeal a law that prohibits the sale of liquor and the operation of houses of prostitution within a two mile radius around Central State University in Wilber force.

title: Merchant Ship Designers Offer Standardized Fleet
description: The latest styles in ship fashions, designed to fill the nation's commercial shipping needs in the nineteen seventies, were put on dis play in New York by the Maritime Administration last week.

title: POLICE PLANNING NATIONAL UNION
description: Policemen from around the United States will meet this week in Denver to adopt a 72 page constitution and elect per manent officers for what may become the country's first na tional police union.

title: RANKS OF JOBLESS SWELL ON COAST
description: TORRANCE, Calif., May 21 A recession is when your next door neighbor is out of work, said James Hamilton with wry laugh. A depression is when you're out of work.

title: OHIO G.0 P. IS SPLIT ON CONTRIBUTION
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, May 23 Stunned leaders of the Ohio Republican party will gather here this week to assess the political effects of a dispute that culminated in the party's gubernatorial candidate asking two of his running mates to drop off the ticket.

title: Susan A. Joslin Engaged to Wed Jonathan Leader
description: BRISTOL, R. I., May 23 Associate Justice Alfred H. Joslin of the Rhode Island Supreme Court and Mrs. Jos lin have announced the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Susan Alice Joslin, to Jonathan Leader, son of Mr. and Mrs. Milton R. Leader of New York. The wedding is to take place here Aug. 30.

title: The Two Germanys Talk to Little Purpose
description: KASSEL, West Germany Willi Stoph, the East German Premier, was scarcely across the West German border at Bebra last Thursday morning when he issued an acrimoni ous declaration accusing the Government of Chancel lor Willy Brandt of commit ting juridical aggression against his state.

title: Palmer of Orioles Stops Red Sox, 30
description: BALTIMORE, May 23Terry Crowley, a rookie filling in for the injured Frank Robinson, cracked a tworun double in the sixth inning to pace the Baltimore Orioles to a 30 vic tory over the Boston Red Sox today.

title: Jay Woodworth And Susan Ray Married on L. I.
description: SHELTER ISLAND, L. I., May 23Miss Susan Hubbard Ray and Jay Neil Woodworth were married here this after noon in St. Mary's Episcopal Church.

title: Peach Bowl Set for Dec. 30
description: ATLANTA, May 23 (UPI) The third annual Peach Bowl (football game will he played at Georgia Tech's Grant Field on Dec. 30, it was announced to day by Tim Manning president of the sponsoring committee.

title: Southern, a Railway Apart
description: Over the last few years a staple of railroad news has been the interview with the railroad president who tells how much his road is going to make from a merger with another. Sometimes that interview is followed by one ex plaining why the savings haven't developed as planned. Robert E. Beding field of The New York Times recently interviewed W. Graham Claytor Jr., president of the Southern Railway, who doesn't have any specific mergers in mind and who thinks railroading is a growth industry. Excerpts from that interview follow:

title: REDS ROUT ASTROS AS SIMPSON WINS
description: HOUSTON, May 23 (UPI) Pete Rose drove in four runs and Bernie Carbo and Tony Perez hit a homer apiece to night to lead the Cincinnati Reds to a 143 triumph over the Houston Astros and give Wayne Simpson his sixth vic tory of the season.

title: Blossoms for Late Summer
description: AFTER the late spring burst of tree and shrub bloom, an other series of trees and shrubs provide display well into fall.

title: Where did the cyanide come from?
description: Captain Richard Mader of the Imperial and Royal Austro Hungarian Army hurries from his General Staff Corps office to his apartment. He has a

title: Cornell's Lacrosse Rally Defeats Syracuse, 11 to 7
description: ITHACA, N. Y., May 23 Cornell's lacrosse team rallied from a 41 deficit to defeat Syr acuse, 117, today, and com pleted its third undefeated sea son in five years.

title: Cairo's War: Now You See It, Now You Don't
description: ONE of Cairo's more intellectual entertainments just now is a satirical play entitled, It's You Who Killed the Beast. An adap tation of the Oedipus legend to an cient Egypt, with Egyptian Thebes taking the place of the Grecian city, it shows Oedipus as a pharaoh of good intentions who is led astray by the sycophancy of his advisers. It's you who killed the beast, they chant seductively, after he apparently has disposed of the menacing sphinx for them. Shielded from the facts by this admiring chorus, the pharaoh be comes complacent and when, inevi tably, the curse of the sphinx returns in a new guise, the stage seems set for the tragic retribution which was the lot of the original Oedipus.

title: Capital Group Lists Liberal Candidates It Will Give Funds
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 A Washingtonbased organization formed early this year to raise campaign funds for liberal Con gressional candidates has decid ed to allocate its initial money to a Senate candidate in Con necticut and to House candi dates in Massachusetts and California.

title: Speaking of Books: Corrections Are Worth Money
description: University education has spread so far in the United States, encouraged by that excellent egalitarian principle which holds that, if one man gains a degree, then everyone should get one, and also a little perhaps by the labor unions and the aging presidents of corporations, who are by no means anxious to see too much young talent come joyously to the market place when so much old talent still needs the money. Consequently Europeans are often astounded at the great many colleges and universities in America.

title: REFUGE PLANNED BY FRESH AIR FUND
description: The Fresh Air Fund, which teaches conservation to 2,500 city boys and girls at its seven camps at Sharpe Reservation in Dutchess County each sum mer, plans this season to de velop a wildlife refuge in an eightacre area around one or the manmade ponds there.

title: Royalty at Wedding in St. Tropez
description: ST. TROPEZ, France, May 23 (UPI)A princess and 10 prominent members of Euro pean aristocracy were among the 400 guests who today, honored a former St. Tropez hairdresser by attending his son's wedding.

title: Ages 912: Facts and speculation
description: Mr. Carse, who has sailed the oceans and written several books of the sea, keeps his customary steady course in describing the life and skill of tugboatmen. Even when he re cords examples of great courage, he avoids drifting into romanticism. The book is an informative trip for those who want to know why these little Dieselpowered craft are so vital and how their crews' ability to make the right de cision in an emergency keeps ships safely on the move in harbors.

title: Kestler Named Captain Of Columbia's Fencers
description: Tony Kestler, a junior from New York City, has been elected captain of the 197071 Columbia varsity fencing team. He succeeds Fred Catapano of Hunting ton, L.I.

title: Lorraine Walsh to Wed
description: PAWLING, N. Y., May 23 Mr. and Mrs. George J. Walsh Jr. have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Lorraine Ann Walsh, to Michael Clark Kelly, son of Mr. and Mrs. Roger M. Kelly of Oxford, Md. The wedding will take place in September.

title: Observer: Meanwhile, Back in Northwest Asia..
description: WASHINGTON, May 23  And now children, time for geography. We're going to talk today about Britain. Who knows where Britain is located. Diane?

title: YUGOSLAVIA TOPS U.S. FIVE BY 7063
description: LJUBLJANA, Yugoslavia, May 23 (AP)Yugoslavia upset the United States, 7063, today and clinched the world amateur basketball championship.

title: Tempered Yankee Scores in 2:00 45 For Yonkers Upset
description: YONKERS, N. Y., May 23 Tempered Yankee, with his trainer, Vernon Dancer, in the sulky, scored a 2:00 45 upset in the featured $15,000 junior freeforall pace at Yonkers Raceway tonight.

title: Stay Out Front Captures Real Delight by 6 Lengths
description: CHICAGO, May 22 (AP) Stay Out Front, a 75 favorite of the crowd of 13,962 at Washington Park, charged past Likely Lady and Dilettante on the stretch turn and went on to win the $7,500 Real Delight Handicap by six lengths today.

title: Miss Prentice Is Bride
description: GARRISON, N. Y., May 23Miss, Josephine Osborn Prentice and Timothy Head Harwood were married here this afternoon in St. Philip's Episcopal Church by the Rev. William Reisman. The bride is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ezra P. Prentice Jr. The bridegroom's parents are Mr. and Mrs. Sydney Harwood of North Andover, Mass., where Mr. Harwood is vice presi dent of the Davis & Furher Machine Company. His wife's father is a senior associate with the New York law firm of Cadwallader, Wickersham & Taft.

title: Color power
description: It's a rental apartment, but there's nothing stereotyped about it. The foyer serves as a dining room; the bedroom doubles as a study, and extra seat ing tucked away in the living room allows George and Louise Beylerian, furniture designers, to accommodate large gatherings comfortably. Bold colors and imaginative use of texture give the onceanonymous rooms a strongly individual characterand without structural changes.

title: MELVILLE NAMES U. S. SKIING TEAM
description: DENVER, May 22 (AP)Six teen members of the 197071 United States ski team have been named by Marvin Melville, chairman of the United States Ski Association's Alpine com petition committee.

title: CALVIN SCORES 33, 6 IN EXTRA PERIOD
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 23 (UPI)Mack Calvin, the Los Angeles Stars' guard, tallied 6 of his team's 10 points in overtime today as the Stars beat the Indiana Pacers, 117 113, to force the American Bas ketball Association champion ship playoffs to at least six games.

title: 3,500 Housing Units Cleared For Renewal Projects in City
description: The Housing and Develop ment Administration reported yesterday that governmental hurdles had been cleared to permit a beginning on major public and moderate  income housing projects involving more than 3.500 units here.

title: Canada Presses Program to Prevent Damage to Arctic Lands
description: OTTAWA, May 23  The Canadian Government, with help from industry and uni versities, is pouring money and talent into a program to pro tect the Arctic environment from what a Cabinet minister has called the evils of uncon trolled exploitation.

title: Headliners
description: Peace Corps director Joseph Blatchford couldn't say he had not been warned. Before stepping onto the tennis court as partner of Vice President Spiro Agnew in a game in Washington last Tuesday, he received a mock telegram advising him to keen ducking. The Vice Presidential aim. it'appeared, had not been too good lately. Mr. Agnew had beaned golf pro Doug Sanders with a golf ball during the Bob Hope Classic in Palm Springs, Calif., in February, and there were rumors, neither confirmed nor denied, that had zonked his tennis partner with a ball during the Governors' Conference in Colorado, Springs last year.

title: Personality:
description: DALLAS Whatever else it may portend, the sudden naming of Robert H. Stewart 3d as chairman of the board of LingTemcoVought, Inc., last Sunday morning defi nitely means the substitution of group management for oneman rule in the troubled conglomerate's affairs.

title: Mama   Makes Us All Voyeurs
description: LIKE Pretty Poison and Targets of past years, and like The Honey moon Killers this year, Bloody Mama is a rela tive low budget, unpreten tious, extraordinarily brutal little movie about the path ology of senseless murder. Also like those previous films, it has elicited aston ished semiraves from critics who were not necessarily predisposed to like it at all when they entered the thea ter. Nothing reflects so tell ingly our national intimacy with violence more than the high artistic batting average of recent Hollywood movies that have taken violence for their theme. It's as if the subject were such a natural for an American director that, once having embraced it, he could hardly go wrong.

title: Proposed Nerve Gas Shipment To Oregon Canceled by Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (UPI) The White House has can celed a controversial plan to ship nerve gas from Okinawa to a storage site in Oregon and is considering Kodiak, Alaska, as an alternative site, it was learned tonight.

title: The Old Stand on the Canale Grande
description: IN case you've been won dering, there will be a 35th Venice Bienniale, opening June 24 at its old Grand Canal stand. And there will be an American exhibition (as announced pre viously in this newspaper). We'll get back to that, but first a report from Dietrich Malilow, who recently popped into town with word of some sweeping changes in the Bienniale's Central Pa vilion, traditionally run by the Italians.

title: Badillo and Scheuer Win Each Other's Endorsement
description: Herman Badillo former Bronx Borough President, and Repre sentative James H. Scheuer of the Bronx, who were rivals in last year's Democratic mayoral primary election, announced yesterday their support of each other in upce;ning Democratic Congressional primaries.

title: A $7billion business founded on the firm rock of narcissism
description: Here they are. The babypowdered infant and her selfstarving grand mother; the 18yearold girl who re ceives a nose job for her birthday present; the haute bourgeoise who is exercised at 10 A.M., deblackheaded at noon, waxed at 2 and coiffured at 4; the defeated political candidate who dyes his hair and the conqueror who exudes a sincere glow of pan cake tan; the plastic surgeon who has his own chin siliconeimplanted; the poodle who is cologned with $4 Sniffe; and finally, the author who has suffered, oh how she has suf fered, to have her stubbornly curly brunette locks transformed into a Waspy golden mane.

title: Education Executive Named
description: WASHINGTON, May 23Dr. Leon M. Lessinger, former As sociate United States, commis sioner of education has been named president of Education Audit Institute, a corporation established here to assist schools in the new field of ed ucational accountability.. The institute will assist school sys tems in accounting for the results of their educational pro grams and in training and pre paring professional staff for a selfappraisal role. Dr. Lessinger is now Callaway Professor of Education at Georgia State Uni versity, Atlanta.

title: Prof. W. Lloyd Warner Dead; Known for Class Status Work
description: W. Lloyd Warner, anthropol ogist and sociologist, and a uni versity professor of social re search at Michigan State University since 1959, died yes terday after a heart attack in Chicago. He was 71 years old and lived in Chesterton, Ind.

title: Stamps
description: GIUSEPPE CASTIGLIONE was a Jesuit priest, a Mila nese, who entered the priesthood at 19 and trained as a painter and architect. He was sent to China as a missionary when he was 27 and soon thereafter became an artist in the court of Emperor Kang Hsi (1662 1723), and given the name Lang Shihning. One of his not able works is a scroll 25 feet, 6 inches long, by 3 feet, 1 inch deep. Known as the One Hundred Horses, it is now in the National Palace Museum in Taipei, Taiwan, Republic of China.

title: The Wiles of the Isle of Women
description: ISLA MUJERES, MexicoThe name alone provides a lure and incentive for visiting this tiny island off the extreme eastern tip of the Yucatan Peninsula, but just because Isla Mujeres is called the isle of women doesn't mean it is loaded with them, anymore than the Isle of Man, in the Irish Sea, is loaded with men. In fact, this island's 3,100 natives, mostly Mayan, number more men than women.

title: Sarah Lavery Wed To Michael T. Fach
description: MANHASSET, L. I., May 23 Miss Sarah Rutherford La very, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas J. Lavery of Port Washington, was mar ried here this afternoon to Michael Timmins Fach, son of Mr. and Mrs. Albert W. Fach, also of Port Washing ton. The Rev. Frank Johnston performed the ceremony at Christ Episcopal Church.

title: Q:
description: Freedom

title: Miss Brighton Stamford Bride Of Gill Barlow
description: STAMFORD, Conn., May 23  Miss Deborah Peirce Brighton, a senior at Jackson College, and Gill Channing Barlow, a senior at Tufts, were married here today aboard the bride's father's ferryboat, Chelsea.

title: Calcutta Port Is Paralyzed
description: CALCUTTA, India, May 23 (Reuters)This busy port was paralyzed fo rthe second day today as about 25,000 men working on barges continued a strik. They are demanding to receive wages recommended by a Government board.

title: PIRATES' 4 IN 4TH SINK EXPOS, 8 TO 4
description: MONTREAL, May 23 (UPI) Manny Sanguillen singled home two runs during a fourrun fourth inning and Roberto Clemente and John Jeter belted homers later tonight as the Pittsburgh Pirates scored an 84 victory over the Montreal Expos.

title: 2 DRIVERS INJURED IN 7CAR COLLISION
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., May 23 (AP)Two drivers were hurt, but escaped serious injury to day when seven Formula Ford racing cars crashed, spun, and overturned at 126 miles an hour at the Charlotte Motor Speed way.

title: Poll in California Reports Drop in Reagan Popularity
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., May 23 (AP)Gov. Ronald Reagan's political popularity dropped by seven points between February and May, the California Poll reported Tuesday.

title: 500 Nurses March to Protest the War
description: Five hundred nurses and nursing students, about two thirds of them in white uni forms, marched from Bryant Park down Fifth Avenue to Union Square yesterday sing ing, All we are saying is give peace a chance.

title: REICHARDT DRIVE TIES GAME IN 8TH
description: DETROIT, May 23 (AP)Ed Brinkman's fourth hit of the game drove in John Roseboro with the winning run in the ninth inning today as Washing ton rallied to beat Detroit, 65.

title: Scott Memento
description: RECENT announcement of the sale of Scott Publications to Graph ics Publishing Co., Omaha, Neb., and Harmer, Rooke & Co., New York, stirred collectors to look for mementos of the more than one century old Scott organi zation, which has had an his toric role in American phila tely. Scott Publications was an offshoot of Scott Stamp and Coin Company, having been separated from the lat ter a number of years ago.

title: SMOG NOW FOUND IN RURAL REGIONS
description: WILMINGTON, N.Y., May 23 Hereon Whiteface Mountain, where the air is normally at the purest level anywhere in the country, spreading air con tamination sometimes brings pollution measurements to lev els approaching that around some major cities.

title: Vietnamizing Cambodia
description: Saigon's announced determination to keep South Vietnamese troops in Cambodia indefinitely, which has now been publicly sanctioned by Defense Secre tary Laird, is a direct challenge to the Administration's own professed efforts and those of Congress to re establish limits to the Southeast Asian conflict.

title: Pope Attends Concert In St. Peter's Basilica
description: ROME, May 23Pope Paul VI attended a concert in St. Peter's Basilica tonight in a Vatican tribute to Beethoven in the bicentenary of his birth.

title: Calendar of Dog Show Events
description: Today

title: Survey Indicates Athletic Programs Face Demanding Test in Fall
description: College athletic programs, once content to isolate them selves from shifting campus values, appear headed for their most demanding philo sophical test this fall.

title: Employes' Petition Backs Allen's Antiwar Position
description: WASHINGTON, May 23  Five hundred employes of the Office of Education have signed petitions supporting Dr. James E. Allen Jr., Commissioner of Education, in his disagreement with the Administration over the Vietnam war.

title: Athletics Director Resigns
description: CHATTANOOGA, May 23 (UPI)  Andrew (Scrappy) Moore, 67, who served as head football coach at the University of Tennessee at Chattanooga for 37 years before stepping up to the athletics directorship in 1967, retired today.

title: ISRAELI PLAY CLOSES AFTER WIDE PROTEST
description: TEL AVIV, May 23A theater here has responded to public pressure and withdrawn a polit ical satire considered offensive to the armed forces.

title: Kerr on the Open Theater
description: THE ELUSIVE Open The ater, improvising most of its plays (or cere monies, as JeanClaude van Itallie prefers to call them) on the floor of a loft and rarely inviting the gen eral public to see any one piece in an extended run, has finally announced a limited engagement of three of its works in repertory, Mr. van Itallie's The Serpent, Sam uel Beckett's Endgame and the most recent collaborative enterprise of the group, Ter minal. (Performances will be given at the Washington Square Methodist Church, 133 West 4th Street, from Tuesday through June 14, and if you have any interest what soever in the theater that is trying to shake itself loose of old habits and inhibitions, you'd better make plans; the company is the finest of its kind and the demand for seats will no doubt be heavy.)

title: Magnolia Tree Growing In Brooklyn Is Landmark
description: A hardy 85yearold mag nolia tree in the Bedford Stuyvesant section of Brook lyn has been designated an official New York City land mark.

title: Letters
description: WHITES ON BLACKS, AND VICE VERSA

title: Finch On a Very Hot Seat at H.E.W.
description: WASHINGTON  Can a lib eral Republican find happiness by coming to Washington to take a Cabinet post heading the Government's most leftwing and disorganized department during a conservative, business oriented Administration? This is the nub of the problem con fronting Robert H. Finch, the Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, who spent five days in the hospital last week due to what was described as extreme fatigue.

title: HOFSTRA STUDENTS AID ARMED FORCES
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I, May 23 (UPI)Despite opposing view points about the war, students, faculty members and adminis trators at Hofstra University in Hempstead have contributed 275 pints of blood to United States forces in South Vietnam and Cambodia.

title: F.T.C. Seeks to Require A Warning on Cyclamates
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (AP) The Federal Trade Commis sion has tentatively ruled that advertising for nonprescription drugs containing cyclamates must include a warning of health dangers when the drug is taken in large doses.

title: KATHY HITE WINS SOUTHERN AMATEUR
description: PINEHURST, N. C., May 23 (UPI)Kathy Hite of Florence, S.C., birdied the 39th hole to day and defeated Mrs. John Griffith of Fort Worth, 1 up, for the Women's Southern amateur golf championship.

title: Measures to Finance Schools Are Being Defeated Across U. S.
description: A mounting series of defeats for school financial measures across the country in recent months has posed one of the most serious crises many edu cators can remember. Some educators feel that the forces causing the problem will even tually bring about a maior re vising of the financial structure that supports public elementary and high schools.

title: Rindt Sets Auto Lap Mark
description: LONDON, May 23 (Reuter) Jochem Rindt smashed his two yearold Crystal Palace lap rec ord today in a practice run for Monday's Alcoa Britain Inter national Trophy motor race. Driving a Lotus 69, Rindt raced round the I.39mile circuit at 99.29 miles an hour0.31 m.p.h. faster than the previous record.

title: BASESFILLED HIT TOPPLES YANKEES
description: CLEVELAND, May 23The Yankees and Indians matched bull pens and benches for 3 hours 50 minutes today and the Indians gained the decision, 43, after 13 innings. Each team used 17 players.

title: In a Lebanese Border Village, Sorrow and Anger
description: BINT JBAIL, Lebanon, May 23The residents of this vil lage less than a mile from the Israeli border and of three other villages in the vicinity are in mourning today for the 13 persons killed in yester day's Israeli artillery bom bardment. But they are angry, tooangry at the Palestinian guerrillas for having brought the Israeli reprisals and angry at the Lebanese Gov ernment for its seeming in ability to defend them.

title: SHRIVER IS UNSURE ABOUT HIS COURSE
description: ROCKVILLE, Md., May 23  Weeks after the deadline set by aides of R. Sargent Shriver for an announcement of his candidacy for Governor of Maryland, the noncandidate is still uncertain about his politi cal future.

title: Janet A. Jabara, Teacher, a Bride
description: Miss Janet Anne Jabara, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Theodore R. Jabara of Brook lyn, was married yesterday to J. Daniel Walsh 2d. The ceremony was performed in St. Mary's Syrian Orthodox Church in Brooklyn by Met ropolitan Philip Saliba and the Very Rev. Paul Schneirla.

title: Drug Chain To Expand In Texas
description: DALLAS, May 23A Dal lasbased drugstore chain, the Ward CutRate Drug Company, has announced plans to begin a statewide expansion, including more than doubling its present size within the next two years.

title: Washington: Whither Art Thou, Spiro?
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 Among the few certainties in this, uncertain age is Vice President Spiro Agnew. Some how he vanishes during the week, but almost always he shows up at the weekend some where in Iowa, South Carolina or Texas, shaking his fist at the press and trying to divert every body's attention from the war and the economy to the hairy scoundrels in the universities and the press.

title: A Tale of Two LowBudget Houses
description: IT is still possible in the face of escalating build ing costs to have a year round home, designed by an architect, at a price under $30,000, according to two architects who managed to design such homes recently.

title: Patricia M. Donahue Wed at Princeton
description: PRINCETON, N. J., May 23 The Princeton University Chapel here was the setting today for the marriage of Miss Patricia M. Donahue to Charles Houck Cooper, both of Denver. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Ernest Gordon, dean of the chapel.

title: Horse Show Calendar
description: TodayLong Island Profet sional Horesmen's Association, Equitation Lodge, Bayport, L. I. Green, amateurowner and junior working hunters; junior and in termediate jumpers, ponies, equitation. 9 A.M.

title: Mutual Force Reductions
description: West Germany's proposal that the Western allies open exploratory talks with the Soviet Union on mutual and balanced force reductions (M.B.F.R.) in Europe dominates the preparations now under way for the NATO ministerial meeting in Rome this week.

title: 2 War Protesters Vow to Fast Until U.S. Leaves Cambodia
description: WASHINGTON, May 23Two of the gentlest war protesters President Nixon will ever see if he ever sees themlay in the shade of a horse chestnut tree today across the street from the White House.

title: Pacific Isle Seeks to Replenish Soil
description: NAURU Leaders of the world's smallest and most iso lated independent republic, the Central Pacific island state of Nauru, are facing up to a stag gering environmental problem with the same calm that they displayed in their long and often seemingly hopeless campaign for sovereignty.

title: Lucille Ross Is Bride Of Michael W. Molloy
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., May 23The marriage of Miss Lucille Brandt Ross to Michael Wall Molloy took place in St. Mark's Episcopal Church here this afternoon. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Grant A. Morrill, the rector, and the Very Rev. John F. Donovan.

title: A radical educator, but no nihilist
description: Two years ago, Herbert Kohl wrote 36 Children, a book that was at once heartrending and heartwarm ing. He told how he had been given a job to teach fifth grade in Harlem, at 119th Street and Madison Ave nue, and how, after spending the summer preparing himself for the fifthgrade curriculum, he had been assigned to teach the sixth grade.

title: President of Howard U. Named Nixon Adviser
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (UPI)President Nixon has named Dr. James E. Check, president of HoWard Uni versity in Washington, as a special consultant for com munication with predomi nantly black universities.

title: DroughtStricken Brazilians Raid Food Stores and Trains
