description: A Port Authority patrolman wto had read a Federal Bu reau of Investigation wanted listing brought about the arrest of a suspect in a bank robbery yesterday in the Midtown Bus Terminal the police reported.

title: Godfrey Cambridge's 'Watermelon Man' Arrives at 2 Houses
description: "Look at my skin!" bellows the hero of "Watermelon Man," after mysteriously changing race overnight, to a polite counterman in a cafe. "I don't have to," is the calm rejoinder, "I can look at my own."This dreadfully unfunny joke of a movie falls crashingly flat on its black-and-white face. There is certainly leeway for good, healthy amusement and a racial mouthful in a subtle, ironic satire of a new-skinned man and his adjustment to himself and the world. Yesterday's new picture literally demands that the viewer find hilarious one long, stultifying clich, smirkily encompassing every racial clich ever invented, ranging from crude and tasteless to dull. Pulling it all behind him like a rusty-wheeled train of vaudeville gags and dominating every moment of the picture, as though it were one of his well-known monologues, is Godfrey Cambridge, the comedian.Let us sincerely hope, judging by the gleeful fervor and calliope steam of his performance, that Mr. Cambridge simply got carried away and didn't realize the excruciating travesty sputtering around him and more often in his wake. How Estelle Parsons, as his wife, fell into itand maybe that's whyis another mystery. Saddest of all, and "Watermelon Man" is a sad occasion, is the waste of an able new director, Melvin Van Peebles. "Watermelon Man" demands complete surrender and gives absolutely nothing in return except embarrassment.

title: Beirut Puts Aside Plan to Seek Arab Troop Aid
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 27 The Government today quietly put aside the proposal to ask troops of other Arab countries into Lebanon as a response to the Israeli patrols that cross into Lebanese territory.

title: DOW UP BY 32.04
description: Stock prices rallied strongly yesterday in a dramatic re covery that carried some lead ing market indexes to their largest oneday gains in his tory.

title: FELDMAN IN QUARTET PLAYING OWN WORK
description: There is a strong precedent for the composer who sits in as violist in performances of his own works (Mozart, eminently, can be cited), so Herbert B. Feldman in that respect stood in a great tradition last night at the New York Cultural Center.

title: Dr. Hugo Boyko, 78, Head Of Art and Science Academy
description: TEL AVIV, May 27 (AP) Dr. Hugo Boyko, president of the World Academy of Art and Science and an ecologist and agricultural researcher, died yesterday at a hospital near here. He was 78 years old.

title: Chess:
description: Andrew Soltis continued his victorious ways by taking first place in the finals of the 196970 Marshall Chess Club championship. He won five games and drew two for a 61 tally. Second place went to A. Deutsch, with 51. Nat Halper was third with 52, and Dr. Edward Lasker, the vigorous 86yearold grandmaster, was fourth with 42

title: Business Records BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS
description: SOUTHERN DISTRICT Wednesday, May 27, 1970

title: Justice Marshall Gaining
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (AP) Justice Thurgood Marshall is making a slow but satisfactory recovery from pneumonia, the Supreme Court said today amid indications that the Justices will be delayed in their summer recess plans. Though Justice Marshall's general health is im proving, the Court announce ment said, it is estimated he will have to remain at Bethesda Naval Hospital at least two more weeks. This could keep the Court in session until late June.

title: N.B.A. Names Gourdine To an Executive Post
description: Simon P. Gourdine, a graduate of City College and Fordham Law School, was named administrative assist ant to Commissioner Walter Kennedy of the National Basketball Association yes terday.

title: British Leyland Reports Sharp Decline in Profits
description: LONDON, May 27 (Reuters) British Leyland, one of the world's largest automobile manufacturers, announced to day a sharp drop in profits.

title: Dream Lover Wins Devon Show Crown Fifth Straight Year
description: DEVON, Pa., May 27Mrs. Susan Gaffney of Ridgewood, N. J., rides one of the coun try's super show horses, but ex cept for once a year the mount is never seen in the metropoli tan area.

title: AMEX UP SHARPLY IN HEAVY VOLUME
description: The American Stock Ex change turned in its best per formance in almost eight years yesterday as stocks rose sharply in the heaviest volume of the year.

title: F. A. Malley Fiance Of Miss MacKinlay
description: ROSENDALE, N. Y., May 27 Mr. and Mrs. Donald A. MacKinlay have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Carol Mac Kinlay, to Francis A. Malley, son of Mr. and Mrs. Francis J. Malley of Port Washington, L. I.

title: Advertising: A Shift by American Brands
description: American Brands is not in the practice of announcing agency switches. Instead, once a year it issues a news release that lists the com pany's agency lineup and the cigarette and other tobacco product brand assignments.

title: Rightists in Israel Refuse To Back Premier's Policy
description: JERUSALEM, May 27  A rightwing bloc of parties in Israel's coalition Government today withheld approval of Premier Golda Meir's policy speech to the Knesset yester day. Their action raised the prospect of a Cabinet crisis.

title: ALPHEUS LINCOLN
description: Alpheus Lincoln, a motion picture actor of silent days, who had also appeared in the theater, died Friday in La Puente, Calif. He was 78 years old.

title: News Summary and Index
description: THURSDAY, MAY 28, 1970

title: Brandt Tells Parliament Of Gains in Moscow Talks
description: BONN, May 27Chancellor Willy Brandt and Foreign Min aster Walter Scheel told Par liament today that they saw positive signs in the current West German dialogue with the Soviet Union that could lead to negotiations on a pact re nouncing the use of force.

title: 149 TO OPEN PLAY IN MEMPHIS GOLF
description: MEMPHIS, May 27A new era for the Memphis open golf tournament begins tomor row. After being a homely 12 year old on the, circuit, it will blossom with a touch of show business and be associated with a nationally known charity.

title: Fire Officers Hire Urge Mayor to Act To Curb Assaults
description: Mayor Lindsay was urged by the, acting president of the 2,500member Uniformed Fire Officers. Association yesterday to adopt a program to curb what he said was an increas ing number of unprovoked as saults on firemen.

title: Two Students Challenge R.O.T.C. Regulations on Hair
description: Two Air Force R.O.T.C. cadets at Michigan State Uni versity have just completed a 74page annotated, footnoted and bibliographed position paper challenging the moral ity, legality and practicality of Air Force regulations gov erning permissible coifs, mustaches and beards.

title: Rising Pessimism Cuts Buying Plans Of Many Families
description: Pessimism about the econ omy is adversely affecting buying plans of many Ameri can families, the National In dustrial Conference Board re ported yesterday.

title: Radiotelephone Pact Voted
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (AP) The Senate voted today to ratify an agreement that per mits Canadian citizens to oper ate radiotelephones while visit ing the United States. United States citizens have enjoyed the privilege while visiting Canada for many years.

title: Ford Foundation Elects
description: William Henry Donaldson, president and chief executive officer of Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette, investment bankers, has been elected a trustee of the Ford Foundation. Mr. Donaldson, 38 years old, is a trustee of Wesleyan University, a director of the New York Coalition, the Beekman Down town Hospital and the City Center Joffrey Ballet. A native of Buffalo, he was graduated from Yale and the Harvard Uni versity Business School.

title: MILBURN P. AKERS, EXCHICAGO EDITOR
description: HOPEDALE, Ill., May.. 27 Milburn P. Akers, retired editor of The Chicago SunTimes, died today when his car collided with a truck, 10 miles south of Hopedale. He was 70 years old.

title: 5 OF 12 IN CABINET PLAN CAMPUS TALKS
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (UPI)  Few top officials of the Nixon Administration will take part in commencement ceremonies on the nation's troubled college carnnuses.

title: CITY ACTS TO CURB ASBESTOS SPRAY
description: The city opened hearings yes terday on proposed regulations that would control the spray ing of asbestos to insulate and fireproof buildings.

title: Lindsay Retains Lawyer to Fight Bid for Testimony
description: Mayor Lindsay has retained a private lawyer to oppose an attempt to have him testify about a $3,000 campaign con tribution by a friend that was allegedly made in lieu of pay ment for legal services due the Mayor's twin brother, David.

title: Bridge:
description: Many players appreciate the advantages of duplicate bridge the competitive quality, the elimination of the luck of the deal, and the possibility of scoring well with bad cards but still prefer to play rub ber bridge.

title: Corinne Praus To Be a Bride
description: KALAMAZOO, Mich., May 27  Miss Corinne Valerie Praus, daughter of Alexis A. Praus, director of the Kala mazoo Public Museum, and Mrs. Praus, plans to be mar ried to Robert ChiaTing Sze, son of Palmer C. Sze of Chatham, N. J., and the late Mrs. Sze.

title: Nixon arid the Protests
description: WASHINGTON, May 27A month has passed since Presi dent Nixon ordered American troops into Cambodia and there are now three quite different views here about how his Ad ministration is reacting to the turmoil that ensued.

title: From John Doe to Belmondo
description: He's definitely the strong, silent type. Six feet tall, rippling muscles, eyes of glassy blue, a long, drooping nose and hair that will curl over his collar when he wears one. He's a type all right but never the sweetheart of Kappa Alpha Theta.

title: Ivy Football Expects No Disruptions
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., May 27The, eight Ivy league football coaches agree there is little reason to expect in terruptions in the sport next fall as a result of protesting or politically active students.

title: Market Place
description: Who owns a corporation today? Is it the shareholder? Or is it management itself?

title: Census Data Saved in Fire
description: NEW CITY, N. Y., May 27 Census records covering Rock land and northern Westchester counties were saved from dam age last night in a fire that destroyed a paint store and a clothing store on South Main Street here. The Census Bureau building was adjacent to the burnedout building.

title: GEORGE X. M'LANAHAN
description: George X. McLanahan, presi dent of the Polynesian Food Products Company of Honolulu, died Sunday after a long illness. He was 57 years old.

title: FUND INCREASED FOR WORK ON BMT
description: Longer subway platforms, housing, a new street layout in a downtown renewal area and a Queens park occupied the City Planning Commission yes terday.

title: Police Panel Gets Subpoena Powers
description: The City Council voted last night to grant subpoena powers for six months to Mayor Lindsay's recently formed five member commission to investi gate alleged police corruption.

title: F.B.I. Investigates Theft Of $217,500 Near Airport
description: Federal Bureau of Investiga tion agents were investigating yesterday the reported theft of a $217,500 shipment of cur rency at Kennedy International Airport by two armed bandits who waylaid a Pan American World Airways courier vehicle.

title: DANIEL J. SAUNDERS
description: Daniel J. Saunders, who re tired six years ago as vice president of the Permutit Com pany a division of the Ritter Pfaudler Company, manufac turers of watertreating equip ment and supplies, died yester day at his home at Dune Road, Westhampton Beach, L. I. He was 71 years old.

title: Prisoners' Wives Ask Liberalized Visiting Rules
description: Wives and children of in mates in state prisons pleaded yesterday at a public hearing of the State Senate Commit tee on Crime and Correction for provision for informal fam ily visiting to prisons so the convicts and their wives can maintain family ties.

title: StayatHome Daughters ...
description: LONDONIn rented rooms and bleak homes on the fringe of London, the stay athome daughters grow old in despair.

title: Football's Integrity Not Harmed By Option Clause, Kuhn Agrees
description: The early history of base ball proves the necessity of the present reserveclause system, Commissioner Bowie Kuhn testified yesterday as the first witness for the defense in Curt Flood's Federal antitrust suit against baseball.

title: Briefing on Space Stations
description: WASHINGTON May 27 (UPI)  Officials of the National Aeronautics and Space Admin istration, and the aeronautics industry will brief next week representatives of European scientific, industrial, and gov ernmental groups in Paris on space stations NASA's admin istrator, Thomas O. Paine will head the sevenman United States delegation at the brief ing session in the Grand Hotel, June 35.

title: International House Party
description: International House, a resi dence and program center at 500 Riverside Drive, where foreign and American grad uate students live and work together, will hold its 11th annual benefit party there on Wednesday. Shirley Verrett, the mezzosoprano, and Aaron Copland, the composer, are honorary patrons of the event, which will include a cocktail party, a continental picnic and a concert of in ternational songs, dances and music. Mrs. Lewis Schachne, Harry Van Dyke, Mrs. Jules Winarick and Mrs. Albert Zesiger are cochairman. Tickets are $12.50.

title: Red Sox Recall Santiago
description: BOSTON, May 27 (AP)The Boston Red Sox recalled today Jos Santiago, a righthander, from Louisville of the Interna tional League in a move to help their pitching corps. The Red Sox optioned Ray Jarvis, a righthander, to Louisville.

title: Student Group Plans Memorial Day War Protests
description: As antiwar demonstrations continued on some campuses yesterday, a student group in Washington announced plans for demonstrations in several cities on Memorial Day and a drive to spread the protest movement beyond the colleges and universities into union halls, military installations and migrant labor camps.

title: JOURNAL DRIVERS END THEIR STRIKE
description: A strike by newspaper de liverers that had prevented 100,000 copies a day of The Wall Street Journal from reaching the city's newsstands since last May 17 was called off yesterday.

title: Book on Slum Life Here Stirs Group
description: A lot piled with garbage, ratinfested slums and the dismal lives of their black and Puerto Rican tenants in the East Bronx were shown in slides yesterday to a shocked audience at Auto mation House, a laborman agement foundation for the study of modern technology and its impact on society.

title: Text of Declaration Issued by Foreign Ministers of NATO in Rome
description: ROME, May 27 (Reuters) Following is the text of a declaration issued today by the foreign ministers of the North Atlantic Treaty Organ ization on their proposal for a mutual and balanced re duction of forces in Central Europe:

title: THAIMALAYSIA UNIT SEIZES RED OUTPOST
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, May 27 (UPI)A force of Thai and Malaysian border police cap tured a Communist guerrilla camp on the border of the two countries yesterday after bom barding it for two days with mortars, Thai police officials said today.

title: Panther Hearing Told of School Plot
description: The chief assistant district attorney of Brooklyn testified yesterday that a Black Panther informant told him in Novem ber, 1968, of an attempt by members of the governing board of the Ocean Hill Brownsville Experimental School District to arrange the assassination of Albert Shank er.

title: U.N. RETAINS ROLES FOR 2 OUTSIDE UNITS
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., May 27The Economic and Social Council today reaffirmed the status of B'nai B'rith, the Jewish organization, and the International Criminal Police Organization, or Interpol, as nongovernmental organizations affiliated with it.

title: Navy Tests Show Humidity in Stratosphere Rose 50% in the Last Six Years
description: Navy balloon flights into the stratosphere have shown that humidity in that extremely dry region has risen 50 per cent during the last six years.

title: Young Rebels' Violence Stirs Outrage in France
description: PARIS, May 27Signs of widespread outrage over vio lence by young dissidents are mounting here as the Govern ment presses efforts to stem a wave of property destruction and other acts of protest.

title: Kelley Released by Padres
description: SAN DIEGO, May 27 (UPI) Dick Kelley, plagued by a sore pitching arm, was released outright by the San Diego Pad res to Salt Lake City of the Pacific Coast League today to make room for Roberto Rodri guez, reliever purchased from the Oakland Athletes.

title: Wolman's The Dreamer, an Israeli Movie, Arrives
EXEMPTIONS URGED IN SENATE BANK BILL
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (UPI) Companies that own banks that produce less than half of their total income asked the Senate Banking Committee to day for exemption from legis lation intended to stem the creation of billiondollar bank dominated conglomerates.

title: Flags Mark Fund Drive
description: Those colorful flags flying on the highest skyscrapers along the main arteries of New York proclaim the beginning of the United Fund of Great er New York's second annu al campaign. Agencies sup ported by the United Fund are trying to meet the per tinent problems of our day drug addiction, foster care, adoption, daycare, heart dis ease, cancer.

title: BELMONTE TO RIDE IN JERSEY DERBY
description: CHERRY HILL, N. J., May 27 (UPI)  John Jacobs, the trainer, confirmed today that Eddie Belmonte would rise the Preakness winner, Personality, in Saturday's $100,000 added Jersey Derby at Garden State Park.

title: NEW ROCHELLE ENDS A POLICE SUSPENSION
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y., May 27 (UPI)  The suspension of a police captain here that led to the dismissal of the Police Com missioner was thrown out to day by a hearing officer.

title: Paul Hecht Gets Role
description: Paul Hecht has been signed for a leading role in The Roth schilds, the Hillard Elkins and Lester Osterman musical pro duction, which opens at the LuntFontanne Theater on Oct. 20. Keith Baxter, English actor, has been engaged to costar with Anthony Quayle in Sleuth, the Anthony Shaffer mystery opening Nov. 12 at the Music Box.

title: New York Hilton Set to Add Rooms
description: A 1,250room addition that will make the New York Hil ton the world's largest hotel will start to rise soon on the West 54th Street site of the George Abbott Theater.

title: Loew's Appoints Counsel
description: Jack Friedman has been ap pointed general counsel of the Loew's Corporation, it an nounced yesterday. Lester Pol lack, vice president and former general counsel, will be in charge of Loew's development activities and the SnyderLoew's joint real estate venture. He remains responsible for the law department.

title: Town Resists U.S. Edict
description: WARREN, Mich., May 27 (AP)The Warren City Coun cil, by a 5 to 2 vote, decided last night to reject a Federal requirement that this Detroit suburb establish a community board to deal with race and human relations problems. A proposed ardinance creating such a board was drafted by Department of Housing and Urban Development officials who warned the city that it faced the loss of Federal urban renewal grants if the ordinance not adonted.

title: Anthony Sansone, Spoke For Suburbs in Albany
description: MAMARONECK, N.Y., May 27Anthony Sansone, spokes man for Westchester County villages in the State Confer ence of Mayors for the last 21 years, died yesterday at his home, 640 Wood Street. He was 73 years old.

title: L.I. Girl, 3, Drowned
description: SEAFORD, L. I., May 27 (AP) Threeyearold Jill McMeni man, of Selden, L. I., was found drowned in a creek today be hind the home here of Joanne Ryan, where she was visiting with her Mother, Frances Mc Meniman, the police said.

title: DAVITS URGES SPEED IN WAR WITHDRAWAL
description: Senator Jacob K. Javits caller yesterday for an acceleration of the United States withdrawal from Vietnam and termed it the biggest single thing the Administration could do to re store business confidence and reverse the economic down trend.

title: AGNEW CRITICIZED BY CLOTHING UNION
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 27 The Amalgamated. Clothing Workers of America today criticized Vice President Agnew for public statements that the union contended threatened dissent, free speech and free dom of the press.

title: SUN OIL SEEKING CANADA CONCERN
description: The Sun Oil Company an nounced plans yesterday to buy 18million common shares of Great Canadian Oil Sands, Ltd., at $4.50 a share.

title: Post Wins Suspended Game And Takes League Crown
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., May 27C. W. Post College won the Knickerbocker Conference baseball championship today, defeating Adelphi University, 31, in the continuation of a protested game played May 5. Post finished the league sea son with an 80 wonlost rec ord, Adelphi with 71.

title: Scandinavians Take World Cup Rally
description: MEXICO CITY, May 27 (UPI) Hannu Mikkola of Finland and Gunnar Palm of Sweden finished in first place, an hour and 18 minutes ahead of their nearest rivals, today in the 16,000mile LondontoMexico City World Cup auto rally.

title: Pope Addresses G.I.'s
description: ROME, May 27 (AP)Pope Paul VI told a group of United States servicemen en route home from Vietnam today: We want to tell you how much we have prayed in favor of peace and how we want to see the end of the war and the affirma tion of love.

title: Fordham Chancellor Takes Post at Negro College
description: The Rev. Leo McLaughlin, the liberal priest who brought major reforms to Fordham University, announced yes terday that he was resigning as chancellor to become di rector of freshman studies at Johnson C. Smith Uni versity, a small, predomi nantly Negro institution in Charlotte, N. C.

title: JONES SCORES TWO ON HIT IN FOURTH
description: Gil Hodges, the genius, had an idea last night. He would bat Cleon Jones at leadoff and drop Tommie Agee to third in the batting orderjust for a change, as the manager put it.

title: Major League Leaders
description: Includes games of May 26

title: The President's Allies
description: American labor, like the nation at large, is divided in its views on the war in Vietnam and President Nixon's policies toward ending it. Jacob Potofsky, president of the Amalgamated Clothing Workers of America, this week described the American involve ment in Southeast Asia as a mortal threat to the nation's democratic processes; two days later, leaders of the building trades, longshoremen's and other unions called on Mr. Nixon to praise his military policies and promise continuing demonstrations in their support.

title: Heyerdahl Off Cape Yuby
description: COLLA MICHERI, Italy, May 27 (AP)The wife of Thor Heyerdahl, Norwegian explorer, said here today that he had radioed that his papyrus reed boat Ra II had rounded Cape Yuby off southwestern Moroc co and was headed toward the Canary Islands.

title: PACT EASES TENSION AT HARLEM SCHOOL
description: An agreement to ease ten sions at Junior High School 120 in Harlem was reached yester day, leaiing open the case of William B. King, who was sum marily dismissed as acting prin cipal May 14. The ensuing disorders caused the temporary closing of the school last week.

title: Jonathan Logan Sees Gain
description: Jonathan Logan, Inc., expects to have a rate of growth in sales and earnings in fiscal 1970 that will be equal to the 10 per cent to 15 per cent growth rate for last year, Rich ard J. Schwartz, president, told the annual meeting yesterday. He said that the second quarter would have similar results as the first quarter when the growth rate was 11 per cent.

title: Stage: Awake and Sing!
description: Of all the important play wrights of the thirties, Clif ford Odets, the playwright of the thirties, would seem least likely to survive revival in 1970. Wasn't he, after all, mired as well as admired in his times?

title: Segregation Move Voided
description: RALEIGH, N. C., May 27 (AP)  A Federal District Court ruled yesterday, that leg islation creating three largely white separate school systems in heavily black Halifax and Warren counties of north eastern North Carolina was un constitutional.

title: JOSHUA E. MATZ, 71, YESHIVA TREASURER
description: Prof. Joshua E. Matz, treas urer of Yeshiva University and a member of the faculty and administration there for almost 50 years, died Tuesday at Al bert Einstein College Hospital. He was 71 years old and lived at 320 East 176th Street, the Bronx.

title: Ashe Wins, Hewitt Toppled
description: PARIS, May 27 (AP)Ar thur Ashe and Cliff Richey moved into the third round of the $100,000 French open ten nis championship today, but Charlie Pasarell, Jim McManus, Tom Gorman and Barry Mac Kay of the United States were beaten.

title: BOAC Jumbo Jet Service Delayed by Pilot Dispute
description: LONDON, May 27  wo Boeing 747 jumbo jets stood silently today in a maintenance area of London's Heathrow Air port, the focus of a labor dis pute between airline pilots fly ing the 360seat aircraft and the British Overseas Airways Corporation.

title: Heckscher Will Hold Up Work On 2 Tunnels in Central Park
description: City Parks Administrator August Heckscher said last night that he would refuse to grant a permit to construct the controversial subway tunnels underneath Central Park until he was satisfied that both in design and construction every measure has been taken to pro tect the park and the park users.

title: U.S. WON'T PRESS CAMPAIGN CHARGES
description: WASHINGTON, May 27The Justice Department has notified members of Congress that it will not prosecutepolitical corn mittes and candidates for al leged 1968 violations of the Federal Corrupt Practices Act.

title: A Staten Island Resident Sues Over Bus Fumes
description: A $250,000 damage suit has been filed against the Metro politan Transportation Au thority charging that the idling engines of diesel buses at a Staten Island bus depot violate a constitutional right to breathe clean air.

title: Wayne Hays Plans to Seek Leadership Post in House
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (UPI) Representative Wayne L. Hays, Democrat of Ohio, an nounced today his candidacy for Democratic House leader next year.

title: N.C.A.A. District Baseball Starts at Princeton Today
description: The National Collegiate Ath letic Association's District II baseball championship will open at Princeton University today. The winner will repre sent the district at the College World Series in Omaha June 12 through 19.

title: Transcript of Nixon Talk Before Billy Graham Rally at University of Tennessee
description: Following is the transcript of President Nixon's remarks at the Billy Graham Rally in Knoxville, Tenn., last night, as recorded by The New York Times through the facilities of A.B.C. News:

title: Construction Contracts Stayed Stable in April
description: The seasonally adjusted Dodge index of nationwide con structioncontract value was 203 in April, the fifth consecu tive month that it remained above 200. It was 208 in March. The index, in which 195759 contracts equal 100, is about the only principal business in dicator that has shown such stability and strength in recent months.

title: Schools and Many Businesses To Mark Memorial Day Today
description: The city's public and paro chial schools and many of its commercial and government of fices will be closed today in ob servance of Memorial Day, which is tomorrow. Banks and major stock exchanges, however, are to stay open and there will be normal mail service.

title: Maoist Students in Paris Battle Police Second Day
description: PARIS, May 28Maoist student rioting swept the Latin Quarter for the second successive day today, and the police occupied a university building to keep rioters from smash ing laboratory equipment.

title: Goldberg Accuses Rockefeller In L.I. School Budget Crisis
description: Arthur J. Goldberg said yes terday that Governor Rockefel ler was responsible for a school crisis on Long Island, asserting that cuts in state aid for education had forced a tax load on Communities that they were unable to bear.

title: Julie Heldman, Rosemary Casals and Kristy Pigeon Victors in Paris Tennis
description: PARIS, May 28 (AP)Fourth seeded Julie Heldman of New York led a trio of American Women into the third round of the French open tennis cham pionships today.

title: Burns Promises Economic Credit to U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, May 28 Arthur F. Burns has pledged that the Federal Reserve Board, acting as a lender of last re sort, would not let the econo my collapse because of a short age of ready funds in banks or other financial institutions.

title: White House Panel Bids Nixon Set Up an Environment Agency
description: WASHINGTON, May 28  A White House advisory panel has recommended to President Nix on that environmental programs now distributed among several departments be combined in a new independent agency.

title: UNBEATEN HUNTER TAKES SHOW TITLE
description: DEVON, Pa., May 28It didn't mean a thing, but Mr. and Mrs. J. Markley Freed's Best Chance won the second year green working hunter stake at the Devon Horse Show today. It was something like a football team running up a big score against a weak op ponent.

title: Samuels and the Legislature
description: As the frantic closing hours of the 1970 session of the New York State Legislature demonstrated once again, the lawmaking process desperately needs reform.

title: GOULD SEES PERIL TO UNIVERSITIES
description: ALBANY, May 28 (AP) Samuel B. Gould, who will be stepping down as Chancellor of the State University of New York next fall, warned today that the greatest challenge of the times was the growing assault on reason.

title: Advertising: Corporate Communication
description: About nine months ago the New York headquarters office of J. Walter Thompson set up a Corporate Commu nications Group.

title: State U. College Head Named
description: ALBANY, May 28 (AP)Dr. John D. Maguire, who won na tional honors for his teaching at Wesleyan University, will become president of the State University College at Old West bury, L. I., on July 1, it was announced today. Dr. Maguire will succeed Harris L. Wofford J??., in the $30,000ayear post.

title: Leo O'Brien Hurdles Brother's Foul Claim at Belmont
description: Rides Augustus Bay to 3Length Victory Over Profile.

title: Secrecy Criticized In Bank of England
description: LONDON, May 28An all party committee of members of Parliament today criticized the Bank of England, the vener able symbol of British financial power, as too secretive and as a law unto itself.

title: Grand Ole Opry Is Yielding to Change
description: NASHVILLE  The Grand Old Opry discovered Amer ica about the time America discovered the Opry, and neither has been quite the same since.

title: Mets' Slugger Runs From Under His Hats, but Cardinal's Quick Recovery of Wide Throw Wins Race to First
INTERNATIONAL LEAGUE
description: WEDNESDAY NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Washington: For the Record
Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Daylight Saving Time

title: Bridge:
description: The start of the 41st East ern Regional Championships at the New York Hilton this afternoon marks the focal point of the tournament year for enthusiasts in the metro politan area.

title: LaboratoryProduced Diamond Of Gem Quality Made by G.E.
description: The General Electric Com pany has succeeded in produc ing diamonds of gem quality in its laboratories. But the com pany doesn't really know what to do with them yet.

title: KUHN'S OBJECTIVE: SOUND ECONOMICS
description: Commissioner Bowie Kuhn insisted yesterday that collec tive bargaining was the only satisfactory method for mak ing any changes in baseball's reserve clause, and that the totality of players are better off in the present system, as his crossexamination was completed in Curt Flood's an titrust suit in Federal Court here.

title: LEFTISTS SWEEP CEYLON ELECTION
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, May 28 A threeparty leftist coalition headed by Mrs. Sirimavo Ban daranaike won an overwhelm ing victory in the general elec tion yesterday, dealing a crushing defeat to the govern ing conservative alliance of Prime Minister Dudley Sena nayake.

title: Mrs. Huey P. Long Dead at 78; Served a Short Time as Senator
description: WASHINGTON, May 28 (AP) Mrs. Rose McDonnell Long, widow of Senator Huey P. Long, died last night at her daughter's home in Boulder, Colo., Senator Allen J. Ellender, Democrat of Louisiana, an nounced in the Senate today. She was 78 years old. Cancer was given as the cause of death.

title: U.S. WAR DEATHS AT 142 FOR WEEK; A DECLINE OF 35%
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 28  The allied com mands reported today that American combat deaths de clined by 35 per cent last week while the number of South Vietnamese soldiers killed rose by 25 per cent.

title: H. KENNETH PHILIPS
description: H. Kenneth Philips, who re tired as treasurer and vice president of the Nestl Com pany, Inc., in White Plains in 1967, died Wednesday at his home in Hilton Head, S. C. He was 67 years old.

title: Cooking at Home? Two Recipes for the Weekend
description: In the menus below, dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe.

title: Vicki I. Meduna Married in Albany
description: ALBANY, May 28Miss Vicki Irene Meduna was married this morning to Dr. Spencer Silverbach at Con gregation Beth Emeth. Rabbi Bernard H. Bloom performed the ceremony.

title: The Home Comes First, but College Degree Is a Close Second
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I.The whole mob will attend Lillian Gardner's commence ment on June 7. At least a dozen mem bers of her family, including her husband, her 5yearold granddaughter and her six children (one of whom, a 22yearold son, will be receiving a business ad ministration degree at the same time) will be on hand when Mrs. Gardner is awarded her bachelor of arts degree from the University of Rhode Island.

title: MRS. GORDON C. ROBERTS
description: UNION, N. J., May 28Mrs. Edith O. Roberts, an art teach er at the VailDeane School in Elizabeth for many years, died yesterday at St. James Hospital, Newark, after a short illness. She was the wife of Gordon C. Roberts. She was 51 years old and lived at 738 Fairway Drive.

title: CATHOLIC SCHOOLS GET STRIKE THREAT
description: Lay teachers of the 39 Cath olic high schools of Brooklyn and Queens voted yesterday to strike in September unless their contract demands are met.

title: HAAREN HIGH SHUT AFTER DISORDERS
description: Haaren High School was closed yesterday morning after a student was arrested on charges of assaulting a police man, fires burned briefly in two classrooms and students started a fire in the principal's auto mobile.

title: Speeding the Mails
description: Modernizing the mails moves a long step closer to accomplishment with the approval of a postal reform bill by the Senate Post Office Committee. The bill contains some unfortunate features, but these are outweighed by the certainty that, when harmonized with the parallel measure under consideration in the House, it will bring important gains in postal efficiency.

title: Jersey Family Wins $250,000 in Lottery
description: The New York State lot tery's highest prize$250, 000was won yesterday by a New Jersey man and his family.

title: At 65, He Turns to Hippie Fashions
description: At an age when most men are thinking of retirement, 65yearold Henry Lish is on a youth kick. His latest ven ture is in the field of junior sportswear; under the Geroni mo label, he's turning out ??ippieinspired separates that are sellnig like Bob Dylan records.

title: Festival at I.S. 201 Offers Masks, Films and Beliefs
description: Intermediate School 201 in East Harlem held a spring festival dedicated to seren dipity yesterday but, as might be expected there, the exercises led to further ex pressions of black and Puerto Rican consciousness.

title: MALTHE HASSELRIIS, PAINTED MINIATURES
description: Malthe Hasselriis, an illustra tor and portrait painter known for his miniature portraits, died Tuesday on vacation in Gen tofte, Denmark. He was 82 years old and had lived for the last 50 years in Forest Hills Gardens, Queens.

title: DEERE EARNINGS DECLINE SHARPLY
description: Deere & Co. showed sharply lower profits in the quarter and six months ended April 30 with somewhat higher sales, reflecting reduced domestic farmequipment purchases in the face of record farmcash receipts in 1969 and 1970, Wil liam A. Hewitt, chairman, re ported yesterday.

title: U.S. MARITIME PANEL REJECTS SOVIET BID
description: WASHINGTON, May 28  The Federal Maritime Commis sion rejected today a bid by Soviet merchant shipping to gain a foothold in the $40bil lionayear oceanborne United States trade.

title: 173 YACHTS START BLOCK ISLAND SAIL
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., May 28 American Eagle, the former 12Meter yacht, was given the start timed to splitsecond per fection today when the 25th annual Block Island race of the Storm Trysail Club began.

title: Theodorakis Has Operation
description: ROME, May 28 (UPI)Mikis Theodorakis, the Greek com poser whose music in the movie Z won an Academy Award this year, underwent an appendectomy today. Doctors said his condition was good. The leftist composer was al lowed to leave Greece last month after months of impris onment for his political beliefs.

title: ProSihanouk Meeting Reported
description: HONG KONG, May 28Fur ther evidence that part of Prince Sihanouk's government in exile is operating within Cambodia was provided today by reports of a meeting of members and supporters of the regime in a liberated area of the country.

title: Market Place
description: Dr. Albert Ellis, well known psychotherapist and author on sex, dropped back on his couch and waved his caller to a chair.

title: Indonesia Badminton Victor
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, May 28 (AP)Indonesia took a 40 lead today in the quarter final Thomas Cup badminton match against New Zealand and needs only one more vic tory to qualify for the semi final against Canada, the Amer ican zone champion.

title: Stans Expecting a Move By Japan on Textile Talks
description: WASHINGTON, May 28Sec retary of Commerce Maurice H. Stans is expecting word from the Japanese Government in the next three days on whether a meeting should be held to pursue talks on limiting ex ports of textiles from Japan, he disclosed today.

title: Falbright Describes Ky As an Asian Agnew
description: WASHINGTON, May 28 (AP)Senator J. W. Ful bright, describing Vice Presi dent Nguyen Cao Ky of South Vietnam as an Asian Ag new, charged today that Sai gon's leaders were determined to keep the Americans mired in the swamp of Cambodia.

title: Foreign Affairs: Mr. Micawber's Formula
description: PARIS  Despite computers and polls it is hard to calculate the real issues in next month's British election but the indica tions are that personality and prosperity will be the basic factors. In both of these the incumbent Labor party seems to hold an advantage.

title: Lesson in Busing Case
description: WASHINGTON, May 28 Yesterday's ruling by a Federal Appeals Court that Southern cities may retain some allblack schools points up how import ant Administration policy is in the judicial enforcement of school desegregation. The ruling, by the United State's Court of Appeals for the Fourth Cir cuit, also suggests how difficult, prac tically, it would now, be for the Supreme Court to override that pol icy. An immediate appeal of the case to the Supreme Court is expected, and the outcome could have a farreaching effect in scores of Southern urban desegregation cases now pend ing in the Federal courts.

title: June 6 Fair to Aid Phelps Hospital
description: NORTH TARRYTOWN, N. Y., May 28The annual fair of the auxiliary of Phelps Memorial Hospital will be held June 6 on the hospital grounds here. It will be part of Tarrytown Centennial Week.

title: WILLIAM J. SHULTZ OF BARUCH SCHOOL
description: Dr. William J. Shultz, econo mist and author, who retired in 1964 as professor of business administration at the Bernard M. Baruch School of Business Administration of the City Uni versity of New York, died Saturday of a heart attack in Camden, Me. He was 68 years old and lived in New Harbor, Me.

title: Mrs. Crimmins Again Pleads Not Guilty in Murder
description: Mrs. Alice Crimmins, obviously under emotional strain, pleaded not guilty yesterday in Queens Supreme Court to the stran gling in 1965 of her 4yearold daughter, Alice Marie, begin ning what may be her second trial.

title: A BOMB GOES OFF AT ROCKEFELLER U.
description: A pipe bomb exploded yes terday at the rear of a small, secondfloor lecture hall on the cloistered Rockefeller Univer sity campus, shattering six windows and showering frag ments of glass onto the walk way below.

title: News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, MAY 29, 1970

title: Books of The Times
description: How can one not forgive Louis Kronen berger for his public autobiography, No Whippings, No Gold Watches. There is, for instance, the story he tellsapropos of becoming Time magazine's theater Criticabout his boyhood playgoing days in Cincinnati. At one Saturday matinee he was admitted to an empty front balcony box, where pres ently he began playing piano on the wide plush ledge, as any his trionic boy might do. Up and down the ledge I ex ecuted runs and crossed hands; banged chords and crossed hands; at tempted trills and crossed hands; and at length three times crossed hands, and con cluded. Exactly one second later the entire balcony burst into an absolute thunder of applausean ovation so unanticipated and overpowering as to have the terrifying force of a violent elec tric shock ... that sent me halfslink ing, halfreeling out of the box and, in flight and panic, out of the theater. How can one criticize a man who tells a story like that?

title: The Theater
description: Seth Allen is an actor of great elasticityin several senses of the word. He can bend his talent as well as his body, and distort himself into the most grotesque, hugely comic characters.

title: Grand Jurors Say Mitchell Prevents A Graft Indictment
description: BALTIMORE, May 28  At torney General John N. Mitchell was strongly criticized by a special Federal grand jury to day for refusing to authorize new indictments based on the panel's investigation of Gov ernment corruption.

title: Unveilings
description: ESTERMANSolomon 1., unveiling, on Sunday May 31 at 1:00 P.M. at Congregation B'nai Israel Cemetery, Midland Ave., Saddle Brook, N. J.

title: Age Could Be Served at Indianapolis
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 28 What happens to a race driv er after he passes the age of 40?

title: Thant Plans European Trip
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., May 28Secretary General Thant plans to leave June 14 for a visit to London, the Hague and Moscow. He Is to address the Royal Common wealth Society in London and attend a World Food Congress in The Hague.

title: OHIO WITHDRAWS TROOPS AT O.S.U.
description: The approximately 1,700 members of the Ohio National Guard remaining on the recent ly embattled Ohio State Uni versity campus were withdrawn last night, after a day in which student demonstrators pelted them with marshmallows.

title: A Portrait of Madison Attracts Descendants to the White House
description: WASHINGTON, May 28 The East Room of the White House was blue with Presiden tial bloodlines todayone sit ting President, two First Ladies, 11 descendants of James Mad ison and two of James Monroe.

title: Armstrong to Recall Tires
description: WASHINGTON, May 28 (UPI) The Transportation Depart ment said today the Armstrong Rubber Company has agreed to recall 15,000 passenger car tires that were manufactured in 1968 and found unsafe in laboratory tests. The tires are 7.3514, Armstrong Coronet, fourply nylon. Owners may identify the tires by checking serial num bers. They have the numeral 8 as the sixth symbol and the letters A, D, E, G, H, R, T, U or Y as the last symbol.

title: Hathaway Is Given Up By Ogilvy & Mather
description: Hathaway, whose man with  the  eyepatch advertis ing helped make Ogilvy & Mather famous, has been re signed by the agency. The C. F. Hathaway Company, a division of Warnaco, had been a client for 18 years.

title: Arrest of Soccer Player Stirs British Fans' Anger
description: LONDON, May 28Virtually all sections of the British pub lic reacted with mounting anger today over the arrest in Bogota, Colombia, of Bobby Moore, the golden boy of British soccer.

title: SAMUEL PLESSER
description: Samuel Plesser, founder and chairman of Plesser's appliance stores in New Hyde Park, Babylon and Patchogue, L. I., died yesterday in North Shore Hospital, Manhasset, L. I, He was 84 years old and lived at 15 Stoner Avenue, Great Neck, L. I.

title: Women's Unit Planning Tours. For Next Week
description: The National Council of Women of the United States has scheduled its eighth an nual Country and City Art Tour for next Tuesday and Wednesday.

title: HAGUE DRIVES IN 5 RUNS ON 4 HITS
description: Somebody has been telling lies about Bob Gibson. Some body has been accusing him of losing ball games, not strik ing out many batters, having a high earnedrun average.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: NAGS HEAD, N. C.  A gentle wind came through the open windows of our room at the Carolinian Motor Ho tel, forming beads of mois ture on the screens and carry ing with it the sound and smell of the sea.

title: MRS. M. I. GREGERSEN, FOUNDATION LEADER
description: Mrs. Georgiane Schenck Gregersen of Englewood, N. J., executive director of the Inter national Foundation, died late Wednesday in an automobile collision near Parry Sound, Ontario.

title: More Than Rhetoric
description: I was hungry, said the Rev. Leo McLaughlin hungry for direct involvement with students in the front lines of social action. It was this drive to be in the vanguard of constructive change, which in the past marked his activities at Fordham University, that has prompted him to resign his post as that institu tion's chancellor and to become director of freshman studies at Johnson C. Smith University, a small Negro college in Charlotte, N. C.

title: Parachuting Coed Killed
description: ORANGE, Mass., May 28 (AP) A Boston University coed making her 12th sports para chute jump was killed last night when she plunged into woods near Orange Municipal Airport. She was identifed as Laura Goldenberg, 21 years old, of Scarsdale, N. Y.

title: JOSEPH NEITLICH, 78, EXCOURT REPORTER
description: Joseph Neitlich, who retired in 1959 as chief court reporter of the State Supreme Court, First Department, here, died Wednesday in Hallandale, Fla., where he lived. His age was 78.

title: CHAIRMAN QUITS STANDARDS POST
description: M. Milton Glass announced his resignation yesterday as chairman of the city's Board of Standards and Appeals.

title: From Grief to Power
description: Once Sirimavo Bandara naike spoke through tears, and those who opposed her dismissed her as a political novice and dubbed her the weeping widow, a title she detested.

title: U.N. URGED TO LEAD ENVIRONMENT FIGHT
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., May 28A Conference on Hu man Survival here attended by scientists and statesmen urged the United Nations today to assume leadership in control ling the manmade environ mental menace.

title: TURNOUT IS LIGHT IN SCHOOL VOTING
description: John C. Helenore, Mrs. Kim Sim Chiu and John V. Lindsay helped make history yesterday. They, along with thousands of other Manhattan residents, took part in the first community school board elections held in the borough under the school decentralization law.

title: SORENSEN ASSAILS NIXON ON MIDEAST
description: At a synagogue luncheon in the financial district yesterday, Theodore C. Sorensen spoke out for the use of the White HouseKremlin hot line to warn the Soviet Union against ag gression in the Middle East.

title: MUSKIE SAYS NIXON IS DIVIDING NATION
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 28 Senator Edmund S. Muskie to day accused the Nixon Admin istration of dividing the nation and threatening democracy by its military and economic policies.

title: DU PONT MERGER BID REJECTED BY BLAIR
description: The 16 board members of Blair & Co. met yesterday afternoon and rejected a mer ger proposal from the broker age firm of Francis I. du Pont & Co. as unacceptable.

title: AGNEW PREDICTS ECONOMIC UPTURN
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I., May 28  Vice President Agnew sought to reassure the financial community today by predicting that 1970 is going to be a good year for business, with an upturn in the second half.

title: Major League Baseball
description: Friday, May 29, 1970

title: Canadian Bill Rates Fall
description: OTTAWA, May 28 (Canadian Press)The Government today auctioned $150million of new 91day Treasury bills at an average price of 98.443 and average yield of 6.34 per cent, campared with last week's 98.415 and 6.46 per cent. To day's $40million of 182day bills brought 96.931 and 6.35 per cent, against last week's 96.878 and 6.46 per cent.

title: LARGE BANKS HELD OPPOSING CURBS
description: WASHINGTON, May 28 (UPI)  An association of 6,500 small banks said today that big bank systems want Congress to postpone new bankregulating legislation because they have the taste of power and they want more.

title: Slovak Zion Synod Elects
description: HAZLETON Pa., May 28 (AP) The Rev. John Zornan, presi dent of the Slovak Zion Synod of the Lutheran Church in America, was reelected presi dent at the synod's convention held here yesterday.

title: HICKMAN'S CLOUT DEFEATS PIRATES
description: CHICAGO, May 28 (AP) Jim Hickman's tworun homer in the ninth inning, his second of the game, gave the Chicago Pittsburgh an 87 victory over the Pittcburgh Pirates today.

title: M'GANNON BACKS CUT IN PRIME TIME
description: Listening at length to Donald H. McGannon is like, being tossed to a pack of roaring urban planners. One is be sieged with talk of renewal and rehabilitation and re building and thoughts of West Side brownstones fill one's head until one realizes that what he wants to reconstruct is evening commercial television.

title: NIXON EMPHASIZES YOUTH CAN EFFECT PEACEFUL CHANGE
description: Transcript of Nixon's speech is printed on Page 8.

title: Department Comment
description: WASHINGTON, May 28The Justice Department answered inquiries today about the Fed eral grand jury action in Balti more by saying only that the unidentified investigation at is sue there would be reviewed further.

title: S.E. Graham Jr. to Wed Miss Kathryn Graham
description: CHAPPAQUA, N. Y., May 28Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Malcolm Graham of Chappa qua and North Palm Beach, Fla., have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Kathryn Virginia Graham, to Stuart Edward Graham Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Graham of Forty Fort, Pa. The families are not re lated. An August wedding is planned.

title: Article 1  No Title
Yovicsin to Step Down as Coach Of Harvard Eleven After 1970
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., May 28  John Yovicsin, who has coached Harvard football longer than anyone else in its 96year history, will step down from that position at the end of his 14th season this fall on the advice of his physicians, university officials said today.

title: HADASSAH GIVEN A GRANT BY U. S.
description: The Agency for International Development, a State Depart ment bureau, yesterday allo cated $4,850,000 to Hadassah, the Women's Zionist Organiza tion of America, to expand its medical research and activity in Israel.

title: Dance: Balanchine's New Firebird
description: It was 20 years ago, give or take a month or so, that I first saw George Balanchine's version of Firebird. I did not care for it at all, and last night, understandably, Mr. Balanchine at the New York State Theater presented a completely, or almost com pletely, new version. I did not like that either, but at least Mr. Balanchine was showing willingness.

title: SOUTHWEST STUDY FINDS BIAS IN JOBS
description: WASHINGTON, May 28 The Federal Government was given a share of the blame for job discrimination against MexicanAmericans in the Southwest in a study released today by the Equal Employ ment Opportunity Commission.

title: HelpWantedAd Index Down Sharply in April
description: The helpwanted index fell sharply in April, according to the National. Industrial Con ference Board. At the end of the month it stood at 186 per cent of the 195759 average, 8 points below the March reading and 48 points under the level of April, 1969.

title: Wholesale Cost Increased
description: Cigarette smokers will short ly have to pay a minimum of two cents a pack more for most of their favorite brands.

title: Air Force Weighing Changes In Wing of C5A Cargo Plane
description: The Air Force is considering further changes in the wing of the Lockheed C5A cargo plane that would enable it to with stand more rigorous operations than originally called for, re liable sources said yesterday.

title: The Screen: Ingmar Bergman's The Passion of Anna
description: Andreas Winkelman (Max von Sydow) is repairing the roof of the cottage in which he lives as a literate hermit. At one point, he stares off at the sun that hangs low and dimwith its edges made ragged by a telephoto lensin the Scandinavian sky. Suddenly the sun dis appears into the grayblue haze, but it's as if Andreas had willed it invisible, much as he has tried to will him ?? invisible without taking the ultimate step.

title: A Correction
description: In an item appearing in edi tions of May 16 of The New York Times the Fifth Avenue Coach Lines, Inc., was de scribed as the bankrupt for mer bus company. This was stated in error. The company is not in bankruptcy. A receiv ertrustee, S. Hazard Gillespie, was appointed in an action by the Securities and Exchange Commission under the Invest ment Company Act of 1940 and no bankruptcy or other insol vency proceddings are pending. A postponed annual meeting is scheduled for June 15.

title: Suharto Invites Foreign Capital
description: President Suharto of Indo nesia said here last night that his Government favored private foreign investment as a means of speeding his country's eco nomic development.

title: Patriotic Town Is Angry Over Teachers' Protest
description: PLAINFIELD, Ind., May 27 In the Buick showroom, a salesman was listening with affability and patienceatti tudes that sometimes wear thin in this rigidly conserva tive townas a longhaired young customer in shorts and sandals, expounded on the dangers of pollution. Above their heads a cardboard sign spun in the air conditioning cur rents, periodically displaying the message that the 1970 Buick was Something To Believe In.

title: Relic of Civilization
description: The Vietnam wars of this century, involving Japa riese, French, Americans and Vietnamese, have left more than enough ruins in Indochina. These ruins we could do without; but there is one ruin, from another century, that we could not do without. It is of course Angkor Wat, potentially endangered by extension of the war into Cambodia.

title: Israeli Cabinet Beset by Controversy Over a Convert's Status
description: TEL AVIV, May 28The case of an American woman who converted to Judaism in 1967 poses a new problem for Pre mier Golda Meir's coalition Gov ernment.

title: Lockheed Wins Contract
description: WASHINGTON, May 28 (AP) The award of a $79,389,235 contract to the Lockheed Air craft Corporation, Burbank, Calif., was announced today. The contract is for production of P3C antisubmarine patrol aircraft.

title: South African Promises Ruling Soon on 22 Captives
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, May 28Twentytwo Af ricans who have been under detention are to be charged or released within a few days, Justice Minister Piet Pelser said here today.

title: ERNEST VAN FOSSAN, EXTAX COURT JUDGE
description: WASHINGTON, May 28 Ernest H. Van Fossan, a retired judge of the United States Tax Court, died yesterday at his home in Lisbon, Ohio. He was 81 years old.

title: Helen Woodward to Be Bride Of Robert F. Boyd on Aug. 22
description: PRINCETON, N. J., May 28 Mrs. J. Taylor Woodward has announced the engage ment of her daughter, Miss Helen McNeil Woodward, to Robert Froome Boyd, son of Mr. and Mrs. J. Cookman Boyd Jr. of Baltimore, and Fisher Island. N. Y.

title: W. H. FAWCETT JR., HEADED PUBLISHER
description: NORWALK, Conn., May 28 Wilford H. Fawcett Jr., chair man of the board of Fawcett Publications, died early today at Norwalk Hospital. He was 61 years old and lived at 335 Chestnut Hill Road here.

title: Mrs. Dempsey's 75 for 238 Gains Cross County Crown
description: GREAT NECK, L.I., May 28 Mrs. Thorne Dempsey, Pip ing Rock, the metropolitan champion, finished with a 36, 3975 for a total of 238 to win the 20th Women's Cross County Golf Association's 54 hole medalplay championship at the Fresh Meadow Country Club today. Par for the 5,876 yard course is 37, 3774.

title: Birds Fly in V Formation to Extend a Helping Wing
description: Two specialists in aerody namics have concluded that large migrating birds fly in V formations because in that way each bird boosts the other, in creasing their flight range as much as 71 per cent.

title: All Trading Halted In Consolidated Oil
description: WASHINGTON, May 28 (AP)  The Securities and Ex change Commission today suspended all trading in stocks of the Consolidated Oil and Gas Company of Denver while it clarifies its role in the pur chase of Canadian oil permits.

title: The Leading Entries
description: Hammer ThrowDeWitt Davies, Bill Din nen, Dick Narcessian, Ed Nosal.

title: Victim of IND Crash In Which Two Died Sues for $1Million
description: A $1milllion damage suit for injuries in the May 20 IND subway crash in Jackson Heights, Queens, in which two persrms were killed and 71 hurt, was filed in State Su preme Court here yesterday. The plaintiff is a 56yearold lithographer, Ephraim Harvard of 6771 152d Street, Flushing, Queens.

title: Going Public Delayed By Interpublic Group
description: Stockholders attending the annual meeting of the Inter public Group of Companies Tuesday were told that the company would delay going public, according to a person close to the power structure.

title: SAMUELS DERIDES GOLDBERG'S DRIVE
description: BUFFALO, May 28  How ard J. Samuels charged today that Arthur J. Goldberg was running scared in their con test for the Democratic nomin ation for Governor and that Mr. Goldberg and his campaign aides were putting increasing pressure on party leaders to win their support.

title: Antiwar Concert Monday
description: Misha Dichter, pianist; Itzhak Pearlman, violinist, and Walter Trampler, violist, will appear in a concert Monday night at the Juilliard Theater at Lincoln Center for the benefit of the National Coalition for a Re sponsible Congress, the anti Vietnam war organization. The performers will be supported by the Juilliard Theater Orches tra.

title: TV Limits on Addonizio Are Disclosed
description: NEWARK, May 28  City Hall officials disclosed yester day that Mayor Hugh J. Ad donizio was being denied a major share of New York tele vision coverage of his campaign for reelection here because of his refusal to comply with an order by the United States At torney's office not to discuss his impending trial.

title: WILLIAM J. PACHLER, UTILITY UNION HEAD
description: WASHINGTON, May 26  William J. Pachler, president of the Utility Workers Union of America, died here yesterday after a long illness. He was 65 years old and lived in nearby Kensington, Md.

title: KENNEDY PHONE LOG DISCLOSED BY COURT
description: BOSTON, May 28 (UPI)A telephone call to Mrs. Aristotle Onassis' Cape Cod home, charged to Senator Edward M. Kennedy's credit card, was made shortly after Mr. Ken nedy reported his automobile crash in which Mary Jo Kopechne died, documents showed today.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Market Summary
description: (Volume 6,819,240 shares)

title: An Asian Policy for Cambodia
description: Extension of the Indochina war to Cambodia has been sharply criticized by one of the most important Asian leaders friendly to the United States.

title: J. WHITING FRIEL
description: JENKINTOWN, Pa., May 28 J. Whiting Friel, who retired as executive vice president of Standard Pressed Steel Com pany in 1957, died yesterday. He was 78 years old.

title: COMMERCE AIDE FOR IMPORT CURB
description: A senior official of the Com merce Department made a sur prise appearance yesterday at the annual meeting of the Amer ican Iron and Steel Institute, where he expressed whole hearted support for the indus try's campaign to restrict im ports of foreign steel.

title: Hospital Lists Sawchuk In Critical Condition Again
description: Terry Sawchuk, 40yearold goalie for the New York Rangers, was listed in critical condition again yesterday in the intensive care unit at Long Beach Memorial Hospital.

title: Rogers Termed Pleased
description: ROME, May 28  United States officials said today that Secretary of State William P. Rogers, who left for Madrid this afternoon, had been pleased with the outcome of the meet ing of NATO foreign ministers.

title: Rogers Avoiding Spanish Oppositionists
description: MADRID, May 28A group of distinguished Spanish opposi tion figures who had asked to meet Secretary of State Wil liam C. Rogers to discuss nego tiations on American bases in Spain were advised by the American embassy today to write a letter instead.

title: CONSTRUCTION BAN SOUGHT IN JERSEY
description: TRENTON, May 28 New Jersey officials disclosed tonight that the State Attorney Gen eral was seeking a court order that would outlaw any further construction in 29 northern New Jersey communities until they stopped polluting New York Harbor.

title: PANTHERS ASK COURT TO SUPPRESS TAPES
description: Lawyers for 13 Black Pan thers moved yesterday to sup press for use as evidence at their trial tapes secretly made of conversations between them and police informants.

title: Audie Murphy Is Held On Complaint of Fight
description: BURBANK, Calif., May 28 (AP)Audie Murphy was booked for investigation of assault with intent to commit murder today in connection with a fight he allegedly had May 18 with a doe trainer.

title: Washington: Graduation Day1970
description: WASHINGTON, May 28  This is the season when the President and members of his Cabinet usually show up at the university graduation exercises to explain the facts of life to the departing scholars, but this year things are a little differ ent. The graduates are explain ing the facts of life to them.

title: Gergley Resigns Mat Post
description: BUFFALO, May 28 (AP) Gerry Gergley resigned today as head wrestling coach of the State University at Buffalo.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, May 28 The Bureau of Labor Statistics reported today the following spot primary prices for the week ended May 26:

title: If You Like Pizza Or Want Tonkatsu
description: A selective list of restau rants in New York and vicin ity is given on this page on Friday. Thee restaurants are rated four stars to none, based on the relationship of food and service to cost. Credit cards are honored in the restaurants where it is indicated.

title: PRICES RISE AGAIN IN AMEX TRADING
description: This may be really the start of something.

title: U.S. DROPS 600 CASES OF DRAFT EVASION
description: WASHINGTON, May 28 (UPI) The Justice Department gave United States Attorneys blanket authority last Jan. 30 to dismiss draft evasion charges against men who had been declared de linquent and listed for accel erated induction because of antiwar protest activities.

title: I.O.S Is Reticent
description: GENEVA, May 28Investors Overseas Services declined to elaborate on a statement it issued today about the Securi ties and Exchange Commis sion's refusal to grant a stay of its 1967 order denying I.O.S. companies the right to operate in the United States.

title: Women's Liberationist Hails the Prostitute
description: A call for members of the women's liberation movement to recognize prostitutes as the most courageous leaders of the revolution against male domi nation highlighted an allday conference here yesterday to explore woman's changing role in society.

title: Miss Deborah H. Johnston Wed
description: SUMMIT, N. J., May 28 Miss Deborah Hawes John ston and Kevin Clark were married today in the chapel of the Central Presbyterian Church by the Rev. Robert H. Stephens.

title: Market Averages
description: Thursday, May 28, 1960

title: Red Cross Enables Kin To Visit Greek Prisoners
description: ATHENS, May 28The In ternational Red Cross enabled the impoverished families of 149 Greek political prisoners to visit them at their camps on the Aegean island of Loros to day.

title: Rumanian Leaves for Soviet
description: VIENNA, May 28 (AP)Pre mier Ion Gheorghe Maurer of Rumania left Bucharest today on a surprise visit to the Soviet Union, Agerpres, the Rumanian press agency, reported.

title: MEXICAN SOCCER ACE SUFFERS BROKEN LEG
description: MEXICO CITY, May 28  With only four days until the opening of the World Cup championship, the Mexican na tional soccer team has been shaken by the loss of one of its key players.

title: In Memoriam
description: DUFFYJames Edmund: On your birthday darling my thoughts seek you as the waves that seek the shore for your infinite wisdom, love and strength have afforded me memories that will last forever.

title: Prostitutes Most of Them Young, Now Work the Day Shift Along Eighth Avenue
description: Ladies of the evening in New York have switched to the afternoon.

title: MOSCOW IS COOL TO OFFER BY NATO
description: MOSCOW, May 28  The Soviet Union, in its first public assessment of the meeting in Rome of the Foreign Ministers of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, reacted coolly to day to the proposal for East West talks on a reduction of forces in Europe.

title: 4 Dead and 5 Missing in Oil Blast Off Texas Coast
description: GALVESTON, Tex., May 28 (AP)Four men were killed and five were reported miss ing tonight following an ex posion and fire aboard an offshore oil platform that was undergoing repairs.

title: I.L.O. Cornerstone Is Laid
description: GENEVA, May 28David A. Morse, director general of the International Labor Organiza tion, laid the cornerstone today of the $25million building into which the agency will move in 1973.

title: Liguori and James Major Figures in I.C.4A Track Meet Opening Today
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 28Is Marty Liguori ready for his first subfourminute mile of the sea son? Can Larry James become the leading gold medalist in I. C. 4A. competition? How strong is Ron Stonitsch?

title: TRUCK TONNAGE OFF 24.4% FOR THE WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, May 28In tercity truck tonnage still af fected by work stoppages throughout the country and freight traffic on United States railroads in the latest week ended May 23 were both below the volume in the correspond ing 1969 week.

title: Seton Hall, Delaware Advance In N.C.A.A. Baseball Playoffs
description: PRINCETON, N. J., May 28 Strong pitching by Jack Dono van of Seton Hall and Ted Zink of Delaware enabled the Pirates and the Blue Hens to gain first round victories in the National Collegiate Athletic Associa tion's District 2 playoff at Clarke Field today.

title: The Screen
description: As almost everyone knows, Charlton Heston, an astronaut who crashed into a future, engrossingly imaginative, ac tionfilled, simian  dominated world first made by the novel ist Pierre Boulle in Planet of the Apes two years ago, is practically indestructible. But most of that same, strange populaceand James Francis cus, an astronaut dispatched to find him in Beneath the Planet of the Apesare proof, in living color, that Heston is vulnerable and that a sequel to striking science fiction can be pretty juvenile. The film opened yesterday at Loew's State 2 and Loew's Orpheum.

title: Student Becomes a Dean
description: WEST DE PERE, Wis., May 28 (AP)Just 72 hours after Patricia Ponto, 21 years old, received her diploma at St. Norbert College, she was hired as the school's dean of women. She was a straightA student in sociology at the 1,600student coeducational liberal arts col lege.

title: NATION'S SUPPLY OF MONEY SURGES
description: The pace of monetary expan sion is accelerating rapidly, banking data published yester day by the Federal Reserve System showed.

title: Rotation of Jets, Giants Rivals Through '78
description: JETS

title: Stock Prices Soar As Rally Continues
description: Stock prices continued to rally yesterday as volume on the New York Stock Exchange rose to the highest level of the year.

title: ONE MAN'S RANGE COVERS 500 MILES
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 28 Harlan Fengler, chief steward of the Indianapolis 500mile auto race, regards with fond paternalism the 33 drivers and crews who reached an initial pinnacle by qualifying for Sat urday's race.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: SST Recommendations.

title: Airlines Feeling Pinch of Tight Economy
description: Controller Arthur Levitt has urged state employes to use buses or trains when they travel between Albany and New York City, instead of the much more expensive airliners.

title: U.S. Education Staff Vacancies Rising
description: WASHINGTON, May 28By the end of June, four of the six top staff positions in the United States Office of Educa tion will be vacant. This de velopment is viewed within the office partly as a symptom of widespread frustration over these matters:

title: CREDIT MARKETS GAIN FOR 2D DAY
description: Bond prices turned in im pressive gains for the second straight session yesterday, but the combined advances fell somewhat short of erasing the precipitous declines that most issues suffered on Monday and Tuesday.

title: INQUIRY IS ASKED ON HIRING AT C.C.N.Y
description: The American Association of University Professors has been asked by the City College fac ulty senate to investigate why 11 C.C.N.Y. teachers were not reappointed. The investigation could lead to censure of the institution by the association.

title: Stage: Snug Amphitryon
description: A snug, briskly cheerful Amphitryon with a tart, take  it  or  leave  it tone winkedminus a leerinto the Forum Theater last night, flashing a tiny but telling set of philosophical teeth. The snug intimacy of its new home, through June 20, suits it.

title: PRICES RISE AGAIN IN LONDON STOCKS
description: Stock markets abroad rose sharply yesterday in response to the massive Wall Street rally on Wednesday.

title: Roundup: Tiant Performs A Double Duty for Twins
description: In the sixplayer trade be tween the Cleveland Indians and the Minnesota Twins last December, the key fig ures were a couple of pitchers  Luis Tiant, who became a Twin, and Dean Chance, who moved closer to his farm in Wooster, Ohio.

title: U.S. AIDE DEFENDS CAMBODIA INVASION
description: The State Department's legal adviser yesterday defended the American invasion of Cambodia as legitimate selfdefense, legal under international law.

title: LLOYDS HAS EYES ON PACING TROPHY
description: WESTBURY, L. I., May 28 Two years ago, Lloyd Lloyds, a Manhattan coat manufacturer, went to con siderable trouble to design a handsome silver trophy that was eventually presented to the winner of the first Margaret Lloyds Memorial Pace at Roosevelt Raceway.

title: Patrolman, 23, Stabbed Fatally in Car
description: A 23yearold patrolman was fatally stabbed yesterday as he sat in a patrol car outside a junior high school on the Low er East Side, and the police accused a former mental pa tient of the slaying.

title: Ambro Links Shirley Chisholm to Party Cabal
description: Representative Shirley Chis holm was accused yesterday of being part of a sinister cabal that coerced the Democratic state committee into desig nating State Senator Basil A. Paterson as its candidate for Lieutenant Governor.

title: Aides Say U.S. Will Warn Moscow on Mideast Role
description: WASHINGTON, May 28  The Nixon Administration is preparing to deliver a strong warning to the Soviet Union next week about increasing Soviet involvement in ArabIs raeli combat, senior officials said today. They added that the decision about future aircraft sales to Israel would hang largely on the Soviet response.

title: Two Noted Heart Surgeons to Leave Posts Here
description: Two of the world's noted heart'surgeons, Dr. Adrian Kan trowitz and Dr. C. Walton Lille hei, will leave their present posts here at the end of June.

title: $11MILLION OFFERED BY HUGHES FOR CLUB
description: CARSON CITY, Nev., May 28 Howard Hughes, who owns six gambling clubs on the Las Vegas Strip; asked the Nevada Gaming Control Board today for permission to extend his holdings to Reno with the pur chase of Harolds Club.

title: Thais' Foreign Minister Says Military Will Act if Reds in Cambodia Threaten
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, May 28 Foreign Minister Thanat Khoman of Thailand declared today that if Communists in Cambodia threatened Thailand's border there isn't any doubt our military authorities will take whatever steps are nec essary.

title: Pope, in Suburb, Finds It Clean and Thankful
description: ROME, May 28Pope Paul VI visited a suburb tonight and saw a large sign urging him to come more often and thus spur Rome's city gov ernment to do more for the neighborhood.

title: Department Store Sales Up
description: WASHINGTON, May 28The Department of Commerce re ported today that department store sales for the latest week, ended May 23, were an esti mated $672million, an increase of 4 per cent above the $645 million sales for the correspond ing week of last year. Total re tail store sales for the latest week were an estimated $6.964 billion, an increase of 3 per cent above the $6.749billion sales for the same period last year.

title: Mrs. Keyes Is Wed To Paul H. Briger
description: Mrs. Pauline Gray Keyes was married here yesterday noon to Paul H. Briger, who is with the New York law firm of Olwine, Connelly, Chase, O'Donnell & Weyher. State Supreme Court Justice Irving L. Levey performed the ceremony in his cham bers.

title: Index Tops 1969 Level
description: WASHINGTON, May 28 (AP) Prices paid to farmers for their products rose onethird of 1 per cent in May, ending a decline of two straight months, and were 1.5 per cent more than a year ago, the Agriculture Department re ported today.

title: Israel Reports 10 Arabs Are Killed in Clash in North
description: TEL AVIV, Friday, May 29 (Reuters)Ten Arab guerrillas were killed in a midnight clash with an Israeli Army patrol in northern. Israel, a military spokesman saidhere today.

title: Sihanouk Aide, in Paris, Appeals for Soviet Support
description: PARIS, May 28A high aide to Prince Norodom Sihanouk appealed here today for Soviet support for the Cambodian in surgent movement.

title: BRITISH TAKE STEP TO BAR SONIC BOOM
description: LONDON, May 28The Brit ish Government today an nounced a series of steps to protect the environment, in cluding a proposal to prevent sonic booms by commercial planes over Britain.

title: CARSWELL BACKERS ASK CAMPAIGN AID
description: WASHINGTON, May 28 Republicans promoting G. Har rold Carswell for the Senate are organizing a $1million fundraising effort across the country to finance his primary campaign in Florida.

title: Officials Take Tunnel Debate to Park
description: High officials got involved yesterday in the dispute over proposed subway tunnels under Central Park, and some tart words were exchanged on the subject under the trees.

title: Film: Beatles Together
description: This latest Beatles en deavor, Let It Be, simply documents their recording rehearsals and provides a climactic, impromptu concert the quartet gives atop their building headquarters in London. It stops traffic and clogs the neighborhood with fans and the curious.

title: Bar Association Urges Pullout Of U.S. Troops From Indochina
description: The Association of the Bar of the City of New York last night passed a vigorously de bated resolution urging the im mediate withdrawal of Ameri can forces from Southeast Asia.

title: Dave Hill Leads by Stroke With 63
description: MEMPHIS, May 28  Dave Hill left the pro tour last week and went home to Evergreen, Colo. While there he hit some 600 balls in practice daily and listened to the advice of a neighbor on how to improve his swing. Today in the opening round of the $150,000 Danny Thomas Memphis classic, he scored a sevenunderpar 63.

title: Police Tear Gas Stops Saigon Demonstrations
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 28 (Reuters)The police used tear gas today to fore stall two student demonstra tions, and some of the stu dents retaliated by throwing stones and firebombs.

title: Free Enterprise Radicals Score Federal Control
description: WASHINGTON, May 28  Milton Friedman, the noted and contentious economist, and a group of other scholars whom he described as free enterprise radicals today conducted a festival of political ideas from the right.

title: Appeals Hartford Link
description: Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate, persisted yesterday in his attempt to block at least temporarilythe $1.5 billion merger of the Interna tional Telephone and Tele graph Corporation and the Hartford Fire Insurance Com pany.

title: Aborigines in Australia Fight for Land
description: DARWIN, Australia, May 23 Djakawu put the people here at the beginning, long before white men came, said Da daynga Roy Marika, leader of 11 aboriginal tribes in Arnhem Land, 400 miles northeast of Darwin.

title: Mayor Promotes 2 Aides
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday the promotion of two key members of his City Hall staff. Harvey Rothehberg, who has served as the Mayor's administrative assistant and appointments secretary since January, 1966, will become con fidential assistant to the Mayor at the same salary$1 a year. Miss Edie Radley, assistant ap pointments secretary since 1966 became appointments secretary Her salary has not been set.

title: Times Are Hard but the Indonesians Have Hopes
description: TJIKUPA, Indonesia, May 22 Sustina, the 39yearold chief of this West Javan village, sat inside the dark little general store watching a detachment of soldiers working on a road across a dusty square filled with ragged children, unem ployed men sitting indolently on benches and scrappy goats nibbling at the scant grass.

title: Cross Bay Parkway Bridge Is Dedicated
description: The sixlane, $26million Cross Bay Bridge linking Broad Channel Island in Jamaica Bay with the Rockaway Peninsula was dedicated yesterday in time for the Memorial Day weekend rush.

title: BANKER DEFENDS MONETARY REIN
description: CHICAGO, May 28  The Government will have to either institute wage and price con trols, increase taxes, or reduce its own expenditures if the United States is to combat in flation, Gaylord A. Freeman Jr., chairman of the First Na tional Bank of Chicago, said to day.

title: 2 Officers Charged With Ordering G.I.'s To Shoot Into Huts
description: WASHINGTON, May 28  The Army charged two junior officers today with attempted murder in connection with a 1969 incident in South Vietnam in which an American platoon was allegedly directed to fire at some huts for target prac tice.

title: POLICE ENJOINED ON WAR PROTEST
