description: WEEKLY COMPARISONS

title: A Joyride to the Jet
description: Two giant steps are required of every airline passenger before he can begin his aerial voyage: First, he must get himself from home or office (or wher ever downtown) to the airport terminal building; having accomplished this, he must find the gate where his aircraft waits more or less docilely and then walk the east mile through Freudian fingers or tunnels to the boarding lounge, where he waits to board the plane.

title: $240Million Capital Budget Is Asked in Massachusetts
description: BOSTON, May 30 (AP)Gov. Francis W. Sargent has sent to the legislature a record capital outlay budget request of $239.6 million, including $199.4mil Ilion earmarked for the state's higher education system.

title: A Talk Talk Talk With Hot Lips
description: CANNES. JUST when everybody at the 1970 Cannes Film Festival was about to give up and go home  at some point, I believe, between the movie about Hungarian falcon hunters and the one about a rock breakers' strike in Tunisia  Sally Kellerman arrived and people stopped yawning. M*A*S*H EST SMASH, yelled Nice Matin's head lines, and so was Sally. The bored papa razzi, tired of photographing actors, from movies about peasants trying to save enough money to buy a tractor, followed her like hound dogs because in a festival full of true allegorical grit, the girl they called Hot Lips was pure Hollywood gold. She came on like a hippie Venus de Milo, waving her arms around her body like Carole Lombard, smiling like Veronica Lake, and walking like an anchovy. For three days the flash bulbs never stopped flashing.

title: Body in Car Trunk Identified
description: The body of a man clad only in shorts found last Tuesday in the trunk of a rented car at Kennedy International Airport has been identified as that of Joel J. Rostau, 34 years old, who had addresses in both Massachusetts and California.

title: Horse Show Calendar
description: Today FairfieldWestchester Professional Horsemen's Associa tion, Frank Altschul estate, River bank Road, Stamford, Conn. Reg ular, green and junior working hunters; open and preliminary jumpers, ponies, equitation 8:30 A.M.

title: CRUTCHER OF GIANTS IS TRADED TO RAMS
description: LOS ANGELES, May 30 (AP) The Los Angeles Rams have acquired an outside linebacker, Tommy Joe Crutcher, from the New York Giants in return for two undisclosed draft choices, a team spokesman announced today.

title: Israeli Units Ambushed
description: CAIRO, May 30Cairo's mili tary spokesman announced that Egyptian commandos ambushed two Israeli armored columns in the Sinai Peninsula today, kill ing many Israeli soldiers and capturing two. The commando assaults, as described by the spokesman, appeared to have been the most successful yet conducted by the Egyptian forces.

title: Heritage Departs Florida For America's Cup Trials
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., May 30 (AP)  Heritage, Florida's first contender for the Ameri ca's Cup, sailed from her home base today for Long Island and the Cup trials.

title: Alexander Hamilton Starts Her 47th and Last Excursion Season
description: The Hudson River Day Line Steamer Alexander Hamilton, a harbor work horse since 1924 is to be replaced.

title: The Week in Finance:
description: WITH dramatic suddenness, the stock market pulled out of its deep nosedive in the middle of last week and shot sharply upward, fanning Wall Street hopes that the prolonged bear market might have ended at last.

title: Card of Thanks
description: BLUMBERGThe family of Jack Blumbers of blessed memory wishes to express their sincere thanks and gratitude to their rela fives and friends for their kind messages of sympathy and contributions made in his memory.

title: Ewbank to Speak Tuesday At 1,000Yard Club Dinner
description: MENASHA, Wis., May 30 Weeb Ewbank, coach of the New York Jets of the American Football Conference, will be the main speaker on Tuesday night at the seventh annual 1,000 Yard Club Foundation dinner.

title: Friendly: We Offer Our Activism, Our Faith...
description: WE cling to our hu manity by our fingernails. The plea comes from the dramatic climax of The Andersonville Trial (Public Television, May 17), but it also describes the plight of public broadcasting in 1970.

title: Education
description: Tutting in time is how child in an urban slum school described his education. Speak ing to a child psychiatrist, he explained what school means to him:

title: PORTUGAL AND U.S. PLAN AZORES TALK
description: LISBON, May 30 (AP)The United States and Portugal were reported to have agreed in principle today to resume negotiations later this year on the future of the American military bases in the Azores after an accord has been reached on United States in stallations in Spain.

title: GRADUATION SPEECH GIVEN BY BREWSTER
description: AMHERST, Mass., May 30 (AP)  Kingman Brewster Jr., president of Yale, spoke at the 100th commencement of the University of Massachusetts to day. He used Memorial Day as his theme and the division of opinion over the Indochina war as an example of patriotism.

title: Y.R.A. SAIL TAKEN BY DOUBLE DARE
Baird, Jets' Safety, May Retire As Aching Legs Lessen Desire
description: The turnover of personnel continues in the New York Jets' defensive backfield.

title: Business Index Declined Slightly
description: The New York Times In dex of Business Activity this week fell slightly to 352.7 from 352.8 a week earlier. A year ago it was 345.4.

title: Researchers Agree Conquest of Cancer Is Distant
description: HOUSTON, May 30For the last nine days, 7,000 scientists from 70 countries meeting here have grappled with the mys teries of cancer, which for centuries has defied the bril liance of thousands of scien tists throughout the world.

title: NAVY BEATS ARMY IN LACROSSE, 87
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., May 30 Navy leveled a fourgoal broadside at Army during the last 10 minutes of their annual lacrosse battle to beat the cadets, 87, before 8,000 per sons in Michie Stadium.

title: Church in Pnompenh Becomes A Vietnamese Refugee Village
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, May 30 (AP)Almost every village in Cambodia has a church in it. The Catholic Church of Notre Dame on the banks of the Bassac River has a village in it.

title: SOVIET ATTACKED ON JEWISH POLICY
description: More than 1,300 faculty members of some 100 Ameri can colleges and campuses have issued a declaration of solidarity with Soviet Jews in what they described as a rising tide of Soviet antiSemitism.

title: Bulterman Scores 3d Victory in Row With Yacht Onrust
description: GREENWICH, Conn., May 30 Jacques F. Bulterman won with Onrust for the second day in a row and the third straight Luders16 Class race on Long Island Sound today. A fleet of 64 sailed off Indian Harbor Yacht Club in the season's sixth championship regatta for Yacht Racing Association fleet of the Connecticut area, based east of Rye.

title: What Can Daniel Barenboim Conquer Next?
description: APROMOTIONAL flyer be ing inserted in new Angel recordings these days is entitled 13 Talents in a Hurry. Promi nent among the photographs and short biographies of the presumably lucky 13 it adver tises is a young man who may be in the biggest hurry of them all, Daniel Barenboim.

title: MARGIN  OF LAP
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 30 For the entire month of May Al Unser had the Indianapolis 500 in the bag, dominating all practice and qualifying sessions without even breathing hard. (Today all he needed to do was go 200 laps around the 2mile Indianapolis Motor Speedway to make a formality of winning the annual auto race.

title: Vatican Raises Pay Of 4,000 Employes As Prices Increase
description: ROME, May 30The Vatican granted its 4,000 employes a 10 per cent pay raise today.

title: Argentina's Winds of Upheaval: Virtually Every Current Except Democracy
description: CORDOBA, Argentina, May 30For some reason, autumn is a catalyst in the volatile political chemistry of Argen tina. The chilly May weather seems an invariable precursor to coups, revolutions, student rioting, strikes and other up heavals.

title: Indochina 3: Alliance With Lots Of Mutual Distrust
description: PNOMPENH, CambodiaThe Cambodian military units in the southern region are insignifi cant in numbers compared to the South Vietnamese troops engaged there, a high official close to Premier Lon Nol said the other day, but at least they can act as gendarmes.

title: Wall St. Experts Find Glimmers of Hope
description: During the precipitous slide in the stock marketjust checked by a strong, al though probably technical, recoveryThe New York Times asked five pertinent ques tions of five knowledgeable figures in the financial community.

title: Friday Night Fights
description: RomeMario Baruzzi. 213 pounds, Italy, outpointed Wil lie Moore, 196, New York, 8 rounds.

title: Peace Corps Colleagues Wed Upstate
description: CAZENOVIA, N. Y., May 30  Miss Kathleen Ann Rybicki was married here this afternoon to James Byrne Robinson, a program associate at the National Institute of Public Affairs in Washington. Both were Peace Corps volunteers in Africa.

title: Recordings
description: WHAT Black poets are doing with poetry today has to be seen and heard if one is to get the full impact in chanting voices, they com bine drama (they don't just Lead their poetry, they act it out) with music and poetry in such a way that it takes the art form out of its in sioup, esoteric atmosphere and puts it right down front Where everyone can appre ciate it. They use the same techniquesrepetition, para bles, testifying, signifying that all great Black orators, preachers, and soul singers do when they are trying to reach out and move Black audiences.

title: GOV. CARGO GIVEN NEW MEXICO EDGE
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., May 30Gov. David F. Cargo is slightly favored to win the nomination for the Senate in New Mexico's primaries on Tuesday.

title: Tufts Coach Honored
description: WEST HARTFORD, Conn., May 30 (AP)Herb Erickson, Tufts University baseball coach since 1964, was named New England coach of the year to day in the National Colegiate College Division. Erickson was chosen by fellow coaches after leading Tufts to a 135 won lost record this spring.

title: 11 Mount Vernon Trackmen Get Roles in New York School Meet
World Inflation Spreads Despite Steps to Curb It
description: Inflation is spreading all over the world, and, as in the United States, efforts to re duce it have yet to show many signs of success.

title: Miss Suzanne Agnew Is Bride Of Charles Gustavus Buffum 3d
description: FOX CHAPEL, Pa., May 30 Miss Suzanne Kohlsaat Agnew and Charles Gustavus Buffum 3d were married here this afternoon in the Fox Chapel Episcopal Church. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. James M. Dix, assisted by the Right Rev. Austin Pardue, retired Bishop of the Episcopal Diocese of Pittsburgh.

title: Maddox, Battling Papers, Ousts Vending Machines Near Capitol
description: ATLANTA, May 30 (UPI) Gov. Lester G. Maddox inten sified his longstanding dispute with the state's two largest newspapers today by raiding newspaper vending machines at the Georgia Capitol.

title: Why a 63YearOld Tycoon Worth $100Million Wants to Run for the Senate
description: ON the morning of March 20, Norton Simon rose early, as usual, swam a few laps in his pool, ate a light breakfast in a nook surrounded by priceless art and read the financial pages. The stock of Norton Simon, Inc., the huge con glomerate he had retired from in De cember, was holding its own in a weak market. Simon was preparing to leave for a meeting of the Univer sity of California Board of Regents he has been a member for 10 years when he received a phone call from a young lawyer he knew. That day,

title: A Bid By NATO
description: For some time, the North Atlantic. Treaty Organization has been fumbling around with the idea of reducing Western and Communist forces in Central Europe. The longstanding concept was to study the problem. Last week the Western Allianqe went a step furtherfrom study to exploration. The 15 NATO Foreign Ministers, meeting in Rome, invited the Sovietled Warsaw Pact powers and interested non aligned nations to explore mutual and balanced troops cuts in the area.

title: A.E.C. Returns Borrowed Silver
description: OAK RIDGE, Tenn., May 30The shipment of nearly 14,700 tons of silver bor rowed from the United States Treasury during World War II for use in the Manhattan Project at Oak Ridge has been completed by the Atomic Energy Commission.

title: King Of The Castle and Te Veda Take Divisions of Arlington Park Feature
description: CHICAGO, May 30 (AP)  Ogden Phipps's King of The Castle and Frank C. Sullivan's Te Vega won divisions of the 350,000 added Governor's Cup Handicap today as Arlington Park pened its 72day meeting betake a crowd of 29.412.

title: Harsh Economic Steps in Peru Are Having a Widening Impact
description: LIMA, Peru, May 30  The economic and social upheaval brought about by the military regime that took power in Peru 20 months ago has thus far af fected mainly the small mon eyed class and foreign interests. But it is spreading.

title: Slowdown Could Be An Asset
description: The stock market decline hasn't been all bad. In fact, if it had not dropped so pre cipitously since midApril, its slide could be viewed largely as favorable to the economy.

title: First Bank By Women Is Planned
description: MIAMI BEACH, May 30 If the Florida Controller's office approves the applica tion for the First Women's Bank of Florida, it will be the first commercial bank in the state with an integrated board of directors.

title: F.D.A. Managers Are Enthusiastic About Changes They Are Making
description: WASHINGTON, May 30The Food and Drug Administration, a Federal regulatory agency that was in disarray six months ago, appears to have developed a new sense of direction.

title: F.B.I. Seeks Man In Polite Holdups Of 19 Banks Here
description: A faststepping bank robber, who works only on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays, who walks away docilely when tellers turn him down, and says thank you when they turn over their money, is being sought here by the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: Letters: In NotSo Wicked New York
description: To THE EDITOR: THE article on Where to GoIn a Wicked World (Travel Section, May 17) elicits m some spontane ous comments motivated by the usual and insatiable urge of mankind to get away from himself and find the pro verbial Elysian fields far from the mad ding crowd.

title: Couple Goes to Auction And Purchases Church
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 30 (AP)John J. Bell and his wife, Rose, went to an auc tion with their savings to buy an abandoned parish house as an investment. They ended up buying St. Ambrose Epis copal Church too.

title: Chemical Industry Predicts Growth
description: Although the nearterm out look for Chemical producers is as uncertain as for the rest of the economy, the new decade promises better days for the chemical industry.

title: Music
description: THE summer season is about here, and I have been thinking of Shakespeare in the parks  thinking of Shake speare as verbal music, which is not very much in vogue these days. Every now and then on a summer night ? drop into one of the Papp productions in Central Park and sit there bemused as the sound of the actors comes riot off the stage but through loudspeakers a good distance away from the stage. Nor is realism helped by the mum blemumblemumble of so many actors, especially American actors, faced with Shakespeare's mighty line. They simply do not know bow to declaim it; the basic rhythm of the iambics eludes them, as does the actual shaping of words and the dy namic schemethe rise and fall; crescendo and decre scendo; the sheer bravura of the writing; the necessary rubato to keep the meter from sounding jogtrot.

title: Tower Bridge in London Becoming Unsafe for Traffic
description: LONDON, May 30 (Reuters) Tower Bridge, one of Lon don's most famous landmarks, is becoming unsafe for heavy traffic.

title: Racial Issue Key to BrewerWallace Vote Tuesday
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., May 30 With the election three days away, the race for the gov ernorship between Gov. Albert P. Brewer and George C. Wal lace is predictably enmeshed in a racial controversy.

title: Portable Oxygen For Sick Slated
description: The Union Carbide Cor poration has announced that it is ready to lease portable liquidoxygen systems to patients suffering from em physema and other chronic respiratory diseases.

title: Airline Earnings Drop Sharply
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 (AP)The Air Transport As sociation said last week that airline earnings are so low as to jeopardize the indus try's $6.6billion reequipment program.

title: LARM'S 3:58.5 WINS I.C. 4A MILE
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 30 Marty Liguori overslept in the morning, ate a late breakfast but was first across the finish line today with the fastest mile in the United States this year, 3 minutes 58.5 seconds.

title: House Unit's Hearings to Focus On Preserving Gulf Island Chain
description: NEW ORLEANS, May 30A subcommittee of the House In terior and Insular Affairs Com mittee will hold hearings in June on a bill to create a na tional seashore on a chain of offshore islands in the Gulf of Mexico.

title: Mrs. Muriel Kaplan Dies; Played in Bridge Olympiad
description: Muriel Kaplan, one of the leading women bridge players in the metropolitan area, died of cancer yesterday at her home at 100 West 57th Street. She was 50 years old.

title: Anne Day Is Wed To P. J. Sarsfield
description: PLAINFIELD, N. J., May 30Miss Anne Perkins Day and Patrick. J. Sarsfield were married here this afternoon at the home of the bride's mother, Mrs. Francis P. Day. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Herbert G. Draesel Jr., rector of the House of Prayer Episcopal Church in Newark.

title: Six Reported Killed
description: TEL AVIV, May 30 (UPI)  An Israeli military spokesman said today that Egyptian troops had killed six Israeli soldiers and wounded six more in a raid that touched of seven hours of fighting on the eastern bank of the Suez Canal. He made no reference to a second raid.

title: Cubs Topple Padres On Clout in 8th, 87, After an 114 Defeat
Miss Birdsall Wed To Roger S. Leeds
description: Miss Nancy Birdsall, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. James E. Birdsall of Upper Montclair, N. J., was married here yes terday afternoon to Roger S. Leeds. The ceremony was performed in St. Paul's Chap el of Columbia University by the Rev. Donald A. DePaoli. The bridegroom is the son of Mrs. Walter S. Wurzburger of Scarsdale, N. Y., and the late Carl Leeds.

title: Calendar of Tourist Events for June
description: 1 Billy Bowlegs Festival,Fort Walton Beach, Fla. Until June 7. Pirate fete.+ Asolo Theater Summer Festival, Sarasota, Fla. Until Sept. 7

title: Last Unsubsidized Cruise Ship Under U.S. Flag Sold to Greek
description: The 18,655ton Matson Line cruise ship Lurline, the last active unsubsidized oceangoing passenger vessel under the United States flag, has been sold to Chandris Lines of Greece.

title: Cards Recall Simmons
description: ST. LOUIS, May 30 (AP) The St. Louis Cardinals called up Ted Simmons, a catcher from their Tulsa, Okla., farm club today. Bart Zeller, a catcher, was optioned to Tulsa.

title: BOMB EXPLODES AT TRADE CENTER
description: A 50foot office trailer parked near the construction site of the World. Trade Center in downtown Manhattan was se verely damaged early yester day by a bomb.

title: BLANCAS, ON 198, LEADS BY STROKE
description: MEMPHIS, May 30  The quality of play is unbelievable, said Frank Beard, golf's 1969 leading money winner, as he finished the third round of the $150,000 Danny Thomas Mem phis Classic with a 66 and found himself tied for fifth place at nine under par.

title: FRENCH TAKE AIM AT AMERICA'S CUP
description: Bruno Bich, the 23yearold son of Baron Marcel Bich, said at the New York Yacht Club Wednesday night that the French syndicate headed by his father in the effort to remove the America's Cup from this country had a motto. It was that the struggle, not the vic tory, was important, quoting Baron Pierre de Coubertin, originator of the modern Olympic Games.

title: U.S. Business:
description: AMARILLO, Tex., May 30  The nation's beef basket is taking a swing from the Midwest to the Southwest.

title: After 25 Years, the Waiting Lists at Girls' Boarding Schools Begin to Thin Out
description: Ever since the end of World War II, those fashionable, once exclusive girls' boarding schools in the Northeast have suffered from an embarrassment of rich esmany more qualified applicants than could possibly be accepted.

title: Miss Howard Doctor's Bride
description: PRINCETON, N. J., May 30 Miss Rowan Belknap How ard was married in All Saints Episcopal Chapel here this afternoon to Dr. Jeffrey Clem ent Morse, son of Dr. and Mrs. Willard Jackson Morse of Randolph, Vt. The Rev Charles G. Newbery of Roa noke, Va., performed the ceremony.

title: Miss Susan E. Coleman Is Married
description: REDDING RIDGE, Conn., May 30Miss Susan Eliza beth Coleman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George Joseph Coleman Jr. of Bethel, was married here at noon today to Walter Blue Clark, son of Mr. and Mrs. Graham Mont rose Clark of Bedford Hills, N.Y. The Rev. James Flana gan performed the ceremony in St. Patrick's Roman Catho lic Church.

title: Article 5  No Title
